Summary: This hotel is in need of renovation but it gets the job done if your here for Disneyland or a convention.  Check in was easy and the front desk agent was friendly and helpful.  The room again is in need of an overhaul but the beds are comfortable. The bathroom needs to be cleaned more thoroughly however.   There is a bus stop right in front of the hotel that will take you to Disney but you need to download an app to use it.   You can also go to the Disney parking lot across the street and use the free shuttle to get to Disneyland (it’s a little bit of walk as the buses are in the middle of the lot).  Overall, would recommend if you don’t mind the dated decor.
Room tip: Walk to the Toy Story parking lot across the street to get a free bus to Disneyland

Summary Heading: Convenient hotel with easy access to Disneyland, what more could you ask for?
Summary: Thanks to this hotel I had a great first time in Disneyland. Locating it was very easy, and parking was a breeze (although the parking lot is outdoor only). You have to pay per day but the price is reasonable. The front desk staff were very kind and checking in only took a few minutes. Our room was spacious, clean and cozy.  Of course, the biggest advantage of this hotel is its close proximity to Disneyland and the Anaheim Convention Center. There are also a couple of restaurants that are within walking distance. Getting to Disneyland was extremely easy: all we had to do was cross the street and enter the Toy Story parking lot, where free shuttles will be waiting to bring you to the Disneyland entrance. It's a simple 5-minute walk, and it seems everyone does this as none of the

Honestly one of the most abhorrent hotel experiences I’ve ever had. Incredibly dirty, old, and faded. Woke up twice to black water backing into my sink at 5am (truly unique alarm sound!). The ACs make incredibly loud noises that reverberated the entire room. The beds are old, the frames make a ton of noise.  I really wish I had something positive to say, but that’s really not the case. I tried checking out but there was nobody at the front desk. As I eventually walked away I saw the attendant inside the office on her phone.  I feel all hotels have some redeeming qualities but this one is well past that point.

Summary Heading: Basic, budget friendly hotel - great location!
Summary: Not the worst hotel I have stayed in, but far from the best. Staff were helpful and friendly. Rooms were clean and a decent size. Good sized fridge. Bathroom very dated / small.   PROS: Best thing about this hotel is the location. Walking distance to the parks and multiple places to eat within the area. Target was only a few blocks away, so we made sure to get what we needed without paying the extortionate prices at the parks.
Room tip: Do not pay to eat the buffet breakfast here. Poor quality, lack of choice. For the cost for a...

Summary: The hotel is terrible.  I've only visited 10 countries but this is the worst hotel of all the ones I've stayed in my entire life.  They don’t do the cleaning if you don't stay for more than 5 days, they don't give you shampoo or soap but the very first day in your arrival, they do not change your towels. you need to buy at the store because you’got tired of waiting and complaining for this basic stuff.  The breakfast is very bad.  El hotel es pésimo. Solo he visitado 10 países pero este es el peor hotel de todos los que me he hospedado en toda mi vida. No hacen el aseo de la habitación si no te hospedas mas de 5 días, no te dan shampoo, jabón ni cambio de toallas, si lo pides necesitas literal te dejan esperando hasta que prefieres ir a comprar para no pasar mas inconvenientes.
Room tip: No te hospedes en ese hotel por ningún motivo.

Summary: On our recent visit to the usa we stayed at the clarion hotel in Anaheim los angeles the hotel is situated close to the 2 disney parks all you need to do is walk through the disney car park from there you can get on the shuttle buses to the parks as for the hotel the rooms are large with good clean beds the decor is a bit outdated but apart from that its a good hotel no complaints we enjoyed our stay.

First let me start with saying that the staff are nice and perfectly fine the real problem is in the hotel. It’s overpriced just to get a beaten up bathroom and a dirty room. And on top of that they pay you for parking and they pay you for breakfast but it’s so disgusting not even edible everything about this hotel is bad and I feel the only reason people come to this hotel is because it’s close to Disney.

We stayed here for 2 nights, only to go to Disneyland.   The staff were very friendly, the hotel was basic but for a short trip it’s fine.   The room was large and spacious and have 2x beds, if you get a room on a high floor facing the right way you can watch the Disney fireworks.   The plumbing of the toilet and shower is a bit dated and sometimes doesn’t work the best so could do with a bit of an update.   I really enjoyed my stay at this hotel as it’s perfect for a trip to Disney and the short stay makes the location perfect.

We were a family of five. We stayed in a suite. There were two double beds and a pull out couch.. it worked great for us. The fridge is a good size. There are three elevators so we never had to wait long to go up or down. The sink is not in the same space as the toilet and shower which worked great for getting ready. The pool was warm and the area was nice with loungers and tables and chairs.  There is no hot tub. The staff were fantastic.  The breakfast had an option  to take out which was convenient.  And it was a big portion.  I do wish there was a place to have lunch and dinner on site but there is now.  The walk to the park was an easy 15 minutes and doable for most people without serious mobility issues.  Overall, I would definitely stay here again. It was clean and

Summary Heading: They are hosting a right wing militia group!
Summary: This hotel is hosting a right wing militia group that is planning to disrupt a medical conference. The group is protesting in front of the hotel, scaring tourists away. Not a family friendly environment.

Summary Heading: Great hotel for the price and good location.
Summary: Great hotel for the price and good location, only a block and half away from Disneyland Maingate.    Some things about the room: Room was clean Some of the furniture (chairs needs to be replaced or upgraded) Water didn't get too hot, but hot enough to take a decent shower Overall the staff was accommodating.  Except the check bag attendant, I believe Amelia was her name.  She wasn't very accommodating.  She made me walk with her to the back of the hotel to the room where the luggage was stored.  She didn't bother checking the closet that was at the front, where she originally stored my luggage.  . Breakfast "buffet" was pretty basic.  For the price they were offering, walk on over to IHOP across the street and get a better meal.  I'm a coffee drinker and the cups they had were

Summary Heading: Outdated and careless about the environment
Summary: Staff was very helpful and kind. However the building is outdated to say the least.  What was really bad was the breakfast. Un eatable, tasteless , expensive AND above all they use disposable cups and plastic glasses!!!!!  I can't believe that is possible to produce so much trash without care. 500 years to decompose one glass for one drink? Unbelievable!  I won't stay again here and I hope they buy glassware and a dish washer!

Summary Heading: Staff is great, hotel is not worth it at any price!
Summary: First, I would like to say that the staff was terrific! However, the hotel is in bad shape and desperately in need of renovations. There were so many issues with my room; too many to name. The rooms are very outdated and feel dirty. The plumbing barely works with both the sink and the toilets backing up. The beds and pillows are so uncomfortable.

We were provided this "hotel" based on a package experience that my kid won to perform at Disneyland.  I didn't expect much as I'm not a 5 star type of hotel person and have lived in motels before but it's obvious this place is outdated and needs some TLC.  Here are my comments:  Check-In & Staff: When we checked in, the lady behind the counter was not friendly at all, wish I caught her name because the rest of the staff I met (from the cleaners to the folks at the restaurant and when I checked out) was friendly and nice.  Room: The room was decent but old.  It was relatively clean.  The washroom is split where the sink is outside (which I prefer) but again it looked dated.  The curtains looked dusty and was hard to open and close.  Each room has a good size balcony which is

I wouldn’t call this hotel a resort and I wasn’t expecting it to be a resort anyway…but LOL. Anyway, our stay was okay. Our room was clean and spacious. A little outdated, but certainly acceptable. The property isn’t too far from Disney, which is of course the purpose of its existence. The staff were generally nice too.   Someone in the hotel was smoking pot, which whatever, go for it… Just please smoke outside. The smell was annoying. I didn’t bother calling the front desk. Not sure what they would have done. Kind of hard to figure out which room it came from.   Eh…. I might recommend this property. It is average. Nothing to write home about. If you are going to Disney, it is a fine place to crash.

We stayed here for 3 nights and while we were quite far away from LA as we expected this location was just what we needed.  Upon checking in we were told about the restaurant and bar but upon later checking we discovered that the restaurant was only open for breakfast and the bar has not been open since the start of the pandemic, despite the cocktail sign being lit up at the entrance to the bar as well as posters in the elevators saying the restaurant was serving breakfast, lunch and dinner. Now 2 years out of date. The rooms were nice, beds comfortable and ample towels, we did have a balcony looking onto the carpark is would have been nice to have a couple of chairs out there to enjoy the fresh air.  The pool area was very nice, not over run with sunbeds and also had tables and

Room was in need of a good clean. There was a layer of dust on the side table where the tv was. Large stains on the carpets. Grubby floor tiles in the bathroom and dirt on the walls.  When we first arrived there was no safe key, so they had to send maintenance to change the lock. Then we had maintenance up a second time a few days later as the flush on the toilet broke. Then, a 3rd visit as the drainage backed up so the bath tub wasn't emptying.  Only positive was the bed sheets were clean. Not worth the $309 a night as stated on the back of the bathroom door.

This hotel was clean , comfortable with friendly staff and great location.  Nice short walk to Disney and downtown Disney. It’s an older style decor but if your looking for a base for Disney this is perfect

Summary Heading: Shabby and in major need of renovation
Summary: An older hotel that is in serious need of a rehab. We booked two rooms and both were pretty shabby. The bathroom was very small and did not seem like it was cleaned very well. The beds were ok. We hardly spent time in the rooms because we were at Disneyland and this was the cheapest option around. I probably wouldn’t stay here again.

Hotel and rooms a little outdated. Rooms very clean. Front desk Iliana and Mayra were very helpful. Needed some printing and scanning done. Business center printer did not work. Very polite and patient. Thank you!

This is an older property that is not maintained Front desk personnel curt, impersonal; Housekeeping short staffed & cleans every 3days - no trash pick up, clean linens, toiletries…, question any amenities implied as included,  website was misleading.  Restaurant onsite, but breakfast was not included.  Parking lot attendees were helpful and personable.  Would strongly not recommend this property.

Horrible rooms. When checking in I asked if we could get an up to date room so we could save the hassle of having to switch since that has happened in the past. (Our previous stay in 2017 we switched rooms and the room we ended up with was perfect) that was not the case in 2022. When I asked if we could have a decent room the girls response was “let me switch it because your room is on second floor and those rooms aren’t great” we got a different room that was super small, dirty (mind you we were told we would have NO HOUSEKEEPING during our stay) room outdated, chairs are old with covers. We asked to switch they upgraded for a higher price when we switched to the suite it was spacious and even with all the space IT SMELLED HORRIBLE! It smelled like FEET AND URINE! The bathroom

Good value for the price. No microwave in the rooms, you'll have to go down to the lobby to use a microwave.  Wish the hotel at least had microwaves in each floor's soda/ice machine area.  Felt a bit out of place heating up my food down in the lobby where people were sitting.  Employees were very friendly.  I would stay at this hotel again.

Made a reservation and check in to the room that wasn't clean at all...not once but twice...I had to go down to the lobby to try to get a clean room three time. No compensation a was done. Bathroom function was falling apart. Sofa-bed was falling apart. The room it self was very outdated. If you tried to use the plug most of them were so loose that the outlet just doesn't stay on. WITH THE ROOM COST AND BAD SERVICE THIS ISNT A PLACE YOU SHOULD TAKE YOUR FAMILY TO. THE QUALITY INN AND SUITE DOWN THE STREET WAS A BETTER CHOICE.

I stayed at the Clarion hotel in mid October with family and our experience was worse than we expected it to be even with the cheap price.  We paid about 88 per night which is the cheapest that we could find within walking distance of Disneyland and rented two rooms. We were not expecting to spend much time at the hotel and weren't looking for anything fancy, we just needed a place sleep and bathe but this hotel is not even good enough for that.  First of all the rooms are filthy, and this fact is even more concerning given the pandemic. We wiped down all of the surfaces and our wipes came out grey. The bathrooms are disgusting. My shower drain still had hair in it and the grout looks like it's never been cleaned. The 2nd room's bathroom floor looked like someone walked on it

We arrived and were greeted by the happy and friendly night staff.  We were checked in quickly and in our room within 10 minutes.   The third floor room was clean and comfortable.  It served as a great base of operations for our Disneyland adventure.   The place is old and tired, but still has what it takes to get the job done!!! Thank you!

We stood at the Clarion for our family Disneyland Resort vacation. Isaac made our trip Awesome he was extremely helpful and pleasant. He is informative, professional, articulate and made our time spent at the hotel comfortable and answered all our questions. He is AMAZING!

Horrible experience, not what is advertised. Rooms are dirty, not up to date and if you see the maintenance guy more then once then you know they have issues. Their website states they have enhanced their cleaning procedures due to COVID however there was hair in the bathroom, on the sheets and towels. I know its an older hotel but the tub was gross it looked like someone had just taken a shower, the fridge and microwave were also disgusting. We were switched from our original room twice, so stayed in 3 different rooms due to maintenance problems. Not fun when you have to pack up everything at 10pm to switch rooms after a long day at Disney with two toddlers and a baby! Worst experience ever. We were definitely not happy and will not be staying there ever!

Where do I start  great location, close to Disneyland and walking distance to Mortons steakhouse  So i chose this hotel because I needed a medical procedure and when making the reservation with an additional blanket, several additional pillows and near an ice machine, strike 1-2-3-  When i arrived i got none of those, fortunately, the desk check in young lady enthusiastically helped..blanket and pillow I'll get them".......  near the ice machine "there's not one on your floor" but I can get u near the elevator and there's one just 1 floor up"  Illianna was very very helpful.. but go no support.  so after she helped me to my room on the 5th floor (i tipped accordingly) I found that the ice machine on the 6th floor didn't work ..note there were only 3 ice machines ....for 9

It’s unfortunate I have to write this but as a business traveler that frequents the convention center with my company, it’s necessary.  My colleagues and I attended the first MD & M convention since pre- COVID this week and both our rooms felt dirty. My room had dried crumbs of food under the chair/ desk which clearly shows it hadn’t been vacuumed. The toilet in the other room needed the top removed to flush. Three days stay with no housekeeping services.   I’ve stayed here before COVID and understanding the rooms are dated; but the front desk staff, location and general vibe made it a great value. But this visit was below grade( except the lovely front desk staff). It’s not their fault but management/ ownership: I wanted to book four additional rooms for the next convention but

My wife and I have stayed at this property several times before for business and pleasure and at each of our stays; we have yet to be disappointed. The employees at this hotel truly value their guests. We would specifically like to recognize Kevin, Areli and Jackie for providing nothing less than exceptional customer service and making us feel like VIP's. We also would like to acknowledge that we truly felt safe and secure throughout our entire stay, especially taking into consideration the challenges we are all currently facing with Covid-19.
Manager Response: Dear Miguel,  Thank you for sharing your feedback with us on your recent visit.  And thank you so much Miguel for your generous & kind words as my staff and I were delighted and honor to have you and your lovely wife as our guests.  We hope to see you and your family again real soon in the very near future once the dust settles from this pandemic.  Until then, be safe and stay healthy.     P.S.  Love the Mando & Fett cosplay!!!  All the Best,  Kevin D Assistant GM

Summary: We stayed at Clarion hotel Anaheim for 3 nights.  The hotel is closed by Convention center, but a bit distance from Disneyland.  We are a family of 4, but the beds are two twin beds.  There is no shuttle service from hotel to Disneyland.  Rooms are dated.
Manager Response: Dear 611stacic,  Thank you for leaving your feedback on your recent stay as we enjoyed serving you and your family.  We look forward to your next Disney excursion.  Best Regards,  Kevin D Assistant General Manager

Summary: This hotel is in serious need of some room upgrades (especially the bathroom), but for the price it’s well worth it. It’s right next to the convention center and is about a 20 minute walk to Disney. If you don’t like the idea of walking, you can walk across the street to the Toy Story parking lot and get on one of those free shuttles- which IMO is a major draw to staying near the convention center at the nicer hotels because at the end of a Disney day walking anywhere is daunting. But, this place has a breakfast buffet for only $12 and it was actually very good food!
Manager Response: Dear Em S,  Thank you for sharing your feedback with us.  And thank you for your kind words as we're glad you enjoyed the convenience of our hotel property to the Convention Center & the Disneyland Resort.  We look forward to seeing you again in the not so distance future.  Best Regards,  Kevin D Assistant General Manager

Summary Heading: Great place and located near perfectly
Summary: Great experience and was pleased with the hotel, service, and location!  Room was clean, staff was friendly, and the location put us just down the street from Disneyland, the Convention Center, and several restaurants.  I would recommend the Clarion if you want to be close to everything, but still save money by not being right at the attractions.
Manager Response: Dear Dreamer20002883184,  Thank you for sharing your feedback.  We're so happy to hear you had a great time with us and thank you so much for recognizing our friendly staff.  We look forward to seeing you again real soon on your next Disney excursion!  All the Best,  Kevin D Assistant GM

Summary Heading: Not for sure why all the negative reviews?
Summary: We stayed here in late Jan 2020 and had a great experience. We stayed on the 8th floor. The room was cleaned, beds were firm, and everything seem had been updated within the past year or so. The bathroom was a little dated with low water pressure for the shower. This is probably one of the best Clarions I've stayed in with the Choice Hotels family. My only complain is the room was 2 double beds instead of 2 queen beds in our room. If the price is right, I'll stay here again.
Manager Response: Dear Marcus W,  Thank you for sharing your feedback with us.  We're so happy that you enjoyed your stay as we thank you so much for being our honorary guest.  We look forward to seeing you with us again soon.  All the Best,  Kevin Do Assistant General Manager

Summary Heading: Good location and amenities, loud horrible plumbing
Summary: This hotel is a good walking distance to Disneyland, Walgreens and food outlets which was perfect for us. We very much appreciated the amenities such as a microwave and fridge. Good sized room, comfortable bed. The arcade/game room had a machine that only ate quarters but would not register them. The small shop is quite expensive. Pool was inaccessible with my room key. The biggest issue I had with the hotel is the plumbing was SO loud! I was awoken constantly when trying to sleep. I'm not sure if my room (723) was near the main plumbing line or my neighbour had some serious toilet issues, but the sound of toilets flushing and plumbing was incessant and loud.
Manager Response: Dear Ellie Q,  Thank you for sharing your feedback with us.  We're happy to hear you enjoyed the short distance walk to the Magic Kingdom and the food outlets nearby.  We also do sincerely apologize for the plumbing issues you experienced as we can understand how frustrating that would be.  Our maintenance crew have been informed and are on top of that as I speak.  We thank you once more and do hope to see you again with us soon on your next Disney vacation.  All the Best,  Kevin Do Assistant General Manager

Summary: Our family of five stayed in two rooms. Not close at all but they are teenagers so it was fine. Both rooms a good size with large bathrooms. Shower pressure was crap!! Son enjoyed the gym. Pool looked nice but too cold this winter for us to use. Twenty minutes from Disneyland entrance. Wasn't impressed with $16 per day parking fee. Staff not very friendly, just the bare minimum.
Manager Response: Dear sherbsfamily,  Thank you for leaving your feedback with us on your recent stay.  We appreciate your generous words and do sincerely apologize for the shower pressure issue you encountered.  We will have our maintenance team look into that matter and make those necessary adjustments.  We hope to see you again in the not too distance future.  Sincerely,  Kevin Do Assistant General Manager

Summary: I had read the reviews on here so wasn't sure what to expect. We were pleasantly surprised with our stay.   Front Desk- Check-In- I believe it was around 8:30 at night? one party in front, didn't take long. Agent was pleasant. I had asked them to have a card ready for husband the next day as he and daughter were coming after myself and I would already be at the parks...it was not ready upon arrival and then they couldn't find reservation- they told him that there was no one under that name in the hotel...found it in the end but was quite a while.   Room- the category I booked on hotels.com said "suite, 1 king bed with sofa bed, corner" from my reading I knew it would still all be one room. The room was Huge! We did not feel crowded. The room was decently updated and had a mini
Manager Response: Dear EAlly,  Thank you for sharing your feedback with us on your recent stay.  Wonderful to hear you had a great time at DL and enjoyed your stay here at our hotel property as it was a pleasure to have you as our guest.  We look forward to seeing you again in the near future.    All the Best,  Kevin Do Assistant General Manager

Summary: This place wasn’t terribly expensive and is located close enough that you can walk to Disneyland. The facilities are a little dated, but access to all the fun city stuff makes it worth it. There is a heated pool, but no jacuzzi.
Manager Response: Dear Kasaundra L,  Thank you for leaving your feedback with us.  Thank you so much for your generous words as we enjoyed having you as our honorary guest.  We hope to see you again real soon.  Best Regards,  Kevin Do Assistant General Manager

Summary: Although I had a reservation for 3 nights, they had no room for me when I walked in from the airport at 1 am. They quickly made a call to the Hyatt and said I would have to go there for 1 night. I requested all 3 at the Hyatt at that point so I wouldn't have to unpack and pack and then wait for a room. They wouldn't allow that....so the desk clerk walked me over...but not knowing how to get there, he took me thru the shrubs while the sprinklers were on. I was soaked. The following day, I returned to find that my room wasn't ready and was told I to come back in 3 hours. I REFUSED and demanded a room right then....and got one. Carpets are filthy in the hallway and room. Grout was moldy in the bathroom. The restaurant wasn't opened for dinner only the bar. It's a run-down, old
Manager Response: Dear John K,  Thank you for leaving your feedback about your recent stay with us.  We do sincerely apologize sir for the unfortunate situations you had to face while on vacation as we can understand how frustrating that could be.  Please forgive us as we are still improving and strive to bring the best customer experience to all of our guests.  We do hope you would reconsider us in the future on your next trip to Anaheim.  Sincerely,  Kevin Do Assistant General Manager

Summary Heading: Double charged for our room, insects, broken sinks, dated bathrooms
Summary: We booked this hotel under the impression that we would be paying at the end of our stay. Our card was authorized for the full amount at check in, and then AGAIN at the end of our stay. Despite the fact that we had already paid. After calling the hotel's general manager, Naomi, who was very difficult to get ahold of, she explained that their policy was to charge us for the stay, remove the charge, and then to take the funds again at the end of the stay. However, the first pending charge was NOT removed and we were charged TWICE for the room. Apparently, this was supposed to be explained to us at check in, it was NOT. I refuse to believe this hotel operates under such an insane policy.  Staff was extremely rude to us when we had questions about parking. A short woman with chin
Manager Response: Dear cas4143,  Thank you for giving us your feedback from your recent stay with us.  We sincerely apologize for the issues your experienced while here.  I have shared this with all of our staff and they have committed to stride to provide excellent service to all of our guests in the future.  Best Regards,  Kevin Do Assistant General Manager

Summary: The location of this hotel is perfect for visiting the disney resort. A short walk takes you straight to the parks without the hassle of paying high parking fees or catching busy buses.  The hotel itself is exactly what you expect from a clarion. Clean, large rooms and friendly helpful staff.  I cant thank the staff enough for making it a special stay for us on what was a very special trip.  i highly recommend
Manager Response: Dear jas8688,  Thank you for leaving your feedback.  And thank you so much for your generous words as we look forward to having you with us again next time on your next Disney vacation.  All the Best,  Kevin Do Assistant General Manager

Summary: This is a very well located Hotel that was Clean and had everything you need. Very good sized rooms that let our family of four have a little space, the staff were very good/helpful. Close to all the major shopping malls and theme parks. It would be fair to say this an older hotel that is due a make over, but everything worked. All in in all good value for money and does what it needs to do.
Manager Response: Dear hatch69,  Thank you for sharing your feedback with us.  And thank you so much for your generous words regarding our wonderful staff and the cleanliness of our hotel facility.  Please come back and see us again soon!  Sincerely,  Kevin Do Assistant General Manager

Summary Heading: Great hotel and really ideal for visiting Disneyland
Summary: We stayed here for 4 nights on a family vacation, this was my first time visiting Anaheim so I wasn’t sure what to expect.  We arrived at the hotel and was greeted by a very friendly young lady behind the reception.  Check in was very straight forward and fast and before we knew it we where on our way upstairs to our room.  First impressions was it was nice and clean, the room was very big which was ideal as there was 4 of us staying in the room. The beds where extremely comfortable, it had plenty of amenities such as a full size fridge, coffee machine, toiletries, air con.  The thing that really impressed me was how ideally placed it was when it came to visiting the Disney parks. It was literally only a 15 minute walk just straight up the road and along the way there were
Manager Response: Dear dannyp0401,  Thank you for sharing your feedback with us.  We are so glad to hear that you and your family had a wonderful and memorable experience at our hotel property and the Disneyland theme park.  We look forward to seeing you and your family again very soon on your next Disney Vacation.    All the Best,  Kevin Do Assistant General Manager

Summary: We booked our trip to California with Tui, which included flights, hotels and airport transfers. The hotel is located about an hour drive away from LAX. Excellently located,  very close to Disneyland parks and opposite the hotel is the free shuttle bus if you didn’t want to walk. (Takes about 10 minutes to walk to the parks) The staff were friendly and helpful when we booked in. First impressions of the hotel were, quite dated and perhaps needing a revamp. Our room comprised of two double beds. T.V, bath and shower, ironing board and iron, and tea and coffee facilities which were topped up every day. The beds were comfortable and we had a good view overlooking the pool area. One issue was on one of the. Hints there were young cockroaches crawling up the wall near our bed, which
Manager Response: Dear X7112JWlouiseg,  Thank you for your feedback.  We honestly thank you for your kind words commending our friendly staff as we take great pride in taking care of our guests.  We will definitely look into those concerns you brought up as well and take care of the issues for our future guests.  We hope to see you with us again one day.  Sincerely,  Kevin Do Assistant General Manager

Summary Heading: Nice like the Hilton ! Not as expensive!
Summary: This hotel may be old, but it’s really nice. The place was clean, and my suite had been updated. I am a diamond member, and was given free parking. The hotel is in a good location. You can walk to Disney. We took the shuttle bus for $6 each. You are going to be walking Disney all day, so you don’t need that 40 minute round trip walk. The room was very nice, hotel old or not. I don’t understand why people complain about the hotel being old when it’s a really nice place. The hotel is rather sound proof. The guests walking above was not a problem. My only complaint would be the TV in the room is way too small. It needs a LG update. The breakfast is pretty good with fresh oatmeal. It’s not too expensive, about $12. They have good waiters to serve you. If you think about $12 is
Manager Response: Dear danielgkendall,  Thank you so much for your feedback.  Thank you also for your kind words regarding the hotel property as we're always doing improvements to the hotel itself.  As we just completed phase one of our renovation down in our lobby area, phase two will be begin very shortly as we're all very excited about it.  We hope to see you with us again sir on your next Magic Kingdom adventure.  All the Best,  Kevin Do Assistant General Manager

Summary: This hotel was very quiet which was nice. $6 Lyft ride to Disneyland. The hotel is very outdated and badly need of an update. We paid for a rollaway bed that was terrible. It was just springs wrapped in fabric. I was going to ask for a refund on that fee but heard another couple being talked to quite rudely by the guy stand at the Guest Service desk, I was afraid to even ask. The breakfast was ok. It was nice that it was free for kids.
Manager Response: Dear 84sherrij,  Thank you for your feedback as it was our pleasure having you as our guest.  As we're in the midst of our renovation to the hotel property, we would love to have you come back and be our guest again in the very near future.  Warm Regards,  Kevin Do Assistant General Manager

Summary: Nice hotel. Easy walk to Disney parks (maybe 15-20 min). Anaheim transit is $6 for a day pass. Lots of restaurants around. Big gift shop. On the upper floors, the bank of 3 elevators take awhile to get to you. We were on the fourth floor and it took 4 minutes for an elevator to arrive ( I timed it). And housekeeping uses these elevators so if they are in the cab you have to wait for another. Room was large with a fridge but no microwave. Our last night the toilet broke. The tank would fill. We had to add water to the tank to be able to use it. It was late that night and as we had to get up early (4 am) to catch our flight we didn’t report it until checkout. They never replaced the in room coffee, either. Not typical for a Choice hotel.  We could hear the traffic noise in the
Manager Response: Dear cnanrw,  Thank you for sharing your feedback with us.  And thank you for your generous words regarding the convenience of our hotel property to the surrounding Disneyland Resort area.  We appreciate your business and we hope you will look us up again on your next Disney vacation.    Sincerely,  Kevin Do Assistant General Manager

Summary Heading: Like being in a time capsule...
Summary: We had a convention to attend and were “awarded” the Clarion as our hotel. It is very old and not updated. Staff was friendly and it was super convenient to the convention center though.   Bathroom felt dirty because of the old tile. Towels were not as plush as I would have liked....
Manager Response: Dear Cathrab28,  Thank you for sharing your feedback with us.  Wonderful to hear you found our hotel location convenient to the surrounding Disney Resort.  Thank you also for commending our friendly staff as we take great pride in warm feedback.  We hope to see you again with us soon.  Warm Regards,  Kevin Do Assistant General Manager

Summary: We chose this hotel for its location to Disney and it didn't disappoint, We stayed for two nights and paid extra for parking on site. Hotel was clean, tidy and helpful staff nice looking pool area and restaurant but we had no time to use them. Ten minute walk to Disney entrance. Will stay again.
Manager Response: Dear Alan W,  Thank you for your feedback.  Thank you so much for kind words regarding our hotel property and recognizing our hard working staff.  We hope to see you again soon on your next Magic Kingdom adventure.  All the Best,  Kevin Do Assistant General Manager

Summary: Great location, 20 minute walk to Disneyland and right across the road from the shuttle bus. Hotel is a bit old but was good for the price. Asked the concierge how best to get to San Diego and he told us to Uber! Went online and managed to find a bus tour that included tickets to Seaworld for around the same price as a one way Uber.  Plenty of places to eat nearby
Manager Response: Dear pktick,  Thank you for sharing your feedback with us.  Wonderful to hear you enjoyed our hotel location and it's short walking distance to the Disneyland Resort.  We look forward to seeing you again with us in the near future.  Best Regards,  Kevin Do Assistant General Manager

Summary: We stayed for 3 nights, the location is great, we were told $6 for a day fro the bus from door to door to Disney, but when I checked online, it was confusing, some said it costs $2 from the corner of the main street outside to Disney, some said it is free if you can catch the local bus by the city..... then we decided to walk to Disney 1st morning so we could get something to eat. At the gate, the guy told us there is a free shuttle bus to 'Toy Story Parking Lot', which is only 3-5 minute walk from the hotel, don't understand why the front desk (we asked 2 different people, the guy when we check-in & the lady before we went out 1st morning) didn't tell us? they only mentioned the $6 bus...... Overall it is in very good location with bunch of restaurants around & 2 gas station,
Manager Response: Dear EddieEddie2018,  Thank you for sharing your feedback with us.  Glad you enjoyed the close proximity of our hotel to the Disneyland Resort.  We hope to see you with us again real soon.  Sincerely,  Kevin Do Assistant General Manager

Summary: I would never recommend this place to anyone. When you arrive you find out that there is a $16 a night parking fee. The room istself was disgusting and dirty, we found children's underwear among our bed and moldy chucks of food in the freezer we never used. Good luck getting a hold of the manager, after promising us a partial refund we never heard from or could get a hold of him again. The only way we were still able to get the refund was through Orbitz.
Manager Response: Dear aleecetaylor,  Thank you for leaving your feedback with us.  We do sincerely apologize for the issues you encountered as we do strive to do better each day.  We do hope you would reconsider and give us another try down the road.  Warm Regards,  Kevin Do Assistant General Manager

Summary: This hotel was absolutely packed when we went.  Its proximity to Disneyland was great. Has a bus at the door thats so handy.  Hotel was clean, has a laundry, wifi and air con and convenience shop downstairs.  No negatives for me.
Manager Response: Dear michelleh0ward,  Thank you for leaving your feedback.  We're glad to hear you had a great time on your Disney vacation while staying with us.  We look forward to seeing you again on your next Magic Kingdom vacation.  All the Best,  Kevin Do Assistant General Manager

Summary: Location for Disneyland is good....but that’s it! We stayed here for 5 nights. Room was serviced only once (and that was only because I saw housekeeping in the hall and asked how often do they service rooms, she advised ‘every day’! I advised her that we had been there for two days already and it had not been done at all). Had to contact the front desk to ask for fresh towels as by now ours were wet and horrid. Bathroom had long black hairs in tub and on floor (none of us match that description).  When leaving for the day on day 4 I asked at desk why our room has still not been serviced? Oh, you must have had the Do Not Disturb sign on your door. NO! We did not. Asked if someone could please service room and replace towels etc whilst we were out and also replace toilet paper as
Manager Response: Dear Merilyn T,  Thank you for sharing your feedback with us.  I would like to sincerely apologize for the room issues your had to endure during your stay as I know how frustrating that can be.  Your satisfaction is important to us and we will be using this feedback you provided to make improvements to ensure we offer an exceptional experience for our guests in the future.  We do hope you will reconsider staying with us again.  Warm Regards,  Kevin Do Assistant General Manager

Summary: Wife and I stayed on a Monday and Tuesday night in room 839, which is a wheelchair accessible room with a wheelchair accessible shower. Room was very clean and quiet. Liked the fact their bath towels were extra long compared to standard hotel towels. Nice bed and linens. It has a nice pool area. Did not eat at the restaurant so no opinion of that. Parking lot was close to the entrance to the hotel. Close to the convention center and is a five minute drive from the Honda Center where the NHL Anaheim Ducks play. Overall, very pleasant stay. Would definitely stay there again.  Disneyland Hack: Walkable to Disneyland but you can also cross the street where there is a remote Disneyland parking lot and catch a free Disneyland shuttle to and from the park.
Manager Response: Dear Castraveler916,  Thank you for sharing your feedback with us.  Thank you so much for your kind words as we're very happy to hear you enjoyed your Disney vacation while staying at our hotel property.  We look forward to seeing you again next time on your next Magic Kingdom adventure.  All the Best,  Kevin Do Assistant General Manager

Summary: Clean rooms, and friendly staff. The breakfast was just ok. No coffee in the lobby was a bummer. You had to go to the breakfast to get coffee. The restaurant staff was super slow. the eggs were runny, and the waffle machine kept getting stuck with mix. The parking lot made you pull out in the opposite direction of Disney and you had to make a U-turn each time you pulled out. You could walk from here, but Uber was so much quicker and easier than driving or walking.
Manager Response: Dear Jaimie R,  Thank you for sharing your feedback with us.  Thank you so much for commending our friendly staff and clean rooms as we take great pride in taking care of our guests.  We hope to see you again soon on your next Disney adventure.  Best Regards,  Kevin Do Assistant General Manager

Summary: Its close, its clean, its a hotel.  Bathroom was the only downfall for me. Shower head was not adjustable and hit me in the face at 5 foot 1. Bathroom was very small. But it did the job.  Staff were freiendly.
Manager Response: Dear MichelleK1691,  Thank you for your feedback.  Thank you for your generous words regarding our friendly staff as we take great pride in taking care of our guests.  We look forward to seeing you again on your next Disneyland trip.  Best Regards,  Kevin Do Assistant General Manager

Summary: Not only cockroaches, but hair and black mold in the bathroom. My daughter and I were in Anaheim for a convention, thought we would save money. The room was filthy! Wiped the bathroom floor with a wash cloth and it came up black! When we complained, the staff gave us a card and told us to call the number on the card to file a complaint. They didn't care. Don't stay here. There are so much better hotels out there
Manager Response: Dear TravelingGrandmaDiva,  Thank you for sharing your feedback on your recent stay with us.  I am so sorry ma'am as I do sincerely apologize for the issues you encountered during your stay.  Please know, I have already aware of my maintenance and housekeeping department heads of your concerns as we will be looking into the matter to make the necessary corrections and improvements as we take all issues seriously.  As we're currently going through a renovation at the moment to improve the quality of the hotel we do hope to get another chance with you later down the line to better serve you.  Warm Regards,  Kevin Do Assistant General Manager

Summary: Room smelled like old musk and cigarettes. Maybe they need to replace carpets and curtains. Rooms are outdated. One plug in bathroom. Beds were comfortable. Small coffeemaker in room not too many choices.  Parking fees, cost to eat breakfast, just seemed tacky. Atmosphere didn’t feel too inviting sort of like ok you can spend the night but hurry up and leave. Just seems that this place does the bare minimum just to stay legal.
Manager Response: Dear LaSirena68,  Thank you for leaving your feedback.  Our apologies for falling short of your expectation as I know how frustrating that could be.  Please know, we are currently going through a renovation as we look to make great improvements throughout the property.  We hope you can give us another chance on your next trip so we can better serve you second time around.  Sincerely,  Kevin Do Assistant General Manager

Summary: We stayed for 7 nights for the sole purpose to go to Disneyland.  The rooms were clean and comfortable. My daughters enjoyed swimming in the pool of an afternoon after a hot morning at Disneyland.  The staff were friendly and helpful I wish they had told us about the free Disneyland shuttles across the road from the hotel when we checked in.  I stumbled across this service when we left Disneyland and I just could not walk the 10-15 min back to the hotel.  Then heard a staff member explaining this service to another family checking in.  The laundry facilities were fantastic.  Overall we enjoyed our stay.
Manager Response: Dear Cmryan74,  Thank you for sharing your feedback with us.  We're glad you enjoyed your stay along with the kids having a great time at our pool and the Disneyland park.  As for the Disneyland parking lot shuttles, those are not FREE to any guests as you would have to park your vehicle over in their lot to have access to their shuttle service.  I do apologize for the confusion and misunderstanding.  We hope to see you again next time on your next Magic Kingdom adventure.  Best Regards,  Kevin Do Assistant General Manager

Summary: Location great for Disneyland. Disneyland bus pickup at Disney parking lot across the street, (no charge) 7 to 10 minute walk one main road to cross with kids at light controlled intersection. Rooms are just okay nothing special but clean.
Manager Response: Dear Charles C,  Thank you for sharing your feedback with us.  Thank you for your kind words regarding our great location to the surrounding Disneyland Resort area.  We look forward to seeing you again soon!  All the Best,  Kevin Do Assistant General Manager

Summary: This hotel needs maintenance. We stayed during a busy summer convention time of year. The location of this Clarion is excellent. You can actually walk to the convention center and if you are up to a 15 minute walk, you  can also walk to Disneyland!  The problem was only that we were given a room with special access that seemed pretty forgotten at the end of a hall. Spacious of course to accommodate a wheelchair. The bathroom had a shower with no bathtub. So far that was not a big issue for us, although I would have appreciated being told they were out of regular rooms and were giving us the special access room. The problem was that the bathroom was abandoned. Fixtures exposed under the zinc covered with old dirty platic, light switches with rusted screws from like the 70s! Out
Manager Response: Dear 25mariaq,  Thank you for sharing your feedback with us.  We're glad you enjoyed the location of our hotel property to the Convention Center and to the Disneyland Resort.  We do hope to see you again as we prepare for our renovation later this year.  Sincerely,  Kevin Do Assistant General Manager

Summary Heading: In desperate need of a make-over
Summary: We stayed here for a convention. The positive is that the beds were comfortable. The bath rooms were very dated and in some situations mold was present. My shower barely spit out water. The restaurant was poor at best and the "bar" was not opened when advertised and when it was it was sad. The "fitness center" is very limited. The location is convenient to the convention center and Disney. That is about the best I can say.
Manager Response: Dear Scott G,  Thank you for sharing your feedback with us.  Our sincere apologies for the issues you encountered during your stay.  We are in the mist of a renovation starting in the lobby and will be going towards a heavier renovation at the end of the year.  We hope you would reconsider staying with us again as we look to better the hotel for our guests and staff.  Warm Regards,  Kevin Do Assistant General Manager

Summary: We chose this property since we were attending an event at the convention center. The location was perfect; close to restaurants & convenience stores as well. The staff was pleasant and our room was ready early. Unfortunately, this hotel is extremely dated. Our room was clean but everything in it seemed at least 20 years old. We had a “suite.” Strange thing is, the sitting area had a couch but no television. There was a big empty space where a television would fit. There are so many other brand new hotels in the area at a similar price point that I doubt we’d choose the Clarion again.
Manager Response: Dear rmwm918,  Thank you for sharing your feedback with us.  We are glad you enjoyed the convenience of our location to the Convention Center and for commending our wonderful staff.  We do hope to see you again in the very near future.  Best Regards,  Kevin Do Assistant General Manager

Summary: My reservations/group accommodations were messed up because of ineffective staff. Instead of attempting to correct the problem, the even more inefficient management was rude and confrontational. The management might treat you better if you are Vietnamese, Chinese or any other non-white background. "Manager Kevin's" toxic attitude turned to flirtatious when another team mom came to my rescue. He was only interested to see if she was Vietnamese or Chinese. What that had to do with the problem at hand, I'm still trying to figure out. The only thing that keeps this outdated, dirty, rudely managed hotel open is its location. Try ordering a drink or food in the "café" =hope you aren't really hungry and have a few hours. You better be willing to explore the bar/kitchen to make it
Manager Response: Dear tiredofrude,  Thank you for taking the time to complete our online survey regarding your recent stay at our hotel.   Our apologies ma'am for the issues your encountered. Your satisfaction is important to us and we will be using the feedback you provided to make improvements to ensure we offer an exceptional experience for our guests in the future.  I hope that you will consider staying with us again so that we can have another chance to provide you with a superior experience.   Sincere Regards,  Sal Barahona Night Manager

Summary: My fiancee booked a surprise trip to Disneyland and he chose this hotel. The location to Disneyland is brilliant and the bus system was great. The staff were always friendly and helpful and gave great recommendations for shows and day trips out. They helped us get the most of out our trip to Anaheim.Our room was very spacious with lots of windows for us to enjoy the California sunshine. I would definitely recommend and return to this hotel.
Manager Response: Dear hollyisonholidayy,  Thank you for taking the time to post your review.  We are glad you enjoyed our staff and location.  We do hope you will visit us again the next time you visit Anaheim.  All the Best,  Kevin Do Assistant General Manager

Summary Heading: Avoid this place at all costs
Summary: This is definitely a place to avoid, we were recommended it by a reputable holiday company as an equivalent to what we asked for, this place is disgusting and should be avoided at all costs, staff are rude, unhelpfull and have no knowledge of the local area (something holiday makers rely on a lot of the time) tried to talk to them but they were so rude I gave up.  rooms are dirty and disgusting, dirty loose covers on furniture covering older dirtier furniture, bathroom is the worst I have ever seen (worse than some $30 motels I have used). The cocktail bar is akin to a cheap working mens club, dingy with no comfortable seating but on a plus side it was only open 1 evening out of the 7 we were there. The games in the games room are disgusting, DO NOT let your children in here
Manager Response: Dear trvedvd1966,  Thank you for sharing your feedback with us.  Our sincerest apologies for the issues you encountered here at the hotel and for not meeting your expectation.  Please know, our hotel property will be going through a heavy facelift renovation in the upcoming months as we are excited to for this big project.  We do hope you would give us another try for us to better serve you and your family and to make a positive and memorable experience.  Sincerest Regards,  Kevin Do Assistant General Manager

Summary: Stayed here for 4 nights at the start of our California trip. I have never been to Anaheim before and the hotel is very well located for Disney. We only used it as somewhere to sleep not eating any meals there. The rooms are in need of update they seem tired and the bathrooms are small. Space wise they were adequate for my family of 4 and the beds are comfortable. Although they had a balcony there was no means of accessing it as the door was fastened shut. Front desk staff were helpful and quick to move our room when we first arrived as I didn't want to back onto the light shafts.
Manager Response: Dear David G,  Thank you for sharing your feedback with us.  We are happy to hear you enjoyed your stay with us and for recognizing our helpful staff as they will be delighted to hear of your generous words.  We hope to see you with us again soon.  Kindest Regards,  Kevin Do Assistant General Manager

Summary: Me and my boyfriend visited here back in March and it was great! For our first time in the US they certainly made a great first impression! Hotel was clean and spacious and was right next to Disneyland California ☺️ although we didn’t visit there we did take an hour bus journey to Hollywood and universal studios! Staff were very helpful and hotel was good! Great location! Would love to visit LA again! 😍😍
Manager Response: Dear ChristieJay1999,  Thank you so much for sharing your feedback with us.  We are delighted to hear you had a great time in Anaheim as well as commending our wonderful employees which would make our staff feel super special.  Thank you again and we look forward to your next Disney trip.  All the Best,  Kevin Do Assistant General Manager

Summary Heading: If you want to hear barking dogs this is your hotel of choice!
Summary: Stayed there 6-7-19. We were put in a ground floor room with an adjoining door to the room next door. Quiet at first until the people in the room either check in or arrived back at there room. Loud doesn't even begin to describe these folks. There is a 3/4 inch gap under the adjoining door and you could here EVERY WORD that was being said. Mind you the yappy dogs didn't start in until in the morning. We wake up to the loud female neighbor telling everyone in her room that the dog was looking for a place to SH*T (she used that exact word) and to put the damn dog in the bathroom so it could Sh*t on the floor. They must have left to go eat breakfast because the one dog started to back non stop and the other dog started to howl and scratch at the adjoining door. There was a
Manager Response: Dear Leesa,  Thank you for sharing your feedback with us.  I am are so sorry for the issues you encountered during your stay as I know how frustrating that can be.  Please know, I have brought that attention to my directing manager as we will be looking into that matter and make the necessary adjustments to better serve our future guests.  Sincerely,  Kevin Do Assistant General Manager

Summary Heading: Fine if you're on a Disney Vacation!
Summary: Whenever you are planning to go to Disneyland, you really only sleep in your hotel.  So for that reason, this hotel is perfect.  We were there for 6 nights, and had a 5 day Disney pass.  Each morning, we would make the short walk to the Toy Story Parking lot, and take the shuttle to Disneyland.  Some of our family did walk home from the parks, as going home at night, the shuttles were busy.  Our room was clean, but dated.  There was a breakfast available for a fee, but we never accessed it.  Previously, we had stayed at the Homewood Suites across the street, and that hotel included breakfast.  For our family of 6, (we had two rooms)  it was much more cost efficient to use this hotel, and pay for our breakfasts.  We found many different options for breakfast at downtown Disney,
Manager Response: Dear disneyvacationer2005,  Thank you for sharing your feedback with us.  So glad to hear you had a great time at the Magic Kingdom as we couldn't be more thrilled for you.  We look forward to seeing you next time on your next Disney vacation!  All the Best,  Kevin Do Assistant General Manager

Summary: I have to give Clarion Anaheim 4 stars because they exceeded my expectations when I checked in at 6:30 am, and my room was available! I was in town for the IPW2019 conference so it was a busy time but I really needed to rest after a sleepless redetermine flight from Hilo. That alone endears this property and my cheerful front desk agent to me....but:  The bathroom sink water smells sulphuric every time you run the sink. You’ll definitely want your own drinking water. I refilled from the fitness center jug as is my custom.   There is no recycling and everything is plastic! That goes for the Anaheim Conference too.   Skip the woefully mediocre but expensive breakfast buffet!  In room coffee is your only choice on property until the restaurant opens at 6 am. Make alternate
Manager Response: Dear punatic66,  Thank you for sharing your feedback with us.  And thank you for your kind words regarding our front desk staff and the smooth & early check in.  We will look into those concerns you brought up and make the necessary corrections as I speak.  We look forward to seeing you again next time with us.  Sincerely,  Kevin Do Assistant General Manager

Summary Heading: RUN AWAY! DO NOT GO, YOU'LL REGRET IT!
Summary: Where to start. This is my 10th wedding anniversary holiday! They did not follow the booking information my travel agent gave them. And we received 2 'double beds' which were to any Austrlian were 2 king single, you could not fit two adults if you tried. I was told at the desk there was nothing they could do. I called my travel agent and she was put on hold for 20min and there was no one at the desk. When they eventually picked her up she was told, only the guest can request to be put in a king room, which I had tried. Andthey told her they had one available tomorrow (we had 6 nights). When she told me this I went back to the counted and spoke with the same person she did and he denied it saying that bookings were 'fluid' at this stage they could not give me one tomorrow and I
Manager Response: Dear Trez P,  Thank you for sharing your feedback with us.  We are truly sorry for the event that you experienced as we know how frustrating that can be especially during your 10th wedding anniversary as we wholeheartedly apologize for that.  As we are still improving everyday we hope that you would one day give us another try down the line in the near future for us to better serve you with a more memorable and superior guest experience.  Happy 10th wedding anniversary!   Kind Regards,  Kevin Do Assistant General Manager

Summary: The room was pretty basic but outdated.  It is really in need of a renovation.  I mean, it was an okay place to crash after a long day at a conference or Disney, but don’t expect luxury accommodations.  It’s in a good location for the convention center and Disneyland.  The buffet breakfast was $14 (I think) and was essentially what many other hotels include in the room rate.
Manager Response: Dear Gino,  Thank you for sharing your feedback with us.  Glad to hear you enjoyed the convenience of our hotel to the Disneyland Resort and the Convention Center.  We hope to see you again real soon.  Best Regards,  Kevin Do Assistant General Manager

Summary: While it may not be the most glamourous of hotels along Disney row, it's one of the best values in Anaheim. The rooms are clean and well-appointed. Our bathroom was dates but all facilities were in working order. The pool and lounge are retro cool. Easy parking. Quick walk to Disney, Target and other conveniences. Free breakfast with great staff and service. I would rather save money on accommodations, as long as the location is safe and quiet, and spend $ on treats.
Manager Response: Dear Janet,  Thank you for sharing your feedback with us.  Thank you so much for your generous words regarding the value and conveniences of our hotel.  We hope to see you again soon on your next Magic Kingdom trip.  Best Regards,  Kevin Do Assistant General Manager

Summary: Went on a girls trip to Disneyland this past week. My niece is the one who booked this particular hotel so I had no idea what to expect. She got a package so certain things were included like daily parking and breakfast so that’s a plus. Let’s start with the other positives- the property is very close to Disneyland so walking is no problem. There are convenience stores and a target nearby for essentials. The staff was very friendly, the grounds and rooms are clean, it has a large outdoor pool. The beds are comfortable (but after 10-12 hours at an amusement park I could probably sleep on the floor and do just fine). The breakfast buffet is pretty standard, not bad but nothing to get to excited about. Now some of the bad- the property is fairly outdated. The bathrooms are clean
Manager Response: Dear greenakerr,  Thank you for sharing your feedback with us.  Thank you for your kind words regarding our friendly staff as we do take great pride in serving all our guests.  As we look to make improvements to our hotel in the later months of this year we do hope to get a chance to see you again.    Sincerely,  Kevin Do Assistant General Manager

Summary: There were multiple issues of which I've already let Expedia know but will do again as I haven't heard back. First off, when my daughter and I arrived close to midnight on Wednesday, May 8th evening, we were told that there are plumbing issues with our room and they have nothing else available so are putting us up at the Red Lion down the street. I was told that they would credit me for one night for the inconvenience. They did not offer us a ride or taxi so we had to walk with our suitcases down the street late at night - not right! We came back the next afternoon and got our room. I asked about the credit and the person at the front desk (different from the evening) said that he must have misunderstood and we wouldn't be getting a credit. On our last night, Saturday, May 11th
Manager Response: Dear TLF0425,  Thank you sharing your feedback with us.  We are so sorry for the unfortunate events you experienced during your stay and can understand how frustrating it was.  Due to the property plumbing issues we encounter that week as it was a real challenge and we apologized wholeheartedly that it effected your vacation.  We are always improving and hoping one day you would give us another try to better serve you with a more magical experience.  Warmest Regards,  Kevin Do Assistant General Manager

Summary: We just returned from five days at this hotel while we went to Disneyland and the beach, and this was a fantastic hotel for a family. We had two queen beds and a pull out couch that slept my family of five perfectly. We enjoyed that it was nice and quiet at night so my kids were able to go to bed after long days at the parks and the beaches. The hotel room also had a small fridge and microwave, along with a coffee maker, so we were able to bring our own cereal from home, buy milk at the CVS or Walgreen's right up the street, and we saved a lot of money eating breakfast in the hotel room!  This hotel is about a 10-15 minute walk from the main gate of Disneyland/California Adventure. My 6-year-old didn't have any trouble making the trip on foot, so we were able to leave our car
Manager Response: Dear msagermcnett,  Thank you for sharing your warm feedback with us.  We can't thank you enough for those wonderful comments about our hotel and the short walking distance to the Toy Story parking lot as it was our pleasure and honor having you and your family as our guests.  We look forward to seeing you again on your next magical Disneyland adventure.  All the Best,  Kevin Do Assistant General Manager

Summary: Walking distance to the parks and affordable. The room was clean and comfortable. The pool is well maintained and the staff is friendly. Would definitely stay again. Good selection of restaurants nearby.
Manager Response: Dear bntzmimi,  Thank you for sharing your feedback with us.  Glad to hear you found our room comfy along with a friendly staff.  We look forward to seeing you again on your next Magic Kingdom outing.  Regards,  Kevin Do Assistant General Manager

Summary Heading: Ya get what ya pay for
Summary: If you are looking for a reasonably priced hotel within walking distance to Disneyland or very close to the Convention Center, then the Clarion is a good choice. Is it a fancy hotel? Nope. Is it a little dated? Yep. We stayed for 3 nights, it was clean, quiet, and the staff were helpful when needed. There are 5-Star hotel options all over the place at 5-Star prices, if that is important to you. But if not, then this is a decent hotel.
Manager Response: Dear Matt,  Thank you for sharing your feedback with us.  Thank you for your kind words about the hotel cleanliness & quietness along with the helpful staff as we were delighted to have you with us during your stay in Anaheim.  We hope to see you again real soon!  Kind Regards,  Kevin Do Assistant General Manager

Summary Heading: Close to the convention center, convenient
Summary: The hotel is Ok, a bit old but convenient. Also a bit expensive but cheaper than the others close to the convention center. Bfast is not included, there is a non-expensive restaurant in the first floor.
Manager Response: Dear Wilmar186,  Thank you for sharing your feedback with us.  Glad to hear to you found our hotel property convenient to the surrounding area.  We look forward to seeing you again soon.  Regards,  Kevin Do Assistant General Manager

Summary: This one is showing its age. But everything worked in my room and is in a good location. For being in the happiest place on earth, a lot of the staff didn't wear smiles all that much. Oh, and the bed squeaked.
Manager Response: Dear i-witness30,  Thank you for sharing your feedback with us.  Glad you enjoyed the location of our property to the surrounding area of the happiest place on earth.  We hope to see you again on your next Magic Kingdom trip.

Summary: This place is an absolute joke we were told we had the next available room and 25 people were given rooms in front of us and we were told it was because of the room type we had a standard room not very believable never again will we waste our time or money
Manager Response: Dear atray08,  Thank you for taking the time to complete our online survey regarding your recent stay at our hotel.   Our sincere apologies for failing to exceed your expectations. I hope that you will consider staying with us again so that we can have another chance to provide you with a superior experience.

Summary: Great location as you are about 15 mins walk from Disney and also have the toy story parking lot across the road so you can take the free shuttle to and from the park which helps at the end of day after walking in Disney for 10 hours lol  Lovely service with check in staff ..all staff seemed friendly and very helpful..Restaurants are close by with Dennys and Carls Junior just down the street. Rooms were pretty standard nothing flash..probably could do with a refresh. Didn't eat in the hotel restaurant so I am not able to comment there..  We chose this hotel for price and location..if you are on a budget and don't want to be miles away from Disney then I would stay here.
Manager Response: Dear Kelly2332,  Thank you so much for sharing your positive feedback regarding your stay with us at our hotel. Best Regards,  Kevin Do Assistant General Manager

Summary Heading: Changed rate withouth notice, treated so poorly I canceled my reservation
