I contacted them later to inquire about adding an additional night to my stay. Note I say INQUIRE. I asked if it was available, and I wanted to know the rate of the extra day. Instead, they MADE the change before I confirmed I wanted it, and in the process, they CHANGED the rates for the other nights on my reservation, increasing by over $35/night. I refused to accept the reservation, and told them I didn't want the extra night if it meant changing the rate for my other nights, but the rep had already made the changes WITHOUT my confirmation, and claimed to not be able to rescind the changes. She said only the front desk of the actual
Manager Response: Dear sirrogueke,  Thank you for sharing your feedback with us regarding your experience.  We're very sorry to hear of the long process you had to go through.  Should you ever look to stay in town next time please call us here directly at the hotel as one of our agents would be delighted to assist you.  Warm Regards,  Kevin Do Assistant General Manager

Summary: I ran a seminar at this hotel and due to some miscommunication, the seminar room was not set up the way we needed it to be.  Without losing a beat, the Banquet manager and staff jumped into action to quickly ensure that the room was set-up and organized before our first guests arrived.  Just outstanding!
Manager Response: Dear Kevin,  Thank you so much for sharing your feedback with us.  We are glad to hear our Banquet manager and staff went above and beyond during the call of duty when needed most.  It was a pleasure having you with us as we look forward to seeing you again next time.    All the Best,  Kevin Do Assistant General Manager

Summary: We had a great stay at the Clarion Hotel Anaheim Resort. I wasn’t sure what to expect due to some of the negative reviews, but we were pleasantly surprised. Our room was clean and spacious, and the beds were comfortable. Bathrooms are small and outdated, but clean. We were on the 6th floor. Hotel staff was friendly. The Hotel is across the street from Disney’s parking lot, very easy walk to the free shuttle to the parks. We visited the hotel lounge a couple of nights and got good service, given that there was only one person working there. Antonio was very nice and attentive. We did the breakfast buffet one morning and that was good too. The only downside for us is that there was no microwave in the room, only a fridge. We were very happy with our stay and will definitely return!
Manager Response: Dear Moncana,  Thank you for sharing your feedback with us during your recent stay at our hotel.  We're so glad to hear you found the convenience of our hotel property to the Disneyland Resort.  We do look forward to seeing you again with us in the near future.  -Kevin Do Assistant General Manager

Summary: We stayed here for 3 night as part of our honeymoon. The room was clean + comfortable. We also had a fridge; coffee machine.+ Iron. The room itself was pretty spacious with good storage if you were staying longer. Staff were friendly and helpful when interacted with.  Short walk to shop; restaurants - Disneyland.  Only slight downside was the shower pressure was a bit low; even when you changed the setting. But we still enjoyed our stay  Overall a very pleasant stay.
Manager Response: Dear Flossie,  Thank you for sharing your experience with us during your stay with us.  Thank you also for your kind words as it was a pleasure having you as our guest.  We looking forward to seeing you again in the near future.  Best Regards,  Kevin Do Assistant General Manager

Summary Heading: Staff was great but hotel not so much
Summary: This was my first visit to this hotel.  The staff at check in was nice and friendly.  They offered me a fee upgrade to a suite based on my purchase package.  They always said bye when we left and check out was quick and easy.  I wish the hotel itself was better.  It’s old and run down.  You could tell that the suite was extended by walling in a balcony.  The beds were horrible, every one on the trip woke up with sore backs and necks.  The shower has zero water pressure and went cold when a toilet from another room was flushed.  If I had paid less then I wouldn’t expect more but you can pay roughly the same amount for better quality.  I visit this area at least twice a year but I won’t be staying at this hotel again.

Summary Heading: Older hotel, poor shower pressure BUT good price & within walking distance to Disneyland
Summary: Our family of 5 (kids = 14, 11, 6) stayed 8 nights (Dec 19-27, 2018) at the Clarion. Hotel is older but solid. Our main priority was that it was close enough to walk to the Main Gates of Disneyland and this fit the bill.   About 20min walk south is a Target which sells groceries so we made two trips there to load up on fruit, snacks, etc.   Hotel has an outdoor pool, coin-operated laundry (2 washers, 2 dryers. Each load is US$2). Front desk was courteous and check in / check out was painless.  Main concerns: 1. we had very poor shower pressure the duration of our stay 2. sofa bed is OLD and ridiculously uncomfortable but the kids were so tired each day that it was good enough.  Overall, a decent choice!!

We stayed for 4 nights but had enough after 1.  Our horrible stay started after we came back from Disneyland around 8:30pm extremely exhausted and just wanted to go to sleep. We walked in to find out our room hadn’t been serviced  by the housekeeper (see attached picture) and the toilet had leaked all over the bathroom floor.. I was at this point angry and disgusted and decided to phone down stairs and make a complaint. They apologised about the room not getting serviced but informed me that they wouldn’t be coming up to make the bed as the cleaner had left for the day.. but they would send the maintenance guy up to look at the toilet. 5 minutes later the maintenance guy knocks on the door. He takes a quick look at it and grabs a clean towel from the rack and wipes up the toilet

Most staff here are quite friendly and very accommodating. Rooms are tired looking but spacious with ample storage and drawers. Pool is quite big and refreshing. There is a gym. Laundry rooms + driers are sooo handy and convenient to have. Breakfast buffet is quite plentiful and varied. Locationwise, it is about 15 mins walk to DL. Or you can hop on an ART bus which stops right outside the hotel and takes you to DL. Most tour buses also stop right outside for pick ups and drop offs. Stone's throw away from the convention centre. Also, 15 or so mins walking distance to Target etc. IHOP is not far either and is on the way to DL. Oh and there is also a gift shop inside the hotel.

Large rooms will house a whole family.  Love that the sink is separate from the tub and toilet area so I could get ready and make coffee while the other part was being used.  Large fridge, and microwave meant we could reheat our left over pizza and keep real milk cold for coffee. Restaurants are in the lobby with a buffet breakfast and other choices within walking distance.  The staff was exceptional  and happy  we asked for extra coffee one day and we got it each day. we were there just before Christmas and the decorations were really nice .  The Anaheim transit bus stops right outside the door of this hotel so if you have any mobility problems or a stroller it is very convenient. But you can also walk to Disneyland !rooms are air conditioned.  This is a three star hotel, not

The hotel is quite dated , but I found the room to be a good size and clean. Beds were very comfy and I had a good sleep. Bathroom is very very tiny. Don’t think I’ve seen one this small. It’s a good 15 -20 minute walk from Disneyland. The ART shuttle bus to Disney is roughly every 20 mins and cost me $5 one way for 1 adult and 2 kids. The restaurant there is below average and is empty most of the time. There are no other places to eat close by. We ended up ordering food and having it delivered. It was an ok hotel for the price. For 3 adults and 2 kids it was about 95AUD a night which was good compared to others.

We stayed here for 3 nights and I regret it.  Location is good if you’re willing to walk 20 minutes to disneyland.  The hotel is really old.  The waiting time for the elevator was too much, they are really slow.  Rooms are not good at all, they’re small, furniture looks really old. Beds are too small, you cannot sleep 2 persons on the same bed, therefore, the rooms aren’t for 4 persons.  Bathroom is increible ugly and SO small and old. There aren’t much restaurants around the hotel so if you want to eat something you need to walk a lot.  Next time I rather pay a little more but stay in a more comfortable hotel.  Must people say “it’s ok just for a sleep” but if you just came from disneyland you’re so tired you need a nice comfortable sleep and trust me, this hotel won’t give you

Hotel room clean and spacious. Distance to Disneyland wasnt that great and there isn’t much around in regards to restaurants. Next time we will be staying in a hotel closer to Disney and to the restaurants.

Summary Heading: Nice Location, Comfy beds, odd parking, very loud
Summary: If you're visiting Disneyland or the convention center, this hotel is in a great spot!  The Disney Toy Story parking lot is directly across street. From this lot you can catch a free shuttle that will get you to Disneyland in about 5 minutes. We walked over and did this each day we went to Disneyland. The convention center is the other direction and there were a two different conventions while we were there. The flow of traffic in the lobby and parking lot seemed well organized.  We stayed in a two double room on the fourth floor. The rooms themselves were small but functional. The toilet and bathtub are in their own SMALL room but overall it worked out. Every room has a balcony and from our room you could see a few of the fireworks from Disney. The walls to the outside are

We were a family of 4 travelling to Disneyland and L.A. on a budget. The Clarion is an older hotel but has everything you need for a comfortable and convenient stay. The ART bus route stops right out front of the hotel. It would be a 15-20 min walk to Disney. Rooms were clean and serviced daily, the hotel also has a swimming pool, restaurant, laundry and gift shop. If you are looking to save money I would highly recommended the Clarion. Staff were friendly and helpful, good bang for your buck!!

Upon arrival, check in staff was very dismissive.  We wanted to valet our car because it’s only a $4 difference and the check in asked us if anyone was outside or if there was spots still available - why should I be answering that for you?  So he just handed us a self parking without attempting to call someone to help.  Process was extremely slow.  The room is very run down, very old muted/faded colors, horrible lighting.  Our TV had a huge scratch on the screen so we called to report it and nothing was done.  Hair on the sheets and in the shower.  The shower water pressure is horrible and keeps fluctuating temperature the whole time. Our AC unit kept making a loud clicking noise all night and when I called about it around 11 I was told there isn’t any maintenance and they

Stayed here due to being close to convention center. What a terrible mistake. This place is a dump with a super shady Cosby-esque dive bar located downstairs. Breakfast here was edible at least. Try the Hilton.

Stayed here for a 5 night stay for a conference. Brought the family along so that they can enjoy Disneyland during the day. Used the Anaheim Resort Transit to get to Disneyland and back. I know people walked to Disneyland, but after a long day of walking, who wants to walk almost a mile to the hotel? Within walking distance to the convention center. Much better rates than Hilton or Marriott which is next door. Lots of eateries and a drug store close by. Stayed on the 9th floor which had a fireworks view.   Staff was very nice. They also allowed delivery from amazon and held on to my order for 2 days until I arrived. Totally worth it to ship bottled water case, shelf stable milk, cup o noodles, Mac n cheese, and snacks so that I don’t have to haul it. Would stay here again if for

Have had amazing customer service. Will be arriving tomorrow for our Anniversary. Requested a King Bed after calling this morning the lady I spoke to was able to change it the day before we arrive. Very satisfied right now. Don't care about the negative reviews. It's the customer service that will continue making this my hotel when I go to Disneyland. Thank you for doing this for us.

We booked this as part of a multi hotel trip, we chose this hotel due to its location to Disney, and it’s certainly within walking distance. Staff were very helpful, rooms clean with fridge and safe, parking chargeable at $16.  Would go back and recommend

Summary Heading: Walk to Disneyland. That’s the best part of this budget inn.
Summary: Ten minute walk to Disneyland or cross the street and take the Woody shuttle at the Toy Story lot. Bus stops right out front.  One block from the Convention Centre. Starbucks, Mexican, Subway, Pizza, Sandwich Bar and Burgers in the Hilton lobby 1/2 block away.  Gift shop with toiletries, souvenirs and toys.  Pool was clean and stocked with pool towels and loungers.  This Clarion is a Budget hotel in need of a redo. Seem to have staffing issues. Housekeepers seemed in short supply,  There is no early booking into rooms. Despite arriving from out of town in the morning our rooms were not ready until exactly 4pm. No apology was made, no suggestions as to where to go to pass a few hours, no offer of beverages, although a sign on a side table suggested coffee was available for $2 per

My 6 year old daughter and I had the most amazing Disney vacation.  We spent 6 nights at the Clarion and despite all the bad reviews, I was pleased with our choice in hotel.  The price was right as well, especially coming from Canada with our exchange rate. It is certainly not the fanciest most modern hotel on the block.  If you need that, go somewhere else.  But it checked off our all our musts: Clean, safe, warm fun pool area, comfy beds, great location. The location is especially what would bring me back.  We utilized the free Disneyland shuttles at the Toy Story Parking Lot across the street.  A short walk to the buses, we were usually at the security lines within 15 minutes of leaving our hotel room.  Target was a 15-20 minute walk in the other direction, and a short 5

PROS: Great location with 10 min walk to Disney, two ART stops right outside. Across the street from the Toy Story Parking lot as well. Room was clean with no issues. The price was good, as it had the cheapest Disneyland package I could find. A very basic hotel, no frills. Free Wi-Fi, room had TV and mini-fridge.   CONS: Have to pay for parking and no free breakfast.

We had a 5 night stay here and loved it. A 10-20 min walk to Disneyland, although the ART has a stop right at the door. While this is no 5 star hotel, it is exceptional value as it is very clean, comfortable and the room was very spacious (we had a double bed suite). The restaurant wasn’t always open but there are heaps of other options in walking distance. We will definitely stay here again

The room was very nice and even included a couch and desk with entertainment center. The room was always very clean but the bathrooms need to be updated. The water pressure was so low that it took over an hour for a person to take a complete shower, which was a damper on the room. Over all the beds were very comfortable, their were plenty of pillows, and we were just a short distance away from Disneyland! The ART (Anaheim Resort Transportation) pickup was just outside of the hotel and was very convenient. The employees here were very helpful and polite, and on the day we checked out, even held our luggage at guest services for day before our flight home. Very nice experience and I would stay here again!

Summary Heading: Clean hotel with the most boring bar in the world
Summary: I stayed here for 5 nights at the beginning of September.  The hotel is in need of a refurb.  It is very clean but improvements are needed.  The patio doors in our rooms would not lock.  We called maintenance and they couldn't fix it, telling me to lift the door and then it would lock.  The bathroom is tiny and you have to shuffle around to get in the shower. All the décor is very 1990s.  The bar is the most boring place ever.  Its as if the staff cannot be bothered with it and just leave it open for the sake of it.  be advised that its not open after 10pm.  Its advertised as Karaoke but there is nothing there.  I went there every evening for a drink and never saw a single customer.  More time is needed to advertise the bar and get people in there to create a welcoming

Booked this months in advance with Expedia.  First time using Expedia and got a really good rate here.  Yes, I read all the bad reviews but the location was great and we were only staying 4 nights.  So I prepared myself and didn't expect anything good.  I was pleasantly surprised.  The room was fine for just my 11 year old and I.  We had 2 beds, desk, fridge and microwave.  Yes, the bathroom is extremely small, at least the toilet/tub shower area.  Hard to even get door closed behind you.  And yes, tub/shower combo could be replaced, old tile showerhead etc.  But again, I got a great deal, I couldn't complain.  Super convenient transportation with the ART bus right outside.  Yes, Disney is walking distance but I wasn't going to walk back and forth to Disney when we were spending

After reading many bad reviews I've avoided staying here in the past. I tried a Priceline Express Deal and ended up being booked here. I was nervous but since you can't make any changes to these deals, I had to suck it up and see for myself.  First off I want to say all the staff we dealt with were friendly and efficient. It has to be hard working at a property like this. It's old, dilapidated, and it's unfortunate the parent company hasn't invested in updating and upgrading. They could be making a fortune if they did even a basic update.  I'm not sure how this hotel has a 3 star rating. It's much more appropriately a 2 star property. It's old and dilapidated looking in many aspects such as the heavily stained carpets in some of the common areas, the very dated deck chairs and

Summary Heading: We were on a budget and this served us well
Summary: We stayed here for four nights to visit Disney and LA.   The hotel is right next to Disney so easy access. Clean enough for a budget room.  No issues with it at all.  Didn't expect the Ritz so wasn't surprised with what we got.    It's clean, functional, serves its purpose well and is in a very convenient location.  We could not find accomodation in the Hollywood area which we could afford on our travel budget and I'm pleased we couldn't.  For the price we paid, in Hollywood i expect that we would have been very disappointed.   Our first visit to California ever so learning the ropes on location etc.  If you're visiting Disney and LA, this location will take you around 90 minutes to get to Universal, Warner Bros studio tour etc. I'd still recommend staying this end of town if

Stayed here for a week at the end of August mainly to use as a base for visiting Disneyland. Check in was swift and we were allocated room 235, when we got into the room and opened the blinds we had a dreadful view of a low level roof and our window didn’t lock. We reported this to reception and were moved to a room on the fourth floor on the other side of the hotel which was much better.  The rooms are basic but very clean, the decor is incredibly dated and bathroom tiny, it is almost impossible to get in there and close the door behind you.  The walk to Disneyland took us roughly 30 minutes from leaving the hotel to arriving at the turnstiles in the park. There is a bus service that runs to the park but this is $5.50 per adult return, depending on the size of your family it is

Summary Heading: Booked for my Son’s 1st Disney Trip
Summary: We booked the Clarion through GetAwayToday.com to stay for a wedding & Disneyland. Overall happy with hotel! Spacious room, clean, mini fridge and microwave in room. Disney fireworks can be seen from our room.  Bathrooms could use updating, free parking (included in Pkg), free buffet breakfast, no movie rental in room. Walk to Disney within 15 mins.

Hotel was booked through British Airways for our trip to DisneyLand Anaheim, hotel was located two blocks from Disney about a 20min walk from the park which was no issue, plenty of eating places on the walk back for dinner in the evening if you did not want to pay park prices (we used Denny’s). The hotel staff was all polite, check in was efficient, the concierge was helpful on many occasions, arranged transport for us to Universal on one of our days and looked after our cases on our final day as we had a late flight, this allowed us to make the most of our final day, the room was perfect large, coffee machine available for use and a fridge to keep anything you needed cool, the air conditioning worked perfectly, yes the rooms need a revamp maybe but they serve their purpose,

This hotel was okay. It had all your basics and the room wasn't too squishy for 4 people. I liked that the bathroom sink was separate from the shower and toilet so you could brush your teeth while other family members could shower. The hotel is also in a really nice location. There's a lot of drugstores around the area as well as restaurants. It's about a 5-7 min drive to Disneyland and about a 15-20 min walk. You also have the option of taking the bus which I believe cost $5 per person.   This hotel wasn't the most amazing hotel I stayed at but it also wasn't the worse. It did the job and for the price we paid, I would consider staying here again.

We booked here through our travel agent. I would never ever return here.   The people who helped us unload our bagger were friendly and helpful. However it all went downhill from there.   At check in the staff were really rude/uninterested. The lady told me they were busy and she was tired. Which I understood, having come from 20plus hours of travelling.   We had booked a family room for two teenaged boys, my husband, myself and our 2 year old son. We were meant to have 2 double beds. There were 2 beds, however I would say more kind singles than double. So we requested a roll away and were charged accordingly. Without this we wouldn’t have Fit.   The bathroom is literally tiny - no room to change. And our bathroom leaked from the roof throughout the night waking us all up. When

My husband and I took the kids to Disneyland for the first time and we stayed at the Clarion. I was skeptical at first when reading the reviews. The Hotel turned out to be fairly nice. We were in a standard room. He had a balcony which was nice. It also had a refrigerator. A microwave would of been nice also. The only setback was the small bathroom and shower. It was way smaller than the normal hotel bathroom. The best part was kids 12 and under ate free with paying adult. That helped us out a lot. It's just about a few days 10-15 walk from the park. Really long blocks. We caught the bus on our last day which stoped right in front on the hotel. Lots of restaurants and drugstores around to pick up any items you forgot. I will definitely stay here again. I would probably get us a

Summary Heading: Good Location but Poorly Managed, Decrepit and Depressing (you get what you pay for)
Summary: I visit Disneyland multiple times annually and usually stay at my favorite hotel in the area, the Doubletree Anaheim Resort, which is clean, spacious, and comfortable. The Clarion had significantly reduced prices, so I decided to stay there on my most recent trip (Aug 2018). I noted the many negative reviews but thought I would judge for myself.  My experience was consistent with the other negative experiences.    Cons: - Slow and inefficient check-in; it was a nightmare (why does it take 15 mins for each person to check-in?) This experience was worse than visiting the DMV. Why is there only one clerk servicing a queue of 10 people at 11 pm? My son arrived after midnight and the queue was just as long. People are tired and want to go to their room after a long flight or

Summary Heading: Average probably better places to stay
Summary: We stayed here for central location and price and you definitly get what you pay for the, the rooms were average not very clean and our cleaners only ever made one bed a day (2 of us shared the room) there isn’t much of a view just car park views however Disneyland is a 5 minute walk. It’s good for the price and location if you’re on a budget

perfect location within walking distance for both anaheim convention centre and disneyland. staff are polite and helpful. rooms are clean. would stay there again. self serve laundry was good. pool area is a sun trap

I booked months in advance, called a couple weeks before and now I’m here and it’s not what I booked and they really don’t care. I booked 2 beds. They gave me one without even mentioning there was an issue and now do they have no roll away. Seriously you screwed up my reservation so go find one or move someone who didn’t prebiotic or prepay!

A bit old fashioned, but very efficient and clean. Good swimming pool, decent breakfast, OK WiFi, and excellently located if you attend a meeting at the convention center or if you want to go to Disney’s. Font desk slow both for checking in and checking out

Excellent location within walking distance to convention center, fine dining, quick bites and convenience stores. Friendly, competent staff worked hard to make sure my stay was enjoyable. Fun to observe  diversity of the guests, ALL enjoying their stay!!

The Clarion was a great location, super close to the Convention Center and the Disney Parking lot and I suppose Disneyland (I did not go there).  I read the reviews and was a bit nervous about the hotel, but the price was great and the location was perfect for my needs.  I was pleasantly surprised when I went in the room... overall it was really clean and in pretty good condition.  Not going to lie, there were definitely signs of age in areas around the room and bathroom, but honestly nothing that skeeved me out and I am pretty picky.  The bed is a bit hard for my liking, but was flat and not old and worn.... The room was decently quiet as I heard very little road noise just big trucks going by with air breaks but the AC drowned those out. The AC was a bit loud and stayed on

Excellent location next to the convention center, across the street from Morton's steakhouse, one block to Walgreens, street shuttle to Disneyland, friendly staff. Second time I've selected for business trip. Will definitely return for business or leisure! Plus, kids eat free for breakfast and dinner.

Summary Heading: Comfortable Stay with Lots of Pluses.
Summary: This hotel is great. It is in a great location, just one traffic light from  Disneyland south on Harbor Blvd, there are restaurants, there's a Target and other convenience stores close by. There is an outdoor pool on site, there is also a bar/lounge and a restaurant and a Disney gift store with some rarer items (Star Wars episode 1 and 2 boxed figures) and California gifts and merchandise.  The Disneyland LAX and John Wayne Airport buses stop right next door and there is a bus stop outside that goes south towards Costa Mesa and across the street which goes North to Fullerton Transport Center.  The rooms are nice, the beds are comfortable, there are adequate towels, the internet is fast and free, the staff are nice, there are laundry facilities for $2 to wash and $2 to dry.  The

This hotel is older.   Pros:  Close to restaurants & shopping  Walking distance to Disneyland  Great “little” gift store Laundry facilities on site  Cons: Close restaurant early if not busy. Doesn’t help the people who return later to find it closed before their posted time of 10 pm. Bathrooms very small with low water pressure  We had a good stay.  Some place to lay our heads for a good night sleep while exploring the surrounding areas.  Would return to this location.

Clarion- I now understand why it is so cheap to stay here!  Absolutely Disgusting Hotel - Rooms are beyond gross, stains on the carpet, and gum and slime stuck to the carpet- bathrooms have mild, dirty shower curtain, NO Shower water pressure, chips and cracks and dirt in the bathroom tiles and walls, Rooms smell of smoke and mold, Mini Fridge had broken racks and stains of previous people staying in the rooms food that must have over spilled and molded. Plug Ins in the room, only 3 worked, 1 moved when you attempted to plug anything in - Breakfast in the morning is Powdered Eggs - Microwave Bacon and pancakes, costs $32.00 for 2 adults to eat and its gross! Front desk staff are not knowledgeable about the area or tourist attractions and completely unhelpful and rude - only 2

We stayed 4 nights and whilst it’s not the newest hotel around, it was clean, comfortable and well situated from Disneyland - a 15min stroll and you are at the gates. There are a number of restaurants within the same distance of the hotel that have a variety of choices, Cheesecake Factory was a hit with us. We found the bed to be comfortable and the shower hot (2 must haves in my book). The staff are friendly and helpful. The buffet breakfast is nice and like all US meals, they’re big!! I’d have no problem coming back again.

We traveled to Anaheim for a basketball tournament and picked Clarion for their location to the convention center and the pics online. Well that is not what we arrived to. The check-in process took forever and I was the only person in line. Before you know it, they had a bus pull up and it was crazy. I got to my room and discovered I was given an ADA room, and no one in my family has special needs. The room was tucked in the back corner and looks like the condemned room. So dirty and nasty I couldn't believe they would put any paying customer in that room. It was definitely last remodeled in the 70's. The bathroom is where I couldn't move on. The shower floor was disgusting. When I turned on the water things we're going down the drain and no one had been in the shower yet. The

We enjoyed the stay at clarion hotel. It was close walk to Disney land. Bath doesn’t hold water very well and the lights in the bathroom did not turn off (we tried everything) and it was quite bright at night time. Otherwise a great stay and would recommend.

Non existent water pressure, free buffet was not even worth being free, repairs being done on our floor with no notice. The buffet was cold even when we were the first to eat at 6 am. Try taking a shower but nearly impossible to wash hair with the water pressure . Faced the street room was very loud with cars, the restaurant next door.

I have stayed here three times.  It’s closest to Disney and the cheapest.   All the times i have stayed here, it has been literal hell.  The managers are horrible and do nothing to help. Leaks in room.  Mold.  It it absolutely horrible.  I have tried calling Matienece over ten times.  The front desk ignores the calls from hotel customers.  I recorded myself calling over ten times to prove to them.  They refused to help with anything and then made me feel like an idiot when I asked simple questions about the credit card hold.    It’s been horrible. They don’t do refunds or even try to help.      The next door neighbors have been so loud pretending to be “ room service” and when i told the manager, he didn’t do anything.   There is leaking that happens all night and has kept me up

The staff was friendly.The parking is crazy they also charge you for parking which should be in the nightly rate Be prepared for a room that is long overdue for a renovation. The bathroom had black mold in the grout. The bathtub stopper did not work. The bathtub wasn’t draining properly The furniture was old and worn. Be aware that the beds are double not queen. The beds are not comfortable at all.I would never stay there again not even for free .it was disgusting old, smelly ,old elevators that took forever. just the worse of all Choice hotels

The location of the hotel can't be beat being just a couple of blocks from DisneyLand. If you're able, it's a quick 15-20 minute walk to the entrance of the park; however, there is a city bus/shuttle available right at the front door.  The hotel itself is very basic and in line with other experiences we've had at other Clarions. Don't go expecting a fancy hotel or even a mid range as the amenities are simple and dated.  The service we received was also average, nothing special or negative. One poor experience was that our room did not receive any housekeeping on the final night of our stay.  Also be prepared that even though you are a bit further from the park, you will hear the event fireworks (9:30 pm) if facing the park. They are loud and last for 15 mins or so.

We just got back and really enjoyed our stay. Close enough to Disneyland, easy to order Postmates for dinners, helpful staff, clean room, etc.  We ordered room service once for breakfast, we thought the prices were reasonable and were impressed by the speed. The hot cocoa was delicious!  Our only complaint would be that our sliding door lock was broken, but being at the level we were, we weren't worried about it.

I was really worried about staying here after reading reviews online and was very pleasantly surprised! The staff was extremely friendly and helpful,  the room was very clean, the pool was nice and well stocked with towels, and the beds were super comfortable. The location is literally across the street from the free Disney shuttle parking lot and there are plenty of dining options nearby.  We were even able to see the fireworks from our room. The only complaint would be the low water pressure in the toilet which meant having to hold the handle down until the bowl emptied and jiggling the handle a little to make it stop running when the tank was full. Otherwise,  an awesome stay with zero problems.

Summary Heading: Worst hotel! Disney should drop them
Summary: The problems at this hotel were endless. Incompetent and rude staff who say they can't do anything about problems. Staff who give incorrect information about transportation to the different parks and restaurants which ended up costing me an extra $100 and ruined our evening. The hotel is out dated and has a gross old smell. Bathrooms are dirty, Housekeeping doesn't actually change the sheets or restock the room. A/C is super loud. The fridge in our room was not working and made a horrible ticking sound. When I brought u the problems to the GM she said she was sorry but couldn't do anything about it. The swimming pool was drained and out of service even tho the hotel site said it was available, Hotel restaurant was actually a sketchy bar not fit to bring my 12 year old son to.

Stayed here during a trade show being held in the nearby Convention Center. Parking is adjacent to the building and check-in was smooth and efficient. Overall, this place is dated, but well maintained. The restaurant on the first floor is really nothing special.

Summary Heading: Good hotel in a great spot
Summary: Have just checked out of the Clarion Inn Anaheim after a weeks stay.   We picked this hotel due to it's great location in Orange County. Disneyland is roughly ten minutes walk away all on one street and there are lots of familiar chain restaurants within walking distance. Alternatively the hotel has an onsite bar/restaurant that is reasonably priced and also has a happy hour.   There are plenty of other on site facilities including a fitness centre, games room, shop and pool area.   The room we had was a corner suite and this was really large, cleaned daily and get comfortable and included a microwave, fridge and complimentary tea/coffee.   The staff in the bar, shop and housekeeping were very friendly however some but not all I must add of the reception staff were professional

Stayed here during my trip to Disneyland. This hotel was definitely dated but it was clean. I mostly just needed a clean place to sleep and shower. This hotel met those expectations. Breakfast and coffee are not complementary but are reasonably priced.

Don’t believe the few negative reviews you may have read about this place! It is roomy, clean, close walk to Disney. Great food, great price and lovely staff. I highly recommend the clarion and will definitely be staying here again

First time staying at this hotel and was very pleased. Large in room safe and very nice in room fridge was a bonus. Surprisingly deep tub for soaking after a day walking in Disneyland and a CVS on the corner with plenty of Epsom salt for sale. Short walk to the park and there is a Starbucks in the adjacent Anaheim Hilton. Comfortable bed, pillows are very soft - so if you like a firm pillow, bring your own. Would stay again.

Recently stayed here we hired a car from The airport LaX is 45 mins away. The hotel in 1st appearance was good and great for access to Disneyland as close by to restaurants and cafes. We had  a room on the 4th floor the bedroom size was good but the bathroom Was small didn't eat at the hotel as we only stayed a couple of days. Clean and tidy rooms

Summary Heading: Wonderful Staff and great place to Stay for Disneyland
Summary: We got to Anaheim early.  We had reservations but could not check in.  Alex gave me the ticket to park the car and told us to have fun at the park. We checked in when we were done.  Room was clean, spacious, and quiet.  We enjoyed the buffet at breakfast.  I watched the staff help families with handicap members and was so touched.  The staff is always helpful with anything.  This is my go to place when I visit Disneyland. Lily and Kevin were a great help as well.  Thank you to all who work there who made our stay so great.

On the positive side: Close proximity to the Disneyland parks, helpful & friendly staff, and pretty comfortable beds.  On the negative side: Old hotel without many updates; old, outdated bathroom, popcorn ceilings, etc. Bathroom was dirty, complete with hair in tub & sink. Breakfast buffet had decent choices but the hot food was barely warm.

We srayed here for 3 nights to do the disney parks before hollywood. Overall it was pleasant a very uncomfortable bed, and good sized room. Yes the bathroom was a bit dates but all functioning. We had breakfast and that was great too. Would recomend this place!

We chose the Clarion Anaheim for it's proximity to the parks and also because it had a pool. Price of course was a factor. When we arrived we were pleasantly surprised as it is nicely kept, very friendly staff, and great amenities. First of all, Alex at the front desk was so great! He was super friendly and has a great sense of humour. He had us checked in quickly and had noticed some notations on our reservation, so he made sure to give us a nice room with a view of the pool. They have a good restaurant, a little gift shop filled with Disney and California souvenirs, and a shuttlebus ticket machine right in the lobby which are all very convenient. The pool was absolutely awesome. Would we go back? You bet we will. Looking forward to another trip in 2020
Manager Response: Hi Jason,  Thank you so much for the great review. Our staff works very hard to offer our guests exceptional service and I am happy that they nailed it. See you in 2020!

Summary: OK, I've stayed in some physically great hotels with really poor staff and service, and I've stayed in some really run down hotels with great staff, but the Clarion has is a terrible hotel with unattentive, rude staff and if I was travelling with young children, I think there are some things that are downright dangerous... First, the physical. It's a Clarion, I don't expect 4 star accommodations. But I don't expect furniture with dangerous metal rods sticking out, or wires hanging out of light fixtures...right? If I had young children, I'd be very concerned. See my photos for what I mean. The plastic peeling off the light fixture is just tacky and so easy to fix if anyone cared... And they don't care. So second the staff. I told the front desk about both the wires hanging out of
Manager Response: We regret that we were not able to fulfill your expectations and we would like to offer our most sincere apologies for the inconveniences caused. We would like to acknowledge that we have a very strict control of all issues reported and regarding this particular matter. The proper department managers have already been informed and have been addressed. We do hope you would give us another try in the near future on your next trip.  Sincerely,  Kevin Do Assistant General Manager

Summary: The Clarion offered amazing value for the dollar. It is the cheapest closest option to the convention centre (less than 2 minutes away) and only about a 10 minute walk away from Disney. There are many restaurants within a 10 minute walk from the hotel making it very convenient. The room was excellent! The room was clean, great bathroom, and a nice balcony. Attractions besides Disney are a bit of a distance away however, if you’re willing to put in a 20 minute walk you’ll find some interesting things to do. With the money you save booking this hotel you’ll be able to cab around with minimum costs. The only thing I was disappointed about was that there was no hot tub to go with their outdoor pool. Overall would recommend to any young people just looking for a cheap convenient
Manager Response: Hi Gavin,  I am delighted that you enjoyed the Clarion and our proximity to the Disneyland Resort and local restaurants. We look forward to having you stay with us again.

Summary: First time in Los Angeles, we choose this hotel due to it’s prices and closeness to Disneyland.  Great service, except they charge our parking fee to the credit card when we asked to pay it in cash. Will visit again if I go back to LA.
Manager Response: Hi Valeria,  I am sorry for the mix up with your payment. Please contact us the next time you travel to Anaheim so you can enjoy our wonderful Hotel again.

Summary Heading: Comfortable stay, but could do with a refurb
Summary: Stayed here for the recent NAMM convention (January 2018) for 5 nights. Despite having some misgivings having read a variety of online reviews, the stay here was comfortable.  Check in was smooth and I was soon on my way up to my 5th floor room. The room itself was fairly large, with ample space for the 2 double beds. The room had a balcony, which was a nice addition. The washroom aspect was adequate, but the bathroom itself (as has been noted in other reviews) is actually very small, with the door and toilet in very close proximity. For a solo traveller however, it was fine.   The room decor was dated and in need of some modernisation, but the beds were comfortable and I had good sleep each night. The room was well insulated and no noise from adjoining rooms or corridors could

We are annual pass holder to Disneyland and we have stayed everywhere close to Disney.  This place was the beat and we will continue to stay here n the future. The rooms were clean and spacious and of course comfy. We loved the breakfast in the restaurant down stairs esp cuz Kids eat free. The buffet was so good.  Customer service was great.  We had a blast.

Summary Heading: Nice hotel, Easy access to conference center
Summary: Stayed here for the second time for a conference. Hotel is very close to the convention centre and if you want to go to Disney it is withing a 10min walk.  In need of a modernisation, but still worth booking

Summary Heading: Nice place to stay, right next to Disney
Summary: Nice hotel. Although it looks a little old, they have good size clean rooms. The breakfast buffet is great and the staff very polite.  Access is easy. If you fly in from LAX it can take you somewhere between 30-50 minutes depending on trafic. The other way around though will more likely take 60-75 minutes.  There are several restaurants within a 15 minutes walking distance from hotel. Steakhouse, seafood, chicken, etc.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to share you feedback regarding your recent stay with us. We are so happy to hear you were pleased with your accommodations and enjoyed the location of our hotel. We hope to see you again when you travels bring you back to the area and give us another opportunity to exceed your expectations!   Best Regards,  Sam Elkurd Assistant General Manager Clarion Anaheim Resort  (714)750-3131

Summary Heading: Good size rooms but looking quite old
Summary: If I could give a half star I would have given a 3.5. The rooms were decent size.rooms were quite old looking. Hot water was shocking and very difficult to get shower at a constant temp which was ideal in cold weather. We were charged for the use of a safe.this day and age honestly?! What a joke. We had notes on our booking by our agent to by next to our family.i also emailed them two days out to remind them to which they said we can’t do anything until the day and then on the day weren’t going to do it.we organized to have Disney Christmas there so was little disappointing to have to fight to hard for it. The only way we could do it was for my hibby and I to pay for an upgrade of room. The best part was the staff member manny in the restauarant and bar.such a lovely man. He was
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to provide your feedback of your recent stay with us. We are very happy to hear of the great service Manny provided to you and your family! Best Regards,  Sam Elkurd  Assistant General Manager Clarion Anaheim Resort (714)750-3131

Summary: I don’t see why this place has so many sub par reviews. Yes, it is dated in the halls and room furniture. It’s clean though and the staff are very friendly. It has a great location, close to Walgreens and CVS, so picking up supplies is easy. It’s also directly across from the toy story parking lot. You can walk over and catch the free shuttle to the parks. The ART stopes out front as well, or It’s also just a 15min walk into the parks.
Manager Response: Thank you much for your positive review! We greatly appreciate you taking the time to share your thoughts on your recent stay with us. We hope that you stay with us so that we may provide you with exceptional service in the future!  Best Regards,  Sam Elkurd Assistant General Manager (714)750-3131

Summary: We had eleven family members book for the Christmas period and we certainly enjoyed the services that were on offer. The staff were very helpful and friendly. "Mannie" who worked as a barman as well as a breakfast waiter did an outstanding job offering us advice as it was needed.  The number three bus to the Park was excellent value for the small footed members(children) who were in or party. The twenty minute rotation meant that you were never waiting too long.  While the hotel is not the flashiest hotel it does represent excellent value for money with supportive staff, not forgetting the bellboy who is at everyone's beckon call.
Manager Response: Thank you much for taking the time to leave your feedback. We are very excited to know that you and your family had such a memorable stay with us! We appreciate the kind words regarding Manny and our Bellhop. We will ensure we pass on your comments to recognize them for a job well done. Thank you again for your time and we hope to see you again in the near future!  Sam Elkurd Assistant General Manager (714)750-3131

Summary Heading: Excellent Customer Service :) / Several toe nail clippings found under the bed :(
Summary: Hello,  First and foremost, I was very pleased with the customer service I received at the front desk and restaurant. While checking in, there was an issue with our reservation, but Alex at the front desk made sure the issue was taken care of so we were able to check into our room in a timely matter.  The next morning we decided to have breakfast at your restaurant and the service we received was exceptional.  My only regret is that I don’t remember the name of the two gentlemen working that morning so I could compliment them by name.  Unfortunately after we went back to our room to get ready to check out, my daughter dropped one of her earrings.  As I was looking for it underneath the bed, I noticed several toe nail clippings, which was disgusting to me. But since we were

Was sceptival about this place after reading some dodgy reviews but was pleasantly surprised. This is a great hotel close to disney parks and many fantastic restaurants. We stayed here for 9 nights. The rooms are cleaned every day beds are comfortable and the staff are very friendly and helpful.
Manager Response: We greatly appreciate you staying with us for an extended stay and are very happy to hear you enjoyed your time here! Summary: we had a great stay at the hotel. The breakfast buffet was great, the front desk staff was extremely courteous, all of our needs were met. The bed was comfortable and the pillows were great. The room was clean and quiet. Close to Disneyland, within walking distance about a mile away.

Summary: We stayed here for 4 days and 3 nights and was wonderful. We brought our chihuahua too. The bathroom needs a little touch up and maybe a microwave in all rooms. But, it was a great stay for my husband and I and it's within walking distance to Disneyland. The staff was really nice too. Glad I booked this hotel with Disney Travel Company.Thank You Clarion for a great and comfortable stay.See you guys next Christmas and with more family members. Be ready for this big group.
Manager Response: Thank you for your wonderful review! We are very happy knowing you had an exceptional stay with us. We are even more excited to hear you will be back your family next Christmas! Best Regards,  Sam Elkurd Assistant General Manager (714)750-3131

Summary: The hotel was located within walking distance to Disneyland. Parking is available with fee.  Room was comfortable and generally clean.  Service staff was very polite and helpful. Our rooms came without breakfast but it was not an issue as there were many shops around the hotel. Recommended to stay.
Manager Response: Hello and thank you for your great review! We are pleased to hear you enjoyed your stay with us and that you recommend our property. Sam Elkurd Assistant General Manager Clarion Hotel (714)750-3131

Summary: Overall, the staff is very attentive, and helpful. great service, only area that needs improvement is with the kitchen. The only day that I ate lunch there I waited over 50 minutes to get my food, granted it was a very busy day, but even after almost every one in the restaurant had finished eating, my plate arrived at the time I needed to get back to my business trip. The manager after explaining the situation and some arm wrestling agreed to not charged for my food. But overall, good place to stay. Desk staff all very friendly and helpful.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to complete our online survey regarding your recent stay at our hotel. This place was perfect ... very reasonable rates, clean rooms, and walking distance to the convention center.  The rooms are smaller so good for 1 person or traveling with one other person.  Perfect for when all you want is a place to sleep and shower.  Staff was very helpful and cordial.  Also caught the fireworks show at Disneyland from my balcony ... centrally located to walk to restaurants, shopping and of course Disneyland.

Summary: My family loved it, great breakfast my three boys loved it. It's a family friendly place and really close to DIsneyland. Perfect for us. The rooms were nice and clean , beds were comfortable and fitted all 5 of us well with a pull out sofa for my teenage son.

Summary: Stayed for 3 nights on floor 1. We got a king sized bed that was subpar in comfort. The furnishing is dated and a little sticky. The bathroom is small, so the door can get in the way of the shower and toilet. The trick is to go in, turn to the side and close the door. sharing the bathroom is almost impossible.  Our toilet was running every 4 minutes so we needed to make sure to have the bathroom door closed to get a good nights sleep. Maintenance couldn't fix it sadly. This made showering a pretty terrible experience. I had to move away from the shower water every 4 minutes because it would get scorching hot from the toilet running.  There was a roach in our bathroom. We killed it and flushed it. We did not let management know because we figured they wouldn't do anything about

We could have easily arranged for a shuttle from the airport prior to our departure had we known there was none available.  This hotel is in need of renovating and repair. Water in the shower would go from warm to scalding hot without notice. If you are on a budget, this is your place otherwise there are much better properties in walking distance.

We were put on a floor (7) that had a leak, damp carpet and a foul, wet, mouldy smell. A couple of metres from our room were 2 huge industrial fans blowing loudly trying to dry the carpet 24/7. Wanting wifi as an inclusion was part of why we booked it, but no connection for nearly 2 days. Coming from Australia, we definitely won’t be back.

Summary: Not a fancy hotel but clean and safe and very close to Disneyland and California adventure  parks. Would definitely stay here again. We stayed here for a week and it worked perfect for our trip. Also close to the convention center and the freeway.

This is the third time we have stayed at the Anaheim Clarion.  The value for the money can't be beat.  The suite was spacious and their breakfast buffet is excellent.  The service is good as well.  We will stay here a forth time.

The Staff were all friendly and amazing. Great Breakfast. I have never slept this well in a Hotel. It was quiet and the beds were very comfortable. We were greeted every time in and out of the Hotel. They were so friendly even at 1 am. I would recommend this highly

Summary Heading: Needs modernising but within walking distance to Disney
Summary: Stayed here for 3 nights. Staff were generally friendly and helpful. It needs a major overhaul to modernise the place.   The hotel is within a 10-15 minute walk of the Disneyland entrance. Plenty of shops and eating places nearby.   I thought the parking charge was excessive at $15 a day.   The biggest concern for me, especially with a young family, was the lack of security. There was a back door to the hotel building that was always open and that anyone off the street could come in through undetected and unchallenged.

Summary Heading: If you like filth and dirt and subpar rooms with rust and grime, this is the hotel for you
Summary: Well I’m told at booking and upon arrival all the family rooms were remodeled and refurbished less that 7 months.  The stained carpeting and dirty front fountain should have gave warning upon arrival.  The popcorn ceilings and stained walls should have warned of the filth and standards of this hotel.  The wall paper was peeling on every wall in both rooms I paid for and my family stayed in. The exposed textured brick was pretty gross as well with exposed grime embeddd in the texture  Let’s start with popcorn ceilings.  It showed all of he water damage to the rooms, yes both rooms.  Then as you go into the bathrooms, both rooms, filth and muck and grime on everything.  The rust in the drains was particularly gross and showed the mung and filth around the drain the yellow tile

Summary Heading: Average is all I can say!
Summary: We stayed here for 3 nights to be close to Disney and it is close to Disney I’ve got to say.  The hotel is a little dated and run down, the rooms are a little dated and need a good lick of paint.   Nobody mentioned at time of booking about the parking charges you needed to pay for the hotel, that was a surprise at check in. The sink would not drain due to a blockage but also another guest in the lift said they had the same problem.   Overall just dated, we only stayed 2 nights cause it was very dusty and didn’t help my partners asthma.

Hotel was average, nothing special but not a dump. The check-in was easy. Bell hop was hard to find. Room were cleaned nicely, bedding was comfortable. The bathroom was huge but the bathroom counter top was way too small, probably the biggest disappointment. the "business center" was laughable. Employees were very nice and helpful. There was a little store in the lobby for snacks and drinks, came in handy. The free wifi was slower than dialup so i'd suggest bringing your own wifi.

Toilet leaking water after first flush. 4 inch COCKROACH crawling on my leg while I was going to the bathroom at 5 am!! Had to switch rooms and therefore missed opening of Disneyland! Do not get a room on the first floor especially facing the pool, many screaming kids until 10pm.

I really enjoyed my stay along with my family at the Clarion. It was really easy to check in and out, they were really nice and the room was always cleaned on returning from a days out. The staff was great always said hello and always smiling.

Dirtiest hotel ever with the worst staff.  The first problem happened when I came early to check in and was told they would call me when the room was ready.  Two hours after check in time they still had not called. The second problem was that Room service never came by to clean or take out the trash. When I finally asked about it they said they put me on the do not disturb list. Finally and definitely not least they gave me lice.   Now i never have had lice before i stayed at this hotel and as such when my scalp started itching after spending one night in the hotel i thought nothing of it. It was not until after my scalp started itching like crazy on the way home that i realized something was up. Sure enough when I checked at home I found that we had been infested with them.

Brilliant hotel in a perfect location. I would recommend this hotel for anybody wishing to visit Disneyland. They have really good tours. Really nice breakfast buffet. Cant wait to stay here again in the future.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to complete our online survey regarding your recent stay at our hotel.  We very much appreciate and value your feedback and will share it with our team.  Your survey responses will serve as encouragement to all of our staff as we strive to continuously improve the quality of our services to provide an exceptional experience for our guests.  It is always a pleasure to receive positive feedback.  Thank you again for sharing your experience, and we hope your next visit will be even more pleasant than the previous one.  Sincerely,  Sam Elkurd Assistant General Manger Clarion Hotel (714)750-3131

Summary: We stayed here 10 yrs ago the deco hasn’t changed. The room needed a good makeover. Comfortable beds, clean linen but had a stinking toilet. The toilet seal had broken so every time you sat down for business the toilet moved. It leaked had a bad stench. Reported to reception was told they would send someone to look at it. We stayed 4 days no one came. If hotels surrounding weren’t booked out we would’ve moved out. 15min walk to DL pretty safe to walk at night. Will never come back here. Happy to pay more for somewhere nice next time
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to complete our online survey regarding your recent stay at our hotel.   On behalf of our entire team, I would like to apologize for failing to follow up with you issue regarding the toilet in your room. I assure that was not our intention, and will follow up with our team to ensure we avoid a similar incident from reoccurring.  Your satisfaction is important to us and we will be using the feedback you provided to make improvements to ensure we offer an exceptional experience for our guests in the future.  I hope that you will consider staying with us again so that we can have another chance to provide you with a superior experience.   Sincerely,  Sam Elkurd Assistant General Manger Clarion Hotel (714)750-3131

Summary: They acted very quickly towards the our bathroom and try to fix as quickly and they were very polite and professional towards any questions or concerns that we may had during our time there.  We will recommend our friends and family to stay at this hotel and we will be happy to stay there again.
Manager Response: Thank you for you compliments regarding our team! I'm glad to see you reported your concern to us and we were able to resolve it for you to your satisfaction. We appreciate you giving us the opportunity to make it right and it is always a pleasure to receive positive feedback.  Thank you again for sharing your experience, and we hope your next visit will be even more pleasant than the previous one.  Sincerely,  Sam Elkurd Assistant General Manger Clarion Hotel 1(714)750-3131

Summary: Clean hotel. Complete breakfast was served. Good service was provided by hotel staff members. Only thing that we could say that we wish the hotel had was to update rooms to have a full kitchen and a regular refrigerator, but other than that it was very good hotel to stay during our family vacation.

Cleanliness was an issue. Bathroom grimy. Staff was friendly. No street noise on 7th floor..but could hear people above. Reasonable walk to DL. If they would do some basic cleaning this would be a great deal in a good location.

The treatment of the staff was excellent. The hotel seems old. The rooms need a improvement by instance changing the rug for other kind of floor. The price around the zone is good and it is well located around the Disneyland Parks.

Hotel was very clean and family friendly. Buffet was good and very convinent. Staff was awesome very helpful! Landscaping was nice and up kept. Great pool and outsidd patio area. Cute gift shop on the main floor for anything you need as well as souvenirs.

This is in a good location within walking distance to Disneyland. We went with a teenager not young children so walking a little further was not a big deal for us. The rooms were very average, clean enough but not immaculate by all means. The hotel staff was nice. The bathroom was decent but fairly run down. The best thing about this hotel was the location and the price. We walked to Target (about a mile or so) to get bottled water and snacks, and saved a TON of money not buying water at Disneyland!
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to complete our online survey regarding your recent stay at our hotel.  We are thrilled to know you enjoyed your stay with us! We appreciate the feedback regarding the condition of your room, and will use it towards improving our product for the future. Thank you again for your time and hope to see you again when your travels bring you back to the area!  Sincerely,  Sam Elkurd Assistant General Manger Clarion Hotel 1(714)750-3131

Summary: Good, price and location is great. Looks old but house maintenance is great. Only drawback I can think about is air conditioning is still manual not automated. It would be great to have temperature controlled AC system.

Summary Heading: The Clarion has never let us down!
Summary: We have stayed at the Clarion now at least 4 times and have never had a bad experience! It's perfect for a 3 day trip to Disneyland! It's clean and convenient from the breakfast buffet and free parking to catching the bus to Disneyland! We will definitely stay there again!

Summary Heading: Excellent value through Get Away Today
Summary: The Clarion provides a clean room, free breakfast buffet and parking through Get Away Today.  This hotel is a little dated, but the rooms were clean, service was excellent and I found it to be an excellent value.

We requested a roll away bed upon check in and without asking she upgraded our room to a studio suite (738) for free. Every member of the staff we encountered was beyond polite and professional and went out of their way to make sure our stay was a nice as possible.    The hotel could use some updating and the water pressure in the shower wasnt great but we vacationed right and only used the room to sleep and shower. The hotel is right across the street from the disney toy story parking area, but the shuttle for 4 days was way cheaper than 1 day of disney parking and a million times less hassle. The hotel is great for the value and we recommend it.
Manager Response: Dear Lisa,  Thank you for your great feedback!   We are excited to know that you enjoyed your stay with us. We will share your comments with our team to ensure they receive the recognition they deserve. Again, thank you for taking the time to review our hotel and we hope to see you again when your travels bring you back to the area!  Kind regards,  Sam Elkurd Assistant General Manger Clarion Hotel Anaheim Resort (714)750-3131

Summary: We were pleasantly surprised by our stay.  Some of the reviews made it seem like a roach motel but we found just the opposite and would highly recommend staying here. Pros: clean, inexpensive (we got a great deal!), staff were extremely nice, pool was awesome-warm, clean and big, only a 10-20 min walk to Disneyland, they upgraded us to a suite for free, beds were new and very comfortable, restaurant in hotel had good food-we arrived late and they served us a great meal, breakfast buffet was extremely good with great service and selection. Cons: bathroom was dated, toilet was noisy at night, no hot tub. If you are looking for the newest Ritz then this isn't for you.  If you want a nice, clean, comfortable, friendly and inexpensive place for the family (with a superb pool) then we

The room was clean, and a lot of room.  The location was great, I was there for a conference, but walked to downtown Disney and near outside of Disney.  Lot's of stores, restaurants and of course Disney Land was right there.    For business, the Anaheim Convention Center was about 2 blocks away and an easy walk.   Nice little pool, staff was friendly.  Highly recommend.

Summary Heading: Needs renewal but offers great value
Summary: This hotel is tired. Worn carpets, tired grout in bathrooms, and so on. But the rooms are spacious, beds fairly comfortable, linens quite new. In short, if you can overlook cosmetics, you can get a decent room at a bargain price. If you are visiting Disney, let's face it, you're only using your room to fall down at the end of the day anyway, right? It's an easy walk to the park in the morning and a $6 cab ride at the end of the day when your feet need the help! Oh, and there's a nice breakfast buffet available at a reasonable price where kids under 12 eat free!
Manager Response: Dear Lisa,  Thank you for taking the time to complete our online survey regarding your recent stay at Clarion Hotel Anaheim Resort.  We are so glad to see you enjoyed your stay with us! We will share your comments with are team to ensure they are aware of your concerns and use it to fine tune our operations for the future. We greatly appreciate your feedback and hope we see you again in the near future!  Kind regards,  Sam Elkurd Assistant General Manger Clarion Hotel (714)750-3131

Summary: Everthind was as expected. Very clean rooms. Very good food. Very good service. Excellent personal. Would come back again and recomende it to my friends and business peolpe. Peaceful to sleep. Good WiFi

We stayed here for seven nights October 3-10 and were very happy with our stay. We arrived at noon from LAX just hoping that we might be able to check our bags until our room was ready. Lili at reception kindly offered that if we weren't concerned about our view, she had a room available for us right away. That was so nice to be able to check in early and relax after a tiring trip. The beds and pillows were very comfortable and I appreciate how quiet the hotel feels. We found a very good price for our stay and loved the convenience of being across the street from the Toy Story parking Shuttle, and a block away from Sabrosada, Walgreens and CVS. I would definitely consider staying here again.

We stayed at this hotel because we bought a tree day hopper pass at Disneyland. Clearly the rates are based on the proximity to the park because the hotel is not new and in desperate need of some refurbishment. Rusty bathroom door handles that would not entirely close and wall tiles from the 50’s make this a strict “just go to sleep” hotel. The bedroom size is almost OK and works fine but I’ve stayed in hotels tree times cheaper with more space and newer appliances.
Manager Response: Dear Lisa,  Thank you for taking the time to complete our online survey regarding your recent stay at Clarion Hotel Anaheim Resort. We have read your comments and have reviewed them with our team so we may be able to improve our operations for the future. We appreciate you giving us the opportunity to improve and hope to see you back in the future when you travels bring you back to the area.  Kind regards,  Sam Elkurd Assistant General Manger Clarion Hotel 1(714)750-3131

Summary: I assumed that this hotel would be a better place to stay, not so much!! They were supposed to give us connecting rooms with our kids but when we arrived the rooms were in separate areas of the hotel when we checked in they wouldn’t correct this. Our room had food on the floor in the corner, the curtains are stained and dirty, and we had no towels. We went out for the day and I stopped by the front desk to ask for another blanket for the bed. When we returned that evening nothing had been done. Beware booking at this hotel.
Manager Response: Dear Lisa,  Thank you for taking the time to complete our online survey regarding your recent stay at Clarion Hotel Anaheim Resort.  Allow me to apologize on behalf of our hotel for failing to exceed your expectations regarding the service you encountered during your stay. We always try our best to accommodate our guests requests if possible, I'm sorry to hear we were unable to do so for you this time. Please know we value your feedback and will use it to improve our operations for the future.   We sincerely appreciate your time and hope you will give us another chance to be able to provide you with superior service and accommodations on your next visit to Anaheim.  Kind regards,  Sam Elkurd Assistant General Manger Clarion Hotel (714)750-3131

Summary: Had a top floor room with great view.  However, maintenance on this property has begun to decline. We have been staying here for many years but may choose another location next time. I will miss the good location.

Service is excellent, including the front desk staff, the room service staff and the bell boy as well. It is convenient for us because the hotel staff helps to keep our luggage before checking-in and after checking-out so that we can have more time to travel around Anaheim. The room is bright. Very convenient, with walking distance to Disneyland. The swimming pool is good.

Great cheaper hotel that is within walking distance to the entrance of Disneyland. Will stay again. Only complaints were toilet ran constantly and AC leaked water onto carpet. Also, someone threw up in the hallway and it didn't get cleaned up the whole time we were there.

This hotel rates itself as a 4 star property I rate it as a 2 star and I've stayed in a lot of hotels. It's old, dated,poorly maintained and managed. I gave a list of deficiencies to the on duty manager she immediately blamed housekeeping for not informing her of all the problems in my room 421, a few of the issues were fixed but most were not including the patio door not being able to be locked because it was so poorly aligned this does not give you a good sense of security and is unacceptable. The walk to Disneyland takes 20 minutes and not 10 as some suggest.  The breakfast buffet costs $15 and the continental costs $8, on the 3 occasions we had the continental we were charged $15 for the full meal until we complained, looks like a scam to me. I've not been contacted by
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to review your recent visit to our establishment. We are very sorry to hear you encountered an issue with your patio door and with your breakfast charges during your stay. We appreciate you brining these concerns to our attention during your stay giving us the opportunity to resolve them for you. Please know your feed back is greatly appreciated, it will definitely assist us in improving our services and guest expectations for the future. I hope you will come back and give us another chance to be able to provide you with outstanding service the next time your travels bring you back to the area.

Summary: Hotel entrance ok, but rooms need major updating , let’s start with the squeaky beds that you can even move an arm because the whole bed squeaks, then the second floor no ice machine have to go to the third floor, our room was hot as the ac was running all the time and the room was still not cooling down, bathrooms are  ridiculously close meaning shower and toilet are literally on top of each other no space to move or even close door
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to review your recent stay at the Anaheim Clarion Resort. I am disappointed we failed to give you the fine accommodations we strive for with all our guests.  Please know that your comments have been reviewed in detail and steps are being taken to ensure these types of issues are handled on a preventive basis. We appreciate your patronage and hope you will stay with us the next time you are in town. I can assure we will do everything we can to make your stay a comfortable and happy one.

Summary: We had a great experience staying at the clarion hotel Anaheim resort. Everything was cleaning, staff was friendly and Disneyland was walking distance from the hotel . I don't have any complaints. We had a great experience overall. Thank you !

A Nice hotel located in walking distance from the Disney Parks and Anaheim Garden Walk shopping and dining. A hotel with friendly and service minded staff. Great breakfast. Our room was standard sized with air condition, fridge, and water cooker. Family friendly pool. Clean and tidy but some carpets in the corridors had seen better days and are in need of replacement.

Summary Heading: Great location but not what I expected
Summary: Great location. 10 min walk from Disneyland. Great choices of restaurants and gift shops and convenience stores all up and down the street. Grocery stores and other restaurants and stores 10 min drive down street. Walgreens and CVS pharmacy nearby hotel as well. Rooms not as nice as I thought. Inside hotel not as glamorous and pics made out to be. No microwave in studio only suites. Also ac kept turning off to save power. Made sleeping and lounging in room not so cold. Also rooms seem to share water, so if another room showers or uses toilet, your room water becomes weaker or cold.

Everyone that we came into contact with during our stay was very nice and always helpful.  The rooms were clean, the food was good, and we were close enough to Disneyland to walk. We even got a free room upgrade.  Will definitely stay here again the next time we visit Disneyland!

Staff was friendly and very helpful. Breakfast buffet was delicious and had many choices. Rooms were average but clean. Good location near Disney and shops. Good value for price and service. Do recommend for convenience.

Summary Heading: Nice hotel for business or family vacation.
Summary: Stayed In the hotel for a business conference held at the hotel next door.  Saved over $150 a night on the room rate and had a very comfortable stay.  Pool was nice,  WiFi was fast and parking only $5.00 per day for a Choice Rewards member.  If you are going to the Anaheim convention center,  corporate events at bigger named hotels,  or a vacation at Disney,  there is no place closer or better.

This hotel is old and the front desk staff is friendly. The bell hop seemed irritated that he had to hold our bags and the light in our room was broken. We actually had to unscrew the lightbulb to go to sleep. Our remote for the tv also did not work. Breakfast was free otherwise so it was fine but do not pay for it. I would not recommend this hotel and will not be staying again.

I wanted to get away for the weekend on my own and decided to visit Disneyland. The Clarion Hotel was in a great location, easy walking distance to Disney, restaurants and the convention centre. It felt very safe. The hotel was clean, big rooms, comfy beds and friendly staff. Would definitely stay here again. Excellent for families, solo travels, business travels. Everyone.

Summary Heading: I had a business trip to Anaheim and stayed in Clarion for 2 days
Summary: I stayed in Clarion for 2 days in their suite. What I like about the Suites of Choice group is the total space inside each suite. I feel I am home. You get a King bed, a sofa set, a study table set, a fridge, an oven, an iron with a board, a locker and your tea coffee maker.  I like their fitness center and swimming pool too. Everything is well maintained and clean. What else do you need while you are travelling? The added benefit is they are always in Perfect Location, and they have friendly staff. This was my 78th stay with Choice group of hotels in 2017. So you can understand that I only stay with the choicest places. :)

Summary Heading: Hotel Stay to see Disney Land
Summary: Hotel was Clean and check in was easy- room was very clean funny it had full beds and not queen beds but there were 2 to a room  and non smoking with no smell  Pool was okay a little small but very clean  we even had a balcony with sliding door that you could step out on  but just good for fresh air in the morning     I was a little disappointed they did not have an area in the morning for free coffee as I had always that was a perk with Clarion- but they did have coffee makers in the room and a fridge that did keep things very cold- the Hotel is several blocks from disney as we were told only 1 block  but buy the ART Bus pass $5.00 day for as many rides you want it picks up right out front  saves your sore feet after walking around the part all day  - AC worked well  water

This is my 2nd time at this location & it was lovely. We didn't spend much time in the hotel, but when we did it was awesome! The only thing was that the bathroom looked a little worn down & maybe needed to be renovated. But overall, it was great.

I was hesitant to stay at the hotel as I had read some terrible reviews.  I was super impressed with the hotel and would recommend to anyone and I would gladly stay here again.  Raymond was at the front desk when I checked in and he was excellent, very professional and super friendly.  Housekeeping staff was lovely, I asked for extra towels and she only had 1 left on the cart she gave that one to me and then said that she would bring me some more.  Sure enough 30 minutes later there was a knock at the door and fresh, clean warm towels were delivered.  I look forward to my next trip and will surely stay at the Clarion!

The travel agent declared this hotel that be 3/5, and I think she was right on.  It is quite a long walk to Disneyland  - I would guess over a mile.  Not bad if you are in good shape, but a long walk at the end of the day with wee ones. This hotel could really benefit from a shuttle, although the ART does stop in front.  There is nothing wrong with the rooms, but the entire hotel is tired.  The gift shop is nothing more than a large closet - but well stocked! It is the 2nd time there for us, and the rooms are clean.
