The bathroom has some bubbling wallpaper and needs a facelift.  But, I must say - the beds were very comfortable!

Booked this accommodation as our base in Los Angeles as its right next to the Disneyland resort (a short walk or shorter bus ride from hotel) Upon arrival we parked the car in the hotels on site car park - this is chargeable. We entered the hotel, the initial impression was good, unfortunately when we were checking in the manner of the receptionist was a little blunt ( this stay was at the end of a larger road trip where we had stayed at multiple hotels and have been very impressed with how welcoming and helpful the staff have been) surely a smile wouldn't be too much to ask for to welcome guests???? We went to our room and again the initial impression was good, its only when you look a little deeper that you realise this is a very tired hotel, the decor especially in the

Arrived 30 min prior to check in.  Told room not ready and they would call when it was--never received a call.  Returned 20 min after check in, room still not ready.  Took them 15 more minutes before it was.  Room was in terrible need of remodel/repair.  Rotten wood shelf, broken tiles, broken handles in bathroom, bad water heater (water cycled between hot and cold).  Housekeeping not provided despite being out of the room from 645 am through 3 pm.   It was a last minute booking, on a certain budget, looking for an king bed, so my bad for not researching it better.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to review your recent visit to our establishment. I'm very sorry to hear of the issues you encountered at check-in and during your stay. We appreciate hearing your thoughts and your suggestions to help us better improve our operation for the future. This will assist us when evaluating our guest’s needs and expectations. I hope you will come back and give us another chance to provide you with outstanding service in the future.

Summary: I booked this hotel through trip advisor and the service was horrible. No where on this listing does it say that you have to pay for parking. It is $14 for the first car and $28 for the second car. I don't mind paying it but i should be listed so clients know! I also called a day prior to add someone to my check in list and was on hold for hours and they still had to call me back to confirm. I got an email confirmation saying my friend can check in for me however on the day of i had to be on hold with the hotel for another hour because they did not get any emails or notifications. Joanna was the representative that helped me and told me that i was set. I wanted to avoid all this hassle on the day of that is why i called ahead. But that didn't play out how it was planned out to

I stayed one night at this hotel.  The rooms are clean and modern.  I have no issue with the quality of the hotel.  However, you are required to pay a $28 USD security deposit per night which they stated would be on hold on the credit card. 22 days later and the security deposit is still on hold or pending and I cannot access these funds on my credit card.  I have a receipt and an email from the hotel telling me no charge to my card and that the security authorisation deposit was released.  Very frustrating!

A little preface.  We didn't expect to take our 9 year old daughter to Disneyland for her Birthday but at $500 Canadian for the week, we decided to go for it.  We booked using Air Miles with no special requests other than 2 beds. Our package did not include any buffet breaky it was bare bones and we had no expectations.   As a couple we usually book at least 4 star accommodations when traveling but this time we were all about the price to make this last minute idea happen.  This is what we got...  The Good: -Easy check in, clean rooms, friendly staff. **however, one of the "clean" glasses with cover on it had about a quarter inch of water in it, hmmmm.  We left it that way all week and it never got replaced. -Amenities in house included decent restaurant, variety store, bar,

Great spot a 10'min walk too Disneyland 2 mins to Convention Centre,  close too restaraunts CVS & Walgreens etc.  Hotel is clean and comfy, rooms are ok tv, fridge, microwave and coffee perk.  Pool area is good but no life guard so children need parents with them at all times as the pool is rather deep.  Breakfast is reasonably cheap at around $13 per adult and kids eat free.  Laundry onsite and ice available on different levels.  This hotel is definitely not worthy of the poor reviews yes it is older style but clean and comfortable, if your lucky you can see the Disney Fireworks from your room

Stayed at the hotel for a week at the end of August. The location is a nice 15 minute walk to Disneyland Park. Our room was perfectly sized for the three of us. After a long day there is a nice pool to cool down in. A bonus is the close proximity of local convenience stores and restaurants where you can find cheap snacks and meals. By the way, the staff are supper friendly!

Summary Heading: Typical area hotel convenient to Convention Center
Summary: Typical, well traveled Disney area hotel, located conveniently to the Convention Center, and very reasonably priced.  The rooms were an ok size, but the beds seemed short, and the bathroom was super tight.  The pool was a decent size, and we appreciated having both a Coke & a Pepsi machine in the hallway.  We did have issues with housekeeping not cleaning our room, and a less than friendly woman at the front desk.  However, not a bad place overall.
Manager Response: Thank you for your feedback. I will share your comments with our Front Desk to ensure we are offering the best customer service that our guests deserve.  We hope to have you stay with us again.

Summary Heading: Best hotel for the price in the area
Summary: If you're going to Disneyland, this hotel is very much worth it. I would say after spending hours and days looking through sites like Tripadvisor (which ultimately gave us the best deal) this was the cheapest hotel in the area that wasn't a motel or shady.  It's pretty generic and a tiny bit outdated but again, if you're going to Disneyland you won't be in the room much anyway.Our room was cleaned daily, the pool was clean and large, the beds were comfortable, the water pressure fine, there looks to be balconies in all of the rooms and it's about a 20 minute walk to Disney (if you walk fast) Overall, for the price and location, it is great!
Manager Response: Thank you for the 5 star review! Please contact our Reservations Department when you are ready to book your next visit. We look forward to having you stay with again.

Summary: The Clarion Hotel is definitely NOT suitable for a family of 5. The rooms were so tight we had to walk single file, even though we booked for 5, everyday they left us towels for 4. The staff were extremely unhelpful, in EVERY ASPECT, especially the tours desk operator who had been working there only a few days. He was NOT properly trained, admitted he did not know what he was doing, therefore I had to book all my own tours from my room. We only attempted to eat at the restaurant once for breakfast, but most of the items they had run out of, so we ended up grabbing muffins from the convenience store. I checked out a month ago, yet I am still waiting for my credit card hold to be released!!!

We stayed at this hotel while in Los Angeles. Was easy to find and park up at. This hotel is within about 30 to 40 minute walk to Disney but I recommend using the bus that stops directly in front of the hotel. The hotel itself is pleasant. We had a slight issue with the room but this was quickly dealt with by reception with a no fuss approach to keep you calm. We were on the 8th floor in a daily big room. Which was nice didn't make you feel penned in, rooms were cleaned daily with extra sheets and pillows in the room so you didn't need to chase someone up about them. The bathroom was a little dated but worked fine. I wasn't happy about the little charge for the safe I would of thought that would of been included in the room so be warned about that. But if you want a good clean

Summary Heading: The upside...15 minute walk to Disneyland
Summary: I definitely booked this hotel for the price, especially since it was so close to Disneyland. Though, red flags went up as soon as we checked in when we were told that we had to pay $14 a day for parking. Really?! We were very shocked about that, though the gentleman checking us in said that he could "give us a deal" and make it only $5 a day if we signed up for the choice hotels newsletter things. We did, only because we wanted to save a little bit of money on the parking.  We were told we were going to be on the 9th floor, which is the very top, on the newly renovated floor. Trust me, it didn't look like much of a renovation. When we got to our room, we were actually appalled to see the job that had been done. There was still brick in the room, where it looked like it used to

Really disappointing stay.  Rooms were old and gross, "recently renovated!??".  No microwave available anywhere on site, put one in the lobby people!  For the premium price you can do way better than this place.  Small tv, old furniture, locks in bathroom didn't work, no microwave.  Friendly front desk staff was the only positive.

Summary Heading: Decent place to sleep, nothing fancy
Summary: About one mile from the entrance to Disneyland and just a block from the Anaheim Convention Center, the Clarion has a good location, it's clean and the bed is comfortable. The decor and furnishings are cheap, dated and a bit worn around the edges. The room included a mini-fridge (but no microwave) and a small safe (for which they will automatically charge you a $1.50/day unless you tell them you didn't use it).  There is a pool and an on-site restaurant but I tried neither. The wi-fi is free and works well. They were surprisingly strict about the 4PM check-in. I showed up a little after 3:30 and was given a stern lecture by the clerk that check-in was not until 4. She did still let me check in but was a bit snippy about it.  As others have noted, despite what your GPS tells you,

Summary Heading: Stay at the Clarion Hotel Anaheim Resort
Summary: The entrance to the self parking lot was off Harbor, not Convention Way, though the hotel frontage is on Convention Way.  Other than having to ask directions once, stellar trip. The room was a suite, with microwave and fridge, and a sofa that folds out for those traveling with kids.  All the comforts, including a large, comfortable bed, and it was very quiet.    Arrived Tuesday afternoon, left Thursday morning.  Wednesday morning, walked the 2.5 blocks (approx. 1 mile) to the security check at Downtown Disney, though there is a shuttle that goes directly to Downtown Disney. Spent the day at Disneyland   Hotel check in was quick and easy. There was a gift shop with something Disneyland doesn't have: postcards!  Other things Disney related were much less expensive than at the

Summary Heading: Beautiful Affordable Resort within walking distance of Disneyland with free daily breakfast buffet!
Summary: About a mile from Disneyland park, this resort is beautiful! My daughter, grandson 10 years old and granddaughter 14 and myself spent a week June 2017.  A gift shop on the first floor is stocked with lots of ( souveniers although we walked down the street and found much less expensive ones in Walgreens or CVS or a little store close by.)  The housekeeping was excellent and the laundry room is very convenient when you have kids. It cost $2 to wash and the same to dry a load of clothes. We got a great price through Getawaytoday tours and we even got the breakfast buffet for free. The original cost is $14 per person and kids eat free. The buffet Is amazing with fresh fruit of every variety every morning, delicious crepes, bacon, sausage, pancakes, cereal, juices, tea coffee, toast,

Recently stayed at the Clarion Resort for a PGF tournament which was their dedicated hotel for the teams.  This hotel was extremely outdated and lacked the comforts one would expect paying $180 a night.  That price didn't include their additional fee for parking which was $14 per day at a discounted rate.  Normally they charge $18 per day which should be included in the room rate in my opinion.  Breakfast was included with our deal, but they normally charge $13+ per meal.  The food was mediocre at best and you'd be better off going to IHOP or something.  The rooms were clean, so good job to maid service.  As for the actual room, they were extremely outdated.  It appears they tried to renovate, but quality of renovation was horrible.  Bathroom door didn't close, shower was nasty,

Not bad for the price.  Disneyland is conveniently located close by the hotel. The ART shuttle has a stop in front of the hotel.  I really only used the hotel for sleeping.  I was rarely in the room but it served its purpose.  The only problems I had were that the rooms were a bit outdated and I could hear my neighbors both above and next to us.  I was still able to get a good night's sleep which is pretty much all I wanted out of this hotel.

I had great time staying at this hotel!! Reasonable price, friendly staff, clean room, close access to Disneyland, restaurants, shopping centers and so on. If you go to Disneyland or Anaheim areas, this is definitely a must stay hotel!!

The staff are very kind and helpful. The hotel is not that clean and the carpets need changing. There is a lovely pool area and a little gym which is ok. The breakfast we had was not very good at all.

Summary Heading: Needs some updating, but a good location!
Summary: We were able to check in early for our 6 night stay, at approx. noon. Our room was on the 7th floor, room #737. Apparently the 7th floor has been renovated, although there were very few things that looks at all new. We did have a microwave and refrigerator, which came in very handy. There is also a coffee pot and safe in the room. The furnishings looked fairly new, and a decent TV. Beds were comfortable and staff was excellent. The bathroom is VERY old, and has some dark and grimy corners throughout.   Lobby is typical for this price range. There is a small gift shop, restaurant and additional bar in the hotel. The pool area is ok, pretty run down and simple. Kinda has a super 8 feel...  Excellent location to Disney ~ about a 20 minute walk. 10 minute walk to Walgreens or CVS

1. Carpet on six floor by the elevators is dangerously loose and buckles. 2. Only one check out person at 10 o'clock in the morning the line is six people deep. 3. Hallway air feels like a sauna on every floor, no AC and very very humid. 4. Elevators programmed ridiculously- We pushed up on the elevator and all three doors open. 5. I found bugs in our hallway. 6. Very visible water/liquid stains on carpet in hallways and then in both rooms we were given.  7. Key card demagnetizes daily. It happen so much, they have a bowl of cards to give you a new card or reprogram your card at the front desk.  By the third time I had this issue a staff member finally told us that cards can not be by a cell phone or any other credit cards.  Can't put it in your wallet or pocket with anything.

Our room was ready when we checked in at 2:00.  We reserved a King but was given a room with 2 doubles, didn't really matter to us.   Positives: Comfy beds and friendly and helpful staff Negatives: Room is in need of repairs, carpets and bathrooms are outdated and very dingy.  Breakfast was ok if it had been hot but not worth $14 a person

Summary Heading: Great location but hotel requires some love.
Summary: Hotel needs upgraded, rooms clean but common areas including carpets leading to rooms stained and in disrepair. Lamp in room did not work on arrival. Previously stayed in hotel 2 years ago and was in much better repair at time. A lot of new hotels have been built in surrounding area for similar room rate.

Stayed 4 nights in a 2 double bed and sofa sleeper suite while attending the D23 Expo.  Room was clean, spacious and quiet.  Included a safe, mini fridge, Microwave and separate sink area.  Beds are a bit small for two adults, but comfortable.  Sofa sleeper not recommended for adults as it has the usual lumps. Can no longer see the Disney Fireworks from room due to different tall Hotel blocking the view.  We did not use the pool facilities but it appeared nice.  The pool was good size and several lounge chairs available.  We dined at the Cantina, happy hour 5-7pm and 9-10pm.  Appetizers & Drinks were good and reasonably priced. They staff was friendly and helpful.  They do charge per night for parking. I would definitely consider staying here again when attending the next

This hotel is perfect for the D23 convention, it is a little far from Disneyland but is walkable distance. We stayed for eight days and do not have any complaints. Breakfast deal is really good, you can get the buffet for $13 but they also said they have cheaper options for those who don't want to eat a lot. It was a good experience and will definitely go back in two years for the next expo

We stayed here, because we attended the 3 day D23 convention at the Anaheim Convention Center. It is a block away and right off Harbor Boulevard. It is clean and nighttime is quiet. The Palm Tree Cafe is passable. The exact same breakfast buffet for $14 that one can get for free at less expensive hotels. Staff are very friendly.  When I wanted to talk to the front desk I called 3 separate times and got the same ,"hold please" request. Granted it was 7-8 AM, a busy time for a single clerk.  If all you want is some place convenient and comfortable to sleep and stow your stuff, this is a good bet.

Summary Heading: Comfortable good stay at reasonable rates near the Disney.
Summary: I stayed here for 2 nights during May'17. What we see in the pictures of hotel-portals is exactly what it is. May be its better in some aspects. All basic amenities except microwave and refrigerator are provided in the room. It would be good if they place these 2 items as well in the room. There is plenty of parking space (charged $14/day) and convenience stores/restaurants are just across the street. Rooms are spacious and well maintained. Utilities like Ice-Vending machine is placed on each floor and that was helpful.  DisneyLand is about 10 mins walk from the hotel. There is shuttle service as well for $3 per adult.

Summary Heading: Overall I was happy, but the hotel needs updating
Summary: The hotel was located in a great spot for us. Right next to the convention center where my daughter had a volleyball tournament. Also close to Disneyland, restaurants and stores. There was a Target and my bank just down the street on Harbor Blvd.  I was suprised on how big the room and bathroom were. Parking was great too, with the lot not being crowded and being able to park near the front entrance. Housekeeping was there every day. Beds were comfortable and plenty of pillows. There was also a sofa bed pullout so everyone had a bed. Some negatives about the stay was the breakfast not being included, especially since it wasn't good. My wife and daughter paid $12.95 each for the buffet style and would never do that again. The water pressure in the shower was so weak. Shower head

The hotel itself is close to the convention center and Disney. We purchased bus tickets that picked you up in front of the hotel and dropped you off at Disneyland, which was really convenient. We had a suite with 2 double beds and pull out couch. There was plenty of room to hang out and also the bathroom was huge.  The only downside was that the bathroom was outdated. New vanity but shower and tile need an update (cracked tile). Hotel staff were great and let us know about local traffic in the area. Several eating places close by, as well.

Love this hotel! Great rooms, great staff. Close to Disneyland. Everyone is very helpful and friendly. The pool is great. They have nice sized clean rooms. I will definitely stay here again next time we are on vacation there.

Summary Heading: Not sure why this hotel has so many bad reviews
Summary: We booked a stay for Vidcon 2017. Check-in with Alex was quick and efficient. Our room on the 8th floor was just fine. There is no one to assist with luggage but plenty of luggage carts for you to use. The rooms could use a little updating (especially the bathroom) but everything was CLEAN and neat. Blackout curtains worked great, there is free WiFi and plenty of electrical outlets. The beds are comfy and we didn't hear any noise from the hall or other rooms. We decided to stay an extra night and it was handled by Alan without a hitch and we stayed in the same room, not needing to switch rooms. The rooms are equipped with a microwave, refrigerator and coffee maker.  They also have a decent size outdoor pool that looked very clean although we did not use it and a small room with

Booked a package directly through the hotel web site that included room and Disney tickets.  When we arrived they had no trouble locating our reservation and getting us checked in but when I asked about the Disney tickets I got the deer in the headlights look.  The clerk then turned to a manager for help who gave me a somewhat less confused look and told me he needed to call someone and to come back in 15 minutes.  We suggested he call us which he did. They did get it straightened out and we got our tickets.  The room was good size but there were huge stains on the carpet and you virtually had to step into the bathtub to close the bathroom door.  We returned later in the evening one night asked if there were any restaurants that delivered and were handed a map of the area but

This hotel has a great location, but this Hotel has more then can do for their guests. There are no microwaves unless you have a suite. Also there are extra charges like fir the safe which we couldn't even use. The pool is nice.

Hotel needs to cut their rates as they are a two star hotel at best.  Needs major renovations.  Bathroom had hair in shower and mold.  I was so disgusted, I didn't even shower after they cleaned it!  Will never stay here again!

What a huge disappointment this hotel was. Very very dated. Needs major overhaul.  Power switches disgusting. And as an overseas guests where we advised we did not have a car. Then going through all the rules and regulations re pets, charge to use safe really and was an old fashioned key safe. Decided to go for a drink at the bar. What a dreary place. Decided there had to be better around. For what we paid this did not deliver. This had to be the worst hotel we stayed in after touring USA

Summary Heading: Average hotel, nothing special except location
Summary: Just like the title. 25 minute walk to Disney Promenade, a little closer to Dowtown Disney. There is an ART Shuttle stop right in front of hotel, $5.50/24 hrs. Takes you right to Parks.  Didn't use the restaurants or facilities.  Expensive to park, $14/day with in/out privileges.  No bellman seen.  Friendly front desk, but disorganized.  I signed in before my room was ready, gave them ID and credit card.  Went I went back to pick up keys, they asked for ID and CC again, Re-entered all the info, and asked me to sign again????

Summary Heading: Sub par but cheap and close to Disney
Summary: Stayed here 4 nights as it was close to Disney and cheap. I would stay here again if the price was right but the staff aren't the greatest. Ordered room service night 1 as I was tired and feeling off, it took 4 days (yes I called to remind them) for the room service tray to be removed from out front my room (it had chicken In there leftover), the cleaners aren't the greatest. They didn't even bother to make my room the last night they just came in took the rubbish and never bought the bin back. They also lack attention to cleaning anything unfortunately. Jazmin at reception gets a special mention. Upon checking out this morning I ask her where I can leave my luggage and she barks at me to go over there to the service desk. I proceeded to wait 30 minutes for them to arrive and

Not bad not great. Smoke detector kept going off all day and all night . They kept coming to fix but never did . No one addressed or cared .  Poor customer care in my opinion all around.  Semi clean room   Would not stay here again

The lobby and check in was fine. Not a great impression when your Reg Card and your paper with hotel and stay information is a literal ripped piece of paper. Could be done a little more professionally. Elevators are VERY old and VERY slow waiting for them. We stayed on the second floor at the front of the building which had very loud traffic noise as well as people in the hall. Sound traveled. Curtains weren't black out. Toilet randomly ran and bubbled. Bath tub had a weak spot in it when you stepped on it, it would bend and make a creaking sound. Beds creaked, tile in the bathroom was very dated so was the wallpaper. Hotel had a musty smell to it on the second floor. It is not close to Disneyland, about a 10-15 min walk depending on traffic and crosswalks. I would not recommend

Stayed here as we were attending a convention and thought the location to be perfect.  Close not only to the convention center, but to the Disneyland as well.  When we first arrived, we needed help with our bags but didn't see anyone up front in the area that looked like a bell service desk.  I found an unattended luggage cart so I used that to transport our luggage from our van to our rooms.  The staff working the desk didn't seem too enthusiastic about their jobs, especially this one woman who seemed as though something was on her mind.  I actually don't expect much, but a smile would do.  Anyway, since it is a Choice Hotel, I asked if breakfast was free and was answered by a sharp, NO its NOT.  Oh well, maybe she was having a bad day.  Wish breakfast was free like it's sister

Summary Heading: Outdated rooms and poor customer service
Summary: My daughter was in a dance competition in the Disneyland Hotel this past Memorial Day weekend. I had originally booked a room in Newport Beach which would've been maybe a 20 minute freeway drive. We decided to stay in Anaheim to avoid extra driving and I thought I was lucky to find this hotel online with a room available. I asked a few questions regarding the deposits and the girl at check in advised me it can sometimes take up to a month for the deposit to be posted back to your card so I decided to do the cash deposit. After settling into our room my husband noticed they still charged our card for the deposit in addition to taking our cash deposit. We called our credit card company and were told the hotel had put a hold on the card for incidentals, We ended up speaking to a

We stayed here one night since we went to disneyland for the day and didn't feel like making the hour drive back home. Our stay was comfortable and quiet, no issues at all. The room was pretty clean. Fyi, you can take a shuttle to and from disneyland for like $5 and change, $3 for kids or take the 10-15 minute walk.
Manager Response: Thank you for staying with us and glad you enjoyed the hotel for your Quick visit! We hope to see you real soon.

Summary: Nice hotel, nearbij Disney. 15 min walk.  Nice and clean room with a balcony. Not very special.  Recepionists are very nice and helpfull Have to pay for parking and breakfast.  Breakfast is simpel.  I will come back there for a Disney vissit.
Manager Response: Thank you for staying with us and glad you find us to be the perfect fit for your need.  We hope to see you again on your next visit to Disneyland.

Summary Heading: Nice rooms, hit and miss service.
Summary: We stayed at the Clarion for 9 days during spring.   LOBBY The hotel itself had a nice looking large lobby with comfortable seats to accommodate 8 people. There is a small but jam packed gift store that sells Disney apparel cheaper than Disneyland itself.  Tip: Buy stuff from here not Disneyland. It's the same but cheaper.   CORRIDORS  The corridors on the ground floor had comfortable seats placed along the walls which I presume were in case of an overflow of people from the lobby waiting for their taxis, shuttles or über.   GYM A small basic cardio gym can be found in the ground floor. The gym requires your room card to access and was usually packed early in the morning. It contains a couple of treadmills, stationary bikes and a cable cross machine. There is a towel rack and
Manager Response: Thank you for staying with us and glad you enjoyed your stay. I will talk with my bell desk and share your comments. I will not let this happened again and will make sure it doesn't. I glad all the good item you mention about the rest of the hotel.

Summary Heading: Loud music and very rude employees!
Summary: I stayed on the second floor  these last two nights. I requested a room away from the elevator. The lady who checked me in informed me that the only floor she could accommodate my request was on the second floor where the rooms were not yet renovated.  I told her that was alright. I had a corner room near the stairwell. Anyway, there was music from an outdoor speaker blaring underneath my window. The first night it seemed like the music became quieter when I called to complain. At that point, I was not sure where it was coming from. The second night the music was loud all night. I called the front desk several times. They were very rude and seemed to like to argue. After hours of not sleeping, I went down to figure out where it was coming from. I found the speaker on the wall
Manager Response: I am very sorry you had a bad stay at the hotel. My staff is really good and helpful. I will look into what happened with my staff that day and assure you that is not the normal treatment. I hope you give us a second chance so we can show you that we care about all of our guest.

Summary Heading: Our overnight stay to watch ball game
Summary: My wife and I stayed at this hotel as we wanted to attend a baseball game at Anaheim Stadium.  The stadium was approximately 10 minutes away from the hotel. Great location!  Upon check-in, the hotel staff were extremely professional and prompt and were very user-friendly.  Our room was very spacious, clean and quiet. After the ball game, we questioned the front counter person with respect to nearby restaurants and where duly provided with that information.The receptionist was very helpful and professional.  Our overall experience at this hotel was very positive and I certainly would recommend this hotel to anyone that will be either attending a hockey, baseball or visiting the Magic Kingdom.Great location!  Glen and Donna British Columbia Canada
Manager Response: Thank you for staying with us and glad you found everything great during your stay while your visit to Anaheim. We hoped you had a good baseball game during you stay.

Summary: This hotel is in need of serious renovations. The rooms are very outdated and dirty. With all of the options around Disneyland, they need to update this one to be competitive. I have stayed in many of the hotels around here and needless to say, I won't be staying here again.
Manager Response: Thank you for staying with us and I am sorry you didn't get one of our newly rooms. e just added over 150 room with new mattress, as well as all new vanity in the bath rooms. All the room will be getting new case good soon.  Thank you

Summary: We spent a total of two nights here for our Disneyland trip. The hotel was in a good location about a 20 minute walk from Disneyland. Staff at the front desk were friendly and gave us information about opening hours of Disney and also informed us of their hotel shuttle to the park. We really just used our room for sleep and showers, the beds were comfortable and clean, bathrooms were clean. We did have an issue with our toilet on the first night which was fixed very quickly when we rung front desk. We did not eat here as we out either at the park or somewhere along the way, there was a small snack and drink shop downstairs which was convenient. There was also a coin laundry here which was wonderful for us as this was stop number two in a four week trip so it was great to get
Manager Response: Thank you fort staying with us and glad you enjoyed your quick trip to Disneyland and we meet your needs.  Mike Thomas

Summary: We checked out a day early because this place was so awful. The staff weren't interested to know why, so I guess that we're not the only ones! Staff weren't very helpful, room was poor and dirty, dirty breakfast pots were still outside the room at 11pm. Beds weren't big enough to share for a family of 4. Aircon was noisy and the bar closed at 10. There weren't any chairs on the balcony. The whole area was run down and didn't offer many restaurants in walking distance other than burger bars. Probably cheap and cheerful for students but one to be avoided otherwise. Definitely in need of a refurbishment and some staff training.
Manager Response: Thank you for staying with us and I am sorry you didn't get one of our newly rooms. e just added over 150 room with new mattress, as well as all new vanity in the bath rooms. All the room will be getting new case good soon. I am sorry my staff let you down we will have a staff meeting with them and will share your concrens.

Summary Heading: Broken Baggage and Thrown Away Items
Summary: My room was not ready when I went to check in around noon. They suggested I leave my bags with the bell hop and said they would call/text when my room was ready. Check-in was supposed to be at 4 pm, and I still did not receive notice my room was ready so I went and checked at about 5 pm. They said yes, the room is ready now, but did not know why I was not notified I could come back and finish my check-in. When I received my bag I noticed that the pull arm was extended, slightly bent, and very loose. The handle was fine when I left Amtrak that morning and took a Lyft to the hotel. The different person working now said it was that way already, and I told him that it was not that way when I came in around noon. I told him that I wanted to speak to a manager and he reluctantly went
Manager Response: I am sorry we dropped the ball on your recent stay at the Clarion, let me assure you this is not standard. I know we get busy at time but we should never have done this to you. I want to personal apologize for the lack of service during the busy convention .  Mike

Summary: Yes this is an older hotel, but it is clean, reasonable and located on the ART bus line to the Disney parks, so no need for a car. The staff is helpful, and friendly and very willing to help you find your way.
Manager Response: Thank you for staying with us and glad you enjoyed your stay with us. Yes we are a older hotel but we try and try and keep everything working order and clean.  We hope to see you next time in Anaheim.  Mike  Thomas

Summary Heading: Perfect location if you are for the show at Convention Center or if you are with the family to visit Disneyland.
Summary: I don't have much to complain, Great location, you may not even need a car if you are attending a show at Anaheim Convention Center which is less than 5 min. walk from the hotel, very good hot breakfast with ample varieties and fresh juices, but ready to pay $15.00/ person plus tax and tip, very clean rooms with friendly and courteous staff, because of its proximity to the convention center, and also to the Disneyland, I would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone with the family.
Manager Response: Thank you for staying with us and glad you enjoyed the hotel location and breakfast. We are a family friendly hotel to all guest going to Disneyland or convention center. We hope to see you again soon.  Mike Thomas

Summary: Stayed at this hotel during a convention. Convenient since it's a short walk to the convention center. This place is out of date & needs a major overhaul. Early arrival & decided check in bags, NO ONE was at the guest desk and the luggage carts (self-serve) are all being used (3 total). After 10mins of waiting we lugged our belongings to the desk - the same reservation desk woman that assisted us had to check our bags since "Charlie" was not at the desk. The room was good size, but the bathroom has seen better days, a timer switch for the light, lack of water pressure in the shower - if you need to wash your hair - good luck! Rust around fixtures & handrails. Hallway was always stuffy & hot like the a/c was on low. Checked out a day early in the evening to avoid the mad rush in
Manager Response: I am sorry we didn't have a bell cart available or did we look for one for you. I will pass this of to our bell staff and make sure this does not happen again.   Thank You  Mike Thomas

Summary: This hotel was clean and comfortable.  They upgraded us to a room that had a sofa bed as well.  I was pleasantly surprised that the sofa bed was very comfortable.  I hate paying for parking.  Also our room didn't have a balcony , just a large window.  The location is great if your able to walk and if not you can get a ART.  Picks up right in front.  I've read a lot of bad reviews and I can't help but think people must be really picky or hard to please.
Manager Response: Thank you for staying with us and glad you got one of our updated studio suite with the new sofa sleepers. All of the studio suite have been updated and most have a great vie of the firework show.  Mike Thomas

Summary: If one is attending a convention at the Anaheim Convention Center.... location, location,location! Although a much older, established hotel than the nearby Sheridan and Hilton,... after walking a huge convention, its so comforting to have a short walk back to your hotel room vs needing a cab! They even have a restaurant which is convenient. However, having to pay a daily nominal fee for using the "in room safe" was disturbing as this is usually included in all other places we have ever stayed.On a positive note ... staff was always friendly and nice.
Manager Response: Thank you for staying with us and glad you loved our location. We have a great location close to the ACC and Disneyland. Thank you for your comments about the staff and happy you revived the service you wanted.  Mike Thomas

Summary: Hotel was old, tiles and grout in bathroom cracking and chipping.  Last day, didn't leave towels or products.  When we called down to the front desk to request them, we were leaving for a bit.  They left us this in the picture.  Wouldn't stay again.  Not up to most Clarion standards.
Manager Response: Thank you for staying with us and sorry we didn't live up to the smartcard we should have been. I will look into this and fix the problem so it doesn't happened again. Thank you for staying with us and pleased give us a chance to so you that is not the normal here.  Thank you,  Mike Thomas

Summary: I was impressed by the size of my room, two double beds and a nice sitting area with a pull out couch. Beds and pillows were comfortable and everything clean. I knew going in that this is an affordable family oriented hotel so I didn't expect a 4-5 star experience. It's in a good location walking distance to the convention center, stores and restaurants. With that being said I have to say the the front desk staff were not as welcoming and friendly as I would have hoped. I saw the supervisor arguing with a very upset guest in front of other guest over parking. The guest was practically in tears. In my opinion with an apparently sold out hotel, the hotel could afford to have just comped the poor ladies parking or deal with the situation in a more private manor. While ordering room
Manager Response: Thank you for staying with us and glad you enjoyed the larger room, All of out studio suite have been remolded over the last year. We hope you come back to the Clarion during your next visit.  Mike Thomas

Summary: After reading the reviews I was scared to book this hotel but the price was terrific. We arrived around 4:00 PM and our room was ready, it was clean, good linens and nice towels plus a coffee maker.  Hotel is old but it looks like they have started to renovate some of the rooms.  Staff was always very friendly and welcoming.  We opted to take ART to the parks and the stop was just out front and never waited more than 10 minutes for a bus.  It was just my daughter and I so one day we tried the breakfast buffet (kids are free)  and it was pretty basic but good for around $15.  Parking is another expense so add that to your daily total to see if it is worth the price.  If you are getting a room with two beds I do recommend the suite for the extra sitting area and a park view.  We
Manager Response: Thank you for staying with us and glad you enjoyed your time you spent at the hotel. We are a family friendly hotel with a great staff and try to make everyone feel like family! We hope to see you again soon.  Mike Thomas

Summary: The hotel is conveniently located next to the Anaheim convention center. The room was clean and nicely appointed. No frills but nice and clean. Parking was reasonably priced. I did not eat there so cannot comment about the food, but the menu looked great and happy hour featured excellent drinks.
Manager Response: Thank you for staying with us and glad you did see the value you get by staying with us. Our location is perfect for both Convention or Disneyland stays.   Thank you again and hope to see you again soon.  Mike Thomas

Summary: I stayed at the hotel at the weekend while attending a Convention at Convention Center. Great location and not far to walk; Prices good. However, room was booked by my company and the hotel staff demanded my personal card to pay for my stay. When I returned next day with company card, it was declined since I wasn't the owner. A friend joined me there, but was not allowed to park in their facility. On my way out at end of conference, my card was declined and I had to back into parking and go back into hotel in the rain to get another parking stub. However, on checkout, I was served by Jazmin. She asked me which card I would use for payment. When I procured company card, she processed it with no hassle and was surprised it had been refused earlier. She also took care of my
Manager Response: Thank you for staying with us and I am sorry you had some issue with your check in but happy Jazmin was there to help you out and help fix everything before you leave. I will pass this on to her and the front desk department.  Thank you again.

Summary: I've stayed at the Clarion twice in the past 6 months. It is a great location, especially for Disneyland or the convention center. But this latest stay I didn't go to either, I just stayed here because I like the hotel and its location. The rooms are really big, the wifi is really good, and I feel safe walking around here alone at night. If you walk 20 minutes (opposite direction to Disney) you can find a target, and the Cheesecake Factory is a short 5-10 minute walk from the hotel. Also, to get here from the airport super shuttle only costs like $15 USD and it's a much nicer location than most parts of LA/LA county. And there's a bus from outside of Disneyland that takes you into LA for like $2.50.  Will definitely stay here again on my next trip to LA 😊
Manager Response: Thank you for staying with us and glad you found the location to be a big plus! We have a great location to do anything in OC or LA. We can't with to see you next time your in Anaheim.  Mike Thomas

Summary Heading: Central location and close to Disneyland!
Summary: We enjoyed our stay here, staff were really helpful and lovely. The rooms were nice for the price we paid, and the cleaning  service was great. It's a 15 minute walk to Disneyland and only about an 30-45min trip into the LA city. Very very close to lots of different food places!! There was a few homeless people around on the streets but never felt unsafe here. We enjoyed our stay and would stay here again!
Manager Response: Thank you for staying with us and glad you enjoyed everything about your stay and the hotel.  With our location close to Disneyland and the convention center the area is well light up and always a lot of people walk around.  Mike Thomas General Manager

Summary Heading: Location was excellent, staff friendly but that is all the positive things I can say.
Summary: Our room was on the third floor, overlooking Disneyland, but you couldn't really see anything. The room came with 2 double beds and I recall the request was for 2 queen beds.  The bathroom was in dire need of refurbishing. Peeling wall paper, shower was old and tiles were in bad shape. Bathroom sink was all marked and cracked around the sink drain and probably the original.. Shower leaked onto floor when used, creating a stream of water all over the floor. My sister said the elevator doors wouldn't close correctly and needed to be pushed closed to make it operate correctly. There may have been room that were updated/refurbished but certainly not one of our! I don't think it is acceptable to charge for the use of the safe.
Manager Response: Thank you for staying with us and sorry you didn't get an updated room.  All of our beds are double size bed so we are unable to fill your request for a room with 2 queen size was unable to fill. We have room with a King bed and a full size sofa beds. Again please accept me apology about your resent stay with is.  Mike Thomas General Manager

Summary Heading: Great Place to Stay near Convention Center
Summary: I stayed here with my husband, daughter in law, and toddler grandson for a visit to Disneyland and California Adventure.  We rented the king suite, which includes one bathroom, and two rooms, and a small kitchen.  The suite is enormous.  Two sofa beds in the front room, a small desk, and a TV with bureau.  The small kitchen includes a full size fridge and a full stove with oven.  There are pots and pans, a microwave, some silverware and some dishware.  However, it is limited.  No cutting board, only two bowls, only one spoon, etc.  No toaster.  The suite was spacious enough that the toddler could play without feeling cramped.  He had a blast.  There is a Vons grocery store less than a mile a way.  We shopped the first day and purchased items for breakfast and snacks.  I bought
Manager Response: Thank you for your stay during your trip to Anaheim this month. You hit it on the head with your nice words about the hotel. I will looking in to the one room with a kitchen and add items needed. We hope you come back soon and will we be here for you.  Mike Thomas GHeneral Manager

Summary: Thus hotel was clean friendly and accommodating. The breakfast was a nice buffet and clean seating area. The rooms were large and beds comfy. The rooms were remodeled and looked nice except the bathroom was not remodeled. It's a very small bathroom and needs to be redone. I would stay here again!
Manager Response: Thank you for staying with us and so happy you and your family enjoyed your stay. We are  a family friend hotel and we are glad you notice that. We are always looking to improve the guest stay so we will look at the bathrooms.  Mike Thomas General Manager

Summary: The hotel was really nice the room are clean and the employees are really nice they have a caffe center for breakfast the food is great and is a buffet kiss eat free they have a restaurant for dinner and they do happy hours for $5 and the bar attendee is great I have a great experience
Manager Response: Thank you for your nice word and glad you enjoyed your stay. We area a vaule hotel for the people come down to Disneyland or convention center in Anaheim. We hope you have time to come back to the hotel and enjoy your time back in Anaheim.  Mike Thomas General Manager

Summary: This hotel is extremely outdated. Our room "felt" dirty, likely because there was mildew on the tiles in the shower or maybe just because everything was so old and dingy.  I would not recommend paying more than $99 for a room here. There are so many other nicer hotels in the area just over $100 for the same price parking with better amenities, cleaner rooms and better restaurants. We stayed three nights and ate at the hotel restaurant twice. Both times we received less than fair service and food that was just ok. In general I would rate the entire experience as "just ok".   The walk to Disneyland was the max walking distance for our family. In fact, the Disneyland Toy Story parking lot that we typically park in and take a shuttle to Disney is just across the street from the
Manager Response: Thank you for staying with us and sorry you didn't have a great stay. I will talk with my housekeeping staff about the room the felt dirty. We have housekeeping service everyday so let me remind them to make sure rooms feel fresh and clean everyday.  Mike Thomas General Manager

Summary: We enjoyed our stay here, great location for walking to Disneyland. Staff were very friendly and helpful. Good amenities, clean and comfortable rooms. Value for money with plenty of places to eat close by.
Manager Response: Thank you for staying and I am so happy you enjoyed your stay with us. We hope you make the Clarion Hotel your home away from home.  Mike Thomas

Summary: Dusty, wet, no microwave, small bathroom with no fan so everything is hiding mildew. Water in shower goes hot to scalding hot. Toilet takes 3 times to flush toilet paper. Small coffee maker, a one cup. Leaking fan/heater all over carpet by table and chairs area or to step out the door to the balcony. As you can tell by pictures not a new problem. They say they are fixing it when we leave. Double beds are springy but appear clean. Just uncomfortable.  Always had higher rooms, suites, but wanted one with a balcony for my daughters asthma. * They did appear (? Couldnt tell since carpet was soaked the whole 6 night stay) to clean floor after my daughter got sick off her dinner in the bar the night before. She wouldnt eat in the bar again.  The service in the bar was wonderful
Manager Response: Thank you for staying with us and sorry you didn't get one of our updated larger rooms when you stayed with us. We are always updating the rooms every year and will continue doing this. Are studio suites are 100 SQ feet larger and have both microwave and refrigerator.  MIke Thomas

Summary: I stayed here for 3 nights during my Disneyland visit. Disneyland was about a ten minute walk down the street or there's a bus you can get on if you can't walk. The room was a good size for our many Disney bags. We ate breakfast across the road at Ihop or Denny's. I'd recommend both those places for breakfast if you don't want to eat at the hotel. There is also a 24 hour chemist right next door which was handy, which sells food and souvenirs. This hotel is in a really good spot.

This place is ridiculous. They charge for breakfast (which we didn't realize because the sign was on the floor), they charge for parking, they even charge to use their safe?! Every other hotel in the area did not charge for parking or breakfast. They had cereal, sausage and make your own waffles..The shower drain was broken, the paint was peeling and the heater was crap and their elevator broke down, no microwave but they have a fridge. The fact that they charge as much as they do is ridiculous. The quality of the room was the same as the Travel lodge down the street. Which is where we ended up staying on our last night for $55.. the rooms looked the same and we got free breakfast and parking and a microwave. They have hidden fees, which they let you know after the fact. All
Manager Response: Thank you for your review. I am sorry to hear that you didn't enjoy your room here at the Clarion in Anaheim. With our location so close to Disneyland and the Anaheim convention center we do charge for parking like all the hotels in this area.   We do offer breakfast in our restaurant either buffet or off the menu. Our buffet offers 4 hot items each day as well as cook your own waffles, fresh slice fruits and Danishes. We also have servers waiting on you to deliver coffee and juices table side.  I have put the room out of order so we can have our maintenance department check out everything in the room. This room will not be put in service unless it 100 guest ready.  Thank you for staying with us.  Mike Thomas General Manager

Summary: We stayed 6 nights last week. First night the room's refrigerator and TV did not work. The next day they moved us to a new, larger room. Everything worked great. Staff was excellent, friendly and helpful.
Manager Response: Thank you for staying with us and glad we find the right room for you! My staff is super important to make everyone enjoy your stay. I am happy they showed the hospitality to you and your family.

Summary: Very old hotel.elevators slow/and or don't work..close to disneyland but never walked anyway.took shuttle.spend less for hotel lil further away if u go if u think being closer is better it's not. Breakfast however was good.the best part of the entire trip
Manager Response: Thank you for your stay and comments. We are always updating our rooms each year. We just added 75 rooms with new double beds this year in January. We have more items to come this year.

Summary Heading: Our Trip: A Three Star Property with Great Service
Summary: We visited Disneyland resort with our 9 year old son over the long MLK weekend. The weather was great, the parks full, and we had a great time! One thing that added to our trip was this property. Let me start with the positive:  Pro - The location was great. While not exactly perfect walking distance, we never waited long for an ART bus (Route 3), and there is a stop right at the front of the hotel by the fountain. Short route meant short ART waits. They staff was flexible with our stay. Bad weather back home meant I bumped our arrival a day early. They added a night to my stay, kept me in the same room, and avoided annoyed keycard problems that usually happen with multiple reservations. We called and arranged for a 1PM checkout and I was happy to pay the $25 fee, but when we
Manager Response: Thank you for staying with us and glad my staff gave you great attention during your stay. We hope to see you on your next Disneyland visit.

Summary: Had a 3 night visit for Citrix Summit conference. In my opinion it is a unspectacular hotel, nothing special. The restaurant looked dirty so we did not dare to eat there. The rooms just had new beds so they were ok. A rather noicy airconditioner in the room disturbed my sleep.
Manager Response: Thank you for staying with us and will review your comment with my staff to have all AC units check. Hope to see you again soon.

Summary: Well it's going to be a long one ..please bear with me ..but I am trying to give some inside views who are going to Anaheim with kids first time .. First I need to thank hotel people for saving my iPad ,I forgot it in my room and it's my carelessness ..we left Anaheim and after reaching San Diego I realized i lost it ...immidieately called front desk ,they said morning lost and found will be open .that  girl at lost and found (juana/ huana) called us back in morning and said she will check if it's there ...again she called and informed she found it ..she was ready to mail ,but as  we were driving to LA and could pick up ..she made sure she keep it at front desk while we arrive ...thank you so much for this honesty ,care and concern !priceless ! When I booked this hotel before
Manager Response: Thank you for your kind words and so glad your stay was good! I happy the Juana found your missing item and everything was taken care of. We hope to see you again on your next visit to Disneyland.  Mike Thomas General Manager

Summary Heading: Great Stay 7 days! First time Visited Anaheim
Summary: We stayed at the Clarion Hotel in Anahaim for 7 days. Room was a nice with two queen beds and sofa bed. Had a fabulous and beautiful view towards disneyland. Had a mean view of Disneyland firework from our room on the 9th floor. Lobby was very clean, tidy and looks bit flash.  Hotel perfect location.  Friendly and smile staff. No complaints.  Really impressed with their quick service. Walking distance to Disneyland - 15 mins. Plenty of good restaurtants nearby. Had breakfast at Ihop (5 mins walk). Took an Uber to Universal Studio (30-40 mins based on busy motorway), Los Angeles Memorial Colisuem to watch LA RAM game and many outlets in Los Angeles and Orange Country. Very friendly uber driver. Would definitely recommend for your stay in Anaheim!

We stayed at the Clarion Hotel in Anaheim for four nights while visiting Disneyland and Disney's California Adventure, and had a wonderful experience! The check-in was flawless and the room was clean and spacious. The sink drain was slow, so we told them about it when we got back from the park the first night. They sent the maintenance person up immediately and he took care of it right away. No fuss, no muss! The buffet breakfast was plentiful, varied, and delicious. The wait staff were very polite, accommodating, and patient, even though we had eight excited grandchildren wreaking havoc on the place. We would definitely stay here again if we have the opportunity and we will recommend it to friends and neighbors.
Manager Response: Thank you for staying with us and Happy that you enjoyed everything about your stay here at the hotel. I was happy that you enjoyed your home away from home then traveling to Anaheim.  Mike Thomas

Summary: We have been booking a banquet room at the Clarion every year for three years to host our Christmas party. Each year Cathy, Emily and the staff has done a great job making it an event to remember.  The prices are extremely reasonable and the location in the resort area is perfect.
Manager Response: Thank you for booking your Christmas party at the hotel each year and we have staff member stand out for you. We can't wait to book your next party here at the Clarion Hotel  Mike Thomas General Manager

Summary: The desk staff at the clarion we're welcoming and helpful when we checked in. They helped us to find several plocal places on the map they gave us at the desk .  We were in a suite which was roomy, had a microwave, mini fridge and two beds,.  Cvs pharmacy is just down the street for pop and chips to have in the room at night. The best thing is the location, you can walk to dusneyland, restaurants and the convention centre etc. Or take the art bus, which is the best bargain in town .  The lobby was decorated nicely for the season, and the room was kept clean and well supplied.  Good start to my birthday, wedding anniversary and Christmas celebrations .  Thanks clarion it rained two of the days we were there and the staff was working hard to keep the floors dry and safe
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to review the hotel and we are glad you enjoyed your time here at the Clarion during your visit to Anaheim. We hope you make us your home away from home.  Mike Thomas General Manager

Summary: (I hope I spelled the name correctly) There were times were I thought I would have a bad experience but She was there to rescue us from that. I won't go into detail but she will know. Thank you Sharene for everything you did for us. I am pleased with my stay.
Manager Response: Thank you for staying with us and glad Sharene saved you vacation at the hotel. She did talked to me and I shared it with my managers so we can do it better the first time. I am glad she was here for you and that you enjoyed your stay.  Mike Thomas  General Manager

Summary: Stayed here for 4 nights. The beds were okay. Nothing special. The room was nice and clean. The heated pool was a nice touch being that it was November and kinda chilly out. The best part was the customer service.  Our Elf on the Shelf, Leo came to visit us at the hotel. We needed someone to make sure that he moved while we were out of the room. I called the front desk and while the gentleman didn't know what I was talking about he took the time to go up to the room and make sure he moved for us.  They went the extra mile and that made a difference.
Manager Response: Thank you for staying with us and glad we were able to go the extra mile for you and you enjoyed your stay with us. We hope to have you come back soon.  Mike Thomas  General Manager

Summary: I had 115 people stay here over Thanksgiving and the staff was wonderful to work with and they were very attentive to all of our needs.  Rooms were maintained well and close to Disneyland.  Would highly recommend for your stay in Anaheim.
Manager Response: We love have group stay with us and glad we did a great job for all your guest. We will be here the next time you book your next group with us next year.  Mike Thomas General Manager

Summary: The Clarion was a great hotel. The only downside was the nightly parking rate. Otherwise the staff was very friendly and helpful. The hotel room was clean and neat. I stayed on the 6th floor and the view of the convention center was awesome.
Manager Response: Thank you for staying with us and glad you enjoyed your stay with us. I am sorry you didn't like paying for parking but we are still the lowest in the area and all hotel around us change. Glad you stayed was a good time and hope to see you soon.

Summary: The hotel is older but very clean and comfortable.  We had the mini suite which worked out great for us.  The parking was fine and easy to navigate but there is only Blue Card parking outside the parking turn styles by valet parking.  this made me nervous but worked fine for us.  We did ask for an updated room.  I was a little concerned about the location we got right next to the elevator but it was quiet and we never heard the elevator at all.  The buffet breakfast was good and even the eggs were tasty.  We will stay here again.
Manager Response: Thank you for choosing the Clarion Hotel during your visit to Disneyland. We are excited that you enjoyed the hotel and glad you found your home away from home.

Summary: Well stayed with friends. Requested a renovated room which was perfect apart from on of the beds being a bit dodgy. Hotel perfect location. 15 mins walk to Disney. Lots of restaurants on close by.  The guy called Charlie at guest services was fantastic, very helpful. Breakfast buffet needs sorting out though...
Manager Response: Thank you for letting us know that Charlie was fantastic during your stay with us. We all try and make everyone fill like the home when they stay with us. We hope to see you again soon  Thank you

Summary Heading: Very nice staff, but the hotel needs an upgrade.
Summary: Hotel room was showing its age.  Tub was chipped, gout was old/shrunken/cracked.  A/C was noisy.  A good location for Disneyland (within walking distance, but not THAT close).  Lots of restaurants close by.  WiFi was good.  The staff was very friendly...
Manager Response: Thank you for staying with us and glad we meet your needs during your visit to the area. We are looking a our bathroom area to update them next year. We just finshed up a room refresh and remold this year.

Summary Heading: Not bad for a hotel near Disney
Summary: This hotel was not bad to stay at. The front desk was very nice and very knowledgeable about Disney. The Lobby was nice and clean. The rooms were ok nothing fancy, just a place to sleep. The shower kept going from hot to cold every so often. For a one niter it's an ok place to stay. If you have the choice to stay at a nicer place you should. We were on a budget to so we had to stay here. The room comes with a nice big fridge which was a great feature since we had kids.
Manager Response: Thank you for staying with us and happy to see that we had what you needed. We are always trying to make guest stay more enjoyable so I will pass this on to my staff members.  Thank you

Summary Heading: A beautiful place and close to Disneyland...
Summary: We were able to stay here November 8-11.  It was a fantastic place to stay and well worth the money and time.  The location was perfect for our family trip to Disneyland. The room was a nice one with two queen beds.  The bed was hard and I really didn't sleep well. The bathroom was in need of an upgrade and I'm sure they'll do it soon.  I liked that the TV always came on to the Disney channel when the grandkids were visiting. If we had no kids, I wouldn't like it.  The parking lot is nice, but they never picked up the trash that was dumped near where we parked our car the whole time we were there.  I don't understand that. Did the housekeeping staff only work inside?  Did they have groundskeeping personnel only work on the weekend?  Isn't this beautiful Anaheim?   Not when
Manager Response: We are excited you had a fantastic stay with us and glad you enjoyed the hotel. We are looking to update the bathroom next year and will be replacing 75 rooms with new beds in the hotel in Decemnber.

Summary: I stayed this hotel with a group while attending a conference at the convention center. The price was reasonable for the area and very convenient to the convention center. Disneyland is also just a 10-15 minute walk away. The hotel itself is a little outdated but was clean and comfortable. Would recommend if you don't plan on spending tons of time in your room.
Manager Response: Thank you for staying with us and glad we were very convenient  and comfortable for you. We are your go to place when coming to Anaheim.

Summary Heading: Wanted to give a 3 star but couldn't do it
Summary: I really did want to give higher stars. I was debating between a low 3 or a higher 2 but as I went over the hotel in my head I thought a 2 was more fitting. When we arrived they upgraded us to a larger corner room on the 7th floor which was nice of them to do. The room was HUGE with a floor to ceiling windows facing Disneyland. The nice thing about that was we were able to see some of the fireworks over the other hotels. For the size of the room the TV was rather small. The bed was hardly softer than sleeping on the floor and made for restless night sleeps. The bathroom was VERY outdated. Kaulking was coming off in the corners, the tub was stained and I could not tell if the bathroom floor was filthy or if it was supposed to look like that.  I have to mention the food that is

I really don't want this to sound awful because my stay at the Clarion was definitely "OK".  We didn't get off on the right foot with the elevator not working when I wanted to get to the lobby my first day....and the first morning's absence of hot water in my bathroom did not set well.  Those things were addressed, but left the impression that the hotel needed a little more attention on the maintenance side.  Then there was the front desk telling me that a $25 charge would appear on my credit card after checking in...and instead, the full amount of room rental showed up on my CC statement the next morning. That too is forgivable...I would have paid my bill anyway.  The location is prime for access to the Anaheim Convention...just a short walk around the corner.  And for the

I'm giving this hotel two stars only because their staff was friendly and the service was good but the rooms weren't very clean and it looks very old. Another good thing is that they offer information about tours and places to visit. I wouldn't stay here again.

Stayed for 4 nights while attending a business trip.  We were given the wrong room at first.  This was corrected only after showing our confirmation to the front desk.  The suite we had was very roomy.  The pipes in the bathroom under the sink were wrapped in some sort of dingy looking tape.  The bathroom needs updated all the way around.  The walls are pretty thin.  There is no breakfast included.  There is coffee in the room- that is it.  The concierge was not helpful at all unless you wanted to go to Disneyland.  Which we did not.  There is no free shuttle to ANYWHERE.  For the price ... I expected more.

I stayed at Clarion on October 2015, for a meeting at the Convention Center, which was excellent, since we could walk for a few minutes and get to the CC. Clean and simple, nice staff, fair prices. Rooms are quiet.

Decent rooms and great location to the Anaheim convention center. Walk over in 2-3 minutes.  The price is low, so the value for the location is quite good.   The rooms are spacious, but quite oldlooking, and even though the staff is friendly its not very efficient. Even though Im not that positive, I slept good all week I stayed there.  Dont eat there :)

Well, the staff were kind of rude, and at check in, despite multiple stations and a long line, the hotel had one poor soul handling all of the front desk. One day, my husband went to ask the concierge person about the shuttle and Disneyland tickets and the fellow took one look at my husband as he approached, and promptly walked off and his in a closet. There was no one else in line and no additional staff to assist, so after 5 minutes of the guy hiding in back, my husband left. We attempted to buy Disneyland tickets there as the entire hotel and room were plastered with "BUY YOUR DISNEYLAND TICKETS HERE!", so when we went to buy the night before we hit the park, you'll never guess! They had no tickets! Wow. The "shuttle service" to the park was to purchase a non-discounted bus
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to complete our online survey regarding your recent stay at our hotel.   On behalf of our entire team, I would like to apologize for failing to exceed your expectations. Your satisfaction is important to us and we will be using the feedback you provided to make improvements to ensure we offer an exceptional experience for our guests in the future.  I hope that you will consider staying with us again so that we can have another chance to provide you with a superior experience.   Sincerely,  Mike Thomas General Manager

Summary: My grand daughter Lily and I stayed at the Anaheim Clarion Hotel for a week. We both loved it - in fact Lily voted it the best stay on our world trip. The staff were friendly and helpful, food great and beds comfortable and clean. What more could you want really. Thankyou!!
Manager Response: Thank you for the kind words and We are so happy that Lily voted it her best stay in the world. We hope to see you again.  Mike Thomas

Summary: Stayed here recently for two nights. The rooms are obviously old but they were clean. Breakfast buffet that was included was decent. I wouldn't pay for it though. Beds were comfy and some of the best pillows I've had in a hotel! Pretty quiet where our room was. Staff was pretty friendly. I would stay here again.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to complete our online survey regarding your recent stay at our hotel.  Your feedback is very important to us and we can assure you that we will use this information to do everything possible to create an enjoyable experience for each of our guests. We hope to see you again soon!  Sincerely,  Mike Thomas General Manager

Summary: The Hotel is run down and needs a lot of updating. Was not impressed with the staff. Don't feel I got my money's worth. I would not stay here again. Not very clean. Only bright stop was the location to the convention center and Disneyland.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to complete our online survey regarding your recent stay at our hotel.   On behalf of our entire team, I would like to apologize for failing to exceed your expectations. Your satisfaction is important to us and we will be using the feedback you provided to make improvements to ensure we offer an exceptional experience for our guests in the future.  I hope that you will consider staying with us again so that we can have another chance to provide you with a superior experience.   Sincerely,  Mike Thomas General Manager

Summary Heading: I stay in a lot of old shady places...but give me rude customer service on top of it, forget it!
Summary: Room is old but old with dust bunnies under furniture which just makes it feel dirty...old dirty.  The beds were "mini" and will not fit a tall person or and adult plus kid.  Shower was old and dirty.  Fan was broken and kept turning on, addressed it with front desk and they said they would come, after ignoring my two calls on the third they move us to another room and rudely said "your moved now you should be FINE."  We could not wait to get out of there...Many other nice places to stay.  We used Priceline "name your price", this has failed us more times then not.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to complete our online survey regarding your recent stay at Clarion Hotel Anaheim Resort.  Allow me to apologize on behalf of our hotel for failing to meet your expectations regarding Dust Bunnies on your recent visit.  I have shared your feedback with Housekeeping to ensure we handle these types of situations differently in the future.    Again, thank you for your time and valuable feedback.  We sincerely appreciate it and hope you will give us another chance to provide you with superior service and accommodations on your next visit to Anaheim.  Kind regards,  Mike Thomas

Summary: Basic room.  Comfy bed,  nice balcony to get fresh air, coffee pot and fridge a plus.  Would have been nice to have a microwave,  bathroom could be updated but clean.  Walking distance to Disney which is great,  feels longer after a long day at Disney.  Onsite restaurant and bar is convenient. Food a tad pricey for the quality but decent.  Would stay again.
Manager Response: Thank you for your comment and I have shared this with my staff and management team.  Thank you  Mike

Summary Heading: Close to Disneyland, clean and convenient.
Summary: We stayed at the Clarion for a week.  Yes it is dated - however we had adjoining rooms and they were always clean upon our return.  Towel supply were fresh and room service was great.  It is close to Disneyland and is on the route for tours to pick up from.  We ate in a couple of times and the meals were reflective of the price we paid.  The front counter helped out with the few issues we had and were polite and courteous.  If you are looking for the luxuries of the Marriott or Hilton I'd recommend you book these hotels.  If you are looking for a hotel that is comfortable and your not planning on spending all day here the Clarion is fine.
Manager Response: Thank you for our feed back and we are happy you enjoyed your stay with us and we hope to see you again soon.  All the best,  Mike

Summary: This hotel for the price is great value being this close to Disneyland but the quality of the room is pretty average. It is out dated but everything works and the beds are very comfortable. The general cleanliness of the lobby and amenities is very good.
Manager Response: We would like to thank you for taking the time to complete our online survey.  Feedback from our guests is very important to us and your input helps with our continuing efforts to provide excellent service and a great stay. Remember your home away from home.  Thank you so much for your business and we look forward to seeing you in the future.  Mike Thomas

Summary Heading: Cockroaches in both Suites we booked...
Summary: I have never, ever stayed in a hotel where I spent this much money (not only for the room but 15$ for breakfast and 10$ a night for parking!) and had cockroaches in the refrigerator, the bathroom, and the drawers.... I will NEVER stay in this hotel again. It was horribly over-priced for what we got... and the location was NOT worth it.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to complete our online survey regarding your recent stay at Clarion Hotel Anaheim Resort.  Allow me to apologize on behalf of our hotel for failing to meet your expectations regarding on your recent visit.  I have shared your feedback with Team to ensure we handle these types of situations differently in the future.    Again, thank you for your time and valuable feedback.  We sincerely appreciate it and hope you will give us another chance to provide you with superior service and accommodations on your next visit to Anaheim.  Kind regards,  Mike Thomas

Summary: We stayed at The Clarion for one night and one night was enough! We had stayed there last year and liked the location and figured one night is worth the location. It really is a great location, but that's it. Terrible service, smelly hotel and badly needs renovation. It doesn't offer free parking where many of it's competitors does. It's $14 per night which I think is very steep as it offers little to no security too. I'm pretty sure we won't be back until they have undergone renovations.
Manager Response: I am sorry you didn't like your room, we are always looking way to improve guest stays and will talk with my anagement team.

Summary: First of all...there is no point comparing a budget hotel with one that is luxury. Obviously they are not comparable. My first impression of this hotel was that it is surrounded by luxury hotels, so clearly looks out of place. But let's remember the price differential. Here's what I like about Clarion: 1) comfy beds (quilted mattress cover); 2) location to Disneyland and Convention Centre; 3) Price point; 4) ART (bus) pick up and drop off right outside the door; 5) very friendly and accommodating staff.  Here's what I didn't like: 1) very dated decor and shabby furnishings (torn, etc); 2) dreadful food (Q. how can you ruin pasta? A. by leaving it in boiling water forever! Not to mention watery eggs at breakfast); 3) not having a menu in the room to order room service (had to go
Manager Response: Thank you for staying with us and I am glad you enjoyed your stay with us. I am also sorry we didn't delver a good meal for you. I will talk with my kitchen staff and also double check the breakfast buffet is up to standard. We are continuously updating the hotel staring in November.  We hope you see again when you are back visiting Disneyland

Summary Heading: Worn Down, Horrible Beds, Just not Right
Summary: Checking out tomorrow morning, and can't wait.  Where to start....  Sharing a king size bed.  Every time I move, every time the other person moves, the whole bed shakes.  My side of the bed is kind of at a slope when I am in it (I'm about 2225 lbs., not a lightweight, but not that bad either for 6'2".)  The mattress is basically so old and crappy that there is no independence between the sides of the bed, hence the shaking of the bed.   A minor point, but indicative of something - they automatically put a charge for the room safe on the bill, apparently you can ask it to be taken off when you check out if you haven't used it.  I've never been to a hotel that charges for a safe - it's like saying our security is inadequate, you need a safe, and you have to pay extra for the safe
Manager Response: Thank you for staying with us and very sorry you didn't enjoy the bed in your room and the safe charge,  we have 75 rooms of new Mattress on order and should be here by the end of October. I will check your mattress and add it to the list of rooms.  Thank you again for letting us know

Summary: We were on a leisure trip to Disneyland and local attractions. The hotel is right across the street from the Disneyland shuttles which makes it easy to walk to the shuttle and return. Our room was comfortable, clean, and quiet.  We had some initial trouble with our check-in as we had requested and reserved a room with a King bed through a third party. We came into town on a Saturday of a busy weekend.
