The front desk clerk, Ichel (yes that is her name), was very helpful sorting through the confusion and maintained a calm and friendly demeanor through our frustration. Ichel was able to work with the housekeeping staff to honor the third party booking with a king bed. The rest of the staff was also friendly during our 3 night 4 day stay.
Manager Response: Thank you and happy you enjoyed your stay with us. We hope to see you again at you visit to Disneyland.  Thank you

Summary: Seems to be a little outdated. Some of the rooms are "refreshed" as the desk clerk phrased it. (You have to ask for a refreshed room) Our room was one of the "refreshed" found it to be clean, but seems the only refresh was the newer carpet. Nice that it had a refrigerator and microwave as there isn't a breakfast included. We tried the dinner and were quite disappointed that we were put in the cocktail lounge! The dining room was closed. A hamburger and fries, plus iced tea was $25 for two people. We ate elsewhere after that. The beds and pillows were very comfortable. There is a pool but no hot tub. It has a gift shop and business center (computer). Also Wi-Fi worked fine. The room had a small balcony, and the air-conditioning worked fine. The Anaheim Resort Transit bus stops
Manager Response: Thank you for you time to tell us about your recent stay and happy that you enjoyed the hotel. I hope you come back soon and we will be here with smiles.  Thank you

Summary: Location of this hotel was the best surprise.  Checking was great with Rose, she was very informative. The room was great, we got upgrade to suite but unfortunately it had two beds. So my hubby and I couldn't sleep together. We had a view of Disney World fireworks at nights. Beautiful area to walk around in. This hotel reallys to upgrade the it old, boring and stuffy restaurant and bar area. It wasn't somewhere you want to spend too much time in.  Would have spend more money if it was updated.  Other thing we didn't like was the water pressure suck got showing. But overall we would stay again!
Manager Response: Thank you for staying with us and so Happy that Rose was a shinning star for you. I will pass on the information about the water pressure with the Maintenance team.  Thank you

Summary: Great location to Convention Center.Clean , quiet , comfortable rooms. Friendly staff. Only negative was poor food facility. There are plenty of good restaurants nearby.WiFi service was fine.Great for business travel.
Manager Response: Thank you for staying with and glad you enjoyed your stay and I will talk with my kitchen department and let them know your concern and we will improve our restaurant for you. Again Glad you enjoyed your stay with us.  Thank you

Summary: My husband and I stayed at the Clarion during our third annual trip to Disneyland, and we were quite pleased! The fact that it had an indoors hotel layout, as opposed to the outdoor motel layout that most of the resorts in the Disneyland area have, gave us a feeling of added security. The staff was friendly, the rooms were clean, though maybe a bit dated, and the beds were comfortable (we booked a double and took the opportunity to each stretch out in our own bed).  We also found the price to be very reasonable for a Disneyland "Good Neighbours" hotel, and the added bonus that the ART bus stops right out front makes it just the perfect choice for couples and families alike! Out of the three hotels we have stayed at, this one was our favourite!  Thank you Clarion Anaheim for an
Manager Response: THank you for staying with us as your home away from home when you visiting Anaheim, I am happy you had an amazing stay. We hope to see you on your annual trip next time.

Summary: Have stayed at this property about 10 times over the past 5 years.  Yes, it is dated and in need of a face lift in many of the rooms.  My toilet would run until I hit the handle a few times and it took the sink about 30 seconds to drain.  Why do I and my family keep coming back.  Wonderful Staff.  They always do everything to make us feel welcome.  It is not five star but you will not pay 5 star prices.  Glad that the refurbishments will start soon but either way, we still like it.
Manager Response: Thank you for your loyalty and glad you enjoyed our staff. Yes on November 13, we will again start some room renovation and can't wait for you to see what we are doing to improve it.  Thank you for staying with us in Anaheim

Summary: Great location but the rooms are OLD. I had to bleach the bath before getting in because I felt the room was old and not cleaned very well. The hotel was accommodating and changed my room three times and by the 3rd room I figured the hotel just really needed updating.
Manager Response: Thank you for staying with us and very sorry you didn't think your room was clean, I will talk with the entire housekeeping department and let them know your concerns and will make sure when we inspected the rooms we do a better job.   Again, Thank you for your feed back.

Summary: Love this place. My family and I having been going to Disneyland during Thanksgiving for the past 5 years and we have stayed here. You can walk to Disneyland or places to eat or you can take the Anaheim bus.
Manager Response: We welcome you back with open arms and will be here with our smile on! We are always trying to make your stay special when your here in Anaheim. WE are looking forward to your visit in November.  Mike Thomas

Summary: We stayed here for the weekend.  We had 2 separate reservations but the desk was very helpful and let us keep the same room both nights.  The front desk staff was incredibly friendly  our hotel was clean, we got room service and it was up to our room in about 15 minutes.  Big servings too, and delicious.  We also had a balcony which was pretty neat.  Some cons would be the size of the room.  The bathroom is very small.  You can hardly fit in there to use the toilet and close the door. It's also right across the street from the shuttles to Disney.  Although I think they can pick you up from the hotel,  we took a 10 minute walk and walked right over.  Not bad at all.
Manager Response: Thank you for your kind words. I am very happy that our staff went above and beyond what you excepted. We hope you use the hotel again when you visit Anaheim.  Mike Thomas

Summary: My husband and I stayed at this hotel - not a resort - for the Dumbo Double Dare at Disneyland. It was just okay. I know it is a competitive environment with the emphasis on Disney, but I stay at a lot of Choice Properties throughout the year. It was adequate, but it would have been nice to come "home" after intense days to an inviting room. It needs desperately to be updated. The staff was outstanding and they are gems: I wish i could give this hotel a very good as a result of them alone. But the property needs an update and I expect better from Choice.
Manager Response: Thank you for staying with us and we have plans to upgraded the room in over 100 room this starting in November. Last year we add new carpets and drapes in over 150 rooms. Thank you and we hope to see you again.  Mike THomas

Summary: Rooms are dated, cramped bathrooms, twin beds are a lot smaller than you envision, dated carpets, only real thing that looks updated is the breakfast bar downstairs which is over priced. Reception staff are rather awkward at times and are confusing 1 staff says parking is $12 a night, 1 says $6 a night, and the room keys are always a problem. It did have a good pool, vending machines and reasonably priced laundry facilities on the property. It's proximity to Disneyland probably attracts people but to be honest there are others motels closer that would be a lot better. I wouldn't recommend to anyone let alone stay here again.
Manager Response: Thank you for your feed back and very sorry we drooped the ball during your stay. I did pass this on to all our department head and will improve to make this hotel a better.

Summary: Clean with very friendly and helpful staff, but the rooms and décor are seriously dated.  Located about an easy 5-10 minute walk south of the Disney entrance.  The location is also centrally located and an easy walk to area restaurants.
Manager Response: Thank you for staying  with us and glad you had a good stay here in September. We hope to see you again during your next visit.

Summary: If our room wasn't free I would of walked out.   Its was dated, the beds very uncomfy. The bedding did look clean thats the only thing it had going for it.   Trust me spend the extra 30 to stay somewhere decent, or stay at motel 6, because that might be nicer. They charge you for parking which none of the parking things work. The staff was friendly.   the air conditioning was horrible and weak but only was i one an uncomfy bed which by the way is too small for two people to sleep it in. It was hot..........  I would never pay to stay here end of story, considered leaving and paying for a nicer room. one upside a mile from disneyland easy walk, otherwise go elsewhere. 14 extra bucks for parking at that joke ha, also they try to sneak in a safe fee of a $1.50 a day FYI.  look

Summary Heading: Fine for a Place to Stay the Night
Summary: In order to save money on our Disneyland vacation, I booked at the Clarion. We are rarely in our room when we visit Disneyland, so a comfortable place to stay the night is mostly what we care about. Prior to our arrival I grew nervous based on others reviews of the property. Upon checking into our room, I could understand why people were not giving rave reviews. We had booked a suite containing 2 doubles and a sofa bed. One of the the beds looked like a taco; you could visibly see the sag in the middle. The sofa bed showed staining and the overall appearance of the room was rundown.The room was obviously old and outdated, albeit spacious. I went down to the front desk and explained that I had been told I would be in one of the remodeled suites. The older gentleman at the front
Manager Response: Thank you for staying with us and glad you enjoyed your stay. We have updated about 80% of studio suite and will finish the rest of them by the end of this year.    Thank you  Mike Thomas

Summary: room was fine,,bathroom a little dated but water pressure was good.staff mainly very good but had one front office staff refuse to give change for the laundry machine despite not having a  machine in the laundry this was sorted by another staff member..for the price it was fine for a short no frills stay.
Manager Response: Thank you for your time and staying with us. I know that bath room are small but we hope you like the bigger room size. I am sorry the front desk didn't give you change for the laundry.  Mike Thomas General Manager

Summary: Room was clean and fresh.bed was very comfortable. Staff was friendly and helpful. Location is next to convention center and very close to Disneyland. It is an older hotel and the age shows, but it was clean and well cared for.
Manager Response: Thank you for you for staying with us during your last visit to Anaheim. I am happy you enjoyed your stay with us and hope to see you again.  Mike Thomas

Summary: When I arrived at the hotel I had to wait 5-10 minutes to be checked in being the only person in line because the front desk person was on the phone and did not even acknowledge my presence. I asked for a room with a king size bed and was originally given a room with two queens but they did make the necessary change after I complained. The room I checked in to was a total disaster, the drapes were shearing, the air condition was very noisy especially at nights that I was never able to get a good night's sleep. The bath tub squeaked with every movement. I had the buffet breakfast in the restaurant one morning and everything in the buffet was cold, including the eggs and potatoes. This hotel is tired and greatly in need of an upgrade both inside and outside. I was very
Manager Response: I am very sorry we didn't leave up to the standard you expected, I am sure we could make it up to you if you come back in the future. I have passed this on to the management team so that it will not happened again.  Mike Thomas

Summary: I went to Anaheim in Aug 2016 for a conference and  booked Clarion because it was one of the hotels organized by the conference for group reservation. Alas! what a terrible experience it was... The first thing I noticed was the room was stinking. It was hard to believe, but it really did. During my stay, I searched for the source of the smell and apparently it was due to mold. Even the freezer compartment in the fridge had colorful mold in it. The chair upholstery had several holes and everything was close to falling apart... A terrible noise was coming from the back of the building all the time... I was in Anaheim for presenting a couple research, so indeed I was too busy to get involved in the complaining process and the consequent headache in such a hotel with such a
Manager Response: I am very sorry you had a bad stay on your last visit to the Clarion. I am looking all your concerns so that we can fixed them so it can't happened again. Thank you you for your time and hope you give us a second chance.  MIke Thomas

Summary Heading: ..stayed here a couple of years back, and it is gone downhill.
Summary: We stayed here a few years ago, and thought I'd give it another try.  From the very beginning, it was a combination of errors.    I specifically called about a couple of hours before 4:00 pm (their check-ion time), and asked if I could have an earlier check-in as we would be arriving at about 3:00 pm.  The Front Desk assured me that it would be no problem.  Upon arrival, I waited in line about 15 minutes (no it is 3:15), and the lady who assisted me was nothing but unpleasant.  She told me that the room was not ready, and she would call me when it was.  I told her that I was parked out front and would not move my car because of the inconvenience.  I waited and waited till about 3:45 pm, and no phone call on my cell.  I then walked back into the lobby, and after discussing it

Spacious rooms with tiny showers, the toilet is so close to the door that it is difficult to close the door. The beds were squeeky but ok. Free wifi but breakfast is not included. Kids eat for free when you have breakfast or dinner at the hotel. You can get a shuttle ticket for 5 usd, which allows you to travel to and from Disney all day long. The hotel also offers pick up from the hotel for various tours. There are many placed to eat at close to this hotel. Parking is 6 usd per day and you have to pay for the use of the safe.
Manager Response: Thank you staying with us and glad you enjoyed your stay with us. We are a small hotel and will do what every we can to make your stay more enjoyable.  Mike Thomas

Summary Heading: Older hotel located close to the Convention Center
Summary: My Drug Court team stayed at the Clarion during the National Drug Court Conference in June.  It is an older hotel that needs updating.  However, the rooms were good size and had microwaves and refrigerators.  The rate does not include a continental breakfast. The staff was friendly and helpful.  Our stay at the Clarion worked out okay, but our first preference would have been the Marriott had they not been fully booked.

Outside looks old, inside ok. Double beds suck though. Bedding is old. Pool is just ok. No hot tub😤. Breakfast is ok but they do have a bar. At least there's a Starbucks at the Marriott next store and other restaurants nearby. This is definitely a budget conscious hotel. Not my choice but it will do for a few days.

Mid July of 2016 we stayed in this hotel for a 2 day visit to disney parks.Paid about $450, not including parking. Room had 2 beds and a sofa bed. Pros: Beds were clean, comfy, and drapes were pitch dark. Cons: WiFi is not the best, no continental breakfast, and fee for parking.

Room was good. Beds were good Con: three roaches  1 one floor. 1 in tub next day.  1 in a drawer that we did not use but we checked as we left Front destroy operated by very young staff We were with others and was to have connecting rooms did not happen they then stated they do not guarantee connecting rooms. We ask why we were not so informed At time of reservation they stated we just don't do that When I ask to speak to a manager I was ask why. He wouldn't be able to change anything. Parking costs extra

Summary Heading: Bad experience from the get go!
Summary: First room included live roach on pillow of bed. They moved us to another room and as we entered there was a live roach scurrying across bathroom floor! Dead roach in elevator three as well. Whole interior of hotel and rooms was very dated, like 1980's décor. Very overpriced and out-of-place for sitting next to Marriott, etc., hotels and yet rates were comparable. Would absolutely NOT recommend anyone stay there.

Summary Heading: Close to Convention Center, but not many features
Summary: First of all - the pluses: room size was great, beds comfortable, had a balcony looking out over the fountain, there was a refrigerator, and the a/c was cold! :) Staff was friendly, as well. The BEST part? The Palm Cafe restaurant on the first floor - dinner was $10-15/plate, and the food was actually wonderful! We preferred this over the fancy steak house across the way. Now, the negatives: The bathroom is so tiny you have to figure out how to open the door while you're in there. :/ Parking is extra - not included - and $14/day. Safe is in room...but again, an extra charge. No provided breakfast. WHile the room was clean, the carpet wasn't - and kind of smelled like smoke.  Overall - it was okay, location is great, just seemed like many of the things you get at other hotels
Manager Response: Thank you for staying with us and glad you enjoyed your stay here. Yes bathrooms are small but you get a bigger room to enjoy. We hope to see you again  Mike

Summary: Staying here for 3 nights room is a really good size..... great to see 2 double beds for the 3 of us to share rather than a sofa bed .....bathroom small but at least sink and mirror area separate ...room is clean but dated !   Had good view of the fireworks from the park at night .have a nice little balcony .....air con good but noisy .....staff on reception friendly not sure how or who they charge  for parking as website says $14 but we were told $7 but I see a previous review said they got it for free  Walking distance to the Disney parks took us 20 mins lots of restaurants around to choose from ..didn't eat in hotel  Stay good but prob wouldn't come back till they had a refurb unless some rooms have but ours didn't .although fab wifi in our room no problems at all
Manager Response: Thank you for staying with us and wed are happy you enjoyed the room and the view of the fireworks. Yes the hotel is older but we have just remolded about half of the hotel and the other half at the end of the year.

Summary: We could have stayed at a nice hotel for cheaper. They didn't offer continental breakfast. And the breakfast that they offer was $15.99 a person and was comparable to a continental breakfast But was the worst breakfast ever. I would have preferred to eat a breakfast Hot Pocket or a breakfast roll from 7-Eleven. However their staff is very friendly and helpful. They could have done a better job of cleaning the bathroom. It's a little Rundown needs some updating. Had troubles with room key But they resolved it quickly which was nice. I probably will never stay there again. I prefer Holiday Inn Resort or Holiday Inn Express these hotels are cheaper and better quality.
Manager Response: Thank you for your feedback. We hope that you will allow us another chance to accommodate your needs. Next time you are in town please try our Full Breakfast Buffet that consists of eggs, potatoes, 2 breakfast meats, waffles, toast fruit and hot and cold cereal with a drink for $13.99.

Summary Heading: Close to Convention Center; but overall just OK
Summary: A benefit was the hotel is right at the convention center, so parking not an issue. But Parking at the hotel was $15/day. The buffet breakfast at the hotel cost extra- it was ok, but nothing much more than I would find at hotels that include a hot buffet breakfast. Waiters brought coffee, but that also meant having to ask for refills and leaving a tip. We had some nice neighbors who checked out and gave its their meal tickets, which was the only reason we went to the breakfast. The waiter picked the tickets up when we sat down. By the end of the meal, he gave us a check, and said we hadn't put down any tickets, and couldn't find them in his stack. The matter D' said it was a hotel issue, the hotel staff said it was a restaurant issue....so we ended up paying almost $15 ( after
Manager Response: Thank you for staying with us and glad you had a good stay. I am sorry that we were not able to give you points because you had a group rate. We hope to see you again soon

Summary: The Clarion was a very nice place to stay.  We chose it because of its proximity to the convention center for the volleyball tournament that we were attending.  Both the hotel and the rooms were very clean and had a friendly staff.  The bathrooms were a little small, but we loved having a refrigerator and microwave in the room.  We will definitely be back.
Manager Response: Thank you for your time and we are happy that you enjoy your time at the hotel! We strive to make sure everyone has a great stay with us.  Thank you and hope to see you soon!

Summary: Went to VidCon with two kids - location was perfect, staff super helpful and nice and everything well taken care of and clean.  Our last day was a nice relaxing day at pool with plenty of chairs and clean towels.  Our favorite was the lobby restaurant - food so good, wait staff so nice and helpful and great deals with free meals for each kid with adult.  Would definitely go back!!
Manager Response: Thank you for staying with us and we are glad you enjoyed your stay with us! Our goal is to make our hotel your home away from home!  Thank you  Mike Thomas

Summary Heading: Older hotel but it served its purpose!
Summary: My boyfriend I did enjoy how friendly and how clean the hotel was. The hotel had better days..but we really liked staying here. I loved the free parking and our view from our room of the main strip to Disney. The hotel was quiet whenever we needed to rest between park outings..which was great. The price was not too much for what we received..Overall, we would stay here again!
Manager Response: Thank you for straying with us and I am happy your enjoyed you visit with us! Please let me know if you need anything during your next visit.  Thank you

Summary: Our room was very spacious and clean.  The bathroom had old grout/caulking that needed to be replaced to make it look more appealing.  My biggest complaint is that most all parking is around back or off to the side.  This wouldn't be a big deal if you could come in the back doors after 9pm but they lock the doors preventing you from using them.  When it's dark and the parking lot isn't very well lit it's unsettling having to walk around to the front of a hotel alone.  There is a reader on the door for room keys but I'm assuming it must be broke.  I asked at the front desk and they told me it was for my safety that they lock the doors at 9pm.  I sure didn't feel safe walking around the parking lot alone at night!  Not to mention if you have luggage or groceries you are bringing

Summary Heading: Hotel not clean but staff was friendly.
Summary: I stayed here from 5/31-6/4/16. The staff was very friendly and checking in was a quick process.  Upon checking in, my credit card was charged for the entire balance of my room without me being informed of that. My company was supposed to pay for the room and I was initially informed that I only needed a credit card for incidentals. It wasn't until after my credit card was swiped and another person in my party was informed of her total that I became aware that authorization from my company hadn't been received and my card was charged for the entire amount at $150 a night. Once my company's authorization was received I was given conflicting information by various staff members when the hold would be released from my personal credit card. The last person telling me that once the

A little disappointed as the only friendly staff were the cleaners and the bell boy the frond desk were quite rude and weren't as helpful as we would of thought they should have been As we have been travelling around America for a couple weeks and other staff were quite nice. The location is great and the room was good for sleeping so was happy with that.

Room Pros: -	Average room, medium comfortable bed  -	Clean Room Cons: -	Toilet in the bathroom ran every 15 minutes, that’s every 15 minutes, the entire 2 day stay -	Water pressure was a trickle -	Water in the shower went from hot to cold to hot to cold during showers. All hours of the day/night and NOT when using the water in the room.  -	Supposed WiFI but doesn’t work in room.   Hotel Pros: -	People at the desk were really nice. Hotel Cons: -	None

Summary Heading: Good option for a quick trip to Disneyland
Summary: Although I've been to Disneyland many times, this was my first time staying at the Clarion. The hotel itself was fine. The lobby was pleasant and the room was in good shape. It was a suite, a little larger than a standard hotel room, with two beds and a sofa bed. The location is good. It's about a 1/2 mile walk to the Disneyland entrance. If you don't want to walk that far, you have two other options. You can walk across the street to the Disneyland Toy Story parking lot and take the shuttle to the entrance. You can also ride the transit bus, which picks up along convention way. There is a ticket machine across from the hotel in front of the Hilton, with all day passes available. The wifi worked fine for us and was free.  The two things I didn't like we're the parking fees ($14

I Enjoyed My 4 Days Stay, My Room was Nice and Clean, I had No Problems at All, Bed was So Confortable I Highly recommend this hotel, I Enjoyed The Walk to Disneyland it was 10 minutes to Arrive and 10 minutes Back to the hotel, They do have a Shuttle bus that takes you to Disneyland and Back to the Hotel to those that don't like walking, I enjoy Dinning in the hotel, really good food, I will come back to this hotel Again.

We stayed here for one night because we drove in earlier than expected for our planned hotel stay somewhere else. After reading the reviews I was a little hesitant about the condition of the hotel. However, once going inside to the lobby, it was clean and the staff at the front desk were friendly.  We reserved the suite-city view, because we had our 3 kids with us. There were 2 double beds and a pull out sofa, so there was plenty of room for everyone. The room was clean and spacious. I did notice a little bit of wear and tear in the bathroom, but nothing terrible.  The breakfast in the morning was great. It was not continental, but kids ate free, so it still was a money saver. Honestly, if you are planning a trip to Disneyland or close to the Anaheim area and are on a budget I
Manager Response: Thank you for staying with us! I am glad you enjoyed your stay and we hope to see you again!  Mike Thomas

Summary Heading: Unhelpful staff, dirty room, loud refrigerator
Summary: My best friend and I made a last minute trip to Disneyland as a celebration for her getting a new job and me selling my house. We stayed at the Clarion because it was cheap and seemed to have mostly okay reviews. So, the truth is that the good reviews are probably either people who have only ever stayed in dumps or have zero expectations about a hotel they're paying over $100 per night for, because the bad reviews are the truth. The refrigerator in our room was clearly broken and would come on every two minutes making an awful noise. I mentioned this to the staff less than an hour after we checked in and nothing was ever done about it. We didn't even use it so they could have just taken it out of the room for heaven's sake! The cups were very clearly not clean and there was a
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to complete our online survey regarding your recent stay at our hotel.   On behalf of our entire team, I would like to apologize for failing to exceed your expectations. Your satisfaction is important to us and we will be using the feedback you provided to make improvements to ensure we offer an exceptional experience for our guests in the future.  I hope that you will consider staying with us again so that we can have another chance to provide you with a superior experience.   Thank You,  Mike Thomas

Summary: I love this hotel, I stay there alot on business. The staff is always cheerful and very helpful. The food is alway top notch. Rooms clean and comfortable. However; the wifi BLOWS! They have multiple wifi channels, none would connect. I would love to see this issue fixed because, I really love staying tgere.
Manager Response: Thank you for staying with us and would like you to know that we are updating g our wifi in June 2016! We hope you can come back and see the fast speed of the internet .  Mike Thomas General Manager

Summary: We stayed at the Clarion through a travel agent for a pre cruise stay. The room was clean and comfortable. The only down fall was the hotel bar was closed and it was a long walk to find a beer. If you are planning to go to Disneyland it is a short walk from the hotel.

Checked in and I knew I should have been concerned when I was waiting for the elevator and a large dog got out with his owner.  Now don't get me wrong, I love dogs and own a lab who does not travel with us unless we are staying in a private residence.    I was staying in this hotel for a convention (one of the largest in the area, thus hotels are at a premium and also trying to save some money).    My room looked ok except NO sheers on the windows and I was on the third floor and looked out at Convention Way where people walk by all day long, NO natural light for my room.  I woke the next morning to looking at a dirty sock under the second bed, then went to plug in my iron and there was dried food next to the plug outlet.  Looking at the ceiling there was black (looked like

I wouldn't recommend this hotel unless you are looking for a cheap place to stay.  We were there on a package holiday and we used 4 rooms all facing the street on the 3rd floor.  In every room the patio door didn't sit properly in it's frame so we could hear street noise all night long, the beds squeaked every time you moved, the bathroom doors squeaked and often wouldn't close properly and in at least one of the rooms there was mold in the bathroom.  The pool was fine but we noticed the same empty case of beer sitting by the garbage for the first 3 days.  All in all it was not a very restful stay.

Not much bad to say. Its dated (popcorn ceilings, yellow bathroom tile) Its 2016! Really? Other than that it has a shuttle you can catch a few feet away to Disneyland. A bit too much walking from the hotel for my taste. $5 and you can shuttle back and forth all day until about midnight. Bed is comfy and there is a fridge. Elevators can be slow. Took the stairs at one point but we were on the 2nd floor. Staff is courteous, accommodated us for another night ( less than $100 bucks...whoo hoo) same room. Walking distance to the beautiful very swanky updated Hilton a few feet away( food court, big bar, more dining/shopping, pretty decor). Might stay again if the price is right. We are still on our Anaheim best hotel adventure being Annual Passholders. Hoping to find a hotel home and

This is a comfortable hotel with all amenities needed.  I wasn't so fussed on the breakfast, but I guess that is a personal thing.  However, after New Orleans and New Jersey, it seemed a little under par.  Otherwise everything was fine.
Manager Response: Thank you for staying with us and glad you enjoyed your stay wit us! We hope you come see the new room we just renovated.  Mike Thomas

Summary: Stayed 21 - 28th April  Used this as a base for touring LA by car so was only there for shower and sleep.  The hotel is old but suits the needs of those just needing a base for time in LA.  The room was sufficient for the 3 of us, and the services were good.  The staff are all helpful and provided good advice when needed.  Great for Disney as the parking lot is over the road.  There are shops, restaraunts and bars within a short walking distance, did not eat at the hotel so cant comment.  Overall good value for our needs

Stayed here this weekend and the room was very dusty there was hair in the Bathtub and on the bathroom floor.The sink outside the bathroom was rusty and just disgusting. The carpet by the window smelled like vomitt. The alarm clock was super dusty and so was behind the tv. There were crumbs on the side of the bed near the wall. When we first got there our ticket for the parking was not working so we asked the valet guy for help he told us he would open it but to ask for a new ticket inside , well when we went to the front desk the lady was very rude and told us that our ticket Is valid until tomorrow . We explained to her that it marked as invalid but she was stubborn and told us no it'll work until tomorrow. All she had to do was give us a new one but instead she just told us

We stayed at the Clarion for 1 night. Our last night of a 10-night school trip with 26 students (New York to Washington to LA)  The accomodation had been organised through an agent so I am not sure of the cost of this hotel. My partner and I had a large room with two large double beds, plenty of sitting space and a good size bathroom. It looked down on the pool and was full of sun in the late afternoon.The bed, linen and pillows were very comfortable, clean and in excellent condition. There was a flat screen TV, tea and coffee facilites, a fridge and toiletries in the bathroom. Generally the room was reasonably maintained but the bathroom could have been far cleaner, with dodgy marks on the bath and lots of hairs on the tiled floor. The hotel was a brisk 15-20min walk to

A great value with great people who strive for excellence. Friendly atmosphere. Manager Sal, along with the rest of the staff, was quick, responsive, generous and very useful to our stay. They gave me free coffee when the restauant was closed THANK YOU

Summary Heading: Tried it twice, Wont be back.
Summary: We chose to stay at the Clarion because it was near the convention center and offered fairly reasonable rates and was within walking distance. However, I see why we got the discount. The room was old, very dirty, especially the bathrooms. Called housekeeping for an extra blanket and towel which were never delivered. The amenities are terrible. I tried this place twice and both times were unpleasant. Never again. Its too bad they can't afford a full remodel as the location was great. Free wifi but terrible connection.

Convenient location, restaurant in hotel, saves money if planning to stay close to Disneyland. Property is aged but they keep maintenance on it. Catering for banquets pretty good. Good room for price, not a spot I'd choose for a romantic getaway or so, but more suited for families. Comfy couches in lobby to hang out.
Manager Response: Thank you for you online review. I am happy that you enjoy your stay with us here in Anaheim and we hope to see you again.

Summary Heading: Pestered by staff due to another guest's unfounded complaint
Summary: I chose to stay at this hotel for its affordability and great reviews, but I was relatively disappointed with my experience.  Firstly, I was accused of smoking in my room (I hadn’t) and the front desk called me twice in less than 5-10 minutes to notify me that there had been complaints twice.  Ok, so I get the fact that there was a complaint, but why do you need to notify me twice in less than 10 minutes that there was supposedly more than one complaint?  Subsequently I had two goons show up from the front desk at my door wanting to enter my room to see if I had indeed been smoking.  One of the two gentlemen took a half step closer to my room from his position outside the door and said immediately, “yea, someone has been smoking in here.” This was a load of crap considering all

The hotel needs a face lift that's all! But that is why it was not as expensive as the other two hotels close by! You can choose to save some money and have a fairly good place to stay or you can pay a lot more! Its restaurant's food is pretty tasty!
Manager Response: Thank you for your time fill out the online and let me know about your stay here at the Clarion Hotel. Yes the hotel is 40 plus year old but have just finished a with a full renovation of the top three floors and re have made lot of improvement over the last three years to the bottom floors. We added grantee to the all rooms, new furniture as well. We keep the hotel updated.  Mike Thomas

Summary Heading: older property, great space, good location
Summary: Great rate for services. Property is a little older, was there for a conference. They have plenty of meeting room/banquet room space and the catering company had tasty food. Their catering staff was extremely pleasant as well. Rooms are good they have a small store that sells souvenir items and toiletries, and also a restaurant on site. They have also have a small arcade for the kids.
Manager Response: Thank you for your review of the Clarion Hotel in Anaheim, yes our hotel is older but we keep it up and the rooms are bigger. We take pride in  providing great customer service for all guest!   Thank you so much for your nice word

Summary Heading: Older hotel within walking distance of convention center.
Summary: The hotel is within walking distance of the convention center, which is exactly what I needed. Older rooms, not clean when we arrived. Dirty towels in the room. Staff was pleasant and always helpful. Comfy beds and air conditioning work well.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking time to review my hotel, I am sorry your room didn't have clean towels when you check in, I will look into see what happen but I am glad that my staff was friendly and helpful

Summary Heading: Rundown, but my room was clean!
Summary: The Clarion has a great location. It is in need of a full remodel, but our room was clean everyday. It is walking distance to the convention center and a CVS Pharmacy to pick up all the things you forgot to pack. The bar and restaurant has terrible service. Our server was very nice, just not enough people working.

The room was small and smelled musty. The mattress was old, uncomfortable, and one of the springs kept hitting my back all night. It was also a long walk to the car with our luggage. Luckily we only stayed one night.

The room rates for this hotel were very reasonable and the location is walking distance to the main gate at Disneyland.  It is also across the street from the Disney parking lot if you need to take the bus into the park.  The rooms were clean.  The restaurant is below average - the breakfast buffet was not worth the price or the wait. The lounge/bar is unacceptable in service, ambiance, and amenities. That being said, I would probably stay here again, because when at Disneyland, you are not in the hotel room for much more than a shower and a good night's sleep - which is what we got.

We stayed here for a cheer competition and trip to Disneyland. The rest of the group was in a hotel that cost twice as much across from the maingate, and we were happy to save some money. Based on reviews, I was worried and pleasantly surprised by this hotel. While not fancy, the room was clean and comfortable. We had 2 double beds (which were super comfy) and a mini-fridge on the 6th floor. The AC worked well and the room was nice and cool.  I love the location because it was close to the convention center for the cheer comp, and it was a short walk across the street to the Toy Story parking lot. We walked in and took the bus free to Disneyland. This was a great way to save money over the ART system.   My only complaint was the bar downstairs. They advertise nightly karaoke.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to tell us about your stay. We are a small hotel and we try and  treat every guest like family! We hope to see you all again next year or for a Disneyland vacation.

Summary: The managers NEED to invest in Internet bandwidth and cellular coverage.  This hotel is still operating in the 20th century. We are living in the 21st century!!!!!!  The Internet is so SLOW.  I will not come here again until they upgrade (100x)!!!

I had family from out of town who wanted to go to Disneyland for 2 days & I booked 2 rooms at this hotel.  I'm a SoCal resident & have an annual pass & this place was just what we needed without having to spend so much elsewhere. We got I think the best rate by calling the hotel directly & getting a discount with our AAA membership. All of the hotel staff were kind, helpful, & friendly from those at the front desk, to staff in their restaurant & bell man.  This hotel is not a close walk to the main gate BUT it's located right across the street from Disneyland's Toy Story parking lot which makes it most convenient. The hotel offers no shuttle to Disneyland (they suggest you take the city bus or something like that) BUT you don't need to because you can literally walk across the
Manager Response: Thank you for staying with us and glad you enjoyed your stay here at the Clarion Hotel. We do not have a shuttle because the ART system runs every 20 minutes to and from Disneyland for only $5.00 per person.

Summary: Took my family and mother in law to the Clarion for our Disneyland trip during spring break of 2015.  Overall this hotel is VERY basic, but it is clean and the staff are really nice and helpful.  Don't expect any of the "Extra's" at this resort, but instead consider it a basic hotel near Disney.  The bus stop to Disney is right out front, and the same stop you can catch a bus to knots berry farm and medieval times.     You can get breakfast in the lobby, and from what I saw some people had it included with their price, but not us.  Was $12.00 for your breakfast.  VERY busy, but a good breakfast.   Pool was nice and not very busy considering what time of year it was.  It is outdoors, so can get chilly in the evenings depending when you travel.    Overall I would prefer something
Manager Response: Thank you for staying with us and your nice comments. We our striving to make sure every guest enjoys there stay here with us.  Thank you

Summary: Stayed at Clarion for 3 nights  ( Room 723). The A/C was not working and neither was the shower. Also it is very difficult for someone to call me at the room. There must be some problem with their reservation database, the front office is not able to locate appropriate individual despite specifying the last name correctly.  They overcharged my credit card and now I have the hassle of calling them up to reverse the charge.  The general ambiance and area of the hotel is good and the staff is friendly.
Manager Response: I am very sorry you had issue with your room. I remember we had some issue with the Front Desk system that week and was with all choice hotels in the USA.   Thank you for staying with us and hope we see you again.

Summary: I stayed there with my daughter and nephew and after reading the reviews I wasn't expecting much. I guess that's the good part because it was no where near as bad as I thought it was going to be. Our room was clean, had a microwave and refrigerator which not all rooms have apparently. Everyday the room was nicely made, so no complaints there. They have a breakfast buffet which for $12.99, kids under 12 eat free, I found that price to be a little high for the quality and quantity of options. However the servers there were the nicest of all the people working at the hotel. They're doing renos and it gets very noisy in the morning, I mentioned this to the manager when leaving and he really seemed like he couldn't care less the noise woke us up at 8am, offering a very unapologetic,
Manager Response: Thank you for staying with us here at the Clarion Hotel in Anaheim, We are pleased with your comments and happy that your stay was a good one and will see you soon!  Thnaks

Summary Heading: Basic needs met but nothing special
Summary: Best part it was close to the convention center for conferencing.  Concerns about cleanliness of the rug on arrival.  Hot water was variable and changed dramatically in short periods of time. Bathroom area with shower and toilet was VERY small.  Walls are thin and you hear others as well as the running water.  Had difficulty accessing the internet on some - but not all - devices.  Appears to have been a weak signal.
Manager Response: Thank you for staying with us and will are upgrading our room in the first half of the year. We hope you come back and see our new rooms!

Summary: We were three people. The room was big and it had two double beds. The vanity sink was outside the bathroom area which was greatly appreciated!  There was always someone in the staff that spoke spanish so it made it a tone easiler to my friends.  The concierge helped us to get shuttle tickets. At first I though it was expensive but as the days went by it was totally worth it! There is a laudry service on the second floor. Its about 6 dollars total (2 for the washing machine- 2 for the drier and 2 for the detergent dispenser)

We rented several rooms and cockroaches were found on 3 of them.  The rooms were not the cleanest either.  Yes it's close to the convention center, but is it worth the extra money the rooms cost I say not.  The parking is also at a cost so they get you there too.  The employees are the only good thing about the hotel.

We wanted to save a little money when going to Disneyland and found a great deal with the Clarion. The rooms are being upgraded and we got to stay in an upgraded one. Was pretty nice. Very large, the bathroom was a little dated, but clean. The beds were very comfortable. They have a buffet style breakfast that is free for kids under 12 if the parents have it too. Wasn't awesome, but did the job. The staff was very nice.   It is right on the ART Line to Disneyland. That was a plus. My only real complaint was having to pay $14.00 per day for parking. I feel like if I am already paying for a room, my parking should be included or discounted at least. But what do you do?

Going by the reviews on here I was worried. But my stay here was the opposite of what everyone else experienced.  We arrived around 9am and were able to check in early (this was great as we had flown from Australia!). Then we get to the room and it's actually nice. spacious (as far as hotel rooms go!), tidy, clean and seems to be updated from the photos on here.  The bathroom is the worst bit - it's in need of a reno but it's still very clean. It's old but the housekeeping keep it spit and span.  It's so close to disney. we did uber a few times - we were so cold and lazy by the end of our stay. it's only about $7 to disney.  Probably wouldn't stay here again but for first trips to Disney, and a cheap hotel this is a great option.

I have waited to do this in hopes that I would feel less angry. I need to do this now so I can let it go.  Not within reasonable walking distance of Disneyland as described.  Poor service in Restaurant. Upon check-out I accidentally left a small Keepsake behind in the room.  Called within 3 hours to have them check for it. Never called me back. I called 3 X's after that, spoke to Housekeeping, never called me back.  I called & spoke to the Manager.  He left a note for the person who cleaned the room to come see him--never called me back.  This item was small enough that he could have given the person my mailing address & just told her to mail it if she had it & be none the wiser so no job lost.  Never happened.  I told them how much it meant to me & they obviously couldn't care

Summary Heading: Would be a "1" review except for the close location to the convention center
Summary: The 2 stars are because the hotel was close to the convention center and was less expensive than the Marriott and the Hilton but I guess you get what you pay for. We think that since the hotel is so close to the convention center they know that they can fill the rooms so they don't really concern themselves with improving the hotel. The room on the south side of the building was heated by the sun, even early in the morning. No amount of air conditioning could cool it. The wifi did not work in the room so we had to sit in the lobby to use it, IF we could find a place to sit. The front doors were constantly opening and because so many smokers were standing outside next to them, the lobby stunk of cigarettes and cigars. The room was pretty run down with peeling wallpaper and worn

Stayed 4 nights during my visit to NAMM and found rooms well kept, clean and reasonably priced. Conveniently closed to Convention Center & Disney World, will definitely stay on my next trip to Anaheim

Summary Heading: Good and clean but showing its age
Summary: Stayed in the Clarion Anaheim for a convention at the Anaheim Convention Center. For that sort of travel the location could not be more convenient. It is also excellent for visits to Disneyland. The hotel is relatively well kept but it is getting a little long in the tooth and showing its age. Nothing specific to complain about. The bedding was clean and the beds were comfortable. The service and desk staff are all very friendly. The personnel are definitely the high point of this hotel. I guess I'd describe it as a good workable utility grade hotel. Warning. Parking is Expensive.

Although the bathroom was a bit small, the room was big enough to sleep all six of us!  Our favorite aspect of this hotel was the full breakfast buffet!  It was a great way to start our day before embarking on our short walk to Disneyland!  We will be back!

This hotel is very average all round. The decor is dated, looks very 90's. The staff weren't the most helpful people I'm world either. I didn't get any help with my luggage even though I was clearly struggling.  The hotel is however in a great location if you are visiting Disney. You can walk there from the hotel in around 10mins. There are also parking facilities on site but be prepared to get your wallet out. $25 per night.  All in all, I wouldn't really recommend this hotel but it is OK and nothing more.

Hotel was booked for us by our daughter's friend, so we could watch both of them on the Star Wars half marathon. This was a good choice for a hotel, as it was easy to find with many attractions and restaurants around it. We live 155 miles away. The hotel was clean and the room, fragrant and quiet. Hotel staff was professional and friendly, with special mention of Ichel, who helped us on checkout.

Summary Heading: Outdated and worn but very clean
Summary: Yes the hotel is old and outdated but the rooms were very clean The hotel is right across from the toy story parking lot and very convenient if you can get a great price for this hotel I would definitely do it again. The lobby is very nice the staff is excellent with the customer service. Our rooms were clean but very worn especially the bathrooms

Summary Heading: Good convenient hotel for Disneyland lovers
Summary: We stayed here to experience Disneyland's New Year's Eve celebrations.  The hotel is walking distance to Disneyland - though we didn't walk as we took the ART buses everyday. It's conveniently located, close enough to restaurants (ihop, coco's, denny's, mortons, etc) and pharmacy (CVS).   The staff is friendly and accommodating; we even bought the SoCal tickets here.  But the breakfast is not included in the price, so we went out each morning for breakfast outside - we didn't think the hotel's restaurant is good enough.   The room is a bit outdated though, the overall appeal isn't there. We were hoping for something a bit better, but I guess you get what you pay for.  The wifi is also quite bad. Were it not for friendly staff, we may not come back again.  I'd still recommend

We stayed at the Clarion just before Christmas and getting home was a nightmare as many flights were canceled.  we happened to leave one day early but found out our flight was cancelled. We called the clarion to get our hotel room back, got it and then cancelled it again when another flight became available.  That one got cancelled too and when we called back, they gave us back our room, no charge.  It made all the difference during a very stressful time with my 10 year old in tow.  They were sympathetic and assured us they would help as much as they were able.  Thank you Clarion!

This hotel was good rooms on the older side but I think they are refurbishing them at the moment. Staff here where one of the best hotel staff I have seen would happily stay here again. Rooms are always cleaned and only bad point was having to pay $1.50 a day for the safe

Summary Heading: Perfect budget accommodation for Disneyland adventures
Summary: We had booked through Booking.com and found our room to be very accommodating with WiFi and King bed.  Whilst parking is $14/night, the car is safe and easily left to meander up the boulevard 5mins to Disnyland.

Summary Heading: The Trip very awesome and we love to stay at Anaheim Clarion Hotel.
Summary: Our Families love to stay at Anaheim Clarion Hotel, because very convenient. All difference kind restaurants around the Hotel. Transportation to Disneyland parks are very convenient either take a Taxi or city Bus only couple minutes. We like Clarion Hotel, because very clean, good restaurant and good services.

Not a bad hotel and pretty close to Disneyland where I our main destination was. The breakfast was quite standard and tasty. The room was tidy and spacious. However I had a feeling that the servers at the reception were annoyed by our requests. But this has not been only this hotel feature during our two week stay in California.

Stayed over Christmas and New Years with the family. about 15 minute walk from Disneyland. Close to the freeway to get around and see the sights. We had a rental car and took day trips to the La Brea Tar Pits and driving around hollywood and LA, hiking near the hollywood hills, shopping at the Outlets at Orange, and took the boys scootering for a day. enough away from the parks to avoid the crowds but close enough to walk to and from for our four day passes. Used the fridge, microwave and coffee machine all the time. Bought food and water at Target only a block or two away. Laundry facilities were fabulous to have in the hotel as well. Not your top of the line place to stay but comfortable and lots of room in our corner suite for 5 people.

Summary Heading: Good Value for the Location Compared to Neighboring Hotels
Summary: Spent four nights here during the annual VidCon event at the Convention Center.  In the past two years, I've stayed at the other two hotels immediately adjacent to the Convention Center, I would rank this one third place out of the three; however, the Clarion was the least expensive and the location is (almost) just as good if you are going to be attending an event for an extended period of time.  Room was neat and clean, free Wi-Fi, refrigerator which is great since we were there for 4 days, flat-screen, and other standard amenities.  Had to pay for parking which is not unusual.  The only interaction with staff was when I tried to alert them that one of the doors in the stairwell doesn't open but he didn't seem to care much.  Overall, if it wasn't next to the Convention Center

Summary Heading: Close enough to Disneyland for our purpose.
Summary: We visited this hotel as part of our 5-day vacation package to Disneyland. Location was a plus; 15 minute brisk walk to gates of Disney. Staff was friendly and helpful.  Hotel is in desperate need of an upgrade! Lobby is misleading- modern, friendly and inviting. Rooms are old and tired. Carpets need to be cleaned and stretched. Better yet, replaced. Bathrooms should be completely upgraded from top to bottom. No humidity fans in the bathrooms, either. Toilets did not flush well. We used the toilets in the lobby often. And they were not always very clean or always functioning, either.  Fire alarm went off during day three in the middle of the day. Kids will be kids but the alarm was hard to hear from the room. Yikes! Breakfast buffet was nice; wait staff was friendly and helpful.

We spent three nights at the Clarion. The desk staff was very friendly, even going so far as to change our rooms without us asking simply because of our interest in seeing Disney's fireworks. I loved that!  (By the way, there's a fabulous view from the 9th floor!)  At the front desk, I asked about setting up shuttle service to the airport for our final day. The staff told me that that could be done for us at the help desk. But in three days, we never saw anyone *at* the help desk. I ended up calling my husband back home and asking him to take care of it.  The rooms definitely are in need of upgrading, as is, unfortunately, the cleaning staff. We were unlucky enough to find a mystery wad of tissues sitting on the ledge of the tub when we arrived. And then even more unlucky to

Well this hotel was cheap. And normally you get what you pay for   The staff really friendly but that is where the good part ends   Got up in the morning to rubbish in our bathroom basin. Back up from the pipes had come up to the sink.  Talk about health hazard .   Very old hotel in need of refurbished. Restaurant is limited and not very good. Quality of food is very poor

As our flight was arriving very early on 26/12/15, I booked our accommodation to commence from 25/12 so we could access our room immediately. I put a note on the booking asking them to confirm that they were aware we were not arriving until 26/12. It took 4 emails over 2 months before they responded.   On arrival, the staff were very helpful however seem confused as to why we weren't there the day before. We were allocated room 732 and at first glance the room was very dated and tired but clean and tidy. On closer inspection, the cleaning staff should be trained to move furniture to clean behind and underneath because it was awful.   The WIFI was free but kept dropping out, it was so bad I couldn't even sync photos from my camera to the iPad. We couldn't even make a FaceTime

Just returned from 4 nights at The Clarion Hotel. As we were barely there, it was adequate. Beds were comfortable and our room was fairly quiet. Drapes are a bit worn and bathroom hugely in need of an update. Also found some interesting things in the bathroom, a couple small bugs, a big spindly legged spider and a large false eyelash. No idea where it came from as it showed up on our second day! Water pressure in shower was poor but water was hot. No fan in bathroom so mirror fogged up and had to shower with door open. Air conditioning unit kept cutting in on the second night, woke us up multiple times. Seemed ok the rest of the time. Check in went well, man at front very efficient and polite. Unfortunately he neglected to tell us tickets for the city shuttle to Disneyland had

I know they are upgrading their rooms and we didn't get an upgraded room BUT  it was spacious, clean and adequate .  Staff were VERY friendly and helpful.  Ten minutes or so walk to Disneyland or Art bus stops right outside.. Coffee making in room and a fridge , safe only $1.50 a day.  Would use again.

advertised as 4 star.  do not believe pics on their site.   room 214.  quiet.  bathroom sink filled w/ cracks around drain.   germs galore.  sink did not drain.  stopper did not work.  tub covered in soap scum. did not drain. toilet too low. good for children only.    bedroom  wallpaper peeling.  heater blastted hot  and  cold air w/ no rhyme or reason. carpet stained and worn. safe costs1.50 per day.  old.   had no key. maintenance replaced lock promptly.  free wifi. did not use.    room service prompt. well cooked breakfast.    one cup coffee maker. coffee only drinkable if u like macdonalds.  i drink starbucks.  no tea provided.  pharmacy/mini-mart 4 blocks away.  small fridge in room.too cold. froze food.  could not adjust it.  shuttle arrived every 20 min.  day pass

We stayed here for two nights, based only on its proximity to Disneyland.  It was the off season, so we didn’t bother making reservations for a double room.  When we arrived, the booking price was $30 more in the lobby than it was online.  They wouldn’t make an exception even when we showed them the listing, so we booked the room on our phone from the lobby and then waited until they “received” it.   The room was not terrible, but it certainly wasn’t pleasant.  It ached desperately for renovation; old fixtures, carpets, bed…  There was a room fridge and wall safe though.   There is a shuttle outside that will take you to Disney, but it’s also close enough that you could walk it (in 10-15 minutes).   There’s an onsite café, though, we didn’t bother eating there.  But there is

Had a great stay. Stayed in the suite which was very spacious, with all new and modern necessities. The bed and pillows were very comfortable. The decor was beautiful and modern. The front desk staff welcomed us with smiles and answered questions we had, they were very knowledgeable about the city. We look forward to staying with you again.

Summary Heading: Not too updated, not too fancy, but wonderful staff
Summary: Check in was smooth, the staff asked where we were headed & were helpful with park tickets. The property itself isn't too fancy, and is showing signs of age. However, the room was comfortable with a fridge and coffee maker. There's a safe in the room, you're only charged if you use it & they are very clear about it upon check in. My only housekeeping complaint was for what appeared to be dog hair on my bed, but it was an easy fix. We arrived after the room service had ended & staff was kind enough to give us a handful of late night delivery options. Everyone we met on property was a gem. Special thank you to the front desk & housekeeping staff who found a set of keys we left in the room & held them until we could return, hours after check out.

Hotel is nothing fancy and sort of does what is says on the tin. Visited as its proximity to Disneyland. Only a short 10 minute walk to Disney and there is a paid bus which a lot of people take but if your up for walking do it as its not that long at all. Room was mostly clean and large with two very comfortable beds and pillows. The bathroom was small and also a bit tatty but was working all fine. One morning there was no hot water but out of 10 nights we stayed this only happened once. Tried breakfast but at 12.95 quite expensive compared to other breakfasts in the area. Overall hotel did its job as a base and nothing much more.

Summary Heading: Cheap but poor service and communication with the staff
Summary: We have a small dog and stayed at this hotel because it allowed pets and was inexpensive.  The staff was not helpful.  The rooms are very dated, although they did seem to be renovating the floor we were on.  Our water was cut off with no notification, we asked the front desk when it would be turned back on and did not receive a response.  Ordered room service took an hour and half was suppose to be 30 minutes.  Took them until 430 to clean our room however we asked the maid at 1:30 pm to clean it after returning from an early morning at Disneyland to find it dirty. We asked the front desk at 3:00 pm if the room could be cleaned and again at 4:00 pm.  The shelf in the front was not affixed and looked dangerous we ask them to fix it and they never did.

I stayed here for a last minute, solo Disneyland trip.  I got a really great deal on Expedia and hoped for the best.  Every employee I encountered was amazing!  They were all so friendly and helpful.  My first impression was that it was definitely a budget hotel.  I got a double bed room.  The carpet was worn, the wallpaper was peeling in the bathroom and there was quite a bit of fixing that needed to be done in the bathroom.  It was also very tiny.  The vanity area was separate and that was decent size but the toilet/shower room was so small I had to almost get in the tub to shut the door (and I'm not a large woman).  I ordered a cheeseburger from room service and before I could eat it 3 roaches crawled out from behind the tv.  I immediately called the front desk and upgraded

Summary Heading: Ok with the big advantage of being close to Disney
Summary: Overall this hotel is ok. That being said I will start with what we found that was not good.  Room had insects, including cock roaches. Not a horrible infestation just one or two you could see scamper away.  Hotel is dated but they seem to be in the process of updating some things as they had many containers taking up parking spaces which at times were a premium.  I do not recommend the breakfast buffet unless included with your room. We went down once and for $12.95 each it was woefully short on substance and quality. You have a Denny's around the corner in easy walking distance and that is good. I also do not recommend the IHOP either as it was not up to the usual quality.  Make sure when you book to check your deal as it could cost you $14/night for parking and if only going

We stayed at the clarion hotel after our cruise it was a hotel that was included in the package.we tried to get a different hotel but everything was booked up as there was the a avengers marathon going on over the weekend of November. 14 an 15. We talked to someone who said it was about 70 thousand people running in it. Busy busy. We upgraded to a suite on the 8th floor looking toward the Disney park the rooms are gettin tired and could use some renovating. We had asked for a queen bed or king but got two uncomfortable double beds.  They have a restaurant and a bar that has karaoke everynight and a happy hour. We had their buffet breakfast costs around 12 each kids under 12 eat free. They also have items on the menu.Did not eat dinner there so cannot comment on the dinner. The

I booked this hotel through Expedia in a combination package with my airfare. It is about 1.5 miles to Disneyland but a nice walk down Harbor Drive.  There are several restaurants close by and a 7/11 and CVS within a block for other supplies.  I found the room comfortable and clean. I left the window open for air since I don't like the A/C running and could hear the fireworks from Disneyland . Some might find that unsettling but I found it enjoyable. The front desk was helpful with a map of the area and guest services helped with my airport shuttle reservations. I would stay there again. WiFi was okay but kept kicking me off.

Well the place looks a bit on the older side. The a/c in the room never got cold and was noisy. The toilet ran all night and day.  The ice machine on my floor did not work. Staff was friendly and the place was quiet for the most part. Close to Disney. If you get a good enough deal it should meet expectations.

Booked this hotel thru British Airways , look it's not a high class hotel but good value for money and 10 min walk to Disney and staff are really friendly , the Decor could do with a bit updating to be honest as a bit dated but rooms were very clean and so was day to day cleaning of the rooms , would stay again , after all it's just somewhere nice to rest you head at the end of the day , never used return to so can't comment on that

Ok, the hotel needs a little renovation, the shower is a little weak (and goes from either sub arctic temperatures, to melting the skin off your face in 0.5 secs), but the people who work there are wonderful, and the hotels closeness to Disney, restaurants and the convention center is perfect. If you are one of those people who want to sit in your room, order room service and watch TV, then don't book here. The rooms are small, and there is no microwave (there is a full size fridge though), but if you are using this hotel as a base for Disney and/or convention fun, I can highly recommend it. They have FREE and strong wifi, the parking was cheap ($5 a night) and it's an easy walk to everywhere!

Summary Heading: Good budget hotel for a Disney Trip!
Summary: My friend and I booked this hotel for our Disneyland adventure back in September of 2014. We had just graduated university and didn't have a load of money to spend on the trip, so we looked for more budget friendly or "good neighbour" hotels. This hotel was average, nothing overly special about the rooms, but it had everything we needed. We asked for a room with a fridge and microwave so that we could buy some food to keep in the room and keep costs down in the park. The room was always clean, and was spacious enough for the two of us. The air conditioner was great to have, too! The biggest "pro" with this hotel is location. Its only four blocks from Disneyland Park, about four blocks from a Super Target, which was great when we needed groceries, and close to lots of restaurants

Summary Heading: Never would I recommend this hotel
Summary: We booked through Westjet, upon arrival the front desk staff was not helpful. We were given our keys went to our room, the bathrooms were filthy, carpets stained and the beds were so old. I went back to the desk and asked for an updated room, all they asked was "did you lay on the bed?" Before giving us a new room, only to find out it wasn't any better. We stayed one night and I contacted Westjet first thing the next morning, they were more than helpful and found us a much nicer, cleaner hotel. When we checked out the manager just grabbed our keys, no apology or explanation.

Summary Heading: Pay a little more to stay somewhere else!
Summary: We stayed at the Clarion for our Disney trip. The hotel smelled and felt very dingy (besides the main lobby). The staff were not friendly at all and almost seemed inconvenienced by us asking a question about the shuttle schedule to Disney. It seems like you are saving money with your initial purchase, but you have to pay for parking at the hotel and pay for the shuttle to Disney. You end up paying just as much in added fees for this hotel as you would if you were to stay at a nicer hotel down the road that has free parking and a free shuttle. We regretted staying at this hotel immediately and will not be returning.

Our family of 5 booked a suite to accommodate all of us. We checked in early, but actually walked into our room after midnight, since we were there to go to Disneyland.  Needless to say that our room was infested with ants, including the beds and walls. Towels were dirty with makeup,  carpets were crusty and the walls had brown n red smeared all over. By the time we were able to get another room, 2 hrs had gone by. They moved all 5 of us to a 2 double bed room. They did offered to spray odorless bug spray in our suite (what!?), before we moved but I declined,  afraid that my 5 year old would have a reaction.  So we paid for a suite, n ended up staying in a cramped, dirty room, that by the way, had ants as well. Not as many as the suite, but a lot. Just a complete nightmare.

Summary Heading: Great value for your dollar! Excellent staff, very helpful and friendly !
Summary: Excellent value for the price, our room was clean, although air conditioner was a little noisy, very thing else was great. Really helpful and friendly staff. Walking distance to Disneyland. Nice clean pool and workout room. Would recommend this hotel to family headed to Disneyland.

Summary Heading: A reasonable place to stay by Disneyland
Summary: We stayed for three nights this past week.  It is a 15 minute easy walk to Disneyland, with the opportunity to pick up supplies at several stores along the way, so very convenient.  The staff was very nice, helpful.  A few reviews we read before our trip commented on the age of the hotel, which compared to the other hotels in the Convention Center is older.  However, the beds are comfortable, clean fresh smelling bedding and towels, nice pool area.  We were there in the middle of the blistering heat wave and the A/C in our room was great and kept us not only comfortable but chilly the way my husband likes!  Overall, I have to say it's a great find for families trying to keep costs under control.  I would stay again.

Summary Heading: It's A Good Thing We Were Hardly In Our Hotel Room...
Summary: Wow. This hotel REALLY needs to be renovated. Our room was pretty old and worn out. (wrinkled carpet, wall paper coming off walls, rust in tub, etc.) The breakfast was pretty good and the main floor was nice. Good customer service and for the most part clean. Definitely take advantage of the shuttle to Disneyland. It's a pretty far walk from the hotel, especially after being at the park for 12+ hours. Would  I stay here again when we come back to Disneyland? No. Would I recommend to a friend? Not likely.

Summary Heading: In need of a lot of renovations.
Summary: We stayed here for a convention at the Anaheim Convention Center because of the location and on that point, it was very good.  Unfortunately, that was the only high point of the stay.  The evening of check in, there was not enough parking in the registration area, only 3-5 spots and as we were not leaving our car at the hotel, we had to circle the block several times for something to open.  The desk staf was pleasant, but did not seem overly concerned with the guests checking in.  Again, there was a large convention, so I'm sure it had already been a very long day for them at that point.   After waiting through the line at check in, I made my way up to the room only to find the key I was given did not work.  I went back down to the front desk, waited again, and was told the key

This is an older hotel, but has very spacious rooms with great views. Very comfortable to accomodate families. I stayed on 12th floor, facing NW, so I did not see Disney fireworks, but has nice city view, and room vas very quiet.  Staff at this hotel is very freindly, and everyone you encounter - will great you with a smile. Hotel located just a short walk to newer CVS, where you can get things most CVS do not care, and even food, such as salads, sandviches, different fruit bowls etc. I bought some for breakfast. Hotel has a restaurant, where you can have a buffet breakfast as well. I did had some issue, but it was resolved with management, therfore I give them 4 stars.I do recommend this hotel, since you will enjoy staying there and you will be taking care of, and all your

Stayed @ the hotel with my family of 6. This was indeed a blast to the past...think Vegas hotels in the hey day of the Rat Pack minus the smoking & casinos. Rooms are very large inc. the standard rooms. We were upgraded to a suite that featured an additional seating area & balcony. The pool was great for the kids although this being advertised as a resort should have included a spa/jacuzzi. Nonetheless, it is perfectly located in the center of all the resorts next to the convention center & all eating & entertainment venues are in walking distance inc. Disneyland. At night, it was like walking the strip in Las Vegas.... tons of people, lots of sights n sounds, plenty to do. The only downside was breakfast & parking. Adults have to pay but kids are free. Parking is crazy at

Summary Heading: Not good for business, probably OK for tourists.
Summary: Stayed four nights for a conference at the Convention Center. I was really surprised at how business "unfriendly" this property is for being less than a block from the convention center. The rooms are clean, and the security seems acceptable, but.......The alleged "high speed" internet is dial-up slow, and really makes being productive a pain, even after trying several different routers.   This hotel has also gone the way of the airlines, charging a premium for everything, including the in-room safe. There are nothing but black out drapes, so when the afternoon sun comes blaring in the window, there are two choices; roast in the sun, or sit in the dark (notwithstanding the lamps). Would it have hurt to add some sheers? The AC unit ran constantly no matter what the

Not Recommended.  This is a 1 star hotel, not 3 star.  The first room we got had bugs in it and the bathroom door didn't shut properly.  The second room, which was supposedly their upgraded suite, had a couch that looked like it was brought in from the garbage dump. It was covered in stains and ripped. The toilet made this horrible screeching noise for about 2 minutes after you flushed it. They say they have free wifi, but it doesn't work at all.

Another late arrival so was only twin beds left could of changed room to king bed in morning but didn't worry. Very old motel stayed in room 435 had balcony overlooking pool area, normal size room, very small bathroom, separate vanity  also small very out-dated but clean, beds good, free wi-fi,fridge,air con was good. Could use safe for $1.50 a day bit strange only in the U.S. Buffet breakfast was standard.15 min walk to Disneyland. Staff were friendly. Had dinner there food was fine beer good.

In fairness, I didn't pick the Clarion; I was sent there when the Anaheim Marriott (one star) was overbooked even though I had a guaranteed reservation.  The Clarion really needs a makeover; it looks old, the carpet needs to be replaced (there was a burn mark the shape of an iron in the middle of the carpet in my room); the bathroom fixtures are hard to operate and the individual AC unit was so noisy I decided it was better to just let the room get warm over night.  However, the staff was very friendly and welcoming, and tried hard to please, which was a refreshing change from the stiffs at the Marriott.  If Clarion would just invest some cash in the physical plant, they would have a winning combination.

We were here to attend a convention held at the Marriott but wanted to stay someplace less expensive. The Clarion gave us a great rate, plus when we got there Charles at the front desk let us check in super early and gave us a larger room. It's a 2 minute walk to the Marriott. The room was clean and the beds comfortable. Would definitely stay here again. Outdoor pool was very nice and the pool towels were actually large enough to dry off with! No free breakfast but at this price I've no complaints!

Reserved hotel for night prior to our arrival to enable us immediate access to our room. Hotel let room even though it was reserved and paid for by us. What hotel does this.. Morning staff unapolagetic.  Room clean and comfortable, walking distance to Disney. Restaurant and wait staff all friendly and helpful

Was half the price of alternatives in this location. It's aged but fair. Everything was fine except the fold out bed had bed bugs. The hotel swapped rooms with no questions asked. The new room was good though the air conditioner a bit loud when it kicked in. From the new room - number 938 we could see the fireworks at Disneyland every night.  Try to get a room on a high level and an even number for best views. You can walk the Disneyland precinct even without buying a Disneyland ticket. Outlet shops and Knotts berry farm are also a short drive away.  Try to get the top level ( 9) and an even number room
