Older style hotel with a little dated rooms, but still very comfortable. We stayed for 2 nights. Very close and easy access to Disneyland and Anaheims main restaurant district. We also went to a Angels baseball game which was also easy to get to and from.

This is the third time we have stayed with the Clarion hotel and each time the experience is just as wonderful.  The rooms are very clean and fresh.  I don't feel the slightest ambivalence about sleeping on these sheets or pillows.  The towels are bright white and smell fresh.  The comparison I made several months back regarding a location I stayed in which was the same cost but not even close to the same quality, still baffles me.  It's not that difficult to make a hotel comfortable and inviting.  The first night, we discovered our fan was not working properly nor was our cable.  We were tired from our drive so we addressed it the next morning.  The reception staff indicated they would change our room immediately and upgrade us to a suite for our trouble.  We hadn't expected

Summary Heading: Very dated, but super inexpensive and got all the amenities.
Summary: The hotel is VERY central, right next to Ketella Avenue so it is literally within walking distance to all of the restaurants and shops by Disney.  It is also SUPER cheap; cheaper than motels around in the same area.  It has a pool, but the rooms are VERY dated.  However, it gets the job done at a fantastic price.  I will definitely stay here again.

Rooms were large and they had a balcony. The hotel needed updating but the prices were more than fair. Needed 2 rooms so prices on this hotel were important. Staff was professional and helpful. There is a Disney shuttle right across the street.  Restaurant was always closed when we were at the hotel.

I was somewhat nervous to stay at this hotel after reading some of the reviews.  We booked through a tour company and did not pay for the travel protection plan, so we could not change to a different hotel without paying a penalty.  My husband and I decided to just make the best of our situation.  When we arrived at the hotel, our room was not ready so we checked our luggage and headed to the parks.  We got back to the hotel about 10:30 and checked into our room.  I must say that we were pleasantly surprised.  The hotel is older and could use some updating, but it was not as bad as some of the reviews stated.  Our room was big and comfortable.  The bed and pillows were fine.  The shower worked and had hot water and good water pressure.  The staff was very friendly and our room

This hotel is great for a "budget" as the location is quite a walk to Disneyland, especially after a long day you just want to get home. The wifi is very poor as I needed to go downstairs into the lobby and use.  If you are wanting something not luxurious and just a "bed" this is great!

Summary Heading: Good hotel..... Great hotel for the price.
Summary: Don't be put off by the reviews saying bad things.  I found this hotel to be quite good. Comfy beds, clean big room.  You can whinge about the wall paper or little useless things but really at the end of the day you need to look at what you really care about in a hotel...  Good service, safe and clean.... The Clarion meets all these.  Only bad thing about the hotel was the wifi was pretty rubbish.

First we took about 30 minutes do to our check-in, I've never had such a waiting time to do that! They charge if you use the safe, which is a very simple box!  No ice machine!  Carpets very dirty and degusting!  The matresses are old and horrible! Better to sleep on the floor! On our second day after a long and tiring day on the park we arrived and the room was exactly on the same way we left on the morning: no cleaning service, no fresh towels!!  If you arr looking for a place to sleep and rest after your park experience forget this place!

From reading some of the other reviews about this hotel, l was pretty nervous when my boyfriend & l booked our stay here this past August. However, we honestly enjoyed our stay at the Clarion Anaheim! Yes, the hotel may be "outdated", but honestly, the customer service we had made us feel so special. The staff was absolutely amazing & l loved how every time we came back from our outings, they would all welcome us with smiles and "welcome backs."  Our room was awesome. We booked a corner suite w/ king size bed on the 8th floor. Our view was pretty good and we had no issues at all regarding the furniture and utilities. For me honestly, as long as l feel comfortable and at home, then l'll be more than fine!  The location is great; only 10-15 minute walk to Disneyland. The

This hotel is clean and customer service was good.  It's walking distance to the parks and Downtown Disney.  We spent most of our time away from the hotel but when we did make use of the beds they were very comfortable! The room we had was spacious and quiet with a great view of the Crystal Palace!

This hotel is ok the bathrooms needs updating as my plug never worked in the bath and they were rather dated.  The actual hotel is nice clean and tidy and the pool was good the staff are amazing and do anything to help you.

Summary Heading: Reasonable priced suites with bus stop right outside the hotel for Disney.
Summary: Cons: Older hotel so don't be expecting it to be renovated. Bathrooms were small and water pressure wasn't the best. Toilets needing a new stopper. Beds weren't the most comfortable, too soft in my opinion. Other than that, I was happy.   Booked the hotel a few months back for my Disney 1/2 marathon just because of location and price. Nice valet and concierge staff. Overnight parking is $14 with in/out privileges, and you get a strange looking chip key for your room. Surprisingly, I was given a top floor suite with 2 double beds, pullout couch, mini fridge, microwave and a coffee maker. Ended up inviting friends to stay the night just because there was so much space. Morton's is just across the street from the hotel or one could try eating at the hotel restaurant. I ended up

First off,don't rely on all the negative reviews on this hotel because every visit is different. I was expecting the worst when I checked in based on the reviews I read on here but to say they were wrong was an understatement. We took an early flight and arrived at the hotel sharply at 11am using the Grey line disneyland express from John wayne Airport and it dropped us off in front of the hotel, on Tuesday September 1st.The lobby was clean and felt really grandiose.Charles at the front desk greeted us very kindly and promptly checked our reservation and told us our room was all ready to go!! We had a suite on the 9th floor facing the parks with a perfect view of the fireworks! When we walked into the room we couldn't believe how nice it was!  2 double beds (snug sleeping but we

I have nothing good to say about this Hotel. The ceiling tiles are falling down we had to share the elevator with the maids and maintenance. It was a bit crowded. The walk to Disneyland was far and the ART never showed up. When asked to extend our stay for another night (our grandchildren was ill) the hotel wanted to charge double the rate. We ask for and never received a roll away bed. Upon check out was charged for it. We only were given 2 towels. We went to the Candy Cane for the additional night. After telling them of our experience at the Clarion they had cookies waiting in our room. I was told that another couple just arrived from the Clarion too.

Summary Heading: Great place to stay - steps away from Anaheim Convention Center
Summary: My son and I stayed here while attending an Expo at the Anaheim Convention Center - we were steps away from the   doors  - which was great!  Also in close proximity to Downtown Disney restaurants and Disneyland/California Adventure.  The room was spacious - perfect for the two of us.  The bathroom was a tad small, but gave us plenty of towels.  Swimming pool area was nice and clean.  The only downside was no free breakfast - but we did have a fridge.  Several convenience store are also nearby to purchase snacks and water/drinks.  Front desk staff was courteous and quick on checkin and check out.  Overall, a good experience.  Would stay here again for the price and location!

Summary Heading: My Son's Wedding Block of Rooms and Rehearsal Dinner
Summary: My son Tyler was married this past Saturday. We talked to Naomi Bennett and Mitzi to get a block of rooms for their out of town guests (including me)  And also planned the rehearsal dinner in one of their banquet rooms.  This was the easiest hotel to work with!  Being from the Hospitality industry myself I am aware of how things should be and when something is just wrong.  This hotel Clarion Hotel Anaheim Resort was AWESOME!!  It is an older hotel but if you are looking for a clean hotel with reasonable rates and a overly friendly staff this is the hotel you want to stay at when in Anaheim!  The staff at the front desk was so accommodating and welcomed us with great big smiles and so helpful with everything and we were asking a lot of questions!!  Big shout out to Sal he is a

I consider myself pretty flexible, so I booked this hotel even after I had read reviews about poor service of the staff and thought that it was only some consumers being over sensitive. I understand the proximity to Disneyland (1.1 miles about 20 min. walk) but this hotel is way over priced for the condition of it. It needs to be remodeled and cleaned. There was mold in the bathroom walls and ceiling, the beds were very small while advertised as queen size. We had to give a good scrub to the tub to give the baby a bath. My daughter put the baby’s cereal on top of the refrigerator only to find it covered with roaches the next morning. There were roaches all over the wall behind the refrigerator. We talked to the front desk staff about having this problem in the room, but they

Summary Heading: Okay Hotel- wouldn't pay more than $100US a night
Summary: This is an old hotel in need of a makeover BUT it is great for the price we paid. ($70US a night). The room was huge and clean, bathroom tiny and shower awful but did the trick. Front desk staff were helpful except house keeping were rude and didn't speak English. DisneyLand was close and bus service was good. Restaurant and room service shut at 10pm- a bit strange when most visitors are coming back from Disney Land even later.

It was about a 10-15 min walk to Disneyland which isnt bad,but you also have the option to walk across the street from the hotel to the toy story parking lot.  The buses/shuttles  are free and drop you off right on front at Disneyland.  The hotel itself was a little outdated  but location was great staff was amazing had a very pleasant stay. The Beds were very comfy rooms were a good size.

I had put a lot of thought into where we were going to stay after visiting Disneyland for the day, Wednesday 8/12 after flying in from Las Vegas that morning.  Being from So. Cal. originally, I knew the traffic patterns during the workweek, so the dilemma was driving to the South Bay tired that night or refreshed the next morning, but having to battle westbound traffic.  I chose poorly, choosing to stay close to the park. I had prepaid for the flights and room, so imagine my surprise when the desk clerk asked for a card to charge me $24 for "Incidentals". There was no room service, mini bar, or anything else to comprise anything "incidental". I was informed that we might have a dog or be smokers and would be credited at check out. I guess we checked out on the surveillance

Walpaper peeling off the walls in the bathroom.  Tile in the bathroom was a mess.   Stepped in the the elevator and the floors were wet from the lady cleaning the floor and there was so much water someone could fall and get hurt.   Was t the Disneyland D23 and i'm surprised this place still is in business.  Warning to do stay in this hotel.

Do not stay here! this is by far the worse hotel i have stayed at. Hotel is run down! Carpets super dirty with stains. Curtains on windows and shower were all ragged. My room had holes on the walls that looked like bullet holes. Elevators are the worse i was on the 5th floor and pretty much had to wait a good 10 minutes to get on it. No complimentary breakfast and no free shuttle to the park. Eventhough location is within a walking distance to the park its kinda far if you have little ones. Bus service available for $5 per person per day. $14 per day parking! all this adds up to your "affordable" stay. Keys to the room did not work. I seen a review about the $25 per day hold on your credit card. Samething happened to me they not only hold the $25 for the room but also all your

Summary Heading: Awful service and Hotel. Filthy, old, nothing good to say
Summary: We booked our stay at the Clarion for a last minute trip to Disneyland, so the options were few. I have stayed at many locations in the area and I know you really don't get the same quality for a hotel here as you would elsewhere, but our experience at the Clarion tops any bad experience I've had pretty much anywhere.  We were given a suite that was actually roomy, but very off putting because the carpets were all stained in many spots and it was pretty disgusting taking off your shoes. We prepaid two nights & got a good deal (until we found out the $14 a night for parking) the second night when we came back from the park at 1 am our room key didn't work. Went to the front desk and the clerk informed me that my Amex hand't gone thru for the $25 deposit at checking (lie! I have

Horrible horrible Hotel. There are no service elavators so it takes long. We booked our trip 6 months in advance. After driving 15 hours to arrive at check in time we are told we have to wait 2 extra hours until our room is ready. The bar and restaurant did not open until 5pm so we just sat in the lobby watching couple after couple get their room key. We booked 2 rooms and requested them together, but one couple was put on the 8th floor while the other was put on the 5th floor. I would NOT NOT NOT recommend this hotel to anyone.

Summary Heading: Comfy but the place is tired
Summary: I had 4 nights here and was surprised. Close to Disneyland...within a 15min walk. Yes the rooms are dated and need a tidy up but the bed was comfy, the staff had great customer service. I will say the A/C worked well but are old and a bit noisy. Bathroom needs some work but the water pressure was great I never ate in so can't comment on the restaurant....my room was huge and had a view 6th floor...when you travel 13.5hrs to see Disneyland you shouldn't be staying in your room all day....I'd stay again.

I booked through hotwire getting a room for $84 a night. I have to say I don't feel this hotel warrants more than $70 a night. The rooms are tight with double beds, not queens. If you get a pullout sofa don't bother trying to sleep on it as you can feel the springs. The elevators are frequently occupied by maid carts or baggage carts leaving you waiting for the next one sometimes three times over. Maid service was continually around 2pm which interfered with napping midday while taking a break from Disneyland. The pool towels are always gone forcing you to call for more. While located close to Disneyland you will want a bus pass as walking half a mile back to your hotel is crummy after walking the parks all day. I wouldn't stay here again unless it was under $70 during peak

This hotel is within walking distance both the Anaheim Convention Center and Disneyland. Bed was comfortable and I had a huge room, overlooking the pool. The rooms, however and the hotel in general, were not very clean. There's a need to really refurbish the whole place and update a bit. There's a nice little restaurant in the lobby and the gym was small but functional.

Summary Heading: Economic choice for family visit Disney land
Summary: Convenient located, friendly stuff. All rooms are dated, WiFi in room is next to none.  Stuff members are very friendly and willing to help. The room is not as quiet as Marriott  next door, but this one is much cheaper. There is no lobby, but if you need to meet friends, you can always go to Marriott.

Summary Heading: Not Worth The Money or Location
Summary: Last minute change to our trip left us looking for a place to stay on a whim. Called many hotels and this was the only one that had had a cancellation for the night. We were told we were being given the last room, which was probably true since we found it to be the handicapped room upon entering, and it had features we had not seen in other hotels.   First off, we were charged an obnoxious rate for a one night stay , not checking in until 11pm and out at 10:30 the next morning. Then they charge you to use the safe in the room you have already paid for. In addition you then have to pay for parking at the hotel you have already been price gouged at.   The room was clean, but walls were scuffed with black marks horribly. Toilet did not flush and had a sewer smell coming from it.

Pros. Very close to conference center. Restaurant staff friendly and served us quickly knowing we were tired.   Cons definitely dated.  The 9th floor room was ok and our housekeepers were very nice and provided what we needed. Air conditioning did work.

Summary Heading: Stayed 2 nights, had a good stay....
Summary: Room was fine, had breakfast in the restaurant both days, servers got you in and out quickly, yes it's an older property but have no complaints. The hotel has a pool, fitness center and business center also. There is also a small gift shop. Also free wifi is provided. If there is a convention going on parking can be a problem. They do sell Disney Tickets and are right across the street from a main parking lot for Disneyland which is great!!

I recently stayed here and was a little unimpressed. It was far away from disneyland which was a not ideal. All the "extra add ons" that I thought were somewhat necessities costed more! The safe was $1.50 a day and parking was $14 a day! Not to mention the beds were so uncomfortable! My dad complained that he could barely sleep! The cleanliness was average, nothing to write home about though. The towels were stored outside of the bathroom though which I found quite infuriating. After my shower I had to run out of the bathroom naked to grab a fresh towel. Overall I would probably stay here again but I would make sure a grab a fresh towel before my shower;)

The thing about lodging is that you need to understand the market.  Too many people expect a 5 star hotel at a 2 star price.  That may wok in William Shatner's universe, but it never happens in real life.  What is realistic is to expect what you pay for.  All that said, the Clarion Anaheim is a 3 star facility.    Pros:  Near Disneyland and the convention center.  It is relatively inexpensive.  It has decent facilities onsite (restaurant, fitness, pool, store.)  The wifi is free.  Cons:  It is an older property and looks dated.  Our room was two full size beds, not queens.  The power outlets in our room were so old that plugs literally fell out of them under their own weight.  I think the outlets have been in use for decades.  The wifi is slow.  As I said, if you need a bargain

I stayed here a couple of weeks ago for the HOSA Nationals competition. I have to say, I wasn't very impressed with this hotel. The rooms were smelly, and the bathrooms were very dirty. The toilet flooded the first day we stayed there, to the point where the whole bathroom was full of water. The wi-fi didn't work at all. The people at the front were not very nice, in fact they didn't even look inviting or welcoming. The breakfasts should've been free, and the place as a whole was pretty old and seriously needs some love. However, the location of the hotel was very good in a sense that it was situated very conveniently. There was a CVS Pharmacy nearby, Taco Bell, other hotels, Subway, iHop, Starbucks, and most importantly Disneyland. Everything was pretty much walking distance.

I recently stayed at this hotel on a trip to Disneyland for the 60th anniversary. The hotel was basic and had no frills. The parking was very expensive, $14 dollars a day! They also charged to use the safe, $1.50 a day, which is ridiculous! The beds and pillows were extremely uncomfortable and the cleanliness was only average. The extra  towels were stored outside of the bathroom so I had to run naked outside of the bathroom to grab a fresh towel. Overall, it was nothing fancy and I have definitely stayed at better hotels in this area before. I probably won't be back.

Hotel staff at the front desk arr very accomodating, but I do agree on some reviews I read. It needs some love and care and probably more training with the maintenance of the rooms. We checked in and there's some crumbs on the daybed and the table was a little sticky. Looked like the place hasn't been vacuumed coz the floor is dusty and dirty. There's some nuts on the side of the bed. I do hope sometimes they check the people cleaning it just to make sure they know what they're doing. Other than that, place is ok and a walking distance to Disneyland. Pool is ok and complimentary breakfast is ok but all the same. Not the Best Hotel but not that bad either.

Summary Heading: Mold, mildew, dirty and general lack of care
Summary: I took my family for a fun filled 4th of July weekend at Disney and we ended up very ill due to mold allergies. The bathroom had extensive mold under the wallpaper and in the grout in the tub. Both my wife and I have allergies to mold and we became very ill and spent the day in bed sick on the 4th and 5th which ruined our entire weekend.  The carpet was dirty, there was trash behind the night stand and dresser, the chairs had stains on them, the rack in the bathroom was rusty, the lights were covered in dust, the furniture was old and worn, the shower pipe was loose, paint chipping off ceiling and walls, wallpaper peeling off the wall and just in general the room was old, worn and dirty. When I told the supervisor he offered to waive a parking charge. The first floor rooms

Would have been nice for concierge to have told us that we didn't need to spend $14.00 USA to park at Disneyland when the hotel has parking available and it's closer. Concierge was a bit rude on check in.  Room was fine, shower was ordinary. Wifi didn't work in room!!

This hotel is reminiscent of a Holiday Inn, in terms of room layout.  It is very well maintained and in excellent shape.  The staff are very friendly and most helpful.  The restaurant is mediocre at best.  If you are planning a trip to the Clarion, be advised that unless you are driving, transportation will be expensive unless you use public transit.  The public transportation system is great (ART), and runs on a timely schedule.  You can purchase a pass for the day, or for three days and it is very inexpensive.  It is also crowded.  The hotel is located on convention center row so there is not a lot of options for shopping or dining.

Have had an absolutely horrible experience here. Pull out couch is large enough for a child only. Dirt/dust clumps hanging from the textured ceiling, corner of the room by the AC unit is full of dirt, crud and possibly mold. There are no curtains, only blackout blinds, so if you want daylight in your room and you're on the first floor, everyone at the pool can see directly into your room.   Decor hasn't been updated in 15-20/years. Shower tile and grout are cracked and crumbling. AC unit is leaking water onto the carpet in one of our rooms. There are two identical paintings on the wall in the same room.   Front desk staff was rude and disrespectful in addressing room concerns. This is a $50 a night value at the most. The pricing is truly delusional. Will never stay here again,

Hotels are costly when it comes to  Disneyland Resort area We wanted walking distance to Disneyland; we got it  Disappointed in lack of wifi  Called the office Clarion company  Still no results  This hotel is one of the older ones Which you will read on other reviews; however, it is clean If you need anything  Ask your friendly floor maid When we returned each evening Our rooms were well stocked and nicely refreshed Charles is a mainstay at the front desk Extremely professional and patient with any needs/questions guests may have

Booked last minute, and would not stay here again.  Website pictures are not accurate or honest.  You walk into lobby and it's clean and friendly.  But rooms are a huge disappointment.  Dirty dirty carpet, windows were gross, slide door lock broken and handle grossly dirty,  and beds were sub par.  I could not walk barefoot. Had to use towels at floor in sink area and near beds.  Refrig did not work, called front desk and they weren't surprised and sent repair person. It was fixed but why should I have to call. Staff friendly and I felt aware of room conditions.  Other family members with us there A/C did not work and couldn't fix in 100 degree weather. Clarion group should be thankful for this staff and be ashamed of the hotel condition.

Summary Heading: Good service and central to town
Summary: We enjoyed our stay there. Staff were very friendly. The only issue we had was that they turned on the air conditioning to keep the place cool. But unit was refrigerated when we got home.  Bus outside for Disneyland

I don' think they have a bellman because no one helped us when we checked in or out. The desk clerk had to get our luggage out of the car then take it upstairs. We wanted to try the Mexican restaurant but were told it has been closed for 3 years even though it is still advertised online, Checking out was easy but difficult because we kept being told that a bellman would be up, then the wait would be half an hour so we hauled ALL our heavy things downstairs. The parking fee is ransom-like, it is WAY TOO expensive. This hotel is not a good value. The transportation to Disneyland was good though.

Summary Heading: Nice place to stay, close to Disney
Summary: We stayed here for 2 nights on our recent trip.  Although we didn't go to the actual parks, we did walk to Downtown Disney.  This hotel is about a 10 minute walk to DT Disney and both parks.    The hotel is clean. It is a bit older, but it is nicely decorated.  The room we had was good sized for 3 adults and 2 teens. We were on the 6th floor in the front facing Disney so we were able to watch some of the fireworks from our room. During the day our room was nice and bright with lots of sunshine coming in.  The pool looked nice and clean, but due to our schedule, we didn't take advantage of it.  This hotel does NOT offer free breakfast, they do have a restaurant in the lobby with breakfast for $12.99/person but we don't pay that much for breakfast so we just went to McDonalds's

Stay away from the Clarion Anaheim. There was nothing but dissatisfaction throughout our stay of 7 days. We had booked 2 rooms.  Immediately, the door lock jammed open, which someone eventually came to fix. Two days later it broke again, and someone again had to fix it. In both cases, we were trapped in the room for an hour or more since the door would not lock, and we did not want to leave our stuff exposed.  My wife had a specially shaped towel she uses for shampooing, with a color of blue which stood out among the standard white towels the hotel uses. This personal towel was taken away by the maid during room service, never to be seen again.  The rooms were right next to the door to the stairway. Every time someone went through it, it banged. Very annoying in the early

Our sink had feces in the sink!!!!!then they charge us twice for three rooms because they made a mistake!!!! The service is rude!!! No free breakfast!!!! No hot water!!! And then the sink wouldn't drain for a while!!!!! DO NOT STAY THERE!!!!

The hotel is a long 2 blocks away from the Disney gate, and the carpet was worn and stained, but other than that, great deal and good service.  The staff put out lemon water for its guests and we filled up our bottles.  Would recommend for the price which was $80/night plus $14 parking yadayada.

The SO and I are staying at the Clarion in Anaheim for a conference. We've been to other hotels around here before but this time we chose Clarion.   The price of a hundred dollars for two weekdays is really nice!  I'd give this hotel a C+ grade. Nothing too impressive (besides the price) but nothing terrible either.   1.) Cleanliness: I always bring my own disinfectant wipes and clean things like the remotes, switches, ac buttons, handles, counters, etc.,. The only spot that was actually dirty was  only the bathroom counters. When I cleaned the bathroom counters the wipe came away dirty. The bathtub tile had all sorts of blue markings  either from soap or something unknown. The tile floor wasn't clean as it could be. You can see the clean tile under the sink and counter.... The

Summary Heading: Pay the extra $$ to stay somewhere else
Summary: At a recent conference held in Anaheim, I stayed at the Clarion "resort" to save my employer about $50/night.  This place is a dump.  I can handle outdated but this place was over used and under cleaned.  There appeared to be a dried blood stain on the bathroom floor, the tile-tub junction was covered with an extra row of tile to cover the presumably moldy caulk line, the mirror had a similar fix. The sink drained oh so slowly and the curtains were worn to the point of fraying. Parents with young children be aware that electrical and computer cords are jumbled throughout the room. Your children will be fascinated by all those pretty cords.  Staff was pleasant enough, wifi was slowish, wake up call was late. Go to the Mariott or Hilton.

Booked through Hotwire.com - I think that Hotwire grouped this hotel with the wrong family of hotels. It was, however, a great rate.   Pros: Safe, clean (but dingy), excellent location, friendly staff.  Cons: Not at 2.8 star hotel, it was more along the lines of a 2 star motel. The Tiles in the bathroom while clean, were dingy. Cracked molding around tub, rust around toilet bolts.  Outdated wallpaper and in our room the wall mounted lamp had been moved a couple inches, well they didn't bother covering the holes and anchors that were set from the previous mounting. Vending machines were either not working or broken, like viewably cracked.   I guess I would sum it up in saying it felt like being in a fixer upper than a hotel.   Recommendation: are you looking for a place to lay

While yes the hotel is older and dated, the room was clean and the beds were very comfortable. Our room had a balcony and AC that worked really well to keep the room cool.  We arrived early and they held our bags until the room was ready so we could head out and explore for a few hours. When we came back to check in there was a VERY rude group in front of us but the two girls at the front desk handled it very well. This group in the hotel was the only negative about the stay (rude, obnoxious, crass) but nothing the hotel can do about that.  The staff were phenomenal, friendly, always greeted us when we returned in the evening and remembered to ask us about what they knew we were doing that day. The two bell men we spoke with were very knowledgeable and friendly. The front desk

Checked in 10 pm just to sleep for the night and get up in the am, and head back to Hollywood for the day.  This hotel is a hot tub time machine...the rooms are extremely dated, stained..the walls are peach and tan colo, gold and cream colored dresser, popcorn ceilings, green tile in the bathroom with tons of stains and mold.. era 1981.  The beds were small, squeeky and hard as a rock.  Im currently sitting in this room staring at pizza stains (I am telling myself that this is what it is) on the curtains and wearing tennis shoes because the green carpet is full of sticky crap and stains.  YUCK.

Stayed at the Clarion two years ago , and everything was fine. We had a lovely 7th floor room at the front. This year ( April ) our experience was completely different, and we had to change rooms four times ! We thank the staff for being so cooperative , however the Clarion is beginning to show its age. The bathroom area is questionable and the noisy AC system makes a good sleep at night virtually impossible :( We regret that things didn't work out right for us, and we certainly wont be staying here again.

the hotel is a bit older but the staff was friendly. The rooms are big. They come with a fridge and microwave which is very helpful for a family. bring your own snacks and food. the pool area is basic. the fitness room pass on. 2 treadmills one broken. 2 elipticals. the arcade has 5 games. overall for budget friendly hotel this is a great value. it is clean and a good location. the small frys wont care about where they sleep they want Disneyland and mom and dad will like leaving with heavier wallets

I called to make a reservation to book for two days to attend for a convention and spoke with Rick. While he's taking to me I told him about the special package I wanted to avail and he said he will put me on hold for just a seconds. Guess what 25 minutes on hold so I called on my other phone and spoke with with other front desk and I informed them that I'm holding on other line for 25 minutes. And glad Rick answered. I informed him my dissapointments and instead of apologizing he responded like "Im here now so how can I help you?" Thats so rude! Of course I got upset and he said if you dont want to make a reservation then dont because your upset ang he hang up on me! So I called again and he answered and said this is Rick and Im the manager! How in this world Clarion will hire

Summary Heading: Good hotel for visiting Disneyland - just close enough to walk
Summary: The Clarion Hotel has a nice size room, with a large secure in-roomm safe (that they charge you extra for if you use it!), ironing board, iron, large sink area, TV, ref rig and microwave. The rooms are spacious and good for spreading out after a long day at Disneyland.  Beds are a little on the soft side.  Maid service is very good and makes up for the lack of maintenance for many of the fixtures such as the sinks, toilet. etc.  The carpet was pretty clean for being stepped on by the hoards of Disney tourists.  Coffee maker is practically a toy, though.  One cup at a time- when you're rushing out in the morning to get to DLand, this teeny coffee maker doesn't hack it.  (Of course, always bring your own coffee if you want real coffee.)  Overall, I would stay here again.  It's a

Summary Heading: was good overall, friendly helpful staff
Summary: close by and easy access to shopping and Disney resorts. although the hotel's a bit aged we didn't mind at all. so yes it's great value for our money. staff was helpful and good size room. thank you. .

This is the best hotel we stayed at during our whole trip. The rooms are nice, it's a perfect walking distance to Disneyland, the pool is as warm as the bathtub. I highly recommend this hotel for your stay

Great place!  No its not fancy but it absolutely is a great place to stay. Very family friendly. Loved the pool area. The pool was a great size. We didn't pay the $14- parking fee. We are Choice members,  maybe that's why. The front desk we're very professional and friendly!  The ART stopped right in front of the hotel. There is a kiosk in the lobby area to purchase tickets for ART.  Yes we will absolutely stay here again!

Summary Heading: The best hotel near DIsneyland and the Anaheim Convention Center
Summary: I visited this location to attend a conference at the Anaheim Convention Center, however, I am returning with my family to visit Disneyland.    The hotel staff was nothing short than amazing. They were fully attentive to my needs as a convention traveler and ensured my every need.  They were always cheerful, happy and my room was huge with a ton of amenities.  The housekeeping staff was immaculate with in their detail. The bed was one of the most comfortable.  The front office staff was amazing with children and the families visiting Disneyland.  The hotel itself may have been the happiest place on earth.   I also have to give kudos to the General Manager, Mike Thomas who was in the lobby ensuring a personal greeting to every guest.  He welcomed me, followed up with a personal

Took our six year old and ten month old on vacation, stayed four nights **family friendly***, VERY clean room,  phenominal staff and  management, free parking, swimming pool was nice and heated, cafe was delicious and always smelled great!! Room was spacious, fridge, microwave to avoid eating out EVERY meal! Super close to Disney, so didn't take us long to get there for opening.... and you can buy tickets at the lobby, skip the lines and take the monorail from downtown Disney and avoid crowds.   Wonderful stay!

Summary Heading: If your looking for a place to just sleep this is it!
Summary: Upon arriving at the hotel,  the check in process was really easy. We were given these memory card/stick things as keys. Opening the door was loud as when your key was accepted it beeped.  Once in the room, we found the rooms very dated. The bathroom was tiny,  couldn't close the door to the shower/toilet area if you were sitting on the toilet. The shower had pressure but not lots,  the shower also fluctuated if one showers between 7 am and 10 am.  The room itself was alright, the adjoining door let in noise from the crying baby,  loud teenage girls,  and other staying guests in that room. The electrical socket coverings,  yes all of them,  were loose and wobbly. The microwave was very dated and hard to use. My grandma's room telephone,  had sticky numbers and did not work very

The hotel is just a few blocks to Disneyland Park. They offer free parking and also free wifi. My room was spacious and clean and I could see the fireworks from my balcony. The fare is fair for a hotel near Disney.

I did not mean to rate the website as a 1, thought it was about the hotel. Not one, two, but three bathrooms were overflowed with water from the toilet. Last day the third bathroom stopped up. The whole time there were issues with the bathroom. The whole time there the wireless did not work. When one is there for a business convention, internet is pretty important. I will never stay there again. Worst hotel I have ever stayed at.

The location to Disneyland, California Adventure and Downtown Disney was great. We could walk, or take the shuttle directly out the front door. Shuttle passes could be purchased from the vending machine in the lobby area. Front desk agents were cordial and made great suggestions for other tours not Disney related.  We booked through bookit.com and got one breakfast free, so we only paid for 1 breakfast a day since kids ate free. For $8, you can't beat it. They had everything you could ask for breakfast wise, and all the servers were prompt and polite.  The rooms are dated, but clean and have everything you need - even a fridge and microwave!  For the price, you can't beat it!

This hotel is definitely convenient to the parks.  About a 7-10 minute walk, or the Toy Story parking lot is directly across the street with a free shuttle.  This hotel was clean and comfortable!  Yes, it's dated, but we knew we didn't pay for luxury.  One night was unfortunately noisy as a school trip arrived at 9:30 with 3 bus loads of teenagers.  The staff was fantastic and so friendly!  The cafe by the lobby was also great!  With an adult ordering a continental breakfast (toast, fruit, coffee and juice), a kid ate free!  The waiters, Jamie and Jesus were amazing!  They remembered us each morning and greeted us with a smile and coffee!  Safe in the room was fine, view was of other hotels - but we didn't expect anything else.

Summary Heading: Cant work while staying here, bad intermet
Summary: Reported to desk that wifi has poor signal in room. Stayed in room at end of hall but desk just said must be my tablet. But since I have an iPad, iPhone and a Surface Pro I know its not my device. Anyway I am unable to work so choosing to stay here best not involve working late.

My husband and I and friends stated here for 3+ nights for a convention at the Anaheim Convention Center. The location is awesome! The hotel itself is dated but the rooms were clean, hot water, ok beds, & nice customer service were great! We had the suite which had 2 double beds and a pull out couch. A regular room our couple friends had were 2 double beds. I didn't mind that it was dated because the location was a perfect close walk and the price was half as much as the Marriott and Hilton. We did have the Buffett breakfast two of the mornings and it was $12 each. Buffet was eggs, bacon, sausage, toast, potatoes, cereal, oatmeal, fruit, yogurt, waffles, pastries and juice.

My husband and I checked into our hotel room around 430pm after being on the road for over 17 hours, the check in staff was very friendly anytime I needed to speak with them ref different questions they were very helpful and respectful.  We had breakfast all 4 days we stayed and let me tell you, we ate like KINGS, every person working at this location was WONDERFUL!!!!! I know this hotel is older and as a teenager I remember staying at this Hotel, it brought back a lot of great memories.  I and my husband were very happy with all accommodations available to us which included a king size very comfortable bed, a full size bathtub with shower, a full counter, Wifi a tv & refrigerator, a balcony a full size swimming pool, a cantina, exercise equipment and parking.  Thank you for a

I stayed at this Clarion for 3 nights, starting Thursday, April 2nd 2015.  To attend Wondercon at the Anaheim Convention Center.  Arrived around 5:30pm and after a short wait in line, I was checked in.  Check in and check out went great.  No problems.  My room was on the 5th floor, looking towards Disneyland.  From that level for 3 evenings I could see most of the 9:30ish pm fireworks at Disneyland.  Maybe about a 7 minute show each night.  I had a double queen room.  It was clean and comfortable.  The bed was very comfortable.  The room smelled good.  The bathroom was clean and everything worked well.  The room had a mini fridge, but no microwave.  The tv worked fine.  The air conditioning unit worked well and I was happy that I could set it and forget it.  The fan ran

great value hotel - good breakfast, clean rooms, great pool better than best western across the road.  I would stay there again.  evening bar food not so good. good gift shop - shuttle to Disneyland paid separately.  Could walk to Disneyland if with older children.

Summary Heading: Bad check in and comfortable but dated hotel
Summary: We arrived at 8:30 am and the man at the desk was very accommodating and told us to come back at Noon for a room. We went out to enjoy the area and got some things from CVS and brought them back to hotel to get room at 12:15. A lady  (we think manager) was very rude and short in tone when we asked if our room was ready. We did nothing more than walk up and inquire about room availability. She said we wouldn't have a room until  4pm....would've been nice to know that this morning.  She wasn't nice at all.   We'd checked our luggage luckily.    Later another younger girl was very helpful and nice.  She gave us a business card so we could call to see if room was ready also explained the wifi and how to get to the pool if we liked. She made it better. We left grabbed lunch and came

We stayed at this hotel for 4 nights in order to visit Disneyland, L.A., and the surrounding sites. The staff was generally great and they had a decent shuttle, five dollars per person per day, to Disneyland. We never made it to the pool because the weather was a little cool but it looked nice. This hotel was close to everything you could need like restaurants, a Target, and of course, Disneyland. The walk to Disneyland would have been about 15-20 minutes so the shuttle was worth it even if it was late sometimes. Only complaint I would have was that there are some small parts of the hotel that need updating. Whether it was a stained ceiling tile, or the old drapes, but especially and most importantly the very old and loud mattresses. We had to switch beds in order to get a

I was here on a tour, and I checked in and went to my room. The rooms were a bit small and outdated, but spotless. I went for a swim in the pool and it was very warm, the business center was kept up, and you can see fireworks from the pool area. The elevators were very good, and I felt safe, and they were very accommodating. I called housekeeping for more towels and soap and they were knocking on my door about 2-3 minutes after I called. You can't get service like that anywhere else

This hotel is less than 5 minute walk to the convention Centre and a casual 15 minute walk to Disneyland. When the feet are too sore the local ART bus has a stop right outside the hotel. The rooms are average size and reasonably clean if not a little dated. The carpet in my room did feel sticky to walk on but not sure why. This hotel is strict on check in time but Jeff was very helpful in stowing my bag whilst I explored. Service in the bar was good if not slow as there was 1 person doing everything. The accommodation is good value for money and restaurants are within 10 minute walking distance. I was confused however why there is an additional charge to use the in room safe, this is normally part of the room cost.

I selected this hotel because of it's close location to the Anaheim Convention Center and because my preferred hotels had no rooms available.  This was one of the worst hotel experiences I have ever had.  The property is sorely in need of updating and the staff is not friendly or helpful.  The weather was very warm during my stay and the outdated room air conditioner kept me awake most of the night, not to mention it was barely functional.  During the hours of 6 am to 8 am, without any warning or notice, all water was shut off to guest rooms, causing a near riot in the lobby.  The staff was just short of belligerent and not helpful.  The solution was allocating 4 bottles of drinking water to each guest.  No compensation was offered or given for the extreme inconvenience.  My

I have stayed at Clarion and Comfort Inn hotels many, many times, almost always satisfied that it was a good value.  This is an exception.  On the positive side, it is within walking distance of the conference center, and Disney.  There are dozens of restaurants and bars also within walking distance.  The bed was clean and comfortable, and the front desk person was friendly.  On the negative side, the in-room furniture and fixtures are very old.  See my photos of the window drapes as well.  The furniture is likely from the 80s.  Elevators are quite slow.  Fitness center is much too small for a property this large, and has very little variety.  I did not use the restaurant and bar on site.

Summary Heading: a touch outdated but not bad
Summary: We stayed here as part of a Disneyland package we purchased from getawaytoday.com. We went with a less expensive package so were prepared for not staying at a 5 star hotel since we were really only sleeping here after spending 12 hours at Disneyland.The hotel decor is outdated but over all the hotel is clean. We reserved one room for 4 adults and a 11 yr old and when we checked in they put us in a small room with 2 double beds, not queens, and there was no space to put the roll away bed, without moving the small table and two chairs out into the hallway. After speaking with someone different at the front desk they moved us into a larger room with a pull out love seat. It worked for my son, but he had to sleep on it with his head at the foot of the bed because one of the foot

Summary Heading: Next time I will pay more money for another hotel.
Summary: I recently stayed here for a convention along with a large group. We got several rooms over a few floors and there was one problem after another.  Maid comes in to clean, makes the bed and changes towels but leaves the trash and we found the door propped open and no one in sight once. One floor has the air on full blast in the hall, another it's off and extremely stuffy. Beds and pillows are lumpy, didn't sleep well the whole stay. Ice and drink machines broken. Old elevators. If you use the very old and noisy air conditioning unit in the room only the area directly in front of the unit gets cold. If you're a light sleeper this is not the place for you. The walls are extremely thin. I was woken up at 6 am by the family next door taking shower after shower. If you're on a budget

stayed with my family on a trip to Disneyland. The location is about .5 miles to the Disneyland entrance.  Walking there is no problem. Check-in was great. Busy, but the woman attending to me was apologetic for the wait and was willing to be patient and answer questions.  Morning breakfast was average, seating was great, hostess was extremely slow is sitting people.  Room was fine. Standard size. Bathrooms do seem old, but still function the same as new ones. Only complaint is the firm bed. It took a long day at Disneyland for me to sleep ok.

I recently attended a trade show at the Anaheim Convention Center and the location for this property could not be better. But beyond that this is a tired hotel that needs help. While the staff rallied to create a positive stay, the 1980s hotel decor has to go if you want to keep up with the other surrounding properties. It wasn't clean enough for a $300 per night room charge AT ALL. The gym is so small and with 5 of us in there with broken equipment it was not ideal. If you'd like me to consider the Clarion brand as a business traveler, please invest in an upgrade.

Summary Heading: Above average, if you don't require pillow cases
Summary: The hotel was clean and quiet, even with tons of kids (proximity to Disneyland/California Adventure = KIDS). We had a suite with two double beds and a pullout loveseat bed. On our last night, we arrived from the parks and the two double beds had been made, but the pullout bed was not made...and NONE of the pillows had pillow cases.  They offer a breakfast buffet, where kids eat free. There was a long wait for a table, so we only ate there on the last day. The server took forever to come for a drink order, and then when I asked for kid's OJs, I assumed those would be in cups with lids, but they weren't and the two year old spilled his, naturally.  Also, the room service menu is extremely limited and very expensive. However, there are a lot of restaurants (fast food and sit down)

Summary Heading: Clean, good breakfast, not too far from Disneyland
Summary: We stayed here for a Disneyland trip.  Clean rooms, nice hotel staff.  The breakfast was a nice buffet with plenty of choices.  We could walk to Disney in the morning, but after dark decided to take the bus back to the hotel since we were exhausted by the end of the day.  It was a lovely hotel, but next time I think I will look for something across the street from the Disney entrance.  Closer would have been better.  But the hotel was lovely and a decent price for Clarion.

There is nothing I can say about this place. Stuck here for a convention. Poor service, Poor food quality. Bathrooms are at least 15-20 years old. Water issues. Maid service not even close to daily. Entire property is dirty. I would not stay here again if it were free

Everything was good, 2 things,   1.- the hallways to the rooms smell like fart  2.- I can't believe that if you stay in this hotel they charge you 14 usd/per night in parking it should be free.  Also looks kind of old, they should renew it. Everything else was fine  Also the location was awesome

I attended a packaging trade show and stayed at the Clarion. It is an older hotel but found most of the staff to be friendly and helpful. If you only need a place to sleep and are either at a trade show (short walk to the convention center) or are spending the day at Disney then this place is very cost effective. Otherwise, there are much nicer places to stay but overall I had a quite room and easy access.

Can't beat the price of this hotel considering the location to Disneyland.  While the room we had needed some updating, it was clean and I couldn't complain because of the price.  Pool is bare bones so we didn't swim.  Hotel restaurant is good with affordable choices and basic items.  Staff was very kind and helpful.  Walk to Disneyland is about 10-12 minutes.  IHOP and Starbucks are located closeby.

Property was clean and quiet. However this was the hardest bed I have ever had sleep on. Pillows were nice but I just tossed and turned all night ;( no sleep! then in the morning check was a long wait, not like the Marriott where you can drop keys off or leave in room and go. The front desk clerk was frustrated and very rude.Check in went much smoother and the concierge was helpful. The balcony was nice with a great view. room was basic, fairly clean ( I am a bit OCD when I sleep in a hotel,so there were little things that should have been cleaned way better).  Would I stay again? Most likely not. Rude clerks and no rest equals a bad day for me, I left the hotel angry so that's not going to be a place I would have as a first, second, third, fourth, fifth and so on choice. It is

Very outdated and worn, even at a rate lower than nearby hotels not worth it.  The carpet in my room was worn and stained, the curtains frayed, very old fashioned amenities, and completely out of touch with today's traveler.  Only one outlet in the bathroom, and no convenience outlets for chargers and such.  Old style cooling unit instead of a thermostatic control.  Very cramped. This chain should be embarrassed and ashamed.

Stayed in pet room. Stale urine smell made room unlivable. I put AC on full blast to sleep. Cracked sink, dirty, dingy walls. Whole hotel needs total makeover. Would never recommend this hotel for anyone.

Summary Heading: Reasonable price hotel but still won't recommend it
Summary: First it's really reasonable price hotel comparing to many hotels near by, and it's very close to Anaheim Convention Center and just few steps from bus station. However, this hotel really need refurbishment, rooms smell strange, an A/C from 80s, vending machines just don't work, staff were not very friendly if they could be more friendly I'd give this hotel better rate however it's negatives, breakfast was one of my terrible breakfast experience however restaurant's staff were very nice & friendly. I'd not recommend this hotel unless you are travelling on very tight budget and you really need to be close to this area.

Summary Heading: Very average (dated) hotel with a premium rate
Summary: The Clarion is situated between the Marriott and the Hyatt, and across from the Hilton, right at the Anaheim Convention Center.  Because of the location, it charges the going premium rate.  Problem is, it is not a premium hotel like the others.  It is very dated and in need of a complete overall; (70's harvest yellow theme throughout, thin worn carpeting, dated fixtures, cheap tile in need of new grout, noisy a/c unit, etc.)  The bellman doubles as the concierge, who although is nice enough, relies heavily on tourist brochures and is not that knowledgeable.  The restaurant food is well worth the walk to anywhere else.  Staff is cordial but no one stood out as pleasant except the bellman.  All-in-all a great location, but not a great stay for the money; and that's taking into

Good location and close to Disneyland. However, the rooms are small and very out dated. The carpets are old and not very clean. Bathroom fan and air conditioning unit were not working. The room they considered a suite was a converted balcony with a small sofa for a small child.  In addition, the rooms would not get cleaned until the early evening.   The breakfast buffet had good variety but overpriced considering other hotels in the area offer complimentary breakfast.

From the time we checked in, to the time we checked out we had an excellent time. staff was great, at the time of check in they upgraded our room to a suite at no extra charge, rooms are a little dated but it worked fine, breakfast buffet was great!! housekeeping was awesome, they brought us extra towels within seconds of asking for them, overall it was an awesome stay, we will stay there again!!!!!

Summary Heading: You get what you pay for
Summary: When we checked in we were made to feel we were imposing on the front desk.  They were not very friendly and did not seem to want to help us.  The room was clean but there was a large crack in the bathroom sink and in the bathtub tile.  The room had a funny odor to it.  They need to update their rooms.  The internet was out the first day, no clean towels the second day, (we finally had to ask for some), and our room key did not always work.  The bar was very under stocked and trying to get an employee to take your order was next to impossible.  No one ever seemed to be in the bar.  We stopped in for dinner one night (the dining room was closed, why we did not know) at 6PM and we sat there for 5 minutes and no one came to help us so we left.  The gentlemen at the Concierge were

We booked this hotel for a Disneyland vacation after our usual hotel was sold out. We were pleasantly surprised by the service, room layout and amenities. Jesus and Jaime were great servers at the breakfast buffet and the front desk was very accommodating. We arrived early on a Friday and were allowed to check into our room extremely early. Our room was on the seventh floor and it was a suite. It included a sitting area that had a sleeper couch. The hotel is an older property but it has been maintained. The pool is heated and there is room service. The bathroom has a separate sink area that makes it nice when getting ready. The bathroom could use an update. This hotel is .75 miles from the main entrance to Disney. We walked it while we were here but it can be a long trek after a

I stayed here recently in order to participate in a race at Disneyland. The hotel is located within walking distance of the main entrance (there is also the Anaheim shuttle for a small fee) and parking available on site (for a fee). The staff at the hotel were helpful and the room was fine for a short visit although the décor was slightly dated. Room came with a fridge which was helpful for chilling water/food.  The restaurant at the hotel is not great so I'd suggest you pick up something before heading back to the hotel.

Booked five rooms for 6 nights each for a convention. Low cost could not redeem the dirty, old and tired rooms.  Dirty carpets, frayed drapes, horrible pillows and cracked tiles in each of our five rooms. Our keys were hit or miss each time we tried to get into our rooms - just ridiculous.  Internet was completely out one day and night and barely functioned the rest of the stay.  Certainly not a hotel geared towards business people.  When I complained upon check out, the manager gave me a credit for my parking cost.  This hotel is surrounded by at least 12 hotels within one block of it - certainly any of them will be my choice for next year's convention.

the front desk people were not friendly. the suite they gave us was dirty and the sofa bed was all broken it could not flip to make it into the bed. The coffee maker was dirty and it did not work. this was suppose to be a fun trip, but it quickly turned into a nightmare. besides the charge us a lot and it really was not worth it. you guys should read this because the photos were you see the room is very different in real life.

At the end of the day you get what you pay for. We knew by the price we paid it would be a mid range hotel and it was . We stayed in a motel in one trip to the USA for a couple of days -that was bad. This was lovely in comparison. We had two rooms - both with two double beds in.  They are somewhat dated but there were no issues with the cleanliness in our rooms and I would have noticed had there been. The rooms were serviced daily and fresh towels each time. For most people using this hotel you are going to be on holiday here and will spend little time in your room anyway , too much to see and do in the area/LA . Make the most of it, it is all excellent fun. The public areas - restaurant/ bar/ swimming pool were all of a reasonable standard.  The hotel had ticket booking and

Summary Heading: lost samsung tab in the hotel
Summary: The hotel offers good services except that at the last day before our departure, I lost my samsung tablet which costs at least USD300.  I am pretty sure that my daughter played it the night before and we walked to McDonald for breakfast the next morning without packing anything yet. After we were back, we could not find our tab. What happened is that before we headed for breakfast that morning, there were at least two housekeeping persons who knocked at our door asking if we need housekeeping that time. Well, no comments.  In the noon before we got on the shuttle, I reported the tab loss to the reception while I was chekcing out and wrote an email to the manager after we were back to Canada. Two weeks have passed and nobody really cared about what had happened. No apology, no

We stayed here for 3 nights. It was conveniently located about 2-3 blocks from Disney land, there was a supermarket just a block away. The room was large as well as the bathroom. For the price it was great.

Summary Heading: You get what you pay for, sometimes less...
Summary: My family travelled to Anaheim for the winter break 2014.  Now I know we only paid an average of $119 per night and i do not expect luxury at this price but I do expect things to work and the room to be clean.  The room was gross.  The outlets were falling out of the walls. They obviously do not vacuum behind furniture or in the corners, our heat and air conditioning did not work. I was able to connect to the free wifi only twice in seven days. They supplied coffee but only one packet of caffeinated per day and there was only one electrical outlet for the coffee maker and or blow dryer/curling iron near the bathroom.  Oh, and our door handle broke - twice.  On the positive side, the shuttle service is decent and they offer a buffet at a reasonable price where kids under 12 eat

My family stayed here back in 2009, we just got home from a 4 night stay here again. I was very impressed with how the property has been maintained so well. Convenient parking, walking distance to the parks, restaurants etc. they employ very friendly, helpful staff & all around accommodating. Clean, convenient hotel & rooms that I'd highly recommend & will certainly return for future Disneyland trips!

While this hotel didn't blow me away as far as a whole, it's only a few blocks away from the gates of Disneyland which is awesome. The room and facilities I experienced were clean and well maintained. The front desk was helpful when we checked in, out, and purchased park tickets. Oh yeah! Disneyland and California Adventure tickets can be purchased at the front desk which is totally convenient! I would definitely stay here again!

We booked this Hotel through Booking.com as a "mystery" motel-the price was right, but all of the add ons made the cost as much or more as another place.  It is inconceivable to me that any hotel/motel can and will charge $14 or more per day to park a car that remains in the lot.  The rooms were not clean when we checked in, kind of a "lick and a promise"  the air conditioner rattled and groaned the first 2 nights, even after being assured it would be fixed,  it was, after we slapped some duct tape on it.  I do not recommend this place, at least until there are changes in customer service.

Summary Heading: Affordable hotel for a small family near Disneyland
Summary: I found this hotel through our employee website and booked a room for our Disneyland vacation.  We chose it primarily because my fiancé had stayed here before and the location is only about 2.5 blocks from the Disneyland resorts, which meant we didn't need to drive to and from the parks everyday.  The hotel is actually next to the Anaheim convention center,  which is why it probably looks so old and worn out.  The room we got had 2 double beds.  The living area was a decent size but the bathroom was ridiculously small.  We also had a small (32") flat screen TV, a mini fridge, a small round table and a small dresser.  The biggest complaint we had was with the restaurant.  It advertised a "breakfast buffet" for $9.95 which was nothing more than a continental breakfast.   We went

Checked in Dec. 4th at 7:30 p.m. and the room assigned to us was occupied by someone else. Room #2... ready to go to bed at 12:30a.m. discovered that we could not turn off florescent ceiling light. The switch was broken. Room #3...water was dripping unto the carpet by the window and the ceiling was almost ready to fall down. We were to tired to move to another room. Upon check out we were told that the general manager would get in tough with us to resolve our problems... seven days later we have not heard from the general manager. A very disappointing stay and this should not be a Clarion.

Summary Heading: Clarion Anaheim has seen better days
Summary: I only ended up in this hotel because my first and second choices in a conference room block were unavailable, and this was the next closest to the convention center. The smaller size of this property makes navigating around in it very easy, but that doesn't make up for the tired condition of the guest rooms. Everyone in my group who stayed here had some story about the deficiencies in their rooms. Old, worn-out bathroom fixtures, carpeting due for cleaning or replacement, electrical outlets inconveniently located for charging devices, poor lighting, and the strange old-fashioned room keys.   I would not stay here again unless the property undergoes a complete refurbishment. It is definitely due for it.

Summary Heading: Is there less than a one star?
Summary: This place defies explanation about how horrible it truly is in real life.  I considered sleeping in my car but instead slept on towels. The carpet is sticky and there is mold on the air conditioner and vents. The water from the tap is white and the shower will scald you if someone in the hotel flushes the toilet.  Forget the internet unless you have all day. Be advised..stay away. The Clarion should be embarrassed and Disney should advise people not to stay there. The convention center should never recommend this place either.

Summary Heading: We nicked named this hotel Scare-eon instead if Clarion
Summary: Smells terrible.  smells like smoke even though suppose to be smoke free.  Hold your breath if you take the stairs. The water is either scalding hot or ice cold. It says there is wi-fi but it's so weak I couldn't do anything with it. Front desk staff messed up our room charges.  My phone charger won't stay in the wall and keeps falling out of the wall. The only benefits are the location and kareoke was fun.  The house keepers did a great job changing the linens and making sure we had fresh towels.

Stayed Thanksgiving week Tuesday thru Sunday in a king suite (room 742) visiting our daughter at Chapman university. We had an AARP rate of $133 a night  and $14 a night for parking.  We found the room to be spacious and comfortable and the bed was great. The hotel is a little worn and maintenance was lacking. The vending machines and ice machine on our floor did not work and there were no signs saying so. The towel rack and hair dryer were loose on their mounts but they worked. The coffee pods for the in room brewers were not very tasty and water in the vending machine was $3 so I suggest going 1 block north to 7-11 and buying a case for $5 as there are fridges in the rooms. Plus you will want bottled water for you coffee as well.  The staff in the restaurant (9.99) buffet was

My girlfriend and I decided last minute to do a weekend trip to Disneyland and got a great deal at this property, which is walking distance to Disneyland.  When we arrived at the hotel, they gave us a free upgrade to one of their Studio rooms.  The room was huge.  We had one of the most comfortable beds I have ever laid on.  There was a couch, a plasma screen tv, microwave, and refrigerator.  It was beautiful, comfortable, and convenient.  I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone.  Thanks Mitzi and Clarion Crew.

We stayed here for 3 nights, 2 adults. The lobby was decorated for the holidays and they were playing holiday music as well.  It was very welcoming.  We checked in at about 9pm after a day in the parks and the gentleman working the front desk upgraded us to a suite on the 8th floor for no extra cost!  We could see World of Color lights from the room!  The room was dated and a little odd (random half walls that suggest it once had a balcony that was later enclosed) but it was perfect for us. Spacious and quiet.    Our package included breakfast and parking.  The breakfast buffet was good but I recommend getting there by 7am or you will be waiting a while for the waffle machine to be free.  The servers at the restaurant were wonderful, very friendly and attentive. The walk to/from

Stayed 5 nights. 2 adults 2 kids. Stayed in a suite which was roomy enough for the kids to have some "play space". Room was clean. Staff was friendly. Not the ritz but was great for us as we only slept there after a long day ya disney.

I just recently stayed here for about a week, the service at this hotel is just unbelieveable. Our room was very good we had a suite and we could see the fireworks from our room. The rooms are very spacious and clean, perfect for our 3 small children. Fresh towels and blankets were put in our room daily, the servers in the restaurant were amazing and very kind. The front desk as well were very helpful with our every need, such as helping us with our disney tickets and finding us the best place to eat in town. The only negatuve to this trip would be one of the girls at the front desk was rude to us a few times and she always looked like she just rolled out of bed and looked unprofessional. Overall great stay, I will most certainly stay here again.

Stayed here for a week on holiday.  Fabulous location near Disneyland.  Rooms were nice and clean and staff were very helpful and friendly! Would highly recommend and would definitely come back and stay here again!

We took somewhat spur of the moment weekend (4 day) trip to Disneyland, and needed somewhere cheap to stay, within walking distance to the park. We had been before and stayed off property at another resort down the road, so we already had certain expectations of the quality of the hotels in the area That being said, we got exactly what we paid for in this resort. The staff that I dealt with were helpful, but not outstanding. The rooms felt old and worn, but clean enough that I can't complain, and the beds were surprisingly really comfortable. It was about a 15-20 minute walk to the parks, which was great, and there is a CVS one block away which is very convenient. Overall this is not the place to stay if you are looking for a luxurious getaway, however if you need somewhere

I was running in the inaugural Avengers half marathon and we needed to be in our corrals at 5:15 a.m.  Needless to say, I did not fancy getting up at 3 a.m. and driving to Disneyland, so I got a room at the cheapest hotel closest to the Park I could find.  GREAT Location.  Steps from Convention Center and a short walk to Disneyland, or you can take the ART shuttle, which has a stop literally in front of the hotel. Price.  By far the cheapest hotel I found that was a short distance to the park.  GOOD Room was clean, had plenty of towels and toiletries. Bed was comfy and clean. Room had bonus stuff - a big cushy armchair, a big mini fridge, a hairdryer, etc.  NOT THE GREATEST BUT SEE ABOVE RE: LOCATION & PRICE Hotel is old, it's not fancy.  I didn't care but some might. Service

You can tell once you walk Into the it's really out dated and old. The price of the parking isn't included in the room rate and neither is the cost of using the room safe!   We didn't bring shampoo or conditioner and had to request more from the front desk. Our face towels weren't replaced daily either.  We will not be returning to this hotel again. Instead, we'd go across the street to the Red Lion or Hilton or Marriott.

I want to say that the service we received at this hotel was excellent.. The  restaurant service was   the greatest..specially two of the service rs Denise and Jami  .They keep on top of everything .   Rooms where nicely keep and clean. all the staff did a great job.

My wife and I spent three nights at the Anaheim Clarion. The room wasn't flash but it was clean and comfortable. It was exactly what you would expect for the price we paid. But the free Wi-Fi was so slow it was next to useless. Most travellers these days expect a reasonable internet connection. Connectivity is important to me and I will not be staying again at this hotel for this reason alone. Another annoying thing was waiting almost 15 minutes to be seated for breakfast, obviously not enough staff that day...but I realise these things happen on occasions so not issue as it only happened once during our stay.

Summary Heading: So-so.  Not bad, but not great.
Summary: Recently stayed at this hotel for a few nights going to a 2 day Convention being held at the Anaheim Convention Center.    Location:  It's a great location if you are visiting the Convention Center.  Just a quick few minute walk up the street.  It's also a great location if you are in town visiting Disneyland.  There are plenty of restaurants around in walking distance and a convenient CVS down the street for snacks, etc.    Parking is $14 a day.  Price: Got a discount on the room.  I believe I paid for $104 a night for a double suite when it normally was $175.  So based off of that, I got a great deal.  Room:  I didn't know what a suite meant but when I entered the room it just means you get a microwave and a small part of the room that has a pull out sofa bed.  So it was a bit

I recently stayed here 5 nights for business...10/24 - 10/29/14 I have stayed at many many hotels and by far this has been the friendliest!  Yes its an older hotel but it is clean and the overall experience is worth giving up some luxeries.  Super impressed with the front desk staff and a shout out to Charles Whitfield THANKS for your daily smiles, excellent customer service - above & beyond expectations!  I will definately stay here again because of you!

Very clean for an older hotel but the very best part was the staff. Very friendly and helpful! Charles at the front desk is the very best as well as Arturo in the resteraunt and bar.They made our trip that much better. I will stay there every time I go!!!

We stay in Clarion from 10/29 to 11/03. Room 738  First when you walk to the room the room smell like mildew.  Second the bathroom and the bathroom floor was dirty, I ask the room attandent to please clean the bathroom again and sweep the floor but  her answer was that rooms is not on my paper.  You need to pay for parking, they charge 15.00 dolars the night for a roller way bed and at the 3 day when I return to my room my rooms was to clean.  I call front desk and because was 11 pm housekeeping was not working they just exchange towels.  The rest of all stay rooms was partial clean, sheets never get change, bathroom was not clean no vacuum at all, cleaning rags in my room in top of my vanity dirty from housekeeping.  I needs to ask front desk I the morning to please make sure

We arrived at 8:00 pm and our room was not ready. The only open room had smaller beds. Bathrooms had rust  thru out and very small. front room staff good and café on  was good. Always had to find maid for bath towels. Keys never worked on 2nd day.

The Clarion hotel is conveniently located very close to Disneyland.  The great, guest services staff suggest to take the ARC shuttle which costs reasonably ($5/day for adults) to get to the theme park.  There are plenty of parking spaces here for a fee ($14/day).  The world-class restaurant staff are helpful and friendly.  The food for the full buffet at breakfast was tasty.  The room is dated, but very comfortable and clean.  All of the channels worked for the Dish HDTV-ready television.  There was no issues with the Wi-Fi here.  My room included a refrigerator which was in working order.  I will stay here again because the staff is helpful and friendly.  Thanks to Mike, Miguel, and Naomi.  Well Done!

walk right across the street is the Disneyland parking and catch the tram to the park or walk two blocks and you are at the front entrance.  Room we had looked toward Disneyland and had a balcony you could stand out on. Room was clean and the staff were friendly and helped when needed. Called and asked for an extra blanket and it was there within 3 minutes, honestly. Great room. Convention Center right next door if you were going there. Would stay here again. Even had a mini frig.

My eleven year daughter and I stayed at this hotel last month for a two day Disneyland getaway.  We travel around the world and have stayed at  five star properties and budget properties. In terms of amenities, no hot tub, and decor, rather dated, this would be a three star. However, in terms of service and location definitely 5 star. The staff from the front desk to the gift shop, restaurant and housekeeping were all unfailing in their courtesy and willingness to help. As an example, one day at the breakfast buffet I stated that I wished they had an item that had been on the buffet the prior morning.  One of the staff heard my remark and even though the item was not offered on the buffet that day went to the kitchen and got the item for me and my daughter. When we to the pool,

BEWARE scam calls in this hotel. They will call you saying that is from hotel but its not true, they will tell you that the system in hotel fail so they need your details again including credit card number.  This is a very dated hotel, the carpets are so dirty that you must use sandals to walk inside room and to have a shower, since the tub is also very stain (black dirty). I know what I was geting into when I booked this hotel BUT NEVER AGAIN AFTER THAT CALL.

This hotel is for sure outdated - the bathroom was all yellow tile and definitely out of the 70's. The room keys are actual keys! Our air conditioner sounded like a diesel engine in our room at first but they did fix that for us.   The staff was very friendly and helpful. They helped us with transportation to LA and San Diego. That being said, if you are planning on visiting LA and Anaheim to go to Disneyland, I would recommend staying in different hotels. It cost us more in transportation from the Clarion to Staples Center for a concert ($240) than it cost us for the tickets to the show ($120)! There is an Amtrak train station in the Angels Stadium parking lot - but we asked many different people in the Anaheim area and no one knew much about it. That or they would rather

The rooms we booked were not clean, food under table and near bed. Curtains were ripped, balcony had water dripping down on it.. Got locked in out room, had to call for someone to let us out. Shower was dirty and sounded like it was going to break

It was a great hotel. We had to book an extra night at a different hotel because we decided to extend our stay.
