The rooms were spacious and the staff was helpful, especially since they let us check in early after a long morning (DLR Half Marathon). Only downfall was having to pay for parking. A hotel with free parking is huge plus for us because we walk everywhere when we go to Disneyland. Overall, it was a nice hotel with a good room but could do without the parking fee.

From the minute I checked in, hospitality at its best. Traveling solo, was made to feel like family. Food, room, pool...alL great value and exceptional service. Charles at the front desk, took my stay and raised it to beyond amazing level.

We were a group of 29 teenage boys, juniors and seniors and family support that stayed for 9 nights. The service was tremendous, breakfast was served especially for us each morning by Maria and John and Arturro who were always happy to see us. Arturro would be running the bar until midnight then happily overseeing the kitchen service at breakfast the next morning. The staff were helpful and patient with our group. The facilities are modest but suitable for families visiting Disneyland and Los Angeles. Thank you

Summary Heading: Basic, clean, budget hotel near Disneyland
Summary: I stayed here with my family the week of Oct 1st. The hotel is about a 10min walk if that to the Disneyland resort. The hotel grounds are clean. The rooms are clean and spacious but the bathroom is very small. The maid service came in everyday to tidy up the room. We only had to call once for extra towels but they were brought up immediately. The hotel staff was very polite and said hello every time we walked through the front entrance. The pool area was very clean there were plenty of clean towels poolside. The water temp was nice being it was almost 100 degrees that week. Overall this is a nice basic budget hotel near Disneyland. There is plenty to eat within walking distance. Denny's, IHOP Ect...My favorite was the overland stage restaurant near Morton's steakhouse it's a BBQ

I visited Anaheim for a recent convention, and thought I would save money by staying at the Clarion as their rates were far lower than other convention center properties. Upon arriving at the property, it became apparent why their rates are low. It feels as though you are stepping back in time (not in a good way), when you enter this property, and it only gets worse once you get to the room!  The lobby and other common areas aren't bad, but they are definitely outdated.   What IS bad are the rooms. VERY outdated. From the furnishings to the bathroom, and I can't even begin to comment on the age of the air conditioning unit. I didn't feel as though things weren't clean, but it definitely felt as though the last update was in the 80s.  The vending machines on every floor were out

Just got back from a business trip last week and my company put a large group of 40 at the hotel.  Well lucky me.  I got room 324 and during the three nights spent there I was progressively bit up by bugs of some sort.  No they were not mosquitoes.   I woke up each morning with rows of bites along my seam lines.  My waist area, thighs and back legs were bitten.  My roommate and my peers thought they were bed bugs but when I returned home my man friend, a registered nurse stated that these were more like mite bites.  I washed everything right away and placed my luggage in a black plastic bag in the heat of the sun for a couple of days.  I was itchy and scratching for three days upon my return home.   And oh yes I should have thought twice when i instinctly put on my shoes when I

Stayed 7 nights at the Clarion Anaheim, it is an older hotel which could use updating, but it was very clean.  We arrived early about 10 am and looking forward to getting to Disney and wanted to drop our luggage off but they checked us in and let us have our room.  The staff at the hotel were very helpful and friendly, and can answer questions or book tours. The rooms were clean, freshly cleaned carpets and the rooms smelt good.  The pool was nice it was very hot and a great way to cool off.  The hotel is within walking distance to DL, there is also a bus stop right out front of the hotel which will take you to DL as well.

We enjoyed our stay but unfortunately there were a few problems. First problem was our room was never cleaned and our towels and toiletries were never replaced once in our 5 days, I had to go down to get more toilet paper. Second problem was that my son had been a little sick so I called down to the front desk so we could get new bedding but was only provided with a sheet and not the mattress cover that was requested and I thought for sure the next day someone would come to see if the room would need some refreshing but that did not happen. Other than that I thought the staff were very professional and friendly.

My husband and I travelled to Anaheim, California along with our daughter and her 2 daughters. Her oldest daughter danced in 2 of the Disneyland parades and in 1 Disneyland showcase. Our hotel needed some serious updating.  The bathroom was very small and it had mold in a lot of the places. The bathroom didn't have a fan and it took forever to get the steam out.  There was no microwave just a refrigerator and the air conditioner was so loud we couldn't sleep. We went from July 6 to the 14. The people working there were very nice.  The pool was also nice. There was only one washer and one dryer for 4 floors and you had to bring your own detergent. On the positive side it was only 2 very long blocks to Disneyland and we could walk or take a shuttle that only charges $2.00 for

Very bad customer service, had to ask at least twice how to get to disneyland and was not told anything about how to get breakfast the next morning. Would rather pay more for better service as the check in agent put me off ever staying there again. If it were another occasion where I wouldn't be  going to disneyland I'd actually rate it very very low. Clarion in Dublin, Ireland is much better.

The hotel was not bad, the bath tubs and washroom were really small, the beds were really old and made a weird noise it would have been better if they would get the beds changed.The price was ok.The service was good, location was pretty close to Disney Land Park.    I wouldn't come to this hotel again.

Summary Heading: Great hotel, Great price, Close to the parks.
Summary: I was surprised to find hotel prices in Anaheim so high in September. When I saw the price on the Clarion, I was pleasantly surprised. I had stayed here before so I knew I was getting a good hotel. The rooms are a decent size. We had 2 double beds and a sitting area as well as a desk and dresser.  It is within walking distance of the parks and Target, but if you don't want to walk, it is on a number of ART routes which is very convenient. The pool area was nice and got used a lot due to the extremely high temperatures. There is a restaurant on site where kids eat free which is handy and economical, but best of all was the fabulous maid service. We got fresh sheets every night of our stay which we loved. For our 6 night stay we saved almost $400 over the brand name hotel we were

I had read other traveller reviews before booking so wasn't expecting anything modern or fancy. We scored four nights at a great price. Our room was clean and had everything we needed for our 4 night stay for our family of five. It can be hard to find one hotel room to accommodate a whole family, but this room had all the beds we needed and was a good size. Hotel is walking distance to Disneyland - 2 large blocks - although we hitched a ride back on the bus to the Disney carpark opposite the hotel (perfect for kids with tired legs after a big day!). Unfortunately the Wifi was unreliable. Carparking was $14/day (for a 24 hour period) which we thought was reasonably priced. Yes it could do with modernising, but I would happily stay here again at the right price.

Summary Heading: Great place to stay when at Disneyland
Summary: We had a very good experience at the Clarion when we went to Disneyland. It's not far from the park and walkable if you want...two blocks from the gate. Or you can take the shuttle. The staff was eager to please and upgraded our room without us asking. It's very affordable, clean and comfortable. The pool was clean and well maintained, nice place to unwind. We got a package through "getaway today" that included a very nice breakfast for all 3 days. The best part of this was our waiter "Jamie"   he was the best, fun, friendly, there to serve but not overwhelm you (lets you enjoy your meal). He is truley a credit to the Clarion. Check in and check out was very fast and pleasant and thats also important to us. For the money it can't be beat for a Disneyland trip.

The hotel is clean and the beds are quite comfortable. We did not use a pool, but there were several people enjoying it. The customer services was also not bad. And everything is OK, except paid parking. I get really annoyed when the hotels charge money for parking. Especially, when you pay 14$ per night and in the morning find big scratch on the back of your car.

If you are looking for somewhere to simply sleep this is the place for you. The hotel is very old and tired.  Our room was clean but the bathroom had cracked tiles and mildew and the vent was rusted over and clogged with dust and who knows what. The beds are very uncomfortable, and the free continental breakfast was only a small plate of fruit and one drink with a slice of toast.

I should have expected the quality of the room for the price I've paid. The hotel itself needs updating. The beds were clean and comfortable to sleep in but I was really frustrated with the bathroom. The sink didn't drain properly and you can not change the temperature of the shower at all! It was scorching hot! Asked the front desk if that could have been adjusted, they said they will ask the maintenance to have a look but didn't seem like they did anything. My boyfriend and I had to bare with the temperature for the 4 nights we were there for.  The hotel itself was close to Disneyland and the ART bus stopped right in front of the hotel.  I would stay at this hotel again if I was only staying for 1 night, I wouldn't recommend staying here if it's for any longer.

its a pity you can't give half points on Tripadvisor, as this hotel is worthy of 3 1/2  Let me start by explaining the hotel's full name: Clarion Hotel Anaheim Resort the "Anaheim Resort" part of the name refers to the part of Los Angeles the hotel is in (the area around Disneyland is called "Anaheim Resort"). Many travel brochures misleadingly give the indication that this hotel is a resort (and some reviewers appear to have thought this prior to arriving). THE CLARION HOTEL IS NOT A RESORT. It is just a hotel, and a somewhat dated hotel at that.  Thats not to say it is a bad hotel: the staff are extremely friendly and helpful (Stephan on the belldesk / attractions desk was fantastic). I found the hotel to be very clean. The amenities offered were what you would expect from a

Me and my wife booked this place with thomas cook a year in advance,  when we arrived they said they had know knowledge of our booking despite me having all the booking and paperwork including days booked and receipts. They were incredibly unhelpful and shunned all responsibility they said out of good will they will put us whilst they drive and resolve the issue and after that we had to pay the $1100 again or get out. Distraught by this and not having a spare $1100 i had to call England to resolve this as they were  not able to. The staff are very rude and show no interest in us as guests and it shows that they do not care about guests either our room was not cleaned everyday. The high speed Internet is non existent its that bad they should not advertise it as high speed it took

We stayed at the Clarion for 5 nights in August as we had an exhibition at the convention center, which is only a few minutes walk away. There are other hotels near the convention center - such as the Marriot and the Hilton - but the Clarion was the cheapest. Location and price were two of the main factors in our choosing this hotel so I had realistic expectations about what level of hotel it would be. It generally met my expectations. My room was on the 3rd floor and it was clean and spacious but the fixtures and fittings are old and in need of updating. The bath and shower are from the 1980s and the phone in my room wasn't working properly. There is free wifi but it is not reliable which was inconvenient as I needed to check work emails. I found the staff to be helpful and

Summary Heading: An almost outdated hotel, but not too bad of a place to stay!
Summary: This late sixtyish structure can perhaps use a major face and body lift, but even as is, it is satisfactory for the price, if you get a good deal. I was there 5 days in August 2014 for a conference, and did fare rather well.  The room was fairly good size, the bed comfortable and the pillows were great. Shower and sink about average but sufficient for one person. Sleep quality was great as luckily there were not too many screaming Disney crazed children running up and down the hall with Micky's ears!  The breakfast buffet looked good and a bargain at $9.95 in A Disney area hotel where everything is expensive for my budget. Beside these minor quirks, I did not have any trouble. The first treadmill was broken and 3 calls to front desk did not get anywhere, it was still broken when

Summary Heading: Don't stay here better options everywhere!
Summary: I was there for a conference from August 4-8 and thought it would be fine.  Great location next to the convention center and 2 blocks from Disney.   The staff was rude and not friendly or helpful at all. The wireless Internet in the rooms was a joke and I couldn't log on and do anything.  The beds were lousy and hurt my back, lower lumbar for 3 days following.   The wake up call failed and did not execute and I over slept as a result.   The food was uneventful and not great in the restaurant.  Server's were not attentive at all.  Getting help from the bellman with our luggage was near impossible and took forever!   Seems like all best people in this area are working for Disney and this is very much the leftovers here with this staff and facilities.   Never again. Stay at the

This hotel over charged my account $430 when I asked why this happened they gave me the run around and no answer was given I called my bank and I had to file a claim to get my money back. My husbands cell phone was also gone from our room he has a work and personal phone and decided to just take one to disneyland when we get back at night the cell phone was gone. I called at&t and someone in Anaheim had my husbands phone. Worst service very dirty hotel people stay away!

Summary Heading: Dirty sheets, stained carpet, dirty bathtub,
Summary: We know now better than to stay at a filthy, dirty nasty Clarion. The hotel was the worst I and my daughter have Ever stayed at. Staff were rude. Could not even get clean towel after asking please don't stay here this place should be condemed. This hotel is not a place that any one would feel comfortable. ... The only good thing was the shuttle service to and from Disneyland.

Summary Heading: Some People just expect too much.
Summary: This hotel was in a great location. The rooms were adequately sized, clean, staff friendly etc. If your after a middle range hotel this is the one for you. Could do with some updateing in halls etc but for the few days we were there it was great. Will definately return when we come back from Australia.

Summary Heading: Not bad, but not the best! 2.5 rating
Summary: I checked in to this Hotel and all of the Desk and Bell staff were very friendly and helpful! The Reason I gave this hotel a 3 is because of the other areas such as appearance, comfort, gym, and safety.....also the on site restaurant.   1) Hotel front desk staff get a 5 star rating  2) The rooms need upgrading as far as bed size (who sleeps on double beds?) The wall paper was peeling, and bathroom door barely misses the toilet. I was in a "suite" and felt cramped! The A/C worked great, tv and fridge worked great. So this gets a 3 star.  3) The onsite Restaurant was clean, the food on the buffet was decent, they need a couple more waffle makers for the amount of people in restaurant. The service in this restaurant was HORRIBLE! The servers only seat you, bring you ONE (1) drink

Summary Heading: I expected more than what I got
Summary: The lobby was really nice and the staff were helpful, when I got to the room it's was really hot it took forever for the AC to cool, my guess was that the sun was hitting the room all day. During night the room did get cold, But other than that the stay was fine

The staff was wonderful, except for one instance where a staff member ( Lauren) was rude to my husband.. The breakfast was great customer service from one member named Bo was outstanding, he brought us fresh clean plates asked how our stay was, if it wasn't great or amazing he would go out of his way to change that. If i were his boss I would PROMOTE him or give him a raise. All in all I would recommend this hotel to friends and families I would however advise them to stay away from Lauren. And to ask for Bo as a server.

We spent 8 days here after getting married in Vegas - we were given room 101 which is on the ground floor, not bad, except that one wall is completely glass (patio doors screwed shut) and it faces directly to the pool area. My new husband went to ask if there were any other rooms or at least some sort of net curtains so we could open the heavy curtains, but was told no.  We had to have our curtains shut on the beautiful LA sunshine all the time for the whole 8 days. The air conditioning was a big old machine and very loud. This was our honeymoon but there was no chance of sharing this happy time with anyone because no one spoke to us, the staff in the breakfast area acted like it was the first time they saw us every time we went for food and were never friendly other than

Summary Heading: Could have been so much better
Summary: We stayed here for our mini honeymoon through a booking of bookit.com. The hotel is old but relatively clean and most of the love has been given to the lobby. Staff is nice but not much in terms of customer service going above and beyond. There were instances that should have been addressed in the beginning (wifi password on check in, change of wifi password on Saturday morning), elevators not working (1 of three operational) just so the guest knows. The hallways were being heated for some reason to 80 plus degrees when the outside temperatures were already well within the 90+. In the room, it was clean and well kept but some things did not work well including the shower, sink, and dresser drawers.   Finally there was a printed warning letter on the night stand about how

My daughter and I just spent 14 nights at The Clarion.  I have nothing but praise for the staff especially including the lovely ladies who cleaned our room everyday.  Everybody was extremely polite and respectful, helpful and happy.  Our room was perfect. Lovely and clean. Overlooking the pool on a lower floor which I requested 8 months earlier.  Nice and close to Disneyland.   ART bus network was fabulous outside the front door.  Most importantly, I felt safe staying there with my daughter.  Thank you Clarion, look forward to staying at your hotel again. Trish.  New Zealand

Even though this is one of the older Hotels in Anaheim i would say 99.9% of the staff are very professional and makes the experience one that you would definitely return or recommend to others for a family vacation. Looking at the over all cost for a vacation to enjoy within ones budget this hotel could not be beat even with all the small issues other travelers may have posted . My only issue with this property that i would "alert" others to avoid is the front desk representative by the name of (Lauren.) This young lady in most of other guest we've spoken to during our trip is to be very rude and unprofessional to say the least. I could only inform others not to judge this property by a front desk rep that needs hospitality training but to judge this vacation hotel by the family

Summary Heading: Not too far from Disneyland. Glad I didn't pay full price
Summary: As several people have said, this is an older hotel, but clean. It is about a 15 minute walk to Disneyland. Must be most people staying here don't have a vehicle because parking lot is small but finding a spot was never an issue.

our room was dirty the door to our room didn't close all the way the front desk staff was rude the soda machines didn't work on our floor or on the other floors so you had 2 go 2 the first floor to get anything the  "continental breakfast " was gross

The Clarion Hotel is perfect location if you are travelling to Disney. The downside of this hotel though is it is very out of date. The first problem was the loud air conditioning unit in the room. Other things were you could here the next rooms taps and toilet so there was not much if any sound proofing. And the biggest problem was the cleanliness of the room as in many placed there was a build up of dust, and stray long hairs were found in many areas such as the bedding, around the bath and in towels. We also noticed there was loud noise from people running along the corridor and graffiti in the lifts and rooms (such as the bedside drawer).

Summary Heading: Luxury Accomodations at an Economy Price
Summary: Our main concern when we came to Disneyland was being within walking distance of the hotel.  We had originally wanted to book a different hotel but our agent steered us towards the Clarion and I'm so glad he did.  The hotel was large but homey.  The continental breakfast was great and even included Disney themed waffles that you can bake yourself.  The staff was very helpful in helping us to secure shuttle passes for the days we didn't want to walk and also making sure our room was as expected.  I kept telling my husband that I couldn't believe how nice the hotel was and how inexpensive.  We had a small refrigerator that was perfect for accommodating my food because I have a lot of allergies and need to pack my own.  I had read online that the refrigerator was small but it is

The front desk staff were very very friendly and very helpful. Very kid friendly. ..nice pool area...dining room experience was great...staff treated us like we were apart of their family especially front desk attendant Charles Very close to everything. ..shopping..Disneyland...Knotts Berry Farm just few exits down freeway. Outlet shopping mall close by...everything accessible by shuttle bus or walking...room were clean and spacious and the view from the huge window was amazing as we were able to turn off lights and clearly have a great view of Disneyland Fireworks. ...I would recommend family and friends to stay here....also a big thank you to Emelys for getting us all checked in due to my reservation with expedia.com being messed up...she fixed quickly and got us into our

I wanted to take this opportunity to thank Elizabeth for her AWESOME customer service. Whenever I had a question about the area she knew the answer. If you are in need, please ask Elizabeth. Now, as for the room. It was really nice. Elizabeth had us on the 5th floor  and on our balcony we saw the fireworks from Disney each night. There were a few items that should have been fixed. Our rug in the room by the air conditioner was wet and the air conditioner itself was leaking water and formed a puddle out on the balcony. There were no chairs on the balcony and with such a great view we wished we could have sat there and watched the fireworks. We would go there again. Nothing is perfect and I believe its a great value.

We wanted an economy hotel with reasonable access to the park and we got it! What we didn't plan on was tireless and affable service from the staff.  We we particularly well cared for by Manuel, Arturo and Charlie at breakfast, lunch and dinner.   While we didn't spend much time in the hotel it was clean and more than adequate for our needs and price range.

Summary Heading: Great Hotel and Services, But the Little Things Made the Difference
Summary: First of all, the location of this hotel is absolutely fantastic. Because of its location, my friends and I were able to enjoy the nightlife of the WonderCon/Disney Area and not have to wander too far off from this hotel.  Booking through WonderCon (or rather CCI) made the process easy and the $99 a night was unbelievable. Well, turned out to be true. Upon arriving, we were told that parking in the hotel lot is an additional $14 a night. That's right, even if you're booked in this very hotel, you will still be charged an additional $14 fee to park in the building's lot.  Secondly, the wi-fi service was very bad. I was attending WonderCon for both business and pleasure, being a reporter for a film website. The wi-fi connection only sometimes worked and when it did, it was only

This was one of the worst hotels I've ever stayed in. We had a "suite" on the top floor, beneath the roof-top air conditioning unit so it felt and sounded like a helicopter was landing on our ceiling constantly. The doorknob in the bathroom was broken and my daughter got stuck in the bathroom until my husband was able to use a screwdriver he found on the floor in the closet to get her out.   The sink was plugged throughout our stay, forcing us all to wash our hands and brush our teeth over the bathtub. We did advise the front desk multiple times about the state of the sink and they sent a staff member with a plunger once but he looked at it then said he was unable to do anything about it, without even trying and left.   Despite there being four in a room, we could never get more

This is a really old hotel which in and of itself doesn't make it bad. However, I slept with the AC cranked all night and still woke up sweating numerous times. There is no Wi-Fi to speak of at this hotel. If you have to work while you're here this is not the hotel for you.

Summary Heading: Clarion Hotel Anaheim excellent overall experience
Summary: Clarion Hotel Anaheim was home to our recent visit to Southern California due to the overall excellent service and friendly vibe by the staff. They make sure your comfort is top priority. Staff is very professional and very accommodating. Something you would expect from a 4-star or 5-star hotel.

This is a sad old hotel. The breakfast buffet really needs a makeover. There is no evening Internet service! At 10 pm I tried to log on to every available Wi-Fi connection at the hotel, and none of them worked. I really needed to do business related work, and was not able to connect.  At 6 am, I could connect and do my business emails. This is unacceptable for business travel. There are not enough electrical plugs in the rooms, and the ones which are installed do not make good electrical connections, (whatever you plug in falls out!)

Arturo and all his staff were absolutely awesome! Greeted with friendly high energy personalities every morning. Their humor and desire to please was a joy to wake up to every morning.  The house keeping was very good and accommodating always making sure we had everything we needed passing by.  Hispanic gentlemen in the lounge...great bartender. Very friendly great service. Bell men also were awesome very prompt and convenient

Summary Heading: Great hotel, close to convention center & Disney
Summary: We came out for Vidcon recently and were pleased to see how close we were to the convention center and Downtown Disney. The rates for the room were affordable, restaurant and bar cannot be beat.$20.00 for a 1 item breakfast at IHOP. The next day had breakfast for 2 at the Clarion restaurant, better tasting, more food and cost the same as the boring 1 item breakfast from IHOP. Rooms are clean and spacious, staff goes above and beyond to be helpful and nice. Will definitely come back and stay again next year! Thanks friends at the Clarion, you know who you are :)

Just returned from Anaheim, where 4 of us stayed at the Clarion for 3 nights. This hotel has a good, friendly staff, but is in desperate need of updating! Stained carpet, mold in showers, peeling wallpaper..with new hotels being built in the area we won't stay here again until they go through a major renovation. The best feature is the close proximity to the Anaheim Convention Center and Disneyland.

Summary Heading: An overall better stay than last time with 1 hic-up
Summary: An overall better stay than last time.  This time the room was much cleaner and quieter .  My only complaint was I was trying to tell my husband how much better it was that last time shortly after he arrived.  I moved my luggage after being there for a couple of days and a Very Large round Cockroach (The size of a Madagascar roach)  ran out from under my bag.  I thought it was a mouse!   I killed it with my shoe and reported to housekeeping who was in the hall and showed it to housekeeping.  Luckily I keep my luggage zipped.  We were moving Hotels so I didn't worry about it too much.  I checked the outside of the bags for hitch hikers which I didn't find or see anymore that the one big roach.  What is good about the Clarion is the location to Disney,  Its convenient to the

Summary Heading: Great Rates, Excellent Service, Well Appointed Rooms
Summary: Firstly, I have traveled quite a bit. Europe, North America and the Middle East. Frankly, this has been one of the better stays in a number of hotels ranging from 3 starts to 5 stars.  I was privileged enough to stay in the 2 double bed suite on the 4th floor. First impressions are that the building was constructed a while ago, and while things are not [yesterday-new] modern, they are certainly ideal and are kept clean and maintained.  The room does have 115V power, 2 double beds, iron, ironing board and safe. A microwave, refrigerator, sink and personal coffee maker round off the mini kitchen. It also has a pull out couch and coffee table, and is complimented by a standard round table and seating for 2. Of course, Air conditioning was more than adequate for the California sun.

At the recommendation of our travel agent, we stayed here during our recent trip to Disneyland.  We upgraded to a suite, and were glad we did, as the extra sitting area was nice.  Also, when checking in, we asked for a room facing the Disney parks, and they were able to accommodate us, and put us on the top floor :)    They have a nice pool, but it was closed for repair when we were there.  They did, however, offer the pool next door as a substitute, but we never used it, as we spent a majority of our time at the parks.    There are 2 restaurants on-site.  One is only open for breakfast and Happy Hour.  They have a buffet for $9.95 with kids eating free with a paying adult.  You can also order typical breakfast items off the menu.  The other restaurant is a sports bar, with

Great price and family friendly. A little outdated, could use a revamp of the rooms. The rooms are somewhat spacious and were clean. My only complaint was that our room was right by the pool and it was very loud at all hours.

All i can say is we had slime dripping from room above and i told them several times and no one cared. Spent my money down the street the next 2 nights. Felt much safer. (From toxic waste or whatever it was) sorry clarion i was not impressed.

Front desk agent at check in was extremely nice however he upgraded us to a suite, I would hate to see the regular room because the suite had 2 double beds and there is no way someone can get into the bathroom if someone is getting ready in the mirror -tiny quarters, after being on a plane for a few hours and a shuttle I had to pee right away I used the restroom (which is outdated and dingy) only to wash my hands and there was no soap, I went into the hall to ask a maid who said she would put some in our room -that never happened neither did ever replenishing our tissue or toiletries the rest of the time we had to ask for towels, last night there we asked for a wake up call that never happened, Breakfast was always cold, servers were nice just cold eggs and potatoes every
Manager Response: On behalf of our entire team, I would like to apologize for failing to exceed your expectations. Your satisfaction is important to us and we will be using the feedback you provided to make improvements to ensure we offer an exceptional experience for our guests in the future.

Summary: The only complaint I have is that the elevator was broken almost our entire stay. We were on the top floor too. It would take almost 10min Sometimes to get the elevator to our floor. It's an older hotel and needs a little updating but it was clean and a great price. I may stay there again

The Clarion Inn worked out well for us. Check in was easy and the attendant was very pleasant and helpful. Our room was clean and the beds were comfortable. We loved the fact that the a/c and fan could run continuously as we hate the units in hotels where the units go off and on all the time, especially at night as the room gets stuffy. This unit was terrific and we were comfortable all night! We didn't use the pool but it looked inviting and people seemed to be enjoying themselves. We recommend this hotel.
Manager Response: It is always a pleasure to receive positive feedback. Thank you again for sharing your experience, and we hope your next visit will be even more pleasant than the previous one

Summary Heading: Well, at least its pretty quiet
Summary: We arrived on a Monday afternoon, for a 3-night stay with our two children. Was not happy to see two doubles as the two beds. What married couple sleeps in a double?! After returning from a long day at Disneyland the second day, was just delighted to see our room was not made up. Nothing done at all. So I called the front desk, and they sent someone up to our room while we slipped out to dinner. They just threw a few clean towels in the bathroom and pulled up the sheets.. This is pretty much the maid routine anyways the rest of the trip. The shower is exciting that it varies from ice cold to hot to warm to cold during your shower...kinda like a wheel of fortune! The decor is from 1986 and has that retro feel...if that's what you're into. But I will say this: it WAS QUIET. Nary a

I stayed there for 5 days for a conference.  The hotel was very close to the convention center.  It was less that a quarter mile to walk.  Compared to the other hotels, this hotel has great amenities and nice rooms for the price.
Manager Response: Thank you for staying with us. We look forward to having you with us again.

Summary: I wasn't looking for a 5-star hotel since we weren't planning on being in our room except to sleep.  This hotel was perfect for our needs.  It was obvious that it prefers to cater more to business clientele, but I think because it's older and a little worn, they find it necessary to supplement their bookings with other travelers.  It's not the newest or the fanciest, but it was clean and had a helpful staff.    They do charge extra for the continental breakfast and parking if it's not included in your package (book through getawaytoday.com if you want a great package deal).  The breakfast, which was included in the cost of our stay, was above-average, with an egg dish and breakfast meat each morning in addition the the standard waffle, pastries and cold cereal, but definitely
Manager Response: Thank you for sharing your experience. We will definitely address the Housekeeping issues but it seems as though your stay was great overall and we are very happy to hear that. We look forward to having you stay with us again.

Summary: We enjoyed our stay!  The only thing I have bad to say is they need more luggage carts and maybe more bell men help. Otherwise it was clean safe and meet my expectations!  I do recommend this hotel.  Also ask about the bus pass to Disney Land. No one mentioned it till I spoke the bus driver after our first day.
Manager Response: We are delighted that your stay was enjoyable. Please call us the next time you are in Anaheim.

Summary: On arrival the front staff were very happy and very helpful. The rooms were clean and tidy. The Staff when returning to hotel were happy to help. We had a nice stay and would do it again. The front desk always greeted us on our return from Disneyland.

Summary Heading: Great location. Not worth the price.
Summary: I reserved a junior suite hoping the room would be a little nicer for the price. The furniture was old and torn. Overall, outdated and worn. Cleanliness was just barely acceptable. Late check-in and early check-out. Next time I'll pay a little more and get a room at the Hilton or Marriot.
Manager Response: Thank you for sharing your thoughts. Guest feedback is very important to us and we will use this information when making our improvements. Thanks again.

Summary: Booked this hotel through Expedia and thankfully when we arrived at check-in they had overbooked and needed to move us to a nearby hotel.  Offered a 'free' dinner that evening for inconvenience which we couldn't eat.  Glad we were moved although the hotel didn't have a bar or restaurant it was much cleaner, inviting and friendly customer service.

Before our arrival I had already seen some of the reviews.  Booked the hotel through Southwest Airlines and got a pretty good deal, The staff at the front desk were not very friendly or helpful.  The rooms are old and the bathroom is itty bitty tiny.  We had a problem with the tub draining. I literally had a shower and a bath because the water would not drain. And this didn't just happen once. All rooms have double beds which is unfortunate. Used on site washer and dryer. The washer leaked everywhere.  The maids were friendly. We did not receive towels a couple of days and we were told it was because they did not have enough.  We asked the front desk to send some up and they just couldn't believe we did not receive any.  It almost felt like they thought we were lying.  Hotel is
Manager Response: Thank you for sharing your experience. I apologize that we fell short of our standards and I will definitely make sure all issues are addressed and rectified. I do hope that you will give us another try.

Summary: Staying at an inside hotel is always nicer. The restaurant was decent. They also had a arcade with only a couple of games that needed to be serviced so i think they should check those more often. The rooms had amenities like a mini fridge and microwave which is a plus to have on vacation. The rooms decor was a little outdated and kind of had an old smell but overall if i had to would stay here again, the staff was great!
Manager Response: We are happy to hear that your stay was enjoyable and look forward to having you stay with us again. Thank you.

Summary: I When we first arrived, the staff was prompt and friendly. We were informed that the "free" continental breakfast would be served, starting at 6am. We got into the room, and it seemed outdated. Every time I would move on the bed, the bed would squeak. I think it was more the frame, then the mattress. The TV didn't work (something was wrong with the signal), and there were crayon markings on the walls. The first night there, we had some time, so we decided to go to the pool - It was cold and smelt of urine. Not very appealing - needless to say, we were out of there in less than a minute. So the bathroom, I don't know when this was last renovated- but the bathrooms are TINY (especially traveling with 4 girls). There was one outlet in the bathroom area, so I couldn't dry my hair

We stayed here for a combo conference/pleasure trip.  It was very convenient to the conference I was attending which was held at the hotel next door and about $65 cheaper than staying at the conference hotel.  This hotel was also convenient to Disney.  We are from a city where we walk a lot, so it was totally walkable for us (half a mile to the entry of the resort).  There were also lots of restaurants around as well, within walking distance.  So, location was excellent.  In addition, on our last day, the hotel allowed us to keep our bags there while we walked around prior to our taxi coming to take us to the airport.  I had a couple issues with the room itself...  First, we woke up one morning at 8am to teenagers being really loud in the pool.  We were on the first floor,

I stayed here with a couple other people for Bats Day. Yes, the room could have used some updating, but it had everything we needed. However, I have a couple issues. First, they charge $9.95 for breakfast, but there are no free refills on juice. Only on coffee and soda. Even hotels that provide a FREE breakfast let you have as much juice as you want. Second, the service at the bar in the hallway was unacceptable. I ordered some food off their menu, and after waiting nearly 45 minutes, and having to ask several times where my food was, someone brought a plate of cold food to me. I told them to remake it, and less than 10 minutes later, a fresh hot plate of food was brought to me. What happened the first time? There were two bartenders and no discernable waitstaff. You place your

If zero stars were possible that us what this "hotel would receive. The pictures of the rooms on the website look nothing like the actual rooms. Hotel claims to be only a block away from Disneyland which is false. It is across the street from the parking lot, where you catch the bus and have a 10 minute bus ride to the park, so I don't want to imagine on far that walk is! The last day we were there the power was out in the "area" from 9-5 and there were no notifications to guests who would be staying there at that time. The power was on everywhere else around the hotel.

Following a bereavement,i was booked to stay here for 3 nights.I was treated well by the staff and given a nice room.Clean and comfortable and very pleasant.Shame about that i wont be going into disney thought :(

My family stayed here for our first time in Disneyland. We were excited to see what it was like and what we were going to experience. This hotel was very classy and new on the outside. It was so nice that we actually posed by the fountain. The lobby was just beautiful, we learned that it had just been remodeled and that the rooms had also been worked on. The front desk staff was unpleasant,  and we looked past that, since we only asked about something once. Check in was smooth, things went well. The halls are very nice and we could tell the place had been worked on. The moment came to open our room... IT WAS OLD AND GROSS!! It even smelled of smoke. We asked for a new room without any problems except for the front being a little snappy. Our new room had no odor, but the shower

We went to Disneyland to celebrate my sister’s engagement.  There were 5 of us total so we got the room with the two double beds and the sofa bed. The beds and pillows were fine. The tub wouldn’t drain when we showered; the water level was above the ankle when we were done and it slowly drained, it took about 20 minutes before the next person could go in. The toilet flushed for the most part but the paper didn’t always go down, so it looked like white confetti in the toilet. To me, the location isn’t ideal for Disneyland. It’s about a 15/20 minute walk but it was exhausting on the way back to the hotel so we ended up cabbing it a few times ($10 each way). It’s an ok hotel, don’t think I would stay here again or recommend it to others. It is cheaper, but when we added the extra

Close enough to walk to Disneyland each day, with a price that doesn't break the bank when you add it to the Disney tickets (we purchased a package through Get Away Today).  Staff was very nice, and the free hot breakfast every day makes the deal even better.  A bit understaffed in the restaurant, however; had to wait to be seated each day, and not enough waiters to cover the patrons.  Food was good, with enough variety to please most diners.  Rooms were basic and clean, and we had plenty of clean towels every day.  Only complaint was that the pool was not cleaned after several windy days.  It desperately needed to be skimmed; too gross for me to get in, but it didn't stop my kids.

It is located very conveniently and that is why it is priced so high. Rooms are average and so is customer service. Wi-fi is horrible. Will connect only after 6-7 attempts. Rates are exorbitant for a hotel with 3-star rating. The reception and waiting area does not look impressive for whatever reasons. Business area is OK but gym is small for the high number of guests visiting the area. Overall the hotel does not have a clean look and to add the noise is really annoying at times.

I know its a bit late but trying to catch up with all my reviews (busy bee)  i stayed in this hotel with 5 other friends back in may 2012 for 3 nights, area is very clean and tidy including the hotel grounds, room was very tidy and did not have any complaints, hotel is about a 10-15 min walk (slow walk) from shops restaurants bars etc.......which was nice.   actually going back to this hotel in september with a few friends...   you get your moneys worth.

The Clarion Hotel Anaheim Resort is very close to everything by walking, driving or catching the Anaheim Resort Transport Buses that stops outside this hotel and the staff are very helpful in everyway

Positives:  room was clean, bed was comfortable, staff was pleasant. Negatives:  water ran hot and cold, too easy to hear neighbors and hallway noise, furnishings/tile/etc. needs updating... but by far the worst:  the noise every morning of several tour busses outside the window - running loudly and constantly for the better part of an hour and tour guides yelling instructions.  Why couldn't this sort of thing take place more quietly?  Surely the hotel could complain and make this happen.  Tour busses should stop and not idle endlessly, instructions to passengers could be spoken or provided by signs until passengers are on the busses (at which point they have a PA system).
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to share your comments. I am happy to hear that you enjoyed the room accomodations and I apologize that you were disturbed by our other guests. . We appreciate hearing your thoughts. This will assist us when evaluating our guest’s needs and expectations. I hope you will come back and give us another chance to provide you with outstanding service in the future.

Summary: My boyfriend and I checked-in on Friday, April 11th. The front desk agents that afternoon were unpleasant and did not smile throughout our entire check-in. I overheard one of the ladies say to another front desk agent that she would like to speak to her ASAP and had a very angry tone. It made our check-in experience uncomfortable and unpleasant. Furthermore, a blood stained chair from the previous afternoon had been removed, however the very next morning it was put back in the very same spot in the hotel lobby. I have NEVER seen a blood stained chair ever sitting in any hotel lobby. VERY unsanitary. As a hotel employee myself, it would never be acceptable to put anything in guests sight that is blood stained. The front desk staff was not informative or helpful when we asked them

There is no "resort" about this hotel. The room smells, the lamp is broken, there is no jacuzzi tub, no free shuttle to Disneyland and no, it's not really in walking distance despite what they say, considering how much walking is done in the park. They charge you for EVERYTHING - parking, breakfast, even use of the safe in the room! I don't even know how they knew we used the safe, except that it's not keyless and you have to take the key with you when you leave. So I guess the housekeeper reports the missing key - which, by the way, if you lose, you will be charged $35.00 for. The breakfast "buffet" for $9.99 was mediocre and we did not eat there. We stayed here because they offered a room with a sofabed, which we needed. Be forewarned - the sofabed is twin-sized. The other
Manager Response: On behalf of our entire team, I would like to apologize for failing to exceed your expectations. Your satisfaction is important to us and we will be using the feedback you provided to make improvements to ensure we offer an exceptional experience for our guests in the future. I hope that you will consider staying with us again so that we can have another chance to provide you with a superior experience.

Summary: Really good stay right next to Disney and many good restaurants. Visiting college daughter at Chapman for Spring Break. Really liked the breakfast buffet - both quantity and quality outstanding. Also, front desk staff found laptop charger and went the extra mile to get it back to us. Thank you Elizabeth!
Manager Response: We are all so proud of the effort our staff makes each and every day and I will make sure to share your comments with Elizabeth. Thank you for staying with us and be sure to call us the next time you're in town.

Summary: i stayed at this hotel for four days while visiting disneyland with my husband. This hotel was clean and the staff are great. Disney is only a ten minute walk but i highly recommend purchasing a shuttle pass, after a day of walking it will save your feet. There is also an outdoor mall with movie theatre about half a mile away. The breakfast at the hotel is very affordable. They let us early check in .  Would have given five stars except it is a little dated but i would definately stay again.
Manager Response: We are all so proud of the effort our staff makes each and every day. Your kind words will go a long way to keep our team motivated. I am happy to hear that you found our location suitable for your needs. We look forward to seeing you again in the future!

Summary: We were there on business. Location was good and the price was good. It was an easy walk to the Convention center. The hotel was slightly outdated. Our room was large and we enjoyed the refrigerator and microwave.  The restaurant could have used a little help with the menu. There was often trash and room service dishes in the hallway that no one picked up.  Even though we had booked the room for two people there were not towels for two in the bathroom. The staff was helpful and friendly.  We would stay again if we needed to go back.
Manager Response: Your feedback is very important to us and we can assure you that we will use this information to do everything possible to create an enjoyable experience for each of our guests. We hope to see you again soon!

Summary: I have stayed here several times and am impressed with the location and the staff. The grounds are a bit outdated but if you can get a good price on the hotel then I would highly recommend it. Have fun at Disneyland!
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to share your comments about your recent stay at our hotel and for such a great review. I will be sure to share your comments with our staff. Thanks again.

Summary: Ok Disney stay. Easy park commute. There are charges for parking and using the safe.  It's clean. This place an OK/economical place to sleep after a long day at the parks.  Most the pop machines were broken during our stay. The busses run in front of the hotel and take you right to the park. No frills here. If the price was right I might stay there again. Yet more likely to find a hotel which did not turn there heads for the that type convention center clientele. I would not have been pleased if I had small children with me. Otherwise it was quiet and clean enough. Microwave and mini fridge in the room. You get what you pay for here clearly.

This was our second time staying at the Clarion.  It is a 30 minute walk to Disneyland. They have a buffet breakfast which is perfect before going to the park.  In the evening, the bar serves food.  We like the chicken tortilla soup. The front desk was very helpful with questions and services as well.
Manager Response: We are pleased to know that you had such a great stay, and we look forward to providing you with the same great service again in the future. Thank you for choosing the Clarion Hotel.

Summary: stayed here in november 2013 and vowed never again. had a particularly grungy room, average service, crap breakfast and vending machines that had minds of their own.  just spent a couple days there as the rate offered for 2 night last minute booking on hotel.com was too hard to pass up. started off excellent as when called in prior to arrival to ask a question, the girl was super friendly and helpful. she comped us parking making it even a better deal. we parked upon arrival at 8:30am but didn't check in until 6pm. the room wasn't quite as high a floor as we had hoped for but was cleaner than i recalled. the breakfast seems to have been vastly improved since november and the vending machines were instructed to stop stealing.  i tend to book on price and location when at
Manager Response: I am very happy to hear that you gave us another chance, thank you very much. We are pleased to hear that it was better than the last and can assure you that your next stay will be even better. We look forward to having you stay with us again.

Summary Heading: Worked Well for our School Group
Summary: I have been working in the tour/hotel/conventions industry in Hawaii and California for the past 30 years; I thought this property worked well for my son's middle school choir from Kauai, which stayed in the hotel from Friday, 3/14/14 - Wednesday, 3/20/14.  Our group was assigned to the lower floors--perfect for middle school kids who might tend to play w/elevator buttons, at the inconvenience of other guests.  When we checked out, we were allowed the convenience of storing our luggage in a banquet room until the bus came to pick us up @ 3p for a shuttle to LAX.  As for the rooms, the bathroom was small, did not have an air vent, and the shower temp/pressure was inconsistent; the beds and pillows were ok; the rooms were kept clean--even the carpets, an important factor for my
Manager Response: We're so glad you enjoyed your stay with our hotel. Thanks for taking the time to share your comments with us. Your kind words energize our staff. We look forward to having your group stay with us again. Aloha!

Summary Heading: Will use this hotel whenever I'm in Anaheim
Summary: This was my 4th time staying at different hotels for an event at the Convention Center, and I've finally found the hotel I will now use each time I come to Anaheim! It was within an easy walking distance, the staff were all very friendly & helpful, and it was quiet & clean. Stayed 2 nights with 2 friends in a room with 2 double beds & pull-out sofabed. Extra charge for the 3rd adult. All staff smiled and were personable at each interaction, but Celia at the Front Desk was especially helpful with juggling 3 people arriving and/or leaving at different times.  We were on the top floor, nice view. I never heard any neighbors. The rooms could use an update, the bathroom was a little small, there was inconsistency in the water temperature in the shower, and the toilet was inefficient.
Manager Response: We truly appreciate your kind review and I am happy to hear that you such a great stay. Please call us anytime you need another relaxing weekend away.

Summary: We recently stayed at the Clarion in Anaheim, CA.  We chose it because of its location to the Convention Center.  Customer service was really lacking there.  We never knew when the restaurant would be open, there was zero information in our room about the hotel or it's services.  It is in a great location and I hope it gets new management and updates before next year's convention.  Very disappointed.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to share your comments. We are under going room renovations starting this week and this includes our guest directories. I apologize that we didn't have the information ready during your stay. We do hope that you will give us another try to see our improvements. Again, thank you for sharing your comments.

Summary: It's not enough that the hotel is far from inexpensive, you'll have to pay more for the parking (although it was rather empty), for a crappy breakfast (with terrible service) and listen to that - for the safe in your room!!! Water in the shower where inconsistent in pressure and you need to take in consideration the occasional burn from irregular temps The fitness center is below standard  And as for the elevators - long wait, and you cannot tell if it's going up or down. Only plus - close to the convention center.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to review your recent visit to our Hotel. We appreciate hearing your thoughts and your suggestions. This will assist us when evaluating our guest’s needs and expectations. I have shared your comments with our staff. I hope you will come back and give us another chance to provide you with outstanding service in the future.

Summary Heading: Good hotel, a little far dorm Disneyland...
Summary: Stayed there this past week for a quick four night stay prior to going to Vietnam.  The room was a decent size for a family of five. The room had two double beds and a small pull out bed on the couch. A downfall is the small bathroom, the toilet and tub barely fit in the room making the closing of the door a bit awkward.  The elevator could be slow at times but never to the point that the stairs would be a better option.  We never ate in the restaurant so can't comment on that.  Unfortunately, it wasn't until our third day that we figured out the Anaheim Resort Transit. It was $19 a day for our family of five and was efficient. My only complaint was how far the hotel is from Disneyland, we are used to staying at the Park Vue but it wasn't available on such short notice.  All in

We had the best service by Arturo at the Mexicana Cafe. He was funny and offered exceptional service. We will come back to stay here just so we can visit Arturo again. Oh, the food was good too! The chicken Mexican salad was awesome and the environment was friendly and comfortable . Overall,

Summary Heading: My stay at The Clarianwas Awesome!!
Summary: I would like to start off by saying I am a Buisness Traveller so I see alot of Hotels. The Clarion is seems to be  ran like a Family Hotel. All the Empoyees seem very happy and Trulely care that you have a nice comfortable stay. The Manager is very involed with his Custumers and Employees. At the front Desk you have(Sal) who went above and beyond for me when there was a billing issue that my Company didnt follow through on. He recognized the problem at took the proper steps to resolve it in a Friendly and Professional manor. Then you have the back of the House (Naomi) who also does a great job and truley cares about there Repeat Customer's like me. Also you have a great Restuarant and Bar staff who is never to busy to talk to you and make you feel very Comfortable and Right at
Manager Response: Thank you for the 5 star review! We really appreciate you taking the  time to share your comments and even more happy to see that our staff took great care of you. Reviews like yours keep our staff motivated so thanks again. Please call us when you are ready to reserve your next business trip.

Summary Heading: Basic Hotel Walking Distance to Disneyland
Summary: I booked this hotel as part of a package deal with the 3rd night free which ended up being the best deal I could find on Presidents Day weekend.  The lobby was welcoming and check in was smooth and friendly.  Normally the parking fee is $14 per day, but with my package it was $4.00 per day.  I asked for a high floor facing Disney so we could see the fireworks.  The best they had available was the 5th floor and we could see some of them through a tree.    I have some nice things to say about the Clarion, and some suggestions.  First of all, I love to stay in hotels.  Being a mother to two young boys, it is a pampering experience for me to have someone make my bed and clean my room.  I like to stay in a place that has nicer things than my own home.   I also love breakfast made for

Summary Heading: Best value in Convention Center area?
Summary: I have made a science of trying to find the "best" hotel for my family of 5 in the Disneyland Resort area. I tried a Disney property (Paradise Pier), and a variety of Good Neighbors from Economy to Suites. While you can find rooms for under $100 a night in and around Anaheim, they are either scary/bad, or miles from the park. The Clarion was a great bargain, at around $90/night for a suite (2 full size beds plus a pull-out couch) on a prepay deal. We found the hotel to have a good mix of business-class amenities, including a very helpful bell desk where we checked our luggage on travel day and arranged a cab for our trip to the airport. There is a lounge/restaurant that was never very crowded, especially mid-day when most families are in the resort. We ate lunch there the day we
Manager Response: Thank you for the 4 star review! I am very happy to hear that you enjoyed your stay with us and our staff will be delighted to hear your kind words. We work very hard to please our guests and I am happy to see that our hard work has paid off. We look forward to having you stay with us again.

Summary Heading: Not worth the money- go cheaper for same or pay more for better
Summary: I stayed here on business.  I shared a room.  The room was clean but the bathroom is tiny- all of my co-workers reported the same.  When I say tiny, I mean it- poor design- the door to the bathroom hits the bathtub! I had to share with a co-worker and it was a nightmare trying to work around each other in sharing the bathroom.  It's true that this hotel NEEDS to be updated badly.  It's in a great location but it simply isn't worth the cash you spend for the room.  While the hotel staff is very friendly, kind and helpful- they are slow.  Check-in as well as restaurant staff.  The breakfast isn't that great either for the price.   We chose this hotel for the convenience of location to our event but we never ate breakfast or dinner here after the first day of our stay. If I had
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to review your recent visit. We appreciate hearing your thoughts and your suggestions. This will assist us when evaluating our guest’s needs and expectations. We are making some room updates in the near future so I do hope that you will give us another chance.

Summary: This is a fine property that is close to Disneyland. It was very quiet and the staff was helpful. Parking was $14.00 a night which is a little pricey. The shuttle to Disney costs $5.00 a day and is conveniently located directly outside the hotel door. They have a restaurant on site which makes breakfast very convenient.
Manager Response: We truly appreciate your kind review. Please call us anytime you need another relaxing weekend away.

Summary: I just arrived home from the airport and couldn't wait to get here. From the moment I arrived at the Clarion Anaheim I had problems. After traveling for nine hours I arrived at the hotel only to have them tell me that they could not charge the card on file for the room because they didn't physically have it in their hand (my company paid for the trip) and that they would NOT let me check in unless I paid for the room. After a round and round conversation with a snippy woman behind the desk with white-blonde hair (Rebecca Foley I believe) I ended up having to pay for one night just so I could get a key. What hotel charges you on check-in anyway? Most hotels charge for your room when you check out!  That was just the beginning. When I stepped into the room the first thing I
Manager Response: On behalf of our entire team, I would like to apologize for failing to meet your expectations. Your satisfaction is important to us and we will be using the feedback you provided to make improvements to ensure we offer an exceptional experience for our guests in the future. Each and every subject that you spoke of is being addressed and proper actions are being taken so that none of this happens again. I really do hope that you allow us another try.

Summary Heading: I love the hotel, but it seems that the rooms are a bit outdated and need to be brought up to today's standards if you are gonna
Summary: The girls that worked on both day and night shift were very friendly and accommodating there is an older man of Indian decent that works there and I think he needs to find another job. I asked a question about my reservation, he looked at me like I was stupid and wasting his time. He then lowered his eyeglasses and gave me that up and down look like what are you doing here you can't afford to stay here? He is just a straight up @$$hole. I really never complain, but this guy is a horrible asset to the hotel. Just because of that alone I probably would pay more to stay somewhere else. I stay in Laguna Beach and we came to take our 1yr old daughter to Disneyland and decided to stay in Anaheim to make it easier. It's just unfortunate that one person can ruin a whole experience.
Manager Response: I am disappointed we failed to give you the fine accommodations and consideration we strive for with all our guests. Please know that your comments have beenreviewed in detail and steps are being taken to ensure these types of issues are handled on a preventive basis. We appreciate your patronage and hope you will stay with us the next time you are in town. I can assure we will do everything we can to make your stay a comfortable and happy one.

Summary: Best stay we had. This was a family trip and it was just amazing.  the walk to disneyland was a drag but it was fun after eating so much from the disneyland, The breakfast was amazing no complaints at all.
Manager Response: We're so glad you enjoyed your stay with our hotel. Thanks for taking the time to share your comments with us. Your kind words energize our staff. Please call us when you are ready to book your next get away.

Summary: We went on a budget trip to Disneyland and wanted a cheap hotel to stay in.  Pros: clean rooms quiet for the most part cheap price! (about $70 a night) close walk to Toy Story parking lot to take their bus to Disneyland cheap food options ($5.50 for breakfast, etc)  Cons: $14 for parking every night no free breakfast loud motorcycles in parking lot at 7am (not hotel's fault, but still annoying) TINY bathroom  Overall, I'd stay there again if it was cheap enough. BUT since parking at the Disneyland parking is only $2 more a day, if I found somewhere else cheaper I wouldn't hesitate to stay there instead. $14 for parking at a hotel is insane!

The people were great!  I do think the hotel needs updating. No recepticles for charging computers or cell phones.  The bathrooms are old and the tile caulking has miildew on it.  They are also very small.  The shower heads have no pressure either.  Once again the employees were wonderful and accomodating. We will considering coming again.
Manager Response: Your feedback is very important to us and we can assure you that we will use this information to do everything possible to create an enjoyable experience for each of our guests. We hope to see you again soon! Thank you for taking the time to post a review.

Summary: Really good.  I'd stay there again for a conference.  I don't go to this area except for business, and I think it an excellent hotel both for business and pleasure.  I do think the breakfast needs healthier options.

We booked at this hotel because our frequent points program offered it and because it was literally walking distance to Disneyland (the only positive we could give it).  At check in we were first bombarded with charges:  $14/parking, $1.50 if we use the safe (why?)...  They handed us some old bizarre looking chip-keys (not the normal key cards you can keep in your purse or wallet) and then when we arrived in the room, it was old and plain.  Let's start with the tiny bathroom.  The vanity sink was disgusting.  Scratched up with black marks inside the scratches.  Old bathtub with yellow tile right from 60's I'd bet.  The beds jiggled around.  When my wife would get out of bed or move, it would shake me around.  It is not at all what I expected of a Clarion.  It's not the worst

Good things: - Hotel personnel is very professionnel, polite. - Close to everything - Nice street  Need to improve: - Hotel is old, should be renovated - Washers and dryers need to change, too old - The breakfast in hotel restaurant could be better.  DCN
Manager Response: We are all so proud of the effort our staff makes each and every day. Your kind words will go a long way to keep our team motivated. I hope you will come back and give us another chance to provide you with outstanding service in the future.

Summary: I have stayed at other Clarion Hotels in other large cities because this brand is supposed to be the top of the line for Choice Hotels.  Frankly, I have stayed at Quality Inns that were much better than this property was.  The location to Disneyland was literally the only thing that it had going for it!  You didn't have available electrical outlets to plug in your i-phone, i-pad, and necessary electronics.  The bathroom was smaller than most I've seen on some cruise ships.  It did have a business center I used for my boarding passes, but didn't offer any breakfast, complementary parking, or anything else.  The yellow tile reminded me of the 60's and the popcorn ceiling reminded me of Motel 6.  It really needs an overhaul!  Price wise, I should have stayed at the Hilton across
Manager Response: Thank you for takeing the time to review your stay. This will assist us when evaluating our guest’s needs and expectations. I hope you will come back and give us another chance to provide you with outstanding service in the future.

Summary: My wife and I went to a concert at the House of Blues and needed a place to stay after. Being that we are locals, we didn't have the pressures of travel or kids. The hotel is easy to find. The staff was friendly, professional and swift. We were in our room in about 5 minutes. The room was nice, clean and everything was in working order. Check out was swift as well. My wife and I were on a date night but I would bring the kids back for a stay-cation. All in all we had an awesome experience
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to share your experience. We are happy to hear that you enjoyed your room accomodations and we have taken note of your feedback regarding the bathroom and breakfast. We will be sure that these items are reviewed and addressed.

Summary: As always, where is it:  LATITUD:  33°47'56.76"N LONGITUD: 117°54'58.19"O  This is a nice hotel "near" Disneynald. It is really old but it is well cared so it does not show the age. You may think it is near from disney BUT the main gates are about 1.42km (0.88 miles) away so is not that close. There is public transportation but 99% of tourist walk their way to the parks.  The GOOD!  - It is "near" the Disney parks, however there are some other hotels at lower price and closer - It looks kind of fancy and you feel you ar in a 5 star or more hotel - The staff is efficient and kind - Allways hot water - Never had a problem with stolen goods or bad room service - It has a tiny business room with free internet with 2 computers at reasonable speed. - It is an old hotel but they manage

Summary Heading: Clean and that's just about it
Summary: We go to Disneyland every year and like to stay at a different place to get the best values. I got a rate of $71 per night which aligned with my experience.  Pros: Cost Location-right across from Toy Story Lot which we take rather than ART so you save $$ there Always had hot water It was clean Sleep quality was there Easy check-in/check-out  Cons: Bathroom area was so small you could hurt yourself. It was the size of an airplane bathroom and that's no exaggeration. There was so much wasted space that could have been utilized for the bathroom. Sorely in need of an upgrade! Seriously, had yellow tile in bathtub that I'm sure was original (cracked and caulked over and over and over). The breakfast was the worst I've ever had. I paid $10 for hot buffet. It was freezed dried eggs

I booked four nights at the Clarion for a convention.  It was an excellent value for the cost.  I requested minimal care, since I don't like to have a towel whisked away as soon as I touch it, as if I had cooties.  I'm an environmentalist and like to save on laundry and supply costs, monetarily and time wise.  I also like the idea of keeping costs and fees down for the hotel.  I spoke with Evangelina, the housekeeper, and the front desk.  My wishes were honored.  It made me feel at home.  On the third day of my stay I got a message from my husband that his best friend had died suddenly.  I immediately packed and checked out in the early afternoon.  The receptionist was a tall, dark and handsome man who was also empathetic and kind.  I was not charged for the day even though
Manager Response: We're so glad you enjoyed your stay with our hotel. We agree that our entire staff work hard to make each guest's stay remarkable, one guest at a time. Thanks for taking the time to share your comments with us. Your kind words energize our staff.

Summary: We stayed at this hotel Dec 4th through the 7th. it was ok.  The room was a "suite" 2 full size beds and a fold out couch.  The hotel is definitely showing its age and in desperate need of updating.  I cant say it was bad but cant say it was wonderful.  The front desk staff was very nice and incredibly helpful.  The rooms were clean.   Would we stay here again.. probably not .. for the amount of money we spent there after the daily parking fee and having to buy breakfast ..for a couple bucks more per night we would have been able to stay at a better hotel that offered a free daily breakfast.  If you are looking for a place with no frills to lay your head.. this would fit the bill but be aware you can probably find the same thing else where with a hotel that may give you a little

Summary: The hotel was next to the one where my Christmas party was and cheaper to boot. When we asked for more coffee, the employee at the desk was very friendly as were the ones who handled my check-in and check-out.

Summary Heading: The extra charges can add up
Summary: A bit old but the room was ok and clean. The windows were too thin since we could hear a freeway that was a mile away. The pool was clean and had good hours. Parking was an extra $14.00 per day (thankfully we're Choice hotel Gold members so it was complimentary for us.) The standard Choice hotel breakfast, which is normally free, cost $9.00. Not many breakfast options within walking distance. Disney is about a half-mile walk.
Manager Response: We truly appreciate you taking the time to share your experience and really appreciate your patronage as an Elite Gold member. Please call us anytime you need another relaxing weekend away.

Summary: A standard quality for a Clarion hotel. The building is pretty old but it's only reflected by some details. The elevators on the other hand are going to be your daily nightmare: they seem to never be available when you try to call one! ;)

Summary: Hotel looks like it trap in the 80's in the interior. Linens are well used and looking like the could have be there since the 80's. The Breakfast room was a mess and under staff. The 10.00 charge was so not worth the breakfast we received, Go around the corner to Carl's Jr. much better and less expensive. Only look impressive at night the lighting hide how old and out dated it is.

Tried to park in the back where there was more room, but the room keys would not work to open the door by the conference rooms.  Had to lug all of my stuff around to the main entrance - not convenient in that respect.  Partook in the continental breakfast twice.  The first morning I went in and was asked if I wanted coffee (included), but I have an allergy to coffee, so I asked if I could substitute orange juice.  I was brought my OJ and was charged $1.75 on my check.  I guess that I should

Summary: I stayed here for Blizzcon 2013 and really enjoyed this hotel after staying at a few other hotels in the area in the past. The location cannot be beat it was sooo convenient to get to food and the convention center. The staff were extremely helpful! Perry down in the lobby was just beyond helpful in getting a cab set up to take me back to the airport. I just gave him a time and my room number and he took care of the rest, impeccable service! My only complaint was the tap water in this area is enough to make you sick! Bring bottled water the vending machine on my floor was always sold out of water haha!
Manager Response: We are all so proud of the effort our staff makes each and every day. Your kind words will go a long way to keep our team motivated. We look forward to seeing you again in the future!

Summary: Stayed at the Clarion because I was attending a conference at the convention center and Marriott hotel.  The room was fine but unremarkable.  Wanted to stay an extra night and the first clerk I spoke with said I'd have to check out and then check back in?????   Asked someone else the next day and they made the change without any fuss.  The bar could use a bit of updating.  We did not eat in the hotel other than some snacks at the bar during the world series.  The Clarions was quite a bit less expensive than the Marriott, but I would probably seek out other hotels if I stayed in the area again.  An unremarkable experience.

Summary: Great location walking distance of disney parks. Close to restaurants and has own restaurant that is reasonably priced. Great pool. Has Internet cafe and free wifi. Staff always spoke and were polite and helpful. A great base to explore from. Rooms are ok but not the best could do with a reverb If I'm being honest but are quiet.

Lobby, elevators, stairways,rooms,bedding, etc. are all outdated. Is it livable and safe to stay there..Yes! Is it nice and value for price...not really!! In addition to condition of hotel, the staff, especially the front desk is in need of Training. They displayed a lack of customer service that one would expect with all the other options in the area. Border line rude, every question was like a pain for them to answer, 90% of time they were on phone!
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to review your recent visit. We appreciate hearing your thoughts and your suggestions. This will assist us when evaluating our guest’s needs and expectations. I hope you will come back and give us another chance to provide you with outstanding service in the future.

Summary Heading: Great location for conference at the Convention center
Summary: This hotel worked great for a conference I went to at the Anaheim Convention center which is right next door.  Has a great breakfast in the morning and all the staff that I dealt with was extremely helpful and courteous.  Location is also great if you want to go to Disneyland as thats only about a block away, which makes this a great alternative to some of the far more expensive options that are also near Disneyland.
Manager Response: We are pleased to know that you had a great stay, and we look forward to providing you with the same great service again in the future. Please keep us in mind the next time you travel to Anaheim. Thank you.
