Summary: Stayed 5 nights for conference. Easy 2 minute walk to convention centre - and 15 minutes to Disney.  Concierge support desk was very helpful, but reception desk is struggling to be very civil.  Restaurant has 'breakfast' - lots of sugar based cereals to start you day in the USA- and the coffee really does set a tone for the rest of the USA (BLAH)...  service in restaurant is good and friendly. Good WiFi access and generally does the job.

Good location, 10 minute walk from Disney.  Hotel is very dated and in need of some work, however still very clean.   Had good service from the concierge when booking an LA trip.  We found the breakfast buffet to be wanting, it felt like little effort was made.
Manager Response: Your kind words will go a long way to keep our team motivated. We look forward to seeing you again in the future!

Summary: I have recently returned from a 7 night stay at the Clarion and was so happy with my experience of the hotel that I wanted to write this review. I travelled with my husband and 2 children and I must admit having read previous reviews I was unsure what to expect. We booked it as part of a package through British Airways as it was great value for money. On arrival the hotel lobby is large and welcoming and the reception staff were friendly and helpful. Our room was average size with 2 standard double beds which were very comfortable. The room itself was a little dated but that really didn't matter as it was clean. The room was serviced each day and was always spotlessly clean, with fresh towels daily. We ate breakfast in the hotel a few times, this was ok but not much choice or
Manager Response: We truly appreciate your kind review. Please call us anytime you need another relaxing weekend away.

Summary: Me and my wife stayed here for 8 nights and for the price we paid we weren't expecting much, and reading other reviews we were not sure what to expect. However we were pleasantly surprised the staff were friendly and helpful and the room although slightly dated was clean and had all of the facilities we needed. The other hotel facilities were also good. The hotel is in a great location for disneyland and it's surrounding entertainment and restaurants.We had a very enjoyable stay and would certainly return here again.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to inform us about your stay. We are very happy to hear that you enjoyed staying with us. We look forward to seeing you again.

Summary Heading: Clean and comfortable room, friendly and professional staff
Summary: I was attending a conference at a nearby hotel and stayed at the Clarion for half the price of the conference hotel. I was very pleased by the comfortable room and cleanliness of the hotel, as well as the excellent staff. I needed to stay an extra night and the woman at the desk went out of her way to book the same room at the same rate, remembered me and followed up on it the next day. I ended up staying four nights, and everything about my stay was perfect.

Hotel staff was the best. Both friendly and accommodating! My room was nice on a high floor with wrap around windows. Only problem was at the time I was there.... The top floors were very warm. Both rooms and hallways. Seemed as if one elevator was being fixed, so waiting was longer than usual. Great location. Near Disneyland and Angel Stadium. Steps to Anaheim Convention Center!!

Summary Heading: Nice place for a weekend stay
Summary: Did a weekend trip to visit Disneyland one final time this year.  The property isn't too far of a walk away from the park and you do have the option of Anaheim Resort Transit if you don't want to walk.  The bus comes by approx. every 20 min., and stops right outside the main entrance.  Very convenient.   The rooms are very clean and comfortable.  No real complaints at all, other than the fact that you have to pay $1.50 a day to use the room safe - and that was just a very minor annoyance if anything. Staff was nice and courteous. Would recommend.

Found this hotel nearby Disneyland for a decent price..first off counter help was rude..we booked a room and were ready to catch some sleep for our big day at Disneyland. Got to our room was not very clean the bathroom had hair in the corners of the counter. Then upon checking the rest of the room along the corners of the wall were dead cock roaches!! Nasty. Needless to say we requested our money back.. They were openly goin to upgrade or room..but their were none avail.. They actually said they were going to move some people around..they were goin to kick someone out of a room to make is happy.. We told them no thanks we don't want to ruin someone  else's weekend..just requested a refund and went on our Mary way.. Not a great way to start off a honeymoon!

Our room was decent-sized and had all of the usual amenities, although the finishes are a bit tired. Still, everything was clean and in working condition. We even had a small balcony. I wouldn't choose this hotel if I was spending much time in the room, but it was great for Disneyland.  It is less than a mile away and walkable down Harbor Blvd., although I wouldn't recommend it for small children. The #6 bus stops in front of the hotel every 20 minutes and takes you to Disneyland. I recommend buying a pass for the time you are there. The deluxe continental breakfast (free with our package) was fine, and the coffee was very good. There is a gym, a pool, and a bar, but we didn't use those. They charge $1.50 for use of the in-room safe.

Great hotel for the price.  Took a 5 minute transit ride from right out side the front door of the hotel to Disneyland.  The hotel staff was very friendly.  Our room was not ready at 4pm, however, I wasn't too angry because the room itself was great.  We had the king suite complete with kitchen and couch.  The couch was a little ratty, they could use a revamp, but the bed was so completely comfortable nothing else mattered. All around, would stay again.

Upon entering our room on the third floor we found a HUGE bug - about 3.5 inches long. They gave us another room on the 5th floor. During the day we found two bugs in that bathroom and then in the middle of the night I found 2 more cockroaches in the bathroom again. AFter they came up to our room and confirmed that the bugs were infact cockroaches they then moved us at 3:30 am to yet a third room on the 8th floor. I have NEVER had this problem in any other hotel in my life and will NEVER go back to this hotel. Stay away.
Manager Response: I reviewed your comments regarding your stay at our hotel. We take great pride in our hotel and in the services we offer and I am disappointed to hear that we fell short of your expectations. We are constantly striving to improve our product and services, and it is through comments like yours that we are able to recognize any deficiencies that may exist and correct them. We apologize if this was not the case during your stay and have reviewed the room inspection process with the Executive Housekeeper to ensure our strict standards are maintained at all times. We conduct an inspection of our guest rooms with our Housekeeping staff on a daily basis. We also conduct ongoing training with our Housekeeping staff to recognize and report any issues that may arise. Furthermore, we call on our certified pest management company to also inspect our hotel as a proactive measure.  Again, we apologize for any inconvenience you experienced with us and hope that you will consider the Clarion Anaheim again if ever staying in Anaheim in the future. Thank you for taking the time to share your comments with us because we are always looking for ways to improve our hotel.

Summary: Just recently stayed at the Clarion.  This hotel was basic, clean and in a great location.  We walked across the street to the Disney parking lot and caught the shuttle bus from there and sometime we walked the 3 blocks to Disney. Another option was the Anaheim Resort Transit but you can save the money and go to the parking lot. The bed was comfy...might have liked bigger pillows, the drapes had a few threads hanging down which if they cut off might help the look.   The room was quiet and we had a nice view of the pool.  The bathroom was on the smaller side but so are the bathrooms of a lot of hotels. We ate a couple times at the restaurant and had good service, good food at a decent price. We enjoyed one day at the pool, lots of chairs and the pool was the perfect temperature.
Manager Response: We truly appreciate your kind review. Please call us anytime you need another relaxing weekend away.

Summary: The hotel really could use a revamp but it is in an excellent location for the Disney attractions (maybe 600 yards) and seems to be still doing a roaring trade. Should be in the lower price range of the hotels in this vicinity. At a price comparable with the Howard Johnson, would be reasonable/good value.
Manager Response: We appreciate hearing your thoughts and your suggestions. We do hope that you return in the future to see our imrpovements. Thank you again.

Summary: We stayed in adjoining rooms to create a suite for 6.  It was GREAT!  Rooms were clean, nicely appointed with excellent access to Disneyland - a quick, inexpensive trip by bus.  Average wait is about 20 minutes.  Personnel were friendly.  Lauren, Celia, and Emelys at the front desk were helpful and accommodating.    The restaurant breakfast buffet was convenient and quite delicious with quick and gracious service.    We'll be back here on our next visit!
Manager Response: We're so glad you enjoyed your stay with our hotel. We agree that our entire staff work hard to make each guest's stay remarkable, one guest at a time. Thanks for taking the time to share your comments with us. Your kind words energize our staff.

Summary: Where to begin.   First, the various travel websites don't have a disclaimer about parking for $14/night for guests. You can get a reduced rate of $4/night if you join the "Choice Rewards" program  Second, the room is fairly clean. Sink and vanity are outside of the bathroom. The bathroom itself is ridiculously small. It houses the toilet and bath. Luckily I'm an average sized person but still found difficulty closing the door. If you're a person of size, plan on standing in the tub to close the door.   Third, trash cans are emptied but not clean. I saw some questionable stains in my trash cans.   Fourth, this hotel boasts an "office center". Their computer doesn't really work and to print, staff asked me to email my documents to the hotel email and they would print for me
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to review your recent visit. We appreciate hearing your thoughts and your comments with respect to business center and the bathroom in your room . This will assist us when evaluating our guest’s needs and expectations. I hope you will come back and give us another chance to provide you with outstanding service in the future.

Summary: i was really worried after reading the reviews ....In the last 3 months we have been to 3 cities and 3 different hotel chains one of which was the weston st francis in san fransico lets just say the bathroom was cleaner here you don't get a hotel room in anaheim to spend much time in the room  We got to the hotel around 10:00 in the morning and the lovely desk clerk said no problem and gave us a room if we didn't mind the 2 floor, Turns out it was really close to the elevator which was great. the rooms were very clean and the bathtub shone okay the down side ,the drapes were ratty and the bathroom vent was dirty but at these prices what do you expect.... oh and it is a fair walk to the park but the shuttle was very good
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to review your stay with us. I am happy to hear that your stay was enjoyable.We take great pride in being able to offer a clean room to our guests. Please contact us on your next visit to anaheim.

Summary Heading: Bad room, bad service, bad food. Won't come back even for free
Summary: Staff didn't greet us ever throughout our stay. Upon check in our room number was given to us on a ripped piece of poorly photocopied paper (see picture). Rooms are not well maintained. See pictures.  Went once for breakfast. Consisted of cold hard boiled eggs and waffles that you had to make yourself. Pastry was stale. No buns, No breads, No bacon, No cheese of any kind! Took them almost until we finished to get us some toast. Plastic bucket on buffet. Bananas were black. See pictures.  It doesn't look like anyone in here is trained or qualified to do what they are doing. I guess any granny b&b would beat anything of this hotel.

Cracks in caulking and black molds in them. Not well maintained. Check the pictures. Rusty air outlets. Would expect it only in a ghetto. Check the pictures attached. Cleanliness is the most important basic principles. If that is lacking nothing else matters.
Manager Response: I am disappointed we failed to give you the fine accommodations and consideration we strive for with all our guests– the type of service in which we pride ourselves. Please know that your comments have been reviewed in detail and steps are being taken to ensure these types of issues are handled on a preventive basis. We appreciate your patronage and hope you will stay with us the next time you are in town to see our improvements.

Summary: You recognize a good hotel not only by a look at the rooms but also through the actions when something goes wrong. And therefore the Clarion Hotel Anaheim Resort had so far the worst service I've ever received.  We booked 2 rooms in the Clarion Hotel Anaheim Resort, via clever-hotels.com (not so clever yuup) and paid already months before the trip. The company behind clever hotels (Navelar) was gone into administration. Don't get me wrong that's NOT Clarions fault but their actions made everything  worse.   I got in contact with the hotel and asked if they can confirm that the rooms are still booked, because Navelar told all customers that their bookings will be canceled. The answer from Clarion was rooms are still booked, but we should contact Navelar to get a clarification
Manager Response: Thank you for bringing your matter to our attention. I apologize that we weren't able to accomodate your request. I know that we currently have your name on a waiting list and should rooms become available we are happy to contact you and allow you to re-reserve a reservation with us.

Summary: Entrance and lobby redone nicely. But room was poor. The leading edge of the drapes on both sides was worn right through -- very shabby. The top drawer of the dresser was broken apart at the back and bottom, though it still worked (poorly) so it may have been like that for a long time. The beds were new, clean and comfortable.   The bathroom was old (40 years), but had a newer tub and a new toilet.  A curly blonde hair hung from the heat light in the bathroom and was only visible when that light was on. It was about 10-inches long, so stretched out, it would have been almost twice that.  Pool area looked good and well-maintained, but I never used it and saw no one else using it. Room service wasn't good. Their idea of a made bed wasn't as neat most guests would expect, and they
Manager Response: Thank you for bringing the concerns about your room accomodations to our attention. We will make sure those items that didntt meet our normal standards are looked at and fixed. We look forward to you staying with us again to see our imrpovements. Thank you for taking the time to rate your stay.

Summary: We took our family to Disneyland, and we stayed at the Clarion for the first time. We stayed for five days straight. Its Walking distance to the park, but since we have a little one we decided to take the bus located across the street of the hotel. It leaves you in front of Disneyland and California Adventure parks. The hotel is conveniently close to many stores and restaurants. The staff at the front desk are accommodating. Our room was clean, and best of all the beds where so comfortable. The blankets and pillows smelled fresh and where soft. My family noticed the same, and we love our beds at home. We have stayed at other hotels and their beds have been clean but adequate, stiff, or nothing to talk about. We had a good nights sleep, all five nights we stayed at the Clarion in
Manager Response: Your home away from home is how we like our guests to feel and we are happy that you enjoyed our comfortable bedding. Great to hear that you found our surroundings accomodating and very convenient. Thank you for the 5 star review. We will see you again!

Summary: The pictures on your website certainly is misleading. The queen side beds are at best queen singles. We entered the rooms to a very unpleasant odour so were forced to leave the sliding door open for a couple of hours. The bathroom is no bigger than a telephone booth. Due to the location of the hotel(on the corner) guests are continually kept awake by the idling buses and trucks that stop at their allocated parking across the road. I have never written a review on any Hotel before in my many years of worldwide travel however felt compelled on this particular instance. This would have to be my worst hotel experience ever and has really spoilt our vacation. We won't be returning.Good luck to your future guests.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to let us know about your stay. I apologize that you didn't find your room accomodations to be fair and I appreaciate you bringing this to our attention. Your comments go along way in helping us improve. We do hope that you give us another try in the future to experience our improvements.

Summary: We were in LA for a wedding and needed a base that was accessible from different parts of LA.  The rooms were comfortable, the hotel is close to Disneyland, and the eating options for dinner within walking distance were pretty good.  Breakfast was a bit of a different story, but we found things around.  The front desk staff were good for information on shopping malls to travel to nearby, and gave us information on shuttle buses.  This was great as we needed to pick up some things before the wedding, and wanted some things for when we travelled back home (Japan).  I'm finding the complaints for this place pretty hilarious because for the cost, it was great value.  We spent around $135 a night for this hotel, and the size of the room is much larger than what we are used to.
Manager Response: We are delighted that you had such a great experience and truly appreaciate you giving our hotel a great review. We look forward to you staying with us again.

Summary: My own fault for not checking reviews before booking. Found great Internet deal for quickly planned Disneyland vacation with nephew. Per-paid for three nights. Arrived and was surprised, because lobby is extravagant looking. That feeling disappeared quickly as soon as we got on outdated elevators. Room (2 double beds) was clean, but smelled funny. Bathroom sink did not drain. Hotel fixed drain as soon as I advised of problem. Then I checked my bank account to verify other transactions, and saw Clarion was billing me again for room I had per-paid for, and even a higher price. Mgmt stated they would cancel transaction. Just a very lousy room in general. If all you care about is a cheap place to sleep, this wasn't terrible. But I will spend more in the future rather than stay here.
Manager Response: We appreciate your feedback and we are working hard to offer our guests the fine accomodations that you and they deserve. Your input is important to us and our staff will be happy to see that you enjoyed their servie. We look forward to having you stay with us again.

Summary: Having read previous reviews before going here two weeks ago was expecting the hotel from hell ! Lo and behold it was a fantastic experience. Checking in girl on desk was very helpful and friendly. Room was on the fifth floor (538) overlooking entrance to hotel. Very nice with two queen sized beds, fridge, table and two chairs, nice big flat screen tv. Vanity area separate from toilet so could use this area when someone was using shower or toilet. Nice location for the parks, could either walk up street for about a mile to parks and some shops and restaurants. Could also come out front of hotel turn left and follow road round then turn left and walk this way to downtown disney a matter of 10mts ( depending how quick walking ).  Downside was size of pool, okay when quiet but
Manager Response: We are very happy to hear that you enjoyed staying with us. Thank you for the five star review! When you are ready for another trip please consider staying with us again.

Summary: We have been here many times before. This time we found that the queen beds were removed, replaced with doubles, the queen headboards still in place.. The coffee pot is no longer available, in its place is a one cup brewer, and only one coffee. The ceramic mugs replaced with paper cups. My Mother is disabled, so we always stay in the same room for the roll in shower. We are shocked at the changes. Don't think we will be returning to this hotel again. On a plus note the staff are very friendly and helpful, and room service is good. Though the menu has changed. For the price, I expected better.
Manager Response: Thank you for your comments. Our staff will be very happy to hear that you enjoyed their services and your feedback about our restaraunt will be shared as well. We do hope that you will stay with us again.

Summary: From all my years of travelling, I will admit this was my worst experience of all time. When I checked in, I had requested in, I had requested a quiet room given that I am sensible sleeper. The room was good, however when I came back from Disneyland, there was a cricket in the room making noise in the room, and nowhere to be found. I was forced to move to other room which was very noisy, and after I requested again to change because I needed a quiet, I was changed once again into a noisy room, and the night supervisor never bothered to help me with the luggage, he just brought the bell cart and left. Note that I am a 120 pound small person, and I needed help with this. The next day, I requested some one again to assist me with my luggage given that I had an early flight, once
Manager Response: Hi Pedro, thank you for taking the time to share your experience. I apologize that we did not offer the best service that we are use to practicing. I will address your comments with our staff to ensure that we learn from your experience and it does not happen again.

Summary Heading: Great place to stay that is affordable!
Summary: We reserved this room on Hotwire under their secret hot deals in which we had to pay for the room before knowing the name of the hotel. We have 4 kids and were staying to enjoy the theme parks so we didn't need fancy amenities. We were pleasantly surprised with this hotel. Yes it is old and could use remodeling but it is very quiet and the beds are comfortable. We had a fold out couch and a crib in this spacious room and never felt the space wasn't adequate. The entire staff were so great and we even had the bell desk reserve our shuttle back to the airport which was an easy process. They have a shuttle that picks up people right outside the hotel and takes you to Disneyland. Very easy and convenient. The only complaint we had were the laundry facilities. There were only 2
Manager Response: We are happy to hear that you enjoued your stay with us. We look forward to having you stay with us again on your next trip to Anaheim.

Summary: I'll give them a two because the beds were comfortable--but, wait, the beds were only double size!  When I asked to upgrade to two queens I was told there were no queens on the property.  So there goes another $15 a night for a roll-away.  The hot breakfast buffet was. . . hot.  That's about all I can say about it.  The pancakes were rubbery.  At least the coffee was drinkable.  Here's the capper: one day we had returned from the park to swim and rest.  The housekeeping service had not come yet--no big deal.  At about 6:00 we left to go back to the parks and I asked the front desk simply to replace the towels and empty the trash.  I wasn't worried about new bedding.  They said they would.  At 11:30 at night. . . still not done.  I know, you get what you pay for.  We certainly
Manager Response: I am very sorry that we failed to give you the fine accmodations that you derserved. Please know that we are reviewing your comments and are taking steps to make sure this does not happen again. Thank you for taking the time to review your stay.

Summary: We stayed while vacationing from Disneyland. I didn't read the reviews about this hotel until just a few days before arriving. I must say that I was a little nervous based on what I had read. Upon arrival, we were impressed not only by the friendliness of the staff, but by how nice the room was as well. Because it was our first trip to Disneyland, we had a lot of questions for the ladies at the front desk and they were always helpful with getting our questions answered. The room well a great size, the beds were comfy, and was very clean. We especially liked the fact that the hotel was located walking distance to Disneyland, restaurants, and convenient stores. Not only that, but because it is on a main road, it was very easy to take public transportation to the Outlet mall

Summary Heading: Perfect for Disneyland or Convention Center
Summary: Just got back from a trip for a Convention, and added Disneyland to my schedule.  Its a short walk to the convention center.  And the ART bus picks up and drops off at the front of the hotel (on the street side) for a ride to Disneyland.     I got a king-size bed room and everything was neat as a pin. And the wi-fi was great just had to re-log into it every time you wanted it. The staff was very friendly and my room was ready an hour earlier, good thing because my flight had changed.  The coffee in the place downstairs is ok, but both the Hotels next door have a Starbucks so I enjoyed a nice morning walk.  Parking is additional but being this close to Disney there are no free parking spots.  And if you don't want to pay the $3 for a bus ticket you can walk across the street to
Manager Response: I am happy to hear that you found our amenities and location to be perfect for your stay. We look forward to having you stay with us again!

Summary Heading: Take the negative reviews with a grain of salt
Summary: I booked the hotel  through a olotels at an amazingly low rate. We were going to  the D23 (Disney fan) convention and were mostly interested in being close to the convention center. I kept thinking to myself "whats the catch,why the low rate?"so I read the reviews. As Disneyland fans we have stayed in some pretty nasty Anaheim area hotels and from the reviews, I thought we were booked in yet another. I think the bad reviews were exaggerated at best. The hotel is definitely in need of a renovation, but the rooms were neat, clean and big enough so that we weren't bumping into each other.The staff was friendly (even remembering our names and room number when we messed up our parking pass) and very hard working.We did have a problem with the mini fridge, but we called downstairs and
Manager Response: We are all so proud of the effort our staff makes each and every day. Your kind words will go a long way to keep our team motivated. We look forward to seeing you again in the future!

Summary: Booked here for family vacation to Disneyland and checked in 8/2 got eaten alive by BED BUGS friday night and saturday night, finally relized omg it's bugs, went down to hotel desk and clerk didn't seem to be to surprised..  Told them they were going to pay for me to do my laundry and that I would not be staying anymore (oh yeah offered to move me to another room really what makes you think I would stay after being eaten alive), took picture of bed and wow lots of them, fuji water bottles under beds and lots and lots of garbage dust etc....  went to different hotel and they put us up for another night so we could do our disneyland days on monday and tuesday we were suppose to do sunday and monday but was doing laundry all day to get rid of whatever had attached to our clothes
Manager Response: I reviewed your comments regarding your stay at our hotel. We take great pride in our hotel and in the services we offer and I am disappointed to hear that we fell short of your expectations. We are constantly striving to improve our product and services, and it is through comments like yours that we are able to recognize any deficiencies that may exist and correct them. We apologize if this was not the case during your stay and have reviewed the room inspection process with the Executive Housekeeper to ensure our strict standards are maintained at all times. We conduct an inspection of our guest rooms with our Housekeeping staff on a daily basis. We also conduct ongoing training with our Housekeeping staff to recognize and report any issues that may arise. Furthermore, we call on our certified pest management company to also inspect our hotel and can assure you that the hotel does not have a bed bug problem.  Again, we apologize for any inconvenience you experienced with us and hope that you will consider the Clarion Anaheim again if ever staying in Anaheim  in the future. Thank you for taking the time to share your comments with us because we are always looking for ways to improve our hotel.

Summary: We had purchased a packaged deal for disneyland tickets , and hotel stay. We had 2 rooms which were neat and clean. We had requested rooms that were close to each other we were accomated they were right beside each other. We had requested a roll away bed which was brought up to the room as soon as we checked in.The rooms are basic two DOUBLE beds , chairs and small table. small bathroom.  Perfect for our stay.  We needed some where clean and decent to sleep and shower. I was surprised at how many towels were in the bathroom,usually at other hotels we are chasing down the maid to get some more. The staff was helpfull and friendly. Overall this hotel was a good value and a decent place to stay.  I would stay again.

They mistakenly put us in two different rooms during a 3 day stay. A hotel employee approached my daughter while she was in the room alone and demanded that she remove the belongings for FOUR people immediately. She was scared and upset and I had to leave a session that I was attending at the D23 Expo.  The clerk at the front desk apologized and offered a free dinner and to comp our parking. We still had to change rooms, although we were upgraded to a "suite", same size beds, the room was maybe 10 square feet bigger. When I checked out, I asked for a receipt to make sure we weren't charged for parking. I was told that I did not need a receipt, as there were no charges to my card and that the parking was comped. Checked my credit card statement today and I WAS charged for parking

I recently had a vacation at Disneyland and bought a  vacation package deal that included a 2 night stay at the Clarion Hotel. The room had a great view to the Disney fireworks at night. The room was also very clean and neatly stocked with towels. The clerk at the front desk was very friendly. He answered all our questions with patience. I remember his name was Salvador. We would always lose our exit park pass and he would always replace it without any annoyance (which was refreshing)! The staff would let the kids swim in the pool a little longer after the 10pm closing time, and they even provided towels downstairs. Overall I give the hotel a rating of 5. I had a great experience there, and in my family vacation. I would recommend it.

Hotel is clean but dated.  The beds are old but ok after a long day at the Disneyland Resort.  The hotel does not offer a free breakfast unless you purchase the package and I do not believe that it is worth the 14.99 that they were charging if you did not have the package deal.  The hotel charges for parking even for handicap guests.  In my opinion there are much better hotels in the area for the same price that offer free parking and breakfast and are overall nicer.  One plus is that the ART picks up right in front of the hotel.  Did not like that when I asked for a key to be left for the other half of my party I was told ok and then when they arrived key no where to be found.  Also had to call to front desk for an item for the room and had to physically walk down to get it.

We stayed here as part of a convention at the nearby convention center.  Not only was the correct room type I had requested not available upon check in - they wanted to charge me to add a roll away bed to accommodate our 3rd person!   The rooms were so small we could only fit the rollaway if we moved end tables on top of one another.  To make it worse the laundry room flooded and about 3 inches of water was on the floor.  It took 5 attempts to get the desk staff to do something about it.  The only positive was the maid staff which were very friendly.

I arrived at the Clarion with my grand-daughter at 10am after a 13 hour flight from Australia.  So we were very tired.  The woman at reception seemed to delight in lecturing me that check-in was not until 4pm, but then with no comment gave me the keys to a room which was available.  Why didn't she make a plus out of the fact that she could help me immediately, rather than make me think that we would have to sit around in the lobby for hours?  Over the next 24 hours I discovered that this was the norm for the front desk staff.  They all seemed miserable and resentful of the imposition of having to deal with customers.  They should be sent to charm school. The hotel itself suited my purposes fine.  A bit tired, but good-sized room and clean.  Moderate distance from Disneyland, but
Manager Response: I am very sorry that we failed to give the best customer service that we strive for. I will share your comments with our staff to insure that we are putting our best foot forward and offering the best customer service to all of our guests.

Summary Heading: Not what I expected of a hotel adjacent to a convention center...
Summary: Check in time was 4pm, and I arrived early. However, I was nearly late to my meeting because my room wasn't ready until almost 5pm.  The room offered a large dorm-type fridge, which was GREAT! Also a hairdryer and decent size in-room safe. The flat screen TV was nice. Lots of plumbing issues: The toilets in the hotel don't flush completely (they appear to, but then things tend to float back up); the shower temperatures fluctuate drastically from freezing to scalding hot, no matter how you adjust the faucet. The bathrooms are also very small (like the door almost hits the toilet as you close it). The coffee maker is in the bathroom, which to me is a bit gross, so I didn't use it (but wanted to note that it is available). Maintenance was very fast to come about my toilet flushing
Manager Response: Thank you for staying with us. I am happy to hear that you found our location and room amenities benificial to your needs. We look forward to having you stay with us again.

Summary Heading: Run down and don't trust Disneyland Travel
Summary: This was a supposed to be a Disneyland approved upgraded property.  I GUESS THE JOKE WAS ON US!  The lobby looks fine until you enter the twilight zone upstairs.  This is a very tired property that was dirty and smelled.  Disneyland better get on the go and start checking approved properties.  I had to take pics to prove what is was like.  Sink drain hardware was rusty.  Very dim interior.  Smoke smelling room.  Stains all over carpet.  Peeling water damaged wall paper.  Cracked tile in bathroom.  Mold stains and pubic hair on ceiling.  Please do not stay.  By the fire alarm there was blackened smoke that looked like the electrical was faulty.  Please move on and don't stay and don't trust Disneyland.  They were very unhelpful in trying to re locate and get money back.  My first
Manager Response: Thank you for your feedback. Please contact me directly as I would like to know what room you occupied so that I have the issued addressed. We do our very best to provide our guests with fine accomodations and I am disapointed that we failed to do that.

Summary: A "healthy" proximity from Disneyland, you burn a lot of calories walking. You sleep great and get a nice clean room. It wasn't too exciting or outstanding in any way.The staff are helpful and told us the great restaurants near the hotel. I would still recommend it.
Manager Response: I am happy to hear that you enjoyed your stay with us. When you return; don't forget to utilize the ART Shuttle that gos to and from the Disneyland Resort every 20 minutes. We look forward to having you with us again.

Summary: No Television Remote to start with. Then went to take a shower and slipped and fell to the ground because the no slip mat that was supposed to be glued to the tub was peeled up half way so just layed there and looked safe until you stepped in and vroosh down you go. Luckily I did not break any other bones since I was already in a cast for my broken arm! the walls looked like there was water damage or mold around the whole room. Just nasty. on top of that the $15 parking fee charged for it being a Disney friendly hotel was not described on the choice Privileges site. and after complaining about the status of the room they only gave $20 off..I stayed at other choice hotels that have accommodated way more for less in the same area and the parking was free!!! This hotel is a sham
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to review your recent stay. I am disappointed we failed to give you the fine accommodations that we strive for with all our guests. Please contact me directly as I would like to know what room you occupied so that I can adress the issues that you've brought to our attention.

Summary: We stayed here last summer for our Disneyland trip and decided to stay again this year.  The staff were generally friendly and very helpful.  The girl at the front desk allowed us to check our bags the day we checked out of the hotel so that they didn't have to sit in the hot car all day.  Unfortunately,  our room was a bit of disappointment.  The toilet would run loudly every 30 seconds or so, which scared our son who is very sensitive to noise.  When we checked into our room, there was a huge wad of hair on the bathroom floor.  The pool had a LOT of hair floating around and left a hairspray-like chemical taste (not chlorine).  I think we will stay a little closer to the park entrance next time.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to review your recent stay. Your comments are appreciated and have been addressed with the staff to insure that we offer a better product on your next trip.

Summary: Stayed here for a national convention.  Room we had (729)  was ADA and nice sized. Room had several outlets (enough for 3 laptops and 3 phone chargers.) Bathroom was larger but the door opened out and would be very difficult for a wheelchair to get through before closing on them.  Rooms are clean and beds are comfortable. Offer guest laundry but 1 of 2 machines were out of order the 4 nights we were there.  Location is great if attending something at the Anaheim Convention Center or going to Disneyland.  Pool area is a little outdated.  Staff was very friendly.  Don't feel it is right to charge $14 for parking when paying for $140 for a hotel room.  Several places to eat within walking distance.
Manager Response: Thank you for staying with us! We are pleased that you enjoyed your stay with us. We also like our close proximity to the convention center and Disneyland. I am happy to hear that you found our location and room amenities accomodating. We look forward to having you stay with us again.

Summary: Nice hotel if on a budget. But one thing I will do next time is decline lock box. Excellent location to catch shuttle to Disneyland. The hotel restaurant has good prices. The staff is very helpful and friendly.The convention center is in walking distance.
Manager Response: We are very happy to hear that you enjoyed your stay and that you found our location beneficial to your needs. Please contact us when you are ready to book your next get away.

Summary: I am posting a review on my recent stay at your hotel online & I am going to share it with you as well. Cons for staying at the Clarion Anaheim, Ca hotel: Room 509-  Toilet takes forever to flush hold handle down, lacks electrical outlets (bring adapters), sink plug issues, water in shower changes temps frequently to cold to scold, AC condensation leads to extremely wet floor (wear shoes), half size balcony. Hotel- gift shop in inadequate, fitness room is half worth it, needs updated/renovated, parking can be a hassle (especially if no one explains to you how to use your pass) & cost $14/day.  Room 509- Pros: Blow dryer, coffee maker (need better creamer/ buy your own), fridge (rocks), iron & board, closet, lock safe for valuables, flat screen tv, nice bedding/bed, even 1/2
Manager Response: Please know that your comments have beenr eviewed in detail and steps are being taken to ensure these types of issues are handled on a preventive basis. We look forward to having you stay with us again.

Summary Heading: Great Value-Bar-Staff Walking distance from Disneyland
Summary: for the price I paid I was very satisfied. The staff was amazing, especially the bartender Arturo, he makes greats drinks, and really he is the only reason my sister and I will return to this hotel. All in all great stay check prices because i would not pay more than $80 to stay here but anything less than that is worth it.
Manager Response: We are all so proud of the effort our staff makes each and every day. Your kind words will go a long way to keep our team motivated. We look forward to seeing you again in the future!

Summary: Just got back from a quick one night stay at the Clarion in Anaheim.  LOVED it, we took advantage of the happy hour and met their great bartender that made a great margarita.  We also used the pool in the evening and found nice warm towels waiting for us.  Some of the reviews had me really scared but once I got there it was FINE!  This is a typical moderate hotel not a five star hotel but not advertised that way either!  Bottom line would I stay there again ABSOLUTELY!   PROS + great location + great price + lobby is nice + restaurant onsite + hotel bar onsite   CONS - a little dated in room - a little weird they charge you for a safe only a $1.50 but not used to - parking is $14.00 a day not surprising because of location to Disneyland -pillow were weird like they were couch
Manager Response: I am very happy to hear that you enjoyed your stay with us at the Clarion Anaheim. We look forward to you staying with us again.

Summary: I stayed here for 3 nights during a recent trip to Disneyland.  We were able to walk to the park from the property.  The hotel was a little older, but had all the amenities we needed.  We were able to buy snacks in the lobby.  Parking was a little difficult (an extra $12 a night) but that's pretty cheap for this area.  I would stay here again.
Manager Response: We're so glad you enjoyed your stay with our hotel. Thanks for taking the time to share your comments with us. Your kind words energize our staff.

Summary: I was very happy with my stay at the Clarion and will be staying here whenever I visit Anaheim.  The staff were extremely friendly and helpful. The rooms are clean and we had a bit of a view of California Adventure from our balcony which was great!  I like the fact the shower/bath and toilet are separate to the vanity area - it makes it easier to get ready in the morning.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to let us know what a great stay you had. We look forward to having you stay with us again.

Summary: The staff were very helpful, courteous, and accommodating.  Hot breakfast was good and lunch was delicious, especially the honey turkey panini with bacon, cheese & homemade chips.  We had a problem the first evening--water was dripping in bathtub from floor above; we were offered a change of room but it was too late in evening for us to move. However the next day we were given a room change w/upgrade for our inconvenience.  Overall stay was very satisfying. Room service, Palm Cafe staff, housekeeping, guest services, are all assets to Clarion hotels.  Walking distance to Convention Center, Disneyland and other restaurants. Reasonable cost for wonderful service.
Manager Response: We truly appreciate your kind review. Please call us anytime you need another relaxing weekend away.

Summary: Stayed here twice with our group. Breakfast is good and kind service. Clean. Bathrooms are small and could do with a facelift. Area outside bathroom is great. Rooms are spacious. Walking distance to Disneyland
Manager Response: We're so glad you enjoyed your stay with our hotel. Thanks for taking the time to share your comments with us. Your kind words energize our staff.

Summary Heading: Nice Service, Great Location, Bad Room
Summary: Service is good, location is very good for Disneyland. but the room is very out dated too, like the ones in 80s or sth they really need to refurbish itself to be called a 3 star hotel. the cost is reasonable for the quality of this hotel, around 75 bucks plus tax. no bed bugs, so that's good. lol
Manager Response: We are all so proud of the effort our staff makes each and every day. Your kind words will go a long way to keep our team motivated. We look forward to seeing you again in the future!

Summary: Well this wasn't the best hotel I've ever stayed in but it sure wasn't the worst. Lobby and entrance are nice enough and modern. Rooms are a bit dated, and could use a good dusting. Beds were small... maybe a double, but not queens. Other than being dated, and needing a dusting, our room was clean. Staff was very friendly, and food in restaurant was fine. Short walk to Disneyland, I think 2 1/2 blocks, didn't take long at all, but you can take a bus from the hotel to Disneyland for $5.  We booked our tours right at the hotel, and it all went very smoothly. I would stay here again - prices were reasonable.
Manager Response: We are pleased to know your stay with was a good one, and we look forward to providing you with the same great service again in the future. Thank you for choosing the Clarion Hotel.

Summary: We stayed hare for 6 nights. Hotel was fine. Short walk from Disney which is ideal, there are hotels nearer to Disney entrance if you have young children or difficulty walking. Transport was available but the walk was no problem.
Manager Response: I am happy to hear that you found our location to be very convenient. Thank you for taking the time to let us know about your stay.

Summary: We got this room for points off our credit card, so all we paid for was the parking, but the room was old and dirty. I reserved a king studio suite and we received a room with two full beds.  The bedding was old and the couch was so stained and gross that I covered it with a bedspread and still didn't want to use it.  When we opened the cupboards over the sink area they were full of crumbs. We stayed two nights and they didn't even dump all of the garbage. When we checked out, there was a maid cleaning the lobby, but she was mopping the floor and it hadn't been swept, my husband even spotted a couple of large black lumps moving. We will never stay at another clarion.
Manager Response: I am disappointed we failed to give you the fine accommodations and consideration we strive for with all our guests– the type of service in which we pride ourselves. Please know that your comments have been reviewed in detail and steps are being taken to ensure these types of issues are handled on a preventive basis.

Summary: Did some research on hotels before booking and I am so happy with the Clarion. We were coming from Las Vegas to Anaheim to stay for the weekend and go to Disneyland. I liked the location (about a 15min walk to Disneyland Main Gate) but we took the ART, a bus. Hotel has a machine to buy ART tickets which was convenient and he drop off pick up is right outside of the main lobby. Lobby was nice, gift shop had reasonably priced Disney souvenirs.  The beds were comfy and the staff was excellent. Would recommend.   Our only complaint was that the restaurant was only a buffet which I didn’t like and is just a preference but everyone seemed to be enjoying themselves.
Manager Response: We truly appreciate your kind review. Please call us anytime you need another relaxing weekend away.

Summary Heading: Great Deal Price Wise, but lacked many basics
Summary: I have stayed in many places, both motels and hotels, and this was definitely not the worst place I have stayed.  However, I cannot highly recommend this hotel.  Let me break it down for you:  The PROS:  1.  Through an online hotel site, I got a pretty great price deal at $52 a night.  $12/day additional for parking, but that is reasonable considering the location.  2.  Its location is supreme; close to the Anaheim Convention Center, Disneyland Resort, and local areas.  3.  The staff that we interacted with were EXCELLENT and very friendly.  4.  The hotel was very quiet so you could sleep well.  The CONS:  1.  It's very unsettling to check into your room and smell.......old.  I am not sure if it was mold, dirt, or just the fact that everything seemed to be at least 25 years old,
Manager Response: Thank you for your feedback, and I apologize that we did not provide the standard of service level that we are striving to achieve. We are working hard to imrpove all areas of our product. We do hope that you stay with us again.

Summary: Well our band stayed at the clarion while we were there and the hotel looked great on the outside but when we stepped in it was very dated and old, when we got to our room after waiting for the elevator for 5 min, we opened the door to see a old out dated room with 2 small beds that 2 people were suppose to share. Our blow dryer , iron, shower didn't work! Had to get replacements. I ordered room services from the hotels cafe and it took 45 mins for them to bring up potato skins ( which were dried out) and gross! On our last night at the hotel our door broke! We looked at the door and it was rotten,, the repair man came up to fix it and when he was putting screws in your could hear he was stripping the screws! And after he was done he left metal and paint shavings on the floor! I
Manager Response: Thank you for your feedback. I am sorry to hear about the issues that you experienced while staying with us. I can assure you that these aren't normal standards and we are working very hard to imrove. We do hope that you give us another try.

Summary: Attended a conference at the Anaheim Conference Center and stayed at the Clarion.  The hotel is a 2 minute walk to the Hilton Conference Center where the conference was held so very convenient.  The room was okay not great.  My room was outdated and a handicap room which I didn't need.  The room and bathroom were clean and the fixtures in the bathroom were cracked.  The woman at the front desk (couldn't see her name tag) wasn't exactly friendly and had no personality.  The bellman on duty on Monday, April 29th about 5:45 was really nice and very helpful.  Ordered breakfast everyday in my room.  The room service waiter that delivered named Jaime was very nice and welcoming.  Delivered breakfast daily with a smile on his face, always a kind word and very attentive to the details
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to let us know how your stay was. We are imrpoving our services and product each day. I will be sure to pass on your great comments to our staff. We look forward to having you stay with us in the future.

Summary: We chose this hotel because it is a short walk over to Disneyland (about a 15 min walk). Hotel rooms were clean, and we even had a Balcony that we could see Cars Land from! Great value for the money, and let's be honest you're there for the Parks, not the hotel! :)
Manager Response: We are happy to hear that you found our location a great value. We also ebjoy the great views from our Hotel from time to time. We look forward to you staying with us again.

Summary: The Clarion is a good base in Anaheim to see the sights. Don't place to much emphasis on the hotel here as you will not see too much of the inside of your hotel room with that the Disney parks have to offer. In the instance of the Clarion, this is a good thing. Basic, dated and underwhelming, the Clarion provides just enough to stay of the complaints list.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to review your stay. I am happy to hear that our location met your needs perfectly. We look forward to having you stay with us in the future.

Summary Heading: We only stay at the Clarion!
Summary: We usually stay at the Clarion but this trip we actually had made reservations at the Hilton Anaheim because it had a Disney view with a sliding door and patio. When we arrived to our room it was awful! We immediately got a refund and left. We ran over to the Clarion and they set us right up right away in familiar room. What a relief! We have always stayed here and enjoyed it. Why did we even think of another hotel. They have even remodeled the dining area so that they have a buffet breakfast every morning and its under $10. The food is amazing! By far this has been the best!!! Free internet too! I will only stay at the Clarion when coming to visit Disneyland. We ate most of our meals here. Arturo Ramirez works at the bar and also serves meals after hours. He had better customer
Manager Response: Sorry to hear that the start of your vacation wasn't what you expected however, I am very happy that the Clarion Hotel was able to make your vacation more enjoyable. We look forward to having you stay with us again.  Thank you

Summary: I am in sales and travel all over the Western United States. I spend alot of nights in hotel rooms. The Clarion Hotel Anaheim Resort is a safe and clean place to stay.  It's easy to walk to dinner. They have a heated pool and a nice place to eat in the Hotel. The very best thing about this Hotel is the people. The night Manager is Rick Gomez, he is a great guy. Go to the bar on Thursday nights and listen to some of the local Disney employes talking shop or singing. Tell the Bar Manager Arturo I said hi. Stay someplace safe. Stay at the Clarion Hotel Anaheim Resort
Manager Response: Our guest's are our number one priority so I am happy to hear that you enjoyed your stay with us. Thank you for taking the time review your experience. We look forward to having you stay with us again.

Summary: My co-workers and boss stayed here two weekends ago to go to a convention and were so disappointed. The rooms are old, dirty, and unmaintained. The staff was very confused by our reservation and was very rude.  Nothing about our stay was enjoyable, we are all very disappointed.

We were booked by our travel agent for 3 nights in early April 2013. It was pre-paid, so no opportunity to change hotels.  There were many issues but overall, this hotel gets away with it's condition/service by it's close location to the Anaheim Convention Centre.  By the way, if you're looking for a family hotel within walking distance, this is quite a long walk to the Disney entrance.  The issues we had:  1. No early check-ins. We had been travelling since 3am and were held to the 4pm check-in time. The lobby was scattered with dozing families.  2. Small cramped room. We had a King room and space was at a premium.  The furniture was very worn and dated.  3. Faulty outlets. If you plugged in any electronic devices, they just fell out. The one outlet that worked was in the

10 of us stayed here for 3 nights, rooms we a nice size and clean, location is very good within walking distance to Downtown Disney and Gardenwalk which has shopping. dining and entertainment. pool area was very clean and overall was an enjoyable stay

Summary Heading: Decent Hotel Close to Convention Center and Disneyland
Summary: Not much to say about this hotel, it was a room block rate that brought me here as well as the close proximity to the convention center for a cheer competition.  Booked a corner 1 bedroom 2 queen (double?) suite and when checked in, was given a regular room with one King bed.  Had to go downstairs to explain we were not given the room we booked and paid for.  We were told they had no more 1 bedroom suites available-- we explained we had our email with verification that we had reserved this room-- She asked to see the email and of course once she saw the email that we had indeed booked a 1 bedroom corner room suite--they magically had one available.  Why would we pay the rate we paid for a regular room when we had paid for a suite rate.  I find that a bit shady.  Overall, room

Summary Heading: Good location if you get it for the right price
Summary: Yeah it's an average hotel, but I found it clean and the location was only about a 10-15 min walk to Disneyland.  The front desk staff were friendly, it had a laundry on site which was great after traveling for a few weeks.  The onsite cafe was really average and mostly empty ( I guess that should have tipped us off ).  Sometimes there were waits for the elevators, but the stairs were an option.  We got a good price for this room at this price it was a great choice.  However I would have probably been disappointed if I'd paid the prices quoted on their website.

It is an older hotel, it could probably do with a bit of a facelift, but as someone who has seen worse, its really not bad.  I got two rooms for an overnight visit to Disneyland for myself and family. The rooms were clean and functional. Comfortable beds.  Free wifi, a coffee machine in the room well stocked with tea and coffee. Room had a fridge.  Which I thought was nice. Laundry facilities were available on my floor. I wasn't sure if that applied for every floor, but if you had kids and needed clean laundry it is a nice bonus. Also a large gift store with all the Disney paraphenalia you can think of so if you forget souvenirs from Disneyland, its right there in the lobby and it wasn't crazy overpriced or anything.    Had a minor problem with the shower I had to tweak the

The room was dirty, only superficially cleaned, one day did not get maid service until we came back at 4pm and called. Then had to leave the room so she could clean. They 'ran out' of blankets. Bring your own soap-you are given one bottle of shampoo for your stay.  There is a fridge but no microwave. My husband slept on the floor rather than sleep on the mattress with a spring in his back. The walls are paper thin. Got phone calls to our room in the moddle of the night.  The shower had a drip, the toilet had a leak too and ran all night. Kept getting locked out of the $14 a day parking lot, both coming in and going out.  This could be because of the night attendant for whom I spelled out 3 times and ultimately wrote out our license plate number. (I don't think he ever got it

This hotel was located just down the road from the Anaheim Convention Center where I was a vendor for two days at a motorcycle parts show. I loved the weather and the palm trees. There was two big groups at all the local hotels; Key Club and Cheerleaders who created a lot of energy in the hotel. I wasn't expecting much enthusiasm from the desk staff and didn't receive any. The room was dated and in need of updating, but was comfortable. The free breakfast on Friday was skinny at best and the Sunday buffet wasn't very robust and a disappointment for $10 -even for L.A.. The whole restaurant was staffed with one waiter who just couldn't keep up with the crowds. The bellman found himself seating customers and helping direct the restaurant staff. He had helped me out by carrying my

Summary Heading: Dirty Motel 6 at a Sheraton Price
Summary: I travel for work much more that I do for pleasure:  35-50 nights a year work and 12-15 nights a year for vacation.    I don't might staying in a inexpensive hotel that is clean & quiet with a friendly staff.  My children and I stayed in a Best Western in northern California this same week that was exactly clean quiet and $100 a night.    This hotel was NONE of those things.    The hotel and room was not "clean."  Old, dirty, tired would be the words I would use and the hotel staff could be described the same with "grumpy" as punctuation.   No good coffee; "go over the the Marriott; and bring us one back."   This is the first review i have posted on Trip Advisor.    I feel compelled to share....   Stay somewhere else....   like maybe the Marriott, right next door.

Summary Heading: Close to convention center and Disneyland
Summary: Clarion Hotel is a suitable place  if you want to attend conferences taking place at convention center.Hilton Hotel is on the other side of the street. For those interested in visiting Disneyland,it takes nearly 15 minutes to walk there.  The hotel is clean with friendly staff and you may enjoy swimming in the pool or having a workout at the gym.

I stayed at the Clarion during a quick trip to the Anaheim area for Wondercon 2013 (I traveled solo). The booking was very last minute but I was able to get a good deal on what turned out to be a fairly large room that came equipped with a fridge (always a bonus in my books). The bed was super comfortable and there was tons of space for a small table and a couple of chairs. The bathroom, while yes, is a little outdated, functioned well.  The staff was also quite lovely, from the front desk staff to the bellmen to the housekeeping crew - everyone was always very pleasant and had a smile on their face. The hotel is about a 15 minute walk to Disney and two minutes to the Anaheim convention center, not to mention tons of food and transportation options. Here's a quick tip: if you're

Our trip was within the last week! Housekeeping management and staff needs to be fired or needs major retraining! Glasses would be left for days on the table, no towels, room would be half done. Then I asked a housekeeper in the hall that I needed towels and she gets snotty and says call front desk.  These housekeepers were sitting in the hallways mind you! I felt like I was at a sleazy 70's rent by the hour hotel.

We stayed at this hotel for three nights March 14, 15, 16, 2013.  The national cheer compition was going on at this time.  I did not hear any noise from other rooms even though I know the hotel had to be booked.  Girls everywhere!  The hotel is within walking distance to Disneyland.  The foyer was clean, the continential breakfast was good.  Many hot food choices including making your own waffels.  The rooms were okay.  It is an older hotel and I'm sure used alot because it is so close to the convention center.   The cleanliness was as good as could be for the amount of use that hotel gets.  Beds were small, but fit two adults fine.  Bathroom was large with a seperate toilet in a closet.  That was a plus.  Looked like there was plenty of parking.  Pool was average.  Nothing

Summary Heading: Clarion Hotel Anaheim Resort is far from a "Resort" style hotel...
Summary: My son and I stayed at the Clarion Anaheim Hotel last weekend (3/15-3/17).  I didn't book this hotel myself, I was part of my daughter's high school cheer group, who were competing at USA Spirit Nationals at the Anaheim Convention center last weekend, and this hotel was booked by our coach after we found out the Marriott was sold out.  My daughter and the squad arrived on Thursday evening, and she was sending me not so glowing texts about the hotel, so I did some searching around looking for reviews.  I was a little nervous about staying here after some of the things I read.  So, here is my opinion, for what it's worth.  I've stayed in every kind of hotel, from REALLY bad ones (when driving across country with my husband and two Rotweillers...the kinds of hotels that allow big

POOR, PLEASE READ. My daughter stayed at the Clarion from 3/14 thru 3/17 for a National Cheer Convention. It was an awful hotel experience for most of the team. The first night, my daughters room woke to find the room was INSFESTED with bed bugs, I spoke to the night manager and asked their policy to assure the bugs don't come home and was told they don't have an actual policy on how this should be handled. While our coaches were filing a incident report to protect us if it's brought home, one of them had their bag stolen from an office - money, airline ticket, ID - all gone. After calling the police as it certainly had to be an employee, they couldn't get to the video monitors (not sure if they ever did) room keys not working the first night. The next night, the girls got moved

Though an older hotel, we found it clean, the staff helpful and our room fine.  Our girls loved that every day we would come home to the pile of soft toys they were collecting neatly arranged on their made bed. We shopped ALOT and all of the bags, tags and wrapping were disposed daily. Parking was good...better if it had been for free!! 10 - 15 min walk to Disney and even with 2 young girls was fine. Our only request will be for our next stay ( as we would def stay again) will be for a room on the side facing Disney..so we can see the fireworks!!

The hotel was older but it was okay, however we had a room that had an adjoining door to another room and could hear everything in the next room. It was really only a problem for 2 of the seven nights, we called the desk but the people didn't quiet down for about 2 hours after that, which was about 1 am, not good when you have a baby trying to sleep. The room had a mini fridge and microwave that you didn't have to request or pay extra for. The breakfast Buffett was not good, it was basically a continental breakfast that is usually at most hotels for free, but you paid ten bucks for this one, the waffle machine was also not working. The staff at the Buffett were so nice and helpful though, as is the concierge guy at the help desk.  A far walk from the park, however you could just

Summary Heading: Close to convention center and walk to Disneyland
Summary: I stayed here in January for the Disney Tinkerbell half marathon.  The hotel was less than a mile to Disney. I was able to walk to and from the race.  The rooms were nice, nothing fancy but parking was horrible and there was a fee.

We stayed at the Clarion Hotel for 2 nights and had our meals in the Tivoli Garden.  The service was excellent..  one waiter(Arturo N.) was attentive, friendly and extremely helpful.  We were delighted  and we congratulate the managagement for hiring Arturo N.  Also, the check in staff was most helpful. We would stay at the Clarion again if we needed to stay in the area.  Thank you.

Or second, or third....Unless walking to the convention center is your only consideration.  While the front desk staff is friendly (but understaffed) and the breakfast wait staff tries really hard ( understaffed, too), this place is a dump.  It's old. Dated. Run-down. Hasn't seen a new carpet, mattress, curtain or anything else in years. It's so old the shiny stuff is peeling off the bathroom mirror. The bar staff is surly and slow.  The bar area itself looks like something out of Austin Power's Mexican nightmare. Dated and dingy. My company books us here every January in spite of our staff's complaints. If you're in Anaheim for a convention or for vacation, go somewhere else.

The Clarion has been, is and will continue to be my hotel when staying in Anaheim. We had a suite this time to accommodate me & my sons and our dog. 2 comfy beds, a pull-out sofa, fridge & microwave made our stay comfortable and homey. The front desk was helpful, friendly and willing to go the extra mile no matter how trivial the request may seem. What I liked was even with a lobby bustling with people, they took the time to say hi to each guest as they walked in. May seem like a small thing but really is nice to be greeted when coming "home" after a long day.  The food at the restsurants was good, the bar has a great happy hour and pool was a wonderful place to relax. Couple that with their great location, so close to D-land, other great chain restaurants and you really can't

Summary Heading: A Good Stay During the NAMM Show
Summary: We stayed here during the 2013 NAMM show. This is an older and slightly dated hotel but very clean and the staff are friendly and welcoming. We booked two rooms as a very good rate (which is hard to find during the NAMM show!) and we were given adjoining rooms as requested. We we very thankful as it may have been a bit tricky to accommodate us given that the hotel was fully booked. If we wanted a hotel with newer rooms, we would have paid easy three times the price but the Clarion was totally fine. We had a fridge and microwave in both rooms and ordered groceries through Vons.com. The Clarion bellman brought all the groceries up to the room which was fantastic. We took the shuttle from the Toy Story parking lot across the street to Disneyland which saved a lot of hassle with the

Excited for my vacation with my family and that would have been the only reason that I didn’t come to the front desk and scream at the disappointment I felt when I walked into my room.  The lobby was very nice and the front desk staff was welcoming.  We were tired from our long day of traveling.  I just wanted to go to my room and put my kids to bed and wake refreshed and ready for our big day at Disney.   Wow:  Open my door and it was so out dated (I actually laughed)  They had old comforters on the beds and I dread to think how often they are washed.   Our sheets on the beds – Not a word of a lie I could see through them.  The housekeeping left something to desire for our full stay. Our rooms appeared to be clean but when you went to look closer they had missed so much. Our

I stay here each year for The NAMM Show. This place shows signs of age but it remains clean and  is a very acceptable 2.5-3 star hotel.   The furniture is a bit dated and the bedding materials a little on the cheap side. There was no closet (just an open rack) or desk in my room with two beds. The bathroom was clean but the fixtures are dated. There were minor cracks in the sink and toilet had a slow leak that caused it to refill every 30 minutes or so. There is an ample-sized refrigerator and two chairs with a small table.   One thing that bothered me was the curtains. There is only one blackout curtain. There is no second shear. In other words, if you want light in the room, you are open to the world. There is a small sliding glass door (that barely secures closed) to a

My family and I stayed here in October 2012.  It was a lovely clean hotel.  The staff were very friendly.  My airline lost our luggage the hotel were great at giving out complimentary toiletries such as toothbrushes, toothpaste, shower caps.  The room was very comfortable with complimentary tea and coffee.  The toilet overflowed one day and I called reception.  They sent someone up within a few minutes and had the problem sorted within 10 minuets.  I would not hesitate in recommending this hotel to anyone.  The staff really care about the customers and any repairs are carried out promptly. The hotel was about 15 minuets from the entrance of Disneyland which was the only drawback.  But there is a bus that goes directly to the park for a small fee.

The rooms were pretty outdated and the door to our balcony the lock was messed up on and the curtain was ripped in the bathroom you could see where the towel rack was pulling from the wall the toilet didn't flush very well and the shower head just sprayed on fat stream of water.  It says a block from disneyland but its a lot longer than a block and the transit bus that runs that route sucked we always had to wait forever.  We only ate breakfast in the hotel and it wad good.  When you walk in and see the lobby you would expect the rooms to be super nice and you would expect that for the price but they weren't great...I maybe would stay again if I got a really good deal but would prob pay a little more for a different one in the area

I don't normally write reviews, but our experience at this hotel was so bad, I feel it is my duty to warn any other would-be guests as to what we experienced at this hotel. We chose this hotel because it was close to Disneyland and affordable. In retrospect, I would have gladly paid more for a better hotel. First, we were expecting queen beds and arrived in our room to find small doubles. Not the end of the world, but I was sharing with my sister so it would have been nice to have the queen. Now I wasn't expecting five star quality, or brand new furnishings but this room felt dirty. The bathroom felt dirty. There was hair in the tub and on the floor (EW!!) and the room had a can't-quite-put-my-finger-on-it odor. The next morning, we had the buffet breakfast in their restaurant,

I stayed here for a convention for 8 nights. The only good thing about this hotel is it's location to the convention center. It is only two blocks away. For the price, however, I do not understand why they don't update their hotel. Upon arrival, my room was very dirty and my bedding had obviously not been thoroughly tended to as there were hairs all over from the person before me. The carpets looked like they hadn't been vacuumed in weeks and the bath room looked like it had mold on the walls that were just painted over. I went to the downstairs restaurant the first morning and royally regret it. My food was cold, the eggs were powdered, and my sausage was incredibly greasy.   The customer service was so-so. The people at the front desk could have cared less I was there and

My friend and I stayed for 4 nights, Nov. 5-9.  We were extremely pleased not only with the room but the friendliness and helpfulness of the staff.  We had the most help from Rick Gomez.  He was gracious and always easy to reach for any questions or needs.  The front desk as well as our PR lady, house keeping, and those in the kitchen were wonderful.  I would choose this hotel again for future reservations.

Summary Heading: Great Value, Great Location, Great Service
Summary: We stayed here for 4 nights in room 472 from Wednesday 14 November. After a 12 hour flight from Australia and an interesting Super Shuttle transfer from LAX, we were hoping that we might be able to get early check-in. Sal B on the desk could not have been more helpful in providing us with a great room that we could use straight away. There were three adults in our party and the corner room was a great size. I have seen a number of reviews here very critical of the Clarion and its age, upkeep and appearance. We experienced none of the issues on which other reviewers have posted very negative comments.  I think some people must go out of their way to find fault. Or crawl around on the floor looking for dust balls and other unmentionable items. Our room was clean, linen was fresh

This is a hotel that shows every bit of it being a hotel used by thousands of visitors coming to Anaheim. The hotel is old, dated and in need of a remodel.   The rooms were average, small but clean. It's about a block away from Disneyland or a 15 minute walk. In a pinch, this hotel will do but compared to other hotels nearby, it's a hard sell to advise anyone to pick this one.

Rooms are outdated and the balcony is a foot wide. Bath tub did not drain and the continental beakfast which should be free and consisted of a wafflemaker and cold cereal was 6'50. Location was noisey hear traffic all nite

well we were really happy with where this hotel was located, it was a 10 min walk to park. it was close to the garden walk where we ate a couple of times:) it was a clean hotel but old and due for some upgrades! we found a cockroach in our room, but i do not believe it was because it wasnt clean just older, needing renos,! not to mention we were in califorina! the pool was awesome, the kids loved it!

Stayed for five nights in October 2012.  Seemed like a good deal, but unfortunately, it was not!  Communication between hotel staff and housekeeping was terrible!  We had to constantly deal with linen issues and failure to take care of our room properly.  We received a "free breakfast" with our package but the restaurant was always crowded with lines out the door in the morning.  This was not because the restaurant was full, but because they did not have enough help.  Also, when we did eat in the restaurant, we had trouble with our orders because the staff struggled with understanding English.  Don't get me wrong, the staff was all very nice and stated they would remedy the issues we encountered, only to fail in their attempts.  I hate having to constantly badger people and it

Summary Heading: Disappointed by the hotel but the staff was nice.
Summary: Firstly – I booked this hotel through a travel agent who informed me this hotel was only a 12 minute walk to Disney.  I was horrified as we kept driving to get there after passing the park entrance.  We traveled with several small children and after the first day walking realized we had to give ourselves 25 minutes with the hopes of hitting every crosswalk light on the way. After a day in the park our kids were too tired to make the trip back and we took a cab everyday afterwards.  The hotel did offer a shuttle at $5.00 per person per day.  There were 7 people in our party that works out to $ 35.00.  our cab that took all of us $ 5.33 there and $4.80 back.  The staff at the front desk at check in were efficient and ready to go.  Super helpful and quick to get us on our way.  The

Summary Heading: The Clarion Hotel fails to please
Summary: The Clarion Hotel offers neither service, clean rooms nor good food. The only positive thing about it is the location, which is close to Disneyland. The housekeeping staff tries hard  but the rooms are not maintained. The lock on our outside "balcony" door was completely broken and the lock on the inside door only worked after repeated attempts. The "balcony" is about a foot wide. The restaurant workers deserve credit for their efforts but the breakfast buffet and food  fall way below appealing. After 12 hours in the park, the restaurant was open so the eight of us, five adults and three children 12 yrs to 7, tried it late and again the next morning but even the children refused to eat there again. We did not complain about anything because it was part of a Disneyland package.
Manager Response: Hello, Thank you for your feedback and I apologize that we fell short of our standard service during your stay. Please know that we have taken your feedback to share with our staff so that they can better serve our guests. I do hope that you return in the future so you can experience our improvements.

Summary Heading: Nice place to stay for the Disney experience
Summary: I stayed at the clarion hotel in October 2012 as an affordable way to see Disneyland and the other attractions that make us Brits flock to California. The location is very good being only a 20 minute walk from the Disneyland parks, I could see or at least hear the fireworks from my room. The room was pretty comfortable although some of the bathroom fittings were coming loose and I noticed the wallpaper peeling away from the wall next to one of the beds in the main room.
