The breakfast room was quite reasonable at $6.50 for the buffet which consisted of cereals, fruit and a make your own waffle station (please note that even though it says coffee is included in the price on the sign outside when you get to the buffet table there is a small plaque saying "coffee $2.00" ). The staff
Manager Response: Thank you for your kind feedback. I am very happy to hear that you enjoyed your stay with us and we look forward to having you with again on your next vacation.

Summary: I have stayed at this hotel several times now as I travel to Disneyland a couple times a year from Arizona.  I keep going back because the value is awesome. I usually buy my Disneyland packages through Getawaytoday.com and this is one of the cheapest hotels listed. I was nervous about trying it because the price was low but after staying there I couldn't understand why the price was lower than some other hotels. It is a bit further of a walk than other hotels but they have a shuttle to Disneyland that comes every twenty minutes. They also have free parking with your stay and give you free breakfast every morning. To me, it is an amazing bargain. The rooms are clean, the water pressure in the shower is good, which is always important to me, and the price is awesome. If you're
Manager Response: We are very happy to hear that you enjoyed your stay with us and that you found our services and added values to be of great use. We look forward to having you with us again during your next trip to Anaheim. Thank you for your feedback.

Summary Heading: The only good thing was Disneyland....
Summary: Luckily, if you come here in the winter, you will be kept nice and warm by the hairs threaded through your blankets! As well as this, the shower floor gives good cushioning from the hair that is on it! Don't get me wrong, it is very close to Disneyland (we caught the ART shuttle, but really you could have at least walked there) and the beds were comfortable.  The breakfast wasn't great, not a lot of variety but it was enough to fill me up for a day at Disneyland.  The wiFi kept dropping out which I wasn't too impressed about as it was my only way of keeping in contact with family.  Also, the vending machine in the lobby stole my $1 :(

This was my first stay @ the Clarion Anaheim. It was a GREAT stay. Midway south on Harbor. Its location directly across from the Toy Story Parking Lot makes transport to & from Disney is the best. I don't understand why families walk that distance when you get dropped off right @ the security bag check. Room was standard with two beds, flat screen tv, mini fridge. FREE internet was great as I was able to access it everyday. On my last night, I was thirsty & hungry, stopped in @ the Mexicana Cafe for a late night steak & a couple ShockTops. Mahalo to Martin, bartender for the EXCELLENT service. Yes I will stay here again as all forms of transport are near (Disneyland Express, ART, OCTA, Toy Story Pkg shuttle).

Had a great time at the Clarion Hotel. Great  staff working there everyone was so nice and they had  a great big heated pool and the breakfast was great too. Thanks.Clarion Hotel for making my stay so great!!!! Be back in Oct for Disneyland Halloween and guess we're I'm staying The Clarion Hotel !!!

Grabbed a cheap room here the night of a concert at The Grove. It fit our needs fine. Was it glam? No. But I assume people like it because of the proximity to Disneyland and the price. We did get to park one car for free but the breakfast situation was a disaster. The sit-down breakfast place had a line forming so the manager sent us to the express buffet as an option. But a family of five hogged all the waffle makers and we ended up eating cold cereals out of a styrofoam bowl. Eventually we had to leave (family still hogging the waffles) and when they tried to charge us $7 each for a bowl of Frosted Flakes I was like, "um no".

The Staff here go above and beyond to make sure everything goes according to plan and even help you by giving you their cell phones when your shuttle doesnt show up !! Great Job ANALISE !! I will definitely be staying here again as well as telling all my friends and family to stay here when they are in the area

I guess it was good for its purpose, a place to shower and sleep. The restrooms did not look clean at all and the beds were not comfortable and there was a weird smell in the hallway. This was a last minute booking but i would not stay here again. I would definietly get something closer to the park even if i had to pay more.

Summary Heading: Understaffed and in need of facelift
Summary: This hotel is located within a 10 minute walk of Disneyland, that is where the positives end. This was our first stay hear and will be our last. This hotel is ridiculously understaffed!! Lots of excuses, but that didn't help the wait times for everything. From the front desk, to bell and valet to the restaurant, be prepared to wait. The rooms are average size and in need of cleaning and overhaul. The A/C is louder than average and the windows are thin and let an excessive amount of noise from the outside into the room. The rooms have a small balcony, but no screen door to keep out bugs if you want to let some fresh air in the room.    I called before booking a room to ask about getting a 1:30pm checkout, because their checkout time was listed as 11:00AM and we were attending a
Manager Response: Dear TropicalTraveler,  I apologize that we were not able to do everything in our power to accomodate your simple request.  Thank you for letting me know of your experience so that we can do better next time.  I will let our Front Office staff as well as our maintenance staff know of your experience so that we do not make those same mistakes again.

Summary: I stayed here with my husband and my 18 month old daughter last week. The location is great and the hotel is just ok. We stayed at this location as we received a free two night stay from listening to a timeshare presentation almost a year ago. The room was a little dated and dingy.They had a fridge in the room which was a plus but it was broken when we first checked in. They did fix it promptly when we called to inform them about this. It didn't have a full length mirror and the channel line up didn't include the Disney channel which I thought was strange since we were so close to Disneyland. The room did have a bathroom and bed so it provided us with a place to take a shower and sleep so just the basics of what we really needed. I am not sure if we would stay here again and if
Manager Response: Dear tcruz914,  Thank you for staying with us, and thank you for bringing the issues regarding your stay to my attention.  While I am happy that we were able to respond and remedy the issue with fridge, I do apologize that there was an issue with the fridge to begin with.    I will share your concerns with the staff so that we be certain to work even harder to make your next stay with us better.

Summary: The room was large and it was handy having a fridge. The location is great, It is within walking distance of Disneyland which took us about 10 minutes and you could see the fireworks from the bedroom window. The staff were polite and helpful. The room could do with updating and the air conditioning unit was really noisy which meant we had to turn it off at night, but it was clean and good value for money.
Manager Response: Dear LittleLaura521,  Thank you for taking the time to write us your feedback.  I am sorry that the A/C was not as quiet as it could have been.  I am looking into that room's a/c unit to be sure that we address the issue.

Summary: Walking distance to Disneyland & numerous restaurants. ART buses stops right at the front. Spacious lobby with free WiFi! I also got a AAA discount. Friendly staff answered my questions. I also got 1 additional hour to check-out (thanks).
Manager Response: Dear HarishC,  Thank you for your business, and thank you for the time that you took to give us your feedback.

Summary: We stayed at the Clarion for just one night - but wished it could have been more!  The room was super spacious, quiet and clean.  The view was lovely through the gigantic floor to ceiling windows.  There was a refrigerator and microwave - which was handy.  We could walk to the parks - which can save you on parking.  It is a little older, but the appointments were fine and the bed was comfortable.
Manager Response: Thank you for choosing to stay with us, and thank you for taking the time to write us your feedback. Your feedback really does help us to continue to improve. We really appreciate it.

Summary: The Clarion near Disneyland offers a great value for the location. The rooms were a nice size, the help pleasant, the location excellent (ART stops right in front to whisk guests to Disneyland), the pool area utilitarian but spacious. The only downside was the cleanliness factor. It's a hotel that needs updating but for the price, clean but well used, would be acceptable. A nice touch would be to remove the stains from the carpet and bedspreads.  The vacumes need to used more frequently or overhauled so they work and the housekeeper in our room could use a refresher on cleaning skills. I was glad I didn't see the housekeeping crew refolding the clean towels on the floor in front of the elevator until we checked out...  But, despite a bit of 'eewh' in a not spotless room, it was
Manager Response: Thank you for giving us your feedback. I apologize that everything was not attended to in the manner that we are accustomed to. We are working hard to make every experience here perfect, and your feedback is valuable to us in reaching our goals.

Summary: The Clarion Hotel Anaheim Resort is located just a few blocks away from Disneyland.  We would regularly walk to Disney rather than taking the shuttle.  The room was clean and comfortable.  The common areas and pool were also well maintained.  A decent hotel and a good value compared (price wise) to other hotels close to Disney.
Manager Response: Thank you for your business, and thank you for your feedback. We appreciate your that you chose to stay with us as we know that you have many choices for hotels in the area. I let the employees know that we exceeded your expectations and what a great job they did, and we will continue to work to hard to exceed your expectations.  We look forward to seeing you again.

Summary: we booked this hotel thru a vacation package, if you are a family and want something that is near Disneyland and don't mind walking some distance this is for you.   The hotel is a little dated, but is clean !  pool is a good size and kept clean. There is laundry room that is for guests so that is a good thing.  The restaurant is average, we did manage to get food delivered poolside and that was a perk.   We booked a suite and its no where what it should be, 2 double beds and a sofa bed .  Bathroom was the best part of the room, good size and good water pressure.    For our next visit we will book something a little closer to the park entrance, as this one is quite a walk.
Manager Response: Thank you for your business, and thank you for your feedback. We appreciate your that you chose to stay with us as we know that you have many choices for hotels in the area. We will continue to work to hard so that we exceed expectations.

Summary: There were two couples of us staying at the Clarion and I must say all the poor reviews that I read have been mainly unfounded. We had two rooms on the secomd floor overlooking the pool , a bit noisy at night, so was Disney fireworks to, but the rooms were claen  a little out dated but the beds were just great, a small complaint was the bath towels, a bit shabby . The staff at breakfast, especially in the cocktail lounge, ( Go Lothuro and Maria) were so helpful , the bellhops Ashley and Fabian were extremley helpful as were the front desk staff, only problem was DO NOT book Grand Express Hollywood trip they recommend , a rip off and rude mangement .The Disney and other buses at the front door, $4.00 all day or $2.00 for pensioners was  excellent service ,and plenty of eating
Manager Response: Dear JeffreyW,  Thank you for your business, and thank you for your feedback.  We appreciate your that you chose to stay with us as we know that you have many choices for hotels in the area.  I let the employees who exceeded your expectations know of the great job that they did, and we will continue to work to hard so that all of our employees exceed expectations.

Summary Heading: Great location but not so clean
Summary: My friend booked 2 nights here last weekend because our friend was getting married. We were in a 2 double sized bed room. Location wise, this place is pretty close to everything. It's only a 10 minute walk from downtown disney and is very close to various restaraunts and corner stores. I'm super OCD so I felt very dirty staying at this hotel. The carpets looked grimey and the sheets just felt dirty. This hotel is definetley cheap but you get what you pay for. Hotel soap and shampoo provided were not to my expectations.  They did bring us extra towels and soap/shampoo which we appreciated alot. Staff were friendly and the place is quiet.
Manager Response: Dear NanNanSF,  Thank you for your feedback.  We appreciate your business, and the time that you took to write us your feedback.  I do apologize for the issues that you encountered.  We are working hard to remedy the issues that you raised and upon your future return, you will notice the improvements that we have made.

Summary: The staff was so friendly. The room was so clean. It was right across the street from my convention. It was a wonderful experience. The beds were comfortable. The safe in our room was an excellent option. Northside gave us a great view of the Disneyland fireworks at 9:30pm (PST). Thanks again.
Manager Response: Dear RoyC,  Thank you for staying with us, and thank you for taking the time to give us your feedback.  We look forward to having you stay with us again.

Summary Heading: Potential to be a Good hotel but dirty Many issues with housekeeping
Summary: The good about the Clarion in Anaheim.  Location Wow what a great spot very easy to get to Disney you can walk or ride bus and Very close to other Highways to go where ever you want to go and with in walking distance of alot of good restaurants in Anaheim.  Front Desk & Bellhops were very nice and professional   In house restaurant was fantastic for breakfast.  Great tasting food  Buses pick up right outside the front door so you don't have to have a car  Clarion has a paid laundry room so you can do your laundry if needed.  Room was huge  and had a nice little balcony  And a partial  view of Disneys Fireworks.   Really nice pool heated and had guest towels.  The price I got was very affordable   Our room was surprisingly quiet even though we were located very closely to the
Manager Response: Dear mmarrs,  Thank you for staying with us during your stay, and thank you for your feedback.  We appreciate the time that you took to let us know of your experience.  I am truly sorry that our staff did not fully and satisfactorily provide you the service that you, and we, expect.  We are doubling down to address those points that you raised.  We definitely share your commens with our staff to help in our training so that we can do better day by day.  Also, the city of anaheim is very cooperative and anxious to address any reports of loiterers that do not belong in the hotel area, and they respond very quickly.  I am certain that what you experienced wil be a one time anomaly.  We look forward to having you stay with us again when you return.

Summary: Amazed by the fact that there was 2 pieces of hair in my bathroom. No soap & no shower curtain. Most likely will not be staying here again. They have a great rate, but parking is $14 additionally. The only good thing I can mention about my stay was the free wifi.
Manager Response: Dear TylerD, Thank you for giving us your feedback.  I apologize that everything was not attended to in the manner that we are accustomed to.  We are working hard to make every experience here perfect, and your feedback is valuable to us in reaching our goals.

Summary: WE really loved this hotel we will go back and stay here again next year like we have been staying every year. House keeping was great like always office staff really helpful . The shuttle bus to disney land was not expensive at all and it runs every 20 min. Rooms were always nice and clean everyday got new towels daily not like other hotels. microwave and referigerator were great to have on days we just wanted to stay in the room and relax. oh one thing i forgot check in was at 4 pm and we were able to check in by 1 pm which was really great, The male that checked us in was very nice and in a good mood and very helpful, we were switched from a regular room to a suite at no charge now no one can beat that. The beds were very comfortable and very clean smelling fresh, the
Manager Response: Dear BrendaO,  Thank you for your comments.  I will pass them along to our housekeeping staff, our front desk staff, and our restaurant staff who have been working very hard to do a good job and to do better each day.  We appreciate your business, and look forward to having you return to stay with us again.

Summary Heading: Okay if you dont plan on spending much time in room
Summary: My fiance and I stayed one night. The room was clean but is in need of renovation. Furniture and bedding seems dated and our floor and room smelled "stuffy" or old. We would probably not stay again as there are better choices in the area.
Manager Response: Dear AndresZ,  Thank you for your feedback.  And, thank you for choosing to stay with us.  We definitely use value your feedback, and please know that we are working to making improvements every day.  We invite you to come back as we are certain that your experience will be much better.

Summary: I live locally but due to some maintenance issues found myself needing to stay overnight at a hotel. Found the Clarion and from the reservations manager at the time of booking to the front desk staff at check in/check out, I recieved nothing but the best of service. They were all very helpful and friendly and made what was a very long day just a bit better. The room was clean and the a/c worked perfectly. The bed was comfy, linens nice and cozy and started the next day with a great hot shower. While I didn't get to check out the pool, bar or restaurant, I will definitely be looking to stay here for my next unwind and relax weekend.
Manager Response: Dear Madsmith3,  Thank you for choosing to stay with us, and thank you for taking the time to write us your feedback.  Your feedback really does help us to continue to improve.  We really appreciate it.

Summary: Very close to both the Anaheim Convention Center and Disneyland Resort. Short Super Shuttle ride from John Wayne Airport. In room refrigerator at no additional fee. Very reasonable rates with free night specials. Accommodating staff with Bell Service to watch bags prior to check-in and after check-out times so that you can continue to enjoy Disney Park hours. ART stop and passes available if you don't want to walk. Restaurants and 7-Eleven nearby. Looking forward to next stay during the August 2013 D23 Expo.
Manager Response: Dear Allan Y,  Thank you for your business, and for your feedback.  We are working hard to provide that same service that you received each and every time.

Summary: I started planning my family trip about 9 months ago! So i was really excited to finally arrive i was able to check in before 4PM which was great, but when i checked in the girl at the counter did not seem to happy to be at work. She was very robotic and simple while checking us in. (i believe her name was Emily) we finally get to the room and noticed the room was out dated and dirty. Once i entered the restroom i was suprise to realize we did not have any towels. I call the number for assistance on the phone and i tried calling about 2 more times before i finally received an answer and Emily answered and was still very cold with her response before i cold finish my request she said ill send them up and hung up. For the following 2 nights i did not get my towels replaced or the
Manager Response: Dear MorganFamily1,  Thank you for letting me know about your experience.  I apologize that we did not give you the service that we expect to give, and that you expect to recieve.  We are working hard to improve everyday.  Your comments are very valuable in making improvements.  Please know that should you return, we will do better.

Summary: This hotel is "ok". It's 3 large blocks from Disneyland (about 10min walk). The rooms were average, clean and didn't smell funny. The breakfast was nothing to write home about, it put some fuel in your belly. For Disney early entry days the hotel breakfast doesn't work because, they don't open early enough (Starbucks day). The service was very slow as they were under staffed. We brought a large group and this hotel was affordable for everybody. Would I stay there again?? maybe
Manager Response: Dear JordanT25,  Thank you for your feedback and for your business.  We definitely use your comments to help us in constantly find ways to improve our service.  We look forward to having you stay with us again.

Summary: Decent hotel, close to Disney parks. Little shabby around the edges (peeling wallpaper in bathroom, electrical outlets askew). Free breakfast that came with our travel package was TERRIBLE, so if that is a deciding factor for you, skip it. Staff was pleasant and helpful, even when I was overly tired and making mistakes about room numbers.
Manager Response: Dear DC_Padrin0,  Thank you for  your feedback.  I apologize that we did not provide you a better meal when you were here.  We are working very hard to do better next time.

Summary: Have stayed here twice and both times had a GOOD experience. The whole place is showing it's age but rooms were clean and we received great service.The onsite restaurant's are fair and the game room was FUN. Plan on staying here for our next trip to DISNEYLAND!
Manager Response: Dear Shawn E,  Thank you for your feedback.  We appreciate your business, and will continue to work hard so that we can provide you with great service each time you come back.

Summary: I stayed at this hotel for 4 night during a convention I was attending. The hotel is starting show its age in some areas but is kept very clean. The employees are really nice and are very helpful in answering all of questions.
Manager Response: Dear FlyingEagle033,  Thank you for your comments.  We would love to have you come back the next time you plan a trip to Anaheim.

Summary Heading: Good for a relatively close walk to the park
Summary: We stayed here 3 nights during our Disney vacation.  The bed was comfortable, service relatively good, and the pool was nice to take a breather.  We have family with mobility issues, so we drove them down to the 15 min Disney parking to save them the 1 mile walk to the park.  A shuttle is available for $3 per adult and $1 per child.  Decent hotel, but will probably stay a little closer next time.
Manager Response: Dear Kahlan112,  Thank you for your feedback.  We know that you have many choices when you come to Disneyland, and we are grateful that you chose us this time.  We welcome you back should you come, and we will work hard to continue to provide you great service.

Summary Heading: Great stay for a Disneyland trip!!!!
Summary: First time at a clarion hotel and it's nice. Great service and value. They even checked us in first thing in the morning. The rooms are clean. Beds comfortable. The bathroom was clean, just could be retiled and maybe the grout fix. We got free parking and breakfast. I will come back here.
Manager Response: Dear jmo02,  Thank you for staying with us, and thank you for taking the time to give us your feedback.  We really appreciate it.

Summary: The only reason I did not give this hotel a lower rating is that the front desk staff was very nice the entire stay. First, we waited for an inordinate amount of time for someone to help us since there were 3 people at the desk and only one person in front of us. One person was on the phone and the other person was trying to look busy, without much success. There was no problem checking in except that they have a different key structure than the  typical swipe cards and they would not let you have more than two, even though there were 4 people in our room, which they did not mind charging extra for. We were there for a convention and it was extremely inconvenient for us all to not have keys.  The rooms are small and dark, very old looking and not well kept, but the beds were
Manager Response: Dear DisneyMom92,  Thank you very much for your feedback.  I appreciate you letting us know of your experience.  I will definitely share your experience with our employees so that we can improve our service.

Summary: I originally wanted to give this hotel a poor rating, but chose to give an average since the hotel itself is nice and although small, the beds were comfortable, at least that is what my daughter said. I wouldn't know because I had to sleep on the floor!  When booking our stay I indicated that there would be a party of 5.  Clarion's website said the room was for 4 or for 5 with an extra bed, which the website said they provided.  Against my better judgement I did not pack our air mattress.  When I went to check in I was informed that they were out of rollaways and that it is first come first serve.  However, the website did not indicate that and we were left without a bed to sleep on.  I requested additional blankets to make the floor a little softer, after waiting I saw someone
Manager Response: Dear Disneylandmomof3,  Thank you for your feedback.  I will look at our hotel description on our websites to make sure that they are more clear.  I apologize, however, that we did provide you service that was better.  Please know that we will continue to work hard to make sure that when you come back again, we will do better.

Summary Heading: Wow. And not in a good way.
Summary: The only way this hotel stays in business is from overflow from nearby nice hotels and motels.  We checked in very late and had to wait at least 45 minutes for our room.  During our wait we were able to witness plenty of unprofessional/confused behavior by the desk staff, we had plenty of time to look at how dirty and worn out the lobby was and we almost turned and left when we realized no one was going to do anything about the homeless guy sleeping in one of the lobby chairs. When we finally got to the room, we were not surprised to find hair on the sheets of a barely-made bed.  Toilet paper in the toilet and some kids toy in the corner of the room.  Was the 45 minute wait because they had to kick someone out?  Or is the housekeeping staff just that bad?  Doesn't matter, we
Manager Response: Dear Rollingvacationer,  Thank you for letting me know of your experience.  I am extremely sorry about the things that you experienced.  Since your stay, we have worked hard, and made many improvements both in our service and in our product.  Your comments are helpful to us in continuing to find areas for improvement.   Should you return, you will definitely see the improvements that we have made.

Summary: If you're in Anaheim - most likely you're there for a convention or to visit the Mouse.  If so , you're not spending too much time at your hotel.  So keep that in mind when reading this review. The hotel is somewhat timeworn.  The pull out sofabed had open worn spots on it.  You could tell the room had been beaten up somewhat - but then again - this hotel seems to cater to youth groups and teen groups - so really what can you expect. For the price, I think it's a decent value.  Our room was quite comfortable, with a good sized bathroom, and a separate sitting area, and a fridge, microwave and safe.  The beds were small (full size rather than queen), but quite comfortable.  And the room didn't have an odor or smell funny like in many other hotels I've stayed at.   We had an
Manager Response: Dear Roberta F,  Thank you for taking the time to give us your feedback.   We appreciate your business and your feedback as it is very helpful in helping to do better the next time you come back.

Summary Heading: A faraway, dumpy hotel with rude staff and horrible toilets
Summary: I don't mean to be a grouch but it wasn't just my stay that ended up wrong, everyone I asked hated this place. The toilet was broken and made noise all night. We told the manager and they said they fixed it. We came back into the room to get something and found the plumber working on it but when we came in he left and didnt finish.There was a hole in the wall and dirty floors not to mention the fact that our window faced the neighbors window. The pool was good though. They tried to make us  pay for the parking in the complimentary parking lot. The staff was rude and on the phone most of the time. I will not be staying there ever again and do not suggest anyone else even looking in to staying here. I would suggest the Hilton instead.
Manager Response: Dear AnnaBird,  I am sorry that we were not at our best during your stay.  Thank you for taking the time to let us know of your experience.  We have addressed the issues that you told us about with our staff, and we will continue to work harder to be sure we are at our best at all times.  Thank you again for your feedback.

Summary: This hotel is in a great location is you're attending a meeting at the convention center.  It's a short walk (about 5 minutes) from the convention center as well as the Hilton and Marriott.  There's a restaurant on the premises, but I found the food selection to be limited and not necessarily for the health conscious.  While the restaurant staff were friendly and very nice, service was slow.  Most of the desk staff were nice and helpful with the exception of one guy who wasn't good at giving directions.  He kept swinging his hand like a pendulum to show direction, which I'm not sure what that meant.  When I asked if I turned right or left when I left the hotel, he continued with his arm swinging.  I was disappointed to see he would handle the invoice when I checked out. I shared
Manager Response: Dear njlibrn,  Thank you for taking the time to write us your feedback.  They were/are very helpful in helping us to do better next time.

Summary Heading: An OK place, but there are better in the area
Summary: Stayed here as my husband was attending a conference so we did not have our choice of hotels. We had a "suite" with two beds and a sofa bed, as well as a fridge and microwave. Room itself was fairly spacious, if out-dated. The real problem was the beds. They were the smallest I have ever seen in a hotel. I believe they were supposed to be doubles, but I have stayed in double-double rooms before and these beds were smaller. Just barely enough space for two people to lie down, and don't even think about moving once you do. We considered letting one of our party use the sofa bed (which appeared to be twin size), But when we pulled it out the frame was bent and the mattress tipped to one side, and it was a tad dusty from lack of use... so we just made do with the small beds. Someone
Manager Response: Dear aqlollipop,  Thank you for your comments.  We know that you have a choice in your hotel accomodations in this area, and we appreciate that you chose to stay with us.  We are working hard to provide you with the very best accomodations, and we invite you to stay with us again.  I do apologize that your stay was not issue-free.  Your comments are very helpful in improving our service.  We invite you to come back and the next time you are in this area.

Summary Heading: nice room but old but stil a good value
Summary: We stayed one night in a room that had a  king size bed and a pull out sofa bed.  You could tell by the looking at the floors in the bathroom and under sink that the place is old, and our toilet was a little slow.  The room itself was fairly large and had a flat screen TV, sink, fridge, microwave and coffee maker.  We payed 102.00 for a weekday night.  The Disneyland shuttle stops right in front of the hotel and they sell shuttle passes in the hotel.  But the restaurant in the hotel was not very good, it is called Tivoli's.  It took about 10 minutes to receive a menu and the food is so-so.  Not too many restaurants close by so keep that in mind.  There is a super expensive steakhouse across the street. The staff was friendly.  So we got a great deal for our money in my opinion.
Manager Response: Dear Roxy1913,  Thank you for taking the time to write us your very specific and thoughtful comments.  Thank you also for choosing to stay with us.  As we work on the details of our service to provide the best service possible, we do use your comments to help train and improve our service.  We invite you to come back the next time you are planning a trip to Disneyland.

Summary: Very clean, good service, and very near of a lot of attractions. I will stay there next time! Price could be more cheap.
Manager Response: Thank you for your business, and for taking the time to write us your comments.

Summary Heading: Listed as a 3 Star resort hotel, not so much.
Summary: We got a very good price for a mystery 3 star hotel 1 block from Disneyland as a last minute deal on another travel site that shall not be named. FTR: this is 2.5 LONG blocks from the entrance to the park and far from a 3 Star property. The lobby lives up to the rating and the staff was friendly and efficient but the room looked and felt like a 2 Star roadside motel though it was clean. The sink was cracked and the whole of the fittings and furnishings seemed old and worn. The room's TV, which we were told were new, was a 32" LCD that was so dim it was almost unwatchable in the dark let alone with a window open. Despite having a room that shared a wall with the elevators, we never heard them. Never heard anything actually. It was indeed a quiet restful night's sleep both nights.
Manager Response: Dear Da-Raz,  Thank you for choosing to stay with us out of the many choices that you have in the Disneyland area.  Thank you as well for taking the time to write us your feedback.  We take very seriously our service performance, and we do use your comments to help us improve our service and product.  I do apologize that everything was not up to your and our standards.  We are working hard to change that, and your comments are very helpful in helping us to reach our standards every day.

Summary: When I arrived, my travel package was supposed to be there from my travel agent. I was informed it was not by the staff. Only after it was tracked down did we discover that it had arrived and was signed for, only it was lost. The hotel is outdated. The service desk was very slow. We were supposed to get breakfast vouchers at time of checkin. They did not provide nor did they do anything about it until my travel agent called them. This caused an unexpected expense on our part. The sodas from the machine are warm. We got to Disneyland often and I will never stay here again.
Manager Response: Dear Ray H, I apologize for the mix up with your reservation.  I will ensure that your comments are shared with our staff so that it helps us to do better next time.  Thank you for sharing your comments with us.

Summary Heading: Old and poor front desk service
Summary: The hotel is very near to the Disneyland. However, I took 30 minutes for waiting to check out. Only one guy severed for a lot people both checking in and out. The hotel is also a little outdated.
Manager Response: Dear LubbockTraveller,  Thank you for choosing to stay with us, and thank you for taking the time to write us your feedback.  I will share your concerns with our staff so that we can do better next time.

Summary: We had two rooms at the Clarion and we really enjoyed the stay. The front desk people and doormen were very helpful and friendly. The room were great..old but very nice TV's and comforters and very clean. I will definetly stay there again. About 1 mile from disneyland..nice walk.
Manager Response: Dear Denisesb,  Thank you for taking the time to provide us your feedback, and thank you for choosing to stay with us during your stay here in Anaheim.

Summary: Stayed here in early May on the first leg of our journey around the states. Before we arrived I was a bit dubious after reading some of the reviews on here. We actually really enjoyed our stay here. The staff were very friendly and helpful. The room itself was very clean with a clean very comfy bed. Yes the room was a little dated but you dont spend your holiday in your room. Walk to Disneyland was easy. We had dinner in the restaurant one night and it was great. Only negative was the staff on the breakfast could have been a little happier but otherwise would we would stay here again.
Manager Response: Dear VickiH,  Thank you for staying at the Clarion.  We appreciate your business, and your specific comments.  We will incorporate your feedback in continually training our staff to do better.

Summary: We stayed at the Clarion during our spring break. The rooms were roomy, clean and extremely reasonable. The staff was helpful and friendly. We were happy that we could see the Disney fireworks from our hotel window. The walk to Disney was about 10 min...the drive was 3. Thank you for the great stay!
Manager Response: Dear jhseattle16,  Thank you for your business, and thank you for taking the time to write us your feedback.

Summary Heading: The room was OK, but the food was disgusting!
Summary: The room was OK and was reasonable value. There is a bar downstairs which isn't too bad and you have downtown disney nearby to go explore. The food here is [--]. Do you like eating shredded newspapers in watered down milk with a thick layer over the top? That was the oates. You'll find your room will be fine, and you'll go to sleep with no problems but I wouldn't ever eat in there again.
I could not believe how reasonable this place was and the room was beautiful!
Manager Response: Dear Patricia G,  Thank you for choosing to stay with us.  We are glad that we were able to provide the accomodations and the service that you needed.

Summary: Stayed here on our first trip overseas. The hotel is outdated but has all the facilities you need. Could have been a bit cleaner but with friendly staff and being tired after a long day at Disneyland you don't tend to stress about too much about it. If you are from out of town and don't intend to spend much time in the hotel then this place is fine. I wouldn't stay again though purely to try something different next time I make it to the States.
Manager Response: Dear Koukli86,  Thank you for choosing to stay with us, and for taking the time to provide us with your feedback.  Your opinions do matter very much to us, and we are working hard to improve all areas of our service.  I do apologize that we were not able to provide you with an issue free stay.  Please know that your comments are very helpful in our efforts to provide perfect guest satisfaction service.  We hope that you choose to stay with us again.

Summary: This was a family vacation to Disneyland, and the location was great.  it was a brief bus ride, or a walk of a couple of blocks.  The rooms were clean and well kept, and we found upon our return from the park that the staff had even laid out my kids stuffed animals on the bed.  Nice touch.
Manager Response: Dear Malohi,  Thank you for staying with us for your vacation, and thank you for taking the time to provide us your feedback.  We hope you return to stay with us again the next time you come to Disneyland.

Summary: The price we paid was a bonus for how close we were to Disneyland. That being said you get what you pay for. I'm not very picky when it comes to hotel rooms however at this hotel the room we got had a view of a roof with an air conditioner and the carpets were disgusting. The hotel is very outdated and it is the first hotel I have ever stayed at where I checked for bedbugs. The location is the only thing going for this hotel as it is on a shuttle route to Disneyland. We go to Disneyland once a year and to be honest it's worth spending a few extra bucks for the comfort of a clean room.
Manager Response: Dear Peachperfect,  Thank you for taking valuable time out of your day to let me know about the issues that you encountered.  I am truly sorry that we were not able to address the issues while you were here.  Please know that we do use your comments in our training so that we can do better the next time you come and always.

Summary: Quiet, and very pleasant. Did not expect that guests need to pay for overnight parking.  It may be too close to Disneyland.
Manager Response: Dear Larry L, Thank you for the feedback.  We look forward to having you return to stay with us again.

Summary: I was very happy to find this Clarion Hotel on the Choice Hotels website for $55 a night. Great location, Excellent value and Super clean. I loved it. 7th floor balcony view. I was extremely happy. They charge $12 for parking but most everyone does in the Resort Corridor. Disneyland is within walking distance. I will stay here again.
Manager Response: Dear Rauln702,  Thank you for providing your comments to us.  We are glad that we were able to contribute to your wonderful stay.  We know you have many choices for your stay accomodations, and we invite to stay with us when you come back.

Summary: We stayed at the Clarion 15-19th April, 2012. I agree the hotel is a bit (about 30 years) outdated. Room service was below expectations as the bathroom was never cleaned and we had the same bedding for our whole stay. Otherwise we found the staff friendly and the hotel conveniently close to the park.  The Tivoli Restaurant was a disappointment. The arms of the old wicker chairs were sticky from previous users and service was non-existent. I asked for toast and received cold toast and frozen pats of butter. I just gave up and went to Molly's along the street.  I appreciate this is an economy hotel but I think I would go elsewhere in future.
Manager Response: Dear Baileylabdog,  Thank you for taking the time to provide us with your feedback.  We appreciation your business and your feedback that helps us as we continuely work hard to win your business.  Please return and stay with us again.

Summary: This hotel is the worst hotel I have every stayed in, there were large brown stains on the floor and the the staff were very rude and unattentive. We stayed here for a total of seven nights and could not wait to return home as we hardly slept the whole time here as the hotel was very noisy. We only visited the swimming pool once as it too was very unkept and dirty. I would not recommend this hotel to anyone.
Manager Response: Dear 206trish,  I apologize for the issues that you encountered during your stay, and thank you for pointing them out to us so that we can continue to improve our offering to you.  We know you do have many choices for your accomodations and we appreciate very much that you chose us.  Your comments are important to us, as we strive to reach our high expectations.

Summary: The people have been very friendly, but the room we are in is a bit too worn. Furniture looks like it's from the late 80s and the bathroom fixture date from at least the 70s. It is clean, but I was expecting a little more.
Manager Response: Dear Will H,  Thank you for your input.  We know that your time is valuable, and your specific comments do help us to keep our focus on the things that matter to you.  We appreciate your business and hope that you return again.

Summary: I chose this hotel for our stay during Spring Break mainly because of price.  It was very decent.  Then I learned with good price came everything else not so good.  When I first arrived, I dealt with Aida.  She is obviously in the wrong profession.  Her customer service skills are non-existent.  She was beyond rude.  When I walked up to the counter, she was on a personal call and didn't acknowledge me.  Another person walked up and asked if I needed help.  She nodded and said to the person on the phone that she had a guest and had to go.  She then turned her back and continued her call for another few minutes.  Poor service completely.  When we got to our room, there was leftover food from the guest before in the fridge and pubic hairs in the tub.  I felt like I had to clean
Manager Response: Dear Becky C,  Thank you for letting us know about your experience here at the Clarion.  Your comments are valuable to us so that we can continue to improve in the areas that we need improving.  Please know that we do take your comments seriously and will work hard to address the issues that you raise.  We look forward to having you stay with us again.

Summary: This was the first time my 2 kids and I visited Disneyland. We got to our room around 5pm on the 12th. Front desk people were very polite. Our room was nice. One whole wall of our room was nothing but windows. We were able to watch the fireworks from Disneyland every night with no problems. The only issue I had was there were not enough buses that picked you up to take you to Disneyland. Very hard to keep anxious kids and some adults calm. :) Some of the buses were extremely small for as many people that were picked up and dropped off. Otherwise we are definitely recommending this hotel to friends and family.
Manager Response: Dear Seresad,  Thank you for taking the time to give us your feedback and vey helpful comments.  We are always looking for ways to improve your service.  We look forward to having you stay with us again.

Summary Heading: Great 1st time at Disneyland and stay at the Clarion Hotel
Summary: Great economical stay a shuttle away from Disneyland. We arrived super early in the morning on the 13th and were able to check in which started our trip out on a good note. Front desk Hostess was very nice. Nice clean room two double beds and a balcony on the third floor right next to the elevator. :) Very quiet and clean room and hotel. The breakfast buffet was included in our stay and really was nice - american breakfast - good fresh fruit, pasteries, scrambled eggs, potatoes, bacon, sausage, pancakes and a drink. The staff was very nice in the restaurant. Good for families and close to Disney - only a 7 minute shuttle away which picks you up right out front. I would stay here again. Thank you!
Manager Response: Dear Nyrazan,  I appreciate that you took the time to give us your feedback.  I am glad that you enjoyed your stay with us.  We look forward to having you stay with us again.

Summary: We stayed at the Clarion Anaheim because it is close to the Anaheim Convention Center. If this were a $49/night hotel, I would have rated it higher. I've stayed in hotels in East Germany just after the Wall fell that were nicer than this (really). Do yourself a favor and avoid this place.  Pros: It is close to the Anaheim Convention Center. The pool is heated. Parking is sufficient. No hookers or roaches.  Cons:  Front desk is unhelpful. --No rooms were available until 4:00. As in, none, not even one. They refused to call us when our room was ready, but told us to keep checking back. --No late check out was allowed. --When we complained about the poor quality of the hotel, the front desk clerk replied, "Uh yuh" and turned away. --Frequently, there was but one clerk at the front
Manager Response: Dear Tom R,  Thank you for taking the time to give us your feedback.  I apologize that we did not exceed your expectations, as is always our goal.  Please know that we are working hard in every to make sure that every guest stay exceeds not only your expections but ours as well.  Should you return to stay with us, I am confident that you will have a much better experience.

Summary Heading: Great stay - convenient location to Disneyland
Summary: We had a very nice stay at this hotel. Went to Disneyland. It is located just across the street from the Disneyland Parking Lots, so we could just walk across and jump on the shuttle. It was in close walking distance to all the restaurants nearby. Close enough we could take a shuttle back mid day and change clothes and go back to Disneyland without losing a bunch of time. We only ate breakfast at the hotel, but it was quite good buffet style and fairly priced (we spent a lot more at the nearby IHOP the day before!) The room was clean. The staff was mostly friendly. They were usually very busy, so you sometimes had to wait a little bit to get someone to help you, which was pretty understandable. All in all, we really enjoyed our stay. It was convenient and didnt cost a fortune
Manager Response: Dear Sarah L,  Thank you for taking the time to provide us your feedback.  We are working very hard to supplement our great location with great service.  We are glad that you enjoyed your stay and look forward to having you stay with us again when you return to Disneyland.

Summary: This was the worst hotel I've ever stayed at. The floors were discusting and the grout was black in the bathroom. On top of that you have to pay for parking- this place should really be much farther down on the list of hotels in the area, maybe we just had a bad room, but jeez.  Stay somewhere closer to the park with FREE shuttles and no paid parking. The candy cane hotel has free shuttles and Travelodge has free parking, wifi and free breakfast and is actually the same price, if not cheaper.
Manager Response: Dear Caroline P,  Thank you for taking the time to provide us with feedback about your stay here.  I apologize that we did not provide you with the service and the hotel accomodations that we are accustomed to providing.  We know that you do have options for your hotel accomodations, and we hope that you will give us another opportunity to demonstrate that we are working hard to provide you with excellent hotel accomodations, and excellent customer service.

Summary Heading: Good value but didn't like paying for parking!
Summary: The hotel overall was good.  You can tell it's an older hotel and could stand some fresh paint and carpet in the lobby area.  Our room was nice and big and the housekeeping was great.  We just didn't like the fact that we had to pay $12.00 for parking per day.  What "discount" they offer you in the room deal, they make up with the $12.00 a day parking!  I suggest they do away with the parking charge or at least make it $6.00 a day.  If you're there for Disneyland, wonderful location and suggest you give this hotel a try!  Maybe they'll do away with parking charges when you go!
Manager Response: Dear Susan L.  Thank you for taking the time to give us your feedback.  Thank you also for choosing to stay with us during your vacation to Disneyland.  We constantly review our offerings, including parking, to ensure that we are competitive with the surrounding hotels.  We hope that overall, we provided you with a great value for your money.   We look forward to having you stay with us in the future.

Summary: Our family stayed in a suite at this hotel during the Tinkerbell Half Marathon.  It was a spacious room, big enough for three adults and 4 kids.  Probably the most important part about this hotel, is the honesty of the housekeeping staff.  My daughter left her brand new American Girl Doll in the room when we left.  It was not until a few days after we returned home that we realized it was missing.  We searched and searched every possible place of our home, car, etc.  Five days after we departed, I finally called The Clarion to see if we, by chance, left it in the room.  The gentleman took down my contact information and said he would so some checking and get back to me.  Within 15 min., he called and said it was found!!  I couldn't believe it!!  I really appreciate the honesty
Manager Response: Dear kcandi_143,  Thank you for taking the time to give us your feedback.  We know that your time is valuable, and we appreciate that you took time out to let us know about your experience here at the Clarion hotel.  We look forward to having you stay with us again.

Summary Heading: I don't mind outdated if it's clean, but...
Summary: Ours had cobwebs hanging from the ceiling and in the heat lamp in the bathroom.  Drain cover was not attached and I had to take it from my 3 year old who was playing with it in the tub.  There was a 12 inch space between one of the beds and the wall which looked like it hadn't been vacuumed for quite sometime.  There was a brown dried up drip and some spots on the door frame and baseboard of the bathroom that I'm afraid to guess what it was.  I just gritted my teeth and scrubbed it off myself.  There was dried make up on the little plastic signs on the vanity.  We stayed 2 nights.  The beds were made up while we were out, but again no sign of vacuuming and the faucet & sink area had not been cleaned.  Sheets had holes.   Staff was friendly.  Coin laundry was a plus but don't buy
Manager Response: Thank you for giving us your feedback and for taking the time to do so.  I definitely use your comments as a tool to improve our performance.

Summary: Three stars on tripadvisor mean "average," and in its category I give this Clarion hotel three stars.  I'll explain, using pros and cons. Pros:  Room was clean.  Bed was comfy enough, albeit a double instead of a queen.  The room had a mini-fridge.  Maid service was fine.  Free on-site parking.  Front desk staff were friendly and accomodating, especially a young Latino named Sal.  The pool is fairly large and comes with towels and an ample number of lounge chairs.  The affordable ART shuttle buses to Disneyland stop outside the front door and run regularly. Cons:  The bathroom was cramped.  No complimentary breakfast; so unless you eat muffins (or whatever) in your room, you'll breakfast elsewhere (there are several options nearby), or in the hotel restaurant off an expensive
Manager Response: Dear Mhada,  Thank you for providing us with a very thoughtful, organized, and helpful comment.  We most definitely take your feedback into account as we work to provide you with the best accomodations for your money.  We hope you come back to stay with us to see our improvement.

Summary: We have been to Disneyland as a family 5 times and have stayed at the Clarion 3 of those trips.  It is a great hotel for the price. The beds are clean and comfortable, as are the rooms. I found that when you are at Disneyland you have very limited time spent in the hotel. We have always had excellent service from the staff when we are at the Clarion and their food in the bar is great!! We are returning to Disneyland in April of this year (2012) and have booked the Clarion again. We have stayed at a couple of other good neighbor hotels and have not had nearly as good of an experience. One of the Marriott properties that we stayed at had no security (which we found out the hard way when our truck window was broken to steal the GPS). If you are looking for a 5 star hotel you
Manager Response: Dear Nelly J,  Thank you for taking the time to give us your feedback.  We appreciate that you chose to stay with us, as we know that you have many choices to choose from.  We look forward to having you come back to stay with us.

Summary: We checked in the 12-26-11.  We were supposed to check out 12-30-11.  We check out a day early for a couple reasons.  The 2 downstairs men's bathrooms were disgusting.  I walked in one and turned around to go to the other and it was just as bad.  Felt like I was at a gas station.  And my wife said the women's was not much better.  For the price we paid for the trip, the best part was the going to the parks.    The pool was extremely cold when the said it was heated.  No continental Breakfast.  And shuttle #6 that services this hotel,  terrible service.  Use #5 over at the marriott down the street.  I never give reviews, but felt that others need to check this out prior to staying here.  And driving from Portland, then checking in .  I was at a loss for words.  Will not stay here
Manager Response: Please accept our sincerest apologies. Your satisfaction is important to us and we certainly appreciate your feedback.  We are working diligently to improve our service and our product. All your concerns will be addressed to the appropriate departments. We certainly hope you reconsider your position and give us another try.

Summary: Stayed there one night on Dec 5.  The public areas are nice and the staff was efficient.  The rooms were clean and the bed was comfortable.  Now for the bad, which outweighs the good: electrical burning smell from the heater; carpet, although vacuumed, was old and ratty; the bedspread smelled like someone threw up on it; had to unplug the refrigerator at night because it made noise; no key in room safe; light bulb was out; could only get about 5 channels on the TV and the volume control didn't work at all; cracked sink with brown stains; information binder was empty.   For one night it wasn't worth making complaints.  I would like to think that the cleaning staff could see these problems.  It should be something they check on every day and fix.  I doubt if I will stay here again.
Manager Response: Dear Leslie S.  Thank you for staying with us last weekend.  I apologize for the issues that you encountered while you were here.  We did just complete installing all new flat screen TV's and may have contributed to the TV concerns which are now all remedied.  We do strive to give all our guests excellent service.  Should you come back, we will do better.

Summary: Stayed at the Clarion while in Anaheim for business.  The hotel is midrange, you get what you pay for.   I would not say the staff are all that friendly and the hotel is very dated. There was a picture tube still in the room, the carpets were very worn, the shower/tub had cracks in it, and the small fridge in the room buzzed constantly. Though I did not visit, the hotel is located close to Disney, which is probably nice for families.   The internet connection worked well. The hotel is right near restaurants, both high and low end, which is nice. Very close to Anaheim airport and highway, which provides easy access to LA (though not quick of course, LA traffic is awful).

I stayed here in April 2010. It was great for the price. The rooms were really clean. The pool said it was heated. I sure didn't think it was. The only other people that were in the pool were people from Alaska. Still a affordable hotel somewhat close to Disneyland.
Manager Response: We appreciate your taking the to share a quick review of our hotel on Trip Advisor. We hope to have the pleasure to serve you again in the near future.

Summary: We stopped in this hotel on the last leg of a round the usa trip and found it to be excellent.  The bar staff in particular were very friendly and welcoming. The food was quite good too.   The view from our room of Disney fireworks was amazing and the location and bus access to Disney Land and all of LA was great.  The pool is nice and quiet and we very much enjoyed our stay.
Manager Response: Thank you very much for your review! Our team will be pleased to hear that you enjoyed our food offerings! That’s always the goal! Hopefully on your next trip, you can stay with us again! We look forward to that day!

Summary: We were a group of students visiting the conference in convention centre and opted for this hotel because it was close. But this turned out to be the horrible experience. The rooms were worn down.When we asked for water and they wanted money to deliver it to then room even for regular drinking water. Please do avoid this hotel. Dont get tempted by the exteriors.
Manager Response: I am extremely sorry for the issues that you encountered during your stay with us. We are working diligently to improve our service and our product. Please know that we take your comments very seriously and do incorporate your feedback into our training.

Summary: I have stayed at this place probably 4 times over the past 6 years when we go to Disneyland.  Everyone has always been very nice, very helpful, and very polite.  I do agree with the fellow that for the money they don't offer free coffee or even a small bite to get you started in the morning.  I stayed at a motel 8 in Hot Springs SD and they offered free breakfast.  Dear Clarion management,  you really need to set some profits aside and give the customers a little something in the morning, even a coffee pot and stale donuts would be better than nothing.  The Anaheim Hacienda Inn even gives free coffee and donuts. But their place is as my review says, Ah Not Good.  Thanks Steve
Manager Response: Dear Steve, Thank you for your review. We are very happy to know that you have enjoyed your stay. It is our goal to provide a great value to our guests. We hope to see you again soon.

Summary: If this were a cheap hotel I would give it a much better rating - but for the price it's not worth it. I realize the location is ideal for some, hence the price (near Disney and convention center). So if you need a room near one of those places and can spend over 100 a night for a very mediocre place, this will work. Cheaper than the Hilton across the street!  Cons: AC was almost not working at all No gym Really yucky bar Dim florescent lighting in room No breakfast (For this price?) No "minimart" in hotel or nearby Sliding door to balcony didn't lock well (dangerous, a person with ladder could enter room - happened to me before!)  Pros Shower worked well Not dirty Location
Manager Response: Please accept our sincerest apologies. Your satisfaction is important to us and we certainly appreciate your feedback.  We are working diligently to improve our service and our product. All your concerns will be addressed to the appropriate departments. We certainly hope you reconsider your position and give us another try.

Summary: This hotel was booked as part of a tour airfare & Disneyland package deal. We flew 12 hours from Australia and drove from LAX to the Clarion arriving at 10am local. We were told that our family suite was not ready and to come back after 1pm. I advised that we would get some breakfast and asked if a room could be made up for us early as we could see a number of people checking out at the adjoining counter. I was informed that they would see what they can do but cannot guarantee check-in until 3pm.   We went for breakfast and returned about 12 noon. We were again told that there were no rooms available and to wait in the lobby and they will tell us when a room is ready. By this stage, our two children 6 & 10 were almost comatose from lack of sleep in the conspicuous lobby chairs
Manager Response: We appreciate your feedback and would like to thank you for taking the time to review our hotel. All your concerns will be addressed to the appropriate departments. We certainly hope you reconsider you position and give us another try.

Summary: This property has a handful of staff that really do care, hence poor and not terrible rating. The rest INCLUDING managers, such as Elizabeth [--] and Phil [--] being at the core of the problem. When your staff is not trained and are shown no leadership you will have a mismanaged hotel such as this. Some of the items on the property suggest a higher end  such as the price for one, but amenities such as, In room safes (for a fee) large in room refrigerator, new(er) bedding, nice pool area, rec room. THEN you have things like unfinished bathrooms with fixtures not fished under the sink, the shower head not attached to the wall, 1970s tile work. EXPOSED WIRED FOR YOU TO HARM GUESTS. Pick a direction , are you budget? high end? Let me help you, your a budget hotel period. The
Manager Response: Dear 1traviler,  Thank you for taking the time to give us your excellent and detailed feedback about your stay here.    We know that you have a great many choices for the hotels that you choose to stay at in the Anaheim area, and we sincerely appreciate that you chose to stay with us.  We value every customer that chooses to stay with us.  Cody is one of our fine employees at the hotel and I am very glad that he offered you the service that we strive to provide.  I want to apologize to you again that we were not able to resolve to your full satisfaction any and all issues that you encountered while you stayed with us.  I want you to know that we fully comply with all and every safety law and regulation, and we do work closely, and comply with all safety personell as needed, and with all regulations whether local, state, and federal.  We strive to make every guests' stay here perfect.  When we fall short, as sometimes we do, we redouble our efforts to make sure it does not happen again.  Again, I sincerely hope that the next time you return to the Anaheim area, that you give us a chance to prove our sincerity and our work to improve our hotel and our service.

Summary: My wife and I really enjoyed our stay at the clarion. The location was great and well within walking distance to Disneyland. The rooms were very clean and the hotel was quite nice. The only negative was the $12.00 per day parking fee. Overall we had a very nice stay and will return again.
Manager Response: Thank you for your positive comments and business. We hope to have the pleasure to serve you again in the near future.

Summary: old, but clean. had numerous prices and hard to find out different packages and what was available.  Wouldn't it be nice if when you call and ask about availability, someone would help out with all services as in buffet breakfast and parking options along with room and different package offerings?  buffet was $10 if not on package, but ordering off menu proved more expensive and the food no better.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking time out to give us your feedback. We are working diligently to improve our service and our product. I know that you have choices as to your accommodations and hope you have a chance to experience us again with better results.

Summary Heading: Again, more than we expected at the Clarion in Anahiem LA
Summary: We stayed here for 3 nights and were pleasantly surprised on arrival. Only in the USA do you get rooms so big and we like that. Check in was fast and easy with a funny chap called Sal, happy to help. Free parking which was included in our room rate. You can upgrade to a suite for an $20 per night.  We ateat the cheesecake factory was never fails. Great food, prices and service. We ate at a couple of other places on the main road which were ok. Denny's is great for a cheap breakfast.  We went to watch the Ducks, ice hockey at the Honda Centre which is 10 mins drive away and entertainment.  From the hotel you can get Hollywood/LA TOURS $65 for an adult for a day trip which includes quite a lot. We had a car but paying $65 each was money well spent after seeing how spread out
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to write such a great review, we are glad to hear you enjoyed your stay with us. I will be sure to share your comments with Sal.  We hope to welcome you back soon.

Summary: Stayed here for 7 nights, in mid October. Quite enjoyed the stay! Close to Disneyland, walking distance or the ART, Target and several restaurants (IHOP, Denny's, McDonalds, PF Changs, Bubba Gump). Friendly staff, comfy beds (although mine was slightly squeaky).  The only negative thing about the room was the SHOWER! The shower was way too low, and the shower knob had a mind of its own - had to turn it a different way each morning to get a decent water temp!
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to write such a nice review. We appreciate the positive feedback and hope to welcome you back soon.

Summary: When we had booked this hotel we were SO nervous. We had read TERRIBLE reviews on here and were even considering booking another hotel upon arrival.  However when we checked in.. we were extremely relieved and happy to find a great little hotel with really great staff!!!  We had a room on the 9th floor, im assuming it was one of the suites. our room was made up very nicely. it was clean. all fresh linens. tv worked. a/c worked. plenty of hot water. fridge worked. beautiful view out the windows.  3 complaints about the room: Pull out bed was horribly uncomfortable. new mattress is needed. the room was VERY humid. very. and the tub and tiles could use an upgrade.  other then that.... there are zero complaints about the room. the two double beds were very comfortable. linens were
Manager Response: Dear AshBDL,  Thank you for taking the time to give us your very thoughtful, and helpful feedback.  Your feedback help us to pinpoint the areas that we can further improve to provide you the service and product that you expect.  Please know that we are making changes and improvements everyday to give you the excellent service that you expect to recieve, and that we expect to deliver.  We look forward to having you come back.

Summary: We got an excellent rate for this hotel from Priceline, which was a nice stay, however it lacked several amenities I hope for in a 3 star hotel.  Parking WAS included, which was a nice surprise.  There was not a complimentary breakfast, but there was a restaurant in the lobby which was decent and slightly overpriced.  It is about a 15 minute walk to Disney.  The rooms were slightly outdated, but quite comfortable for the price.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking time out to give us your feedback. We are working diligently to improve our service and our product. I know that you have choices as to your accommodations and hope you have a chance to experience us again with better results.

Summary: When we arrived to Annaheim I was surprised how many outdated hotels over there. It's  seems like the closer they are to Disneyland - the less they care about renovating...  Our hotel wasn't exeption, my impression was like I was back in 1980s. When we entered our room first what we noticed is the powerful smell of filthy socks and missing windows! I mean, we had a view window - big piece of glass with no sign of open it. The only way to get the air in the room is old AC ( no wonder why I got  astmatic bronchitis 4 days later). Old furniture, squeaky beds...  Our bathroom was poorly cleaned, If bathtub was at least wiped but I could bet that floor hasn't been washed since World War II. The shower curtain.. Gosh! How can you not change such a filthy curtain? It cost $1 at any
Manager Response: Thank you for taking time out to give us your feedback. I am happy to hear that the staff was very helpful and caring. We are working diligently to improve our service and our product. I know that you have choices as to your accommodations and hope you have a chance to experience us again with better results.

Summary: When I arrived, they could not find my reservation -- it took about ten minutes for them to discover it had been faxed to them but never entered into their system. The non-smoking room had cigarette burns on the furniture, a powerful smell of rotten eggs (sulphur dioxide, I think) from the water faucet as soon as it was turned on, a Zenith tube TV -- maybe 24" -- that had a text feature from the 1980s that blacked out half the screen, and a wall a/c-heating unit that one might find in an old Motel 6 (and no thermostat for control). The drapes are missing a pull-rod on one side (showing a lack of attention to detail). The Internet instructions are to be found in the Guest Services Directory (there is no directory in the room). This is an old building with high published rates
Manager Response: Thank you for taking time out to give us your feedback. I am extremely sorry for the issues that you encountered during your stay with us. We are working diligently to improve our service and our product. I know that you have choices as to your accommodations and hope you have a chance to experience us again with better results.

Summary: Was upgraded to a Suite on the top floor. that gave us a fridge. Toy Story Lot was across the street that made shuttles easy and cheep.  Food was good enough and not crowded . Able to see fireworks.  Only downside was Air had trouble keeping up on a hot day but was not enough of a issue to ask to move.  Thanks to Aida and Sal.
Manager Response: Thank you for the great review. We really appreciate your business and are happy to hear you enjoyed your stay. I will make sure to share your comments with Aida and Sal and the rest of our staff. We look forward to having you come back in the future.

Summary Heading: Disappointed and won't stay here again.
Summary: I booked our 4 night stay through the airline to take advantage of a package deal.  The room was NOT what I requested or paid for and the staff members at the Clarion had no interest in making it right.  They let me know that I needed to go back to the airline if I was dissatisfied with the room's amenities.  We did have a fridge in our room but the door wouldn't stay closed and the bathroom had tile and grout issues.  We had only carry-on bags and utilized the hotel's lock up for the luggage and then found that the baggage had been handled so roughly that liquids and medical equipment had been broken.  Again, the hotel had no apology or way to receive restitution.  Don't stay here!
Manager Response: Please accept our sincerest apologies and rest assured that we are taking measures to prevent such events from happening again. Your satisfaction is important to us and we certainly appreciate your feedback. I know that you have choices as to your accommodations and hope you have a chance to experience us again with better results.

Summary: Right across the road from the Disney parking lot..short walk and catch the Disney shuttle!!!  Didn't have to pay parking at Disney, which is $15.  Didn't have time to check out the pool or fitness center, but the room was clean and had a great balcony view.  Front desk staff was awesome and very nice.

My son, grandson and I stayed in one of the suites from Aug 22-26 for our trip to Disneyland. We were delayed by an accident in Commerce (surprise) and called ahead to see how close we were and if we would be able to make our Medieval Times reservations. Naomi advised us that we still had another 30-40 minutes depending on traffic, gave us directions and then referred us to Fernando for info in Medieval Times. Check in was a breeze and Fernando showed us the quickest way, on surface streets, to Medieval Times. Our room, and especially bathroom, was clean, beds comfortable and enough room for 3 of us. My son and grandson enjoyed the pool, my son enjoyed the fact he could escape from me for a bit by going down to the bar for a drink and non family chat. We had room service twice
Manager Response: Thank you for letting us know of your experience.  We are so glad that your family enjoyed your time here in Disneyland.  I will definitely pass along your feedback to our staff to help us work even harder to be the best.

Summary Heading: 6th time staying here and love the place!
Summary: We have stayed here several times over the last couple of years when we want a weekend or few days away at Disneyland and don't want to pay the exorbitant price of the resort hotels.  The place is in need of a remodel, not because it's falling apart or anything, but it's stuck in 1985 and needs to be freshened.  But everything is very clean and well taken care of.  There is a restaurant for breakfast that's just OK if you don't want to fight the crowds down at IHOP or Denny's.  The bar is small and quiet but has really nice bartenders.  They have a great special for a Large Pizza and Pitcher of soda for like $15-20? (don't quote me on price, I forgot) which includes room service so it's a great bargain.    I would normally knock a point off of the place for having such expensive
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to give us your feedback.  We really appreciate your letting us know how we can be even better.  We look forward to having you come back.

Summary Heading: You get what you pay for...
Summary: If you are looking for an average priced average hotel then this is it.  The rooms are basic but suffice and much thye same can be said of the resturant and the pool.  The service of the front desk staff and conceriege all very friendly and helpful, in fact Dan at guest services desk was brilliant - so helpful.  Breakfast was the huge downside, it was well below average and servers were rude.  The hotel had a broken window at the front during our stay that really shouold have been fixed so it didn't look like we were staying at a ghetto.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking time out to give us your feedback.  I am very sorry that every aspect of your stay was not up to our standards.  Thank you for acknowleding Dan's service to you.  We are working hard to make every facet of the hotel excellent.  I hope you give us another chance.

Summary Heading: If you care about quality go elswhere...
Summary: We stayed at that Clarion Hotel Anaheim the week of the 8th.  We made reservations for a suite.  When we arrived on a Tuesday around 11am the front desk rep. was not welcoming.  She did not smile and told us that check-in was at 4pm and went on working on her paperwork. She did not give any options nor was she customer service oriented.  She looked irritated and annoyed.  Didn't seem like she liked her job.  She told us to come back and that was all she said. Luckily, we had friends who arrived one day earlier at the same hotel, so we dropped off our belongings and rested in their room after an 8 hour drive. When we finally checked in with another front desk rep. again we experience the same unwelcoming attitude.  We got to our suite and our kids were amazed by the size of the
Manager Response: I am extremely sorry that we did not make your experience at our hotel incident free.  Please know that we are working hard to improve every single area of the hotel.  I know that you have choices as to your accomodations, and I appreciate that you chose to stay with us last week.  Again, I apologize for the incidents that you experienced and hope you have a chance to experience us again with better results.

Summary Heading: This new GM is really care about the business!!
Summary: My family  stayed in this hotel  beginning of this month. The hotel was OK, but the  front counter clerks were not friendly at all. Their attitude were cold and not willing to help. I went to the office to make  complains. Next day, the General Manager called me and apologized. Although he is new in the position, but you can tell that he is trying very hard to improve the service and whatever he can to make the hotel better place to stay. I will stay there again next Jan for the NAMM show, I believe everything should be very different, because the hotel hire an excellent manager!!!
Manager Response: I apologize that every aspect of your stay here was not up to our standards, and to your expectations.  We are working hard to exceed your expectations at every level in our interaction with you.  We look forward to having you stay with us again.

Summary: This is the third time we've stayed here while attending a sporting tournament at the Convention Center. Since we got the group rate, it's worth the price.
