The staff is helpful, the rooms are clean, the restaurant & bar are just fine, but the property is older ie.  the bathrooms are small, the elevators are slow, the carpets are a bit worn, etc., but nothing horrible.  It's still a great value. This time around we upgraded to the mini-suite (I think it's called) and the additional space, refrigerator & microwave were well worth the extra 20 bucks. Since there are often a lot of tournaments going on, expect to find youth teams around and about. The on-site parking is convenient, and no more expensive than the other hotels, or the Conv. Center itself.
Manager Response: Thank you for letting us know about your experience.  We are working hard to improve those areas that we can.  We definitely appreciate that you've chosen to stay with us when  you come to the convention center or to Disneyland, and hope that you will continue to do so.  Thank you again for your business.

Summary Heading: nice hotel but the age is showing
Summary: very nice hotel, bathroom stall was tiny.  If you sat on the toilet you had to do a twist to get at the right angle, very small room.  the tile was old and caulking was breaking apart, but other than that a very nice room.  the maid made our trip even more special by arranging our daughters stuffed animals in a playful manner, which made our daughter happy.  because of that i tipped generously!!!!.
Manager Response: Thank you for staying with us.  Thank you also for your feedback.  We are really working hard to make your stay here the best.

Summary: We were disappointed with having to pay a fee to use the room safe and having the use based on the honor system.  Also extremely disappointing to have our grandson's DS disappear when the family accidentally left it charging in the bathroom outlet.  He has been waiting for days to hear about it but so far no one knows what happened to it.  Sad to say I see now why they need the safe.
Manager Response: I am very sorry that we did not make everything right, and that your stay here was not perfect, which is our goal.  Please know, that the security of your belongings are very important, and do take your feedback very seriously so that we can do better next time.

Summary Heading: Clean Room but horrible breakfast buffet/rude waiter
Summary: We were there July 5-9, 2011. The room was very nice and clean. Unfortunately, the bathtub drain would not close so my 2 and 5 year olds could not take a bubble bath. Showers were horrible as every morning we would take a shower, the water would turn really cold and instantly turn really hot, so I couldn't give my 2 kids showers. When we went to eat breakfast at their restaurant in the hotel, they asked us if we had a voucher (as we booked with Get Away Travel Agency) and we said "yes" and from then on were treated like second-class citizens. I asked the waiter, Armando, if we could order hot chocolate and he very rudely, in front of everyone told us that we had a "voucher" and we would have to pay extra, so I said I would be happy to. He then replied that the hot chocolate
Manager Response: Thank you for letting us know about your stay here.  I am truly sorry that we did not provide you the service that we expect from our employees, and that we are working hard to improve.  Please be assured that we will take proper steps so that our guests will not encounter similar service levels.  Each guest is important to us. Again, I apologize for falling below our expectations.  We will do better.

Summary: The hotel exceeded our expectations and we were very happy with our room.  The bed was very comfortable and the room was clean.  We plan to stay again in the future. The staff was very accommodating.
Manager Response: Thank you for staying with us, and for your feedback.

Summary Heading: I will not recommend it to anybody.
Summary: First of all, the clerk at the front desk was not friendly. The bathroom floor, bath tub, and the sink were extremely dirty. The bath room did not have exhaust fan, and the kitchen sink was clogged. The room has not been cleaned properly. This was the worst hotel we had ever stayed at.
Manager Response: I am extremely sorry for the issues that you encountered during your stay with us.  We are working diligently to improve our service and our product.  Please know that we take your comments very seriously and do incorporate feedback into our training.

Summary Heading: Liked it but they charge for parking.
Summary: Good value for the money, clean and easy walking distance to California Adventure and Disneyland.  Not overly fancy but comfortable and everything we needed.  We had a rental car and were disappointed that they charge for parking.
Manager Response: Thank you for expressing your concerns.  Thank you for staying with us, and we strive to provide a competitive product with the surrounding hotels in our area.

Summary Heading: We won't be staying at the Clarion again...
Summary: We had a big group, 12 people and 3 rooms and booked months in advance.  When we got to the hotel at 3:00 we were told our rooms weren't ready.  We waited until 5:00 before all 3 rooms were cleaned and ready for us.  The rooms aren't terrible but very dated.  The TV has very few channels and the internet doesn't always work.  We had to wait in line for 45 minutes to eat our "free" breakfast and the bar and pool close early so we weren't ever able to use them by the time we returned after Disneyland.  The only good thing was the beds, they were comfy.
Manager Response: I am sorry that we were not able to have your rooms ready in a timely manner.  Thank you for taking the time to give us your very cogent feedback.  We are working hard to improve our service, and we do hope you change your mind and come back.

Summary: I did the "name your own price" on Priceline and got stuck with this hotel for our Disneyland vacation. I checked the reviews on here and I was scared. I was thinking of finding a better place to stay and just eating the cost of this hotel. I'm sure glad I didn't. There was a line upon checking in, at about 7pm. We had a overly tired 2 year old and were ready to get to our room. The 3 sets of people in front of us were all from different countries and the language barrier was bad. The young man at the desk was very kind and patient with all of them. I think I would have gone postal having to deal with them but he kept his cool. His apology for our wait was very sincere and I told him not to worry about it. After all, it wasn't his fault. He was so friendly and nice and really
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to give us your valuable feedback.  We know your time is valuable, and really appreciate that you took the time to let us know the details of your stay.  We will continue to work hard to be better in all areas.

Summary Heading: Everything we needed it to be, but dated rooms
Summary: Hotel room was clean and the staff was friendly.  We booked through Priceline and got a great price, but did not feel it should be classified as a 3 star.  The bed was comfortable, and it had everything we really needed, the room just seemed very dated.  The lobby was nice and seems to have been remodeled, but the rooms are on the older side.  Window unit was noisy (which I like), but some guests might not.  Parking was a bit steep at $12 a day.  Older TV with limited channels.  For the price we paid, we were satisfied with our level of comfort, just a little disappointed with the "niceness" of the room as a "3 star."  For the right price, we'd stay again, but it wouldn't be our first choice in the future.
Manager Response: Thank you for the review.  We are working hard to address those issues that will make your stay here much better the next time.

Summary: Stayed 2 nights with my family in this hotel to visit Disneyland. Room was good, for the rates I have paid (around $60). It is close to Sheraton and Hilton with a 15 minute walk to Disneyland Parks - not bad in the morning. In the end of the day we decided to take a taxi ($ 9). In a review I have read they charge $ 12 for parking; they did not charge me.
Manager Response: Thank you for your feedback.  We are continuing to work hard to provide our guests with great service.  It is good to see that we are on the right track.  Should you come back to Disneyland in the future, we look forward to having stay with us again.

Summary: These people should not run a hotel.  The lounge and restaurant opens when they think it should, not when they say it does.  There is no early check in even though I requested it.  They told me to wait at the pool for 4 hours (The pool was a mess!). The people who work here have no clue and no reason to help you out.  If the reservation had not been pre paid, i would have walked!  If you can get a tent close by, take that as opposed to this place.
Manager Response: I am very sorry that we were not able to specifically meet your needs.  Please be assured that we are working hard to get better every day.  We hope you do return, and we are certain that you will have a better experience.

Summary Heading: Not that good, but you get what you pay for.
Summary: This was my annual trip to Disneyland with my wife and son (age 3 at time of review).  Last year we stayed at the Holiday Inn Suites near Downtown Disney, which was great.  Only drawback with that hotel was the not so close proximity to Disneyland and the loud fireworks at night, but we otherwise loved it.    The Clarion was our choice via a Priceline bid, and everything looked OK on the surface.  After reading some of the terrible reviews, I was expecting a place that would make Norman Bates look like J.W. Marriott.  But here's the bottom line, you get an acceptable (not luxurious or modern) room for about $30-40 less per night than most other hotels in a resort area.  The bed was not that firm but OK.  The internet access was a joke.  Plugging in the network cable gave you
Manager Response: Thank you for your feedback.  We are working harder to meet your expectations.  I apologize for not reaching those expectations.  However, should you return, we are confident that your experience will be much better.

Summary: We first stayed at the Clarion back in 2008 and then again back in 2010.  Both times we had a great stay. The rooms were clean, the beds were comfortable, the staff were very polite and cheerful and the food was pretty good.  Yes it's abit of a walk to Disneyland but considering all the junkfood we were planning on eating we were quite happy to walk the three blocks. We caught the shuttle bus back at night and found it easy to board each time.  My daughter loveds the Clarion and has actually requested we stay there next time we visit. In her words " It's not fancy mum but I feel safe and at home there".  The only thing I would ask is for a few more complimentary coffee sachets to be left out instead of 1.
Manager Response: Thank you for your business and for your comments.  We very much appreciate that you choose to stay with us.  We look forward to having you stay with us again, and know that we will take to heart your feedback.

Summary: i checked in on a saturday night and a young gentleman by the name of sal checked me in he was extremely rude and direct. the rooms need to be renovated and housekeeping needs work, i found trash under my bed that was not mine, who knows how long that trash had been under there. I checked out on sunday morning and 2 young ladies (emily & ada) checked me out they were extremely friendly and bubbly they are a great attribute to your hotel. they made my stay a little bit more pleasant. i would return only to conversate with them.
Manager Response: Thank you for your comments.  I apologize that all of our employees did not exhibit the consistent great customer service that we all strive for.  We hope when you return, we can show you our improved consistent customer service level.

Summary: Service wasn't the best; didn't try the food but the restaurant area it wasn't encouraging; pool's very small; elevators were veeeeeery slow; rooms are clean and big; windows are not opening, so there can be veeeery hot in the summer
Manager Response: Thank you for your thoughtful feedback.  Please know that we are working hard to make  your stay here the best ever.

Summary: Somebody actually gave this place a positive review??!?  The entire property exudes cruddiness.  The carpet, drapes, and chairs all had mystery stains.  I was afraid to take off my socks and walk on the carpet barefoot.  The room is what I would expect from a motel in Barstow or Needles.  Refrigerator, coffeemaker; safe (don't let them charge you $1.30 for it).  Old TV.  Room service 630-930A, 430-930P (sandwiches and salads). Restaurant, bar; gift shop, lobby pay computer, pool.  Parking $12/day. Free newspaper.  Free but very slow wireless internet. Not suitable for families visiting Disneyland but there is a free shuttle.  Not suitable for anybody unless you bid on Priceline like I did and got zonked.  And this is Choice Hotels' flagship brand.
Manager Response: I am very sorry that we did not help provide you a good hotel experience.  We are working to improve every area and hope you give us another chance.

Summary: Hotel was older than expected but it was well kept and clean. Front desk was very helpful and courteous, especially when I lost my key every day. It was next to Disneyland so it made it very convenient.
Manager Response: Thank you for your feedback.  We are really in a great location and hope you return next time you visit Disneyland.

Summary: A couple of things made what was otherwise a good experience somewhat disappointing. The room I had on the 7th floor was very noisy.....ranks as one of the three worst hotels I've ever stayed in for night-time noise. Add to that possibly the worst in-room coffee I've ever had and it made for a less than enjoyable stay.  Overall though, the hotel was OK. The rooms are pretty good (double beds...not queen), clean and well equipped.....although its rare to find a room without flat screen TV's anymore. Staff were good, parking was OK ($12 per day) and there is a restaurant and gift shop on site. You will have to pay for breakfast (although I did read that kids eat free?). Free wifi was very slow, except in the lobby, which was actually pretty nice.  A word of warning though...the
Manager Response: Thank you for sharing your concerns.  I do apologize for those for the noise.  We continue to improve in those areas that you mentioned.  I do hope that you come back again next year during your spring vacation time.

Summary Heading: What a complete mess this hotel is
Summary: I found the hotel in its entirety a mess from start to finish.  The staff was impolite and unhelpful.  No one once smiled at the front desk. The so-called free high-speed internet was always saturated and never high-speed.  I logged onto the next door Travelodge.  The room was worn and stuffy.  The only way to get air into the room was to run the fan or air conditioner and that made a lot of noise.  The toilets did not flush reliably and the shampoo on two occasions was a used bottle.  A terrible place to stay.  With so many alternatives, go elsewhere.
Manager Response: Please accept my apologies for the things that were not up to your, and our, expectations during your recent stay here this week.  I want to assure you that we are working hard to not have any similar instances happen again.  We would love to have you stay with us again, and assure you that if you should return, you will experience a much better stay.

Summary Heading: OK hotel but not the service or the food
Summary: The hotel is clean and neat. The front desk is functional but not very friendly which is a surprise considering most of the front desk in US is over friendly sometime. The room is clean, it comes with free wifi and really closed to Anaheim Convention Center. The food in the cafe is totally disappointing and the service is really slow. But if you just want a place to stay, than this is a good place.

Beds were overly soft, not comfortably soft. Maids only spoke Spanish. Found one cockroach on the bathroom floor and steeped on it! Called the front desk about it and 5 minutes later a maid shows up with an aerosol can of bug killer to spray! No thank you...don't want to breath that stuff! Not only that I believe that you have to be licensed to spray bug killers in commercial locations. Do the white sock walk...yours should be dirty in 5 to 7 minutes of room walking. Floors should be steam cleaned more often. Will not return.

Summary Heading: Avoid this hotel when traveling to Disneyland
Summary: This Clarion was the biggest dissapointment  of our trip to Disneyland and California. The hotel was very dated and in poor shape. Some of the paint on the walls in the bathroom were chipping and had a few small repair holes. The room had a musky odor and the carpets were very worn. The beds were hard, uncomfortable and squeaked when there was any movement on them. Unfortunately, we waited over an hour in the restaurant to get breakfast despite the fact that there were  two waiters an only 5 small families in the dining area. I complained to the hotel manager but she did not seem interested in my comments?
Manager Response: Thank you for the feedback.  Please be assured that we are working hard to improve our service so that you can enjoy your stay with us in the future.

Summary: My boyfriend and stayed at this hotel from Dec 28-Jan 1st 2010 and it was the worst mistake ever in our hotel history!  First of all before we came I suffered my first seizure only a couple days prior, so when we landed at SNA our luggage did not arrive and I was tired so I took the trip to the hotel well my boyfriend dealt with the luggage.  When I arrived to the hotel the room was under his name, but I had his credit card and our reference number.  Yet I guess this was not good enough for them so I had to wait in their lobby until my boyfriend arrived ( we dont bring our cells as its really expensive ).  2 hours later we were able to check in with the staff ( which it seemed like we were putting them out by wanting to check in ).    When we arrived up to our room it smelt like
Manager Response: I am truly am sorry that your experience was not the best.  Our guests' safety and security is one of our most important concerns.  And, unfortunately sometimes it is an inconvenience.  I appreciate your comments, and we will do better next time.

Summary: I've stayed at the Clarion Hotel twice now.......both stays were fine....when you pay a "value price"your not going to get top of the line anyhow....the rooms have always been clean.Yes, its older but, we were never there enough to care..what the decor was like and I personally chose cleanliness over looks any day.The pool is the best because its quiet and private compared to the other hotel we stayed at you almost have the whole pool to yourself (can't promise that year round but, in Oct and June it was) Some of the front deak people are happier than others..I was actually frightened to ask  one of them for something as she came across very unhappy to be there  and that was a supervisor. So, I think this hotel needs to put effort into training their staff to be more people
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to give us your very specific suggestions to improve our service at the Clarion Hotel.  We hope that the next time you return, you do stay with us, and that you will see the improvements that we have made in our service.

Summary: We stayed at this hotel with our 3 children and 3 adults. We were here because we came to Disneyland for Christmas...The only thing that was convenient was how close it is to Disneyland but other than that it was very unsatisfactory! I came down to the front desk to get some change for the vending machine and stood in front of an older gentleman for about a good 3-5 minutes before I finally said, "Do you work here?" He stated yes give me just one second, the whole time Im standing there he never once even looks at me, so then he finally said, What do you need, I said I need some change and he tells me to hold on so the other guy could help me, well the other guy was already helping two other guest and that is why I came to him to begin with...so then he waits a few minutes and
Manager Response: I apologize for the not-so-stellar service you recieved.  I will definitely see to it that our attention to guests' needs are better handled.

Summary Heading: Rude staff at old shabby hotel.
Summary: We stayed at the Clarion in Anaheim on our trip to Disneyland. The best thing about the hotel is its proximity to the Disney parks. It is also pretty affordable. We only paid $70/night during the week after christmas so I was pleased with that. For that price I don't expect the Four Seasons but I do expect courteous service.   During check-in the girl at the front desk was exceedingly rude to both me and my wife. It was as though we were an extreme annoyance by wanting to stay there. This kicked off our stay on a bad note. We brought our son's pack and play for him to sleep in.  We asked for a crib sheet to be brought up and they said they would but it never showed. My wife finally went downstairs to the same rude girl and got on 2hrs later.   They have a couple restaurants on
Manager Response: I am sorry that we did not contribute to you having a good vacation during your trip to Disneyland.  I am working to improve our service and hope that you will give us another chance.

Summary: After having this hotel recommended to us by a previous group who had travelled here, we decided to take our group to this hotel. Whilst the hotel is in a convenient location for Disneyland that is about where the good points about the hotel finish. The standard has slipped dramatically in 4 years to the point where we will never go back, nor recommend anyone else goes there, and it is a shame that this is what 60 people will remember from their time in Anaheim. The rooms were never cleaned properly, on 2 occasions we found the housekeeping staff dirty cleaning towels left in our room after it had supposedly been serviced. On several occasions the door of one of our rooms was left open after being serviced (this happened 3 days in a row and was reported each time and nothing
Manager Response: I am extremely sorry that we did not reach your expectations.  We are correcting the issues that you pointed out, and hope that you change your mind about returning and give us another chance.

Summary: Room was clean and decently appointed considering this is not an upscale hotel. Was there for a convention and the price was cheaper than anything else close by. Would have prefered 1 king bed instead of 2 doubles but I knew that beforehand. The staff were very nice, breakfast in the restaurant was actually pretty decent, peaceful and attentive. So if you can't afford to stay at the Hillton, it's a good value for the money.
Manager Response: Thank you for kind response.  We hope that you choose to come back for your next trip to a Convention, or to Disneyland.

Summary Heading: Typical older hotel that has been modestly updated
Summary: I stayed at the Clarion in Anaheim for a Conference.  The location was perfect for us, an easy walk to the Convention Center.  We had no problems checking in or out (on heavy traffic days).  The rooms were modest.  It is obviously an older hotel that has done some updates.  We only ate breakfast at the hotel.  It was good, but they were understaffed.  The wireless was free, but inadequate.  In terms of the surrounding hotels, we could have chosen a nicer one, but we would have paid more for it. Overall, we had a pleasant trip and with a few caveats I would recommend it to fellow business travelers.

Summary Heading: most awful hotel experience ever!!! Will never go back or recommend to anyone!!!
Summary: We arrived at the hotel after a very long flight on September 18 around 2am . The man behind the desk was the rudest person ever. He kept making insulting gestures when my fiance was trying to read the license plate number of the rental keys. We thought the worst was over so after taking a shower and trying to get into bed we noticed these 2 big brown spots on the sheets. We tried to call the desk and no one picked up. So my fiance had to go down and let them know. The rude man wouldn't even listen to him so instead he sends the security guard up to change the sheets. After about 15 mins of trying to find the right  sheets we get a call from the desk saying that BECAUSE HE DIDN'T WANT TO INCONVENIENCE THE SECURITY GUARD AND SO HE  DOESN'T DO  ANYMORE WORK THEY WOULD SWITCH OUR

The Clarion Hotel is absolutely wonderful.  Yes the hotel is an older hotel, but the upkeep of the facilites is great.  We had our church youth group stay at the Clarion for 2 nights.  The rooms are clean and well kept and the staff from the front desk to the catering staff and the security were awesome!  All of these people made you feel welcomed.  The staff is like family, they take good care of you.  We had breakfast catered for us each morning, and the food and the service was outstanding.  When booking this hotel, the sales manager was so kind and outgoing and looking out for all our needs, and the needs were exceeded with excellence.  I really give the Clarion high marks for their facilities and their staff.  I would recommend this hotel to friends and family.

This hotel was ok for a single night stay, which is all we needed.   Since we are die hard Disney fans we went for the park and spent so little time in the hotel room that it makes it less of an issue & could live with this hotel at the price we paid.  The room was dated without a doubt but it was clean and the bed was comfortable.  It was quiet with the exception of the kids screaching at the pool the next morning.  We were a bit surprised we could hear that considering we were on the 5th floor, but other than that it really was very quiet.    We didn't use the restaurant as there are several nearby options to choose from depending on what you are in the mood for.  The restaurant was empty when we arrived (lunchtime) and also when we checked out at 11:00 a.m. so wait time did

So, the fact that it was so close to the disney park was nice.. everything else i was very unhappy with, my family and i check in at about 11:00 p.m. theres a male working, looked like he could have been a manager? he was extreamly rude, him and the other gentlemen that was workin with him that night made us feel very ignored. we get everything we need go to our room and its a hastle to close our hotel room door all i seen all that night were people complaining about one thing or another. the beds werent too bad so we slept alright i would have to give it a thumbs down for customer service. the busses that we payed for to take us to disney came about once an hour, (we were told every 15 min) there was a homeless man bathing in the fountain in front of the hotel and no security

Summary Heading: Old and tired, would not stay there again.
Summary: Staff were friendly, but hotel looked old and tired from the outside. Website photo is a bit misleading. Hotel rooms were a bit old and was not a great first impression of America.  Food was average, ate out after first night, because pizza wasn't that good. Would not recommend anyone to stay there if they are only going to Disneyland. It is  not as close to Disneyland as we were told. Definitely  should stay IN Disneyland.

Wow!!  The Ceres Sizzle 16U Team just got back from Disneyland were we stayed at the Clarion Hotel on Convention Way.  I must say I was more than impressed with the staff. We arived 5 hours befroe check-in; not only did they get us into rooms, but they up-graded us to mini-suits (at no extra charge) and got us all on the same floor. We were even able to get ajoining suits so the players were able to virtually stay in the same room.  The rooms were very clean and had pleanty of towels (big issue when you have a buch of 16 and 17 year old girls). The staff was great.  I will recommend the Clairon to all of my friends and family.

We arrived early morning around 9am after transferring from Hollywood. We were pleased to find out our room was ready and we were able to check into our room. The room was clean and tidy. The bathroom was clean but is in need of a makeover with some wallpaper peeling off the walls. This is 2010 and they still have bulky old style TV's but they do have free wi-fi. The hotel is a couple of blocks away from Disney and we found the walk quite reasonable, the shuttle service comes by every 20mins or so if you don't want to walk. We had a continental breakfast included, this was simple, consisting of tea or coffee, toast or muffin and a choice of hot or cold cereal.

Summary Heading: Run Down and Dirty with unhelpful staff
Summary: I booked this through a vacation package and it turned out it WAS too good to be true. The best part was the pool was clean and fairly warm, but the towels were emery boards. Our bathroom was so disgusting - the sink would not drain, the bathroom was mouldy, I dared not put my kid in the tub for a bath. Pretty dingy. Also they did not sell the passes for the transit bus for children there, the shuttle service on anaheim transit was horrible - out of about 15 bus routes, this one for this hotel was the least reliable. The gift shop was small and not well stocked, the restaurant was just ok and the 3 concierges I dealt with were just plain unhelpful. We booked bus tour of LA with Johnny who was awesome and told us a lot about the surrounding area - where to shop and stay. I would

Summary Heading: Dont let the pictures fool you!!!!!
Summary: When we arrived to the hotel the guest service lady was pleased to let us know that we had been upgraded to a Suite, including my mom and dad as well. So we finish checking in and get to our "SUITES"!! WOW, our beds were a full if that and not a queen and the part about an upgrade was because they threw in a lumpy uncoftorable sofa bed. The bathroom was the size of my closet at home, we had 6 people in the room and the bathroom could barely fit 1 person in there..If your sitting on the toilet and want to open the door to let someone in, forget about it aint going to happen. There was mold on the shower tiles and the shower head was broken. Our phone didn't work and that was a big deal being that we had other family members in the hotel, took 2 phone calls to guest services for

We come every year the whole way from Ireland. We travel with five children and throughly enjoy our stay every year. All staff are effiecent and pleasant. It almost feels as if we are visting relatives they are that friendly. The rooms are always clean, airy and spacious. Every thing is close at hand, such as The Garden Walk and Disneyland and lots of choices of restaurants. We have travelled every year from 1996 to this hotel. One of the best parts of our holiday is staying in this hotel. With the games room and swimming pool it is family freindly. Looking foward to our next stay again at The Clarion Hotel.   Duffy Family, Ireland

We booked this hotel through Disneyland Travel.  They are listed as a "Good Neighbor Hotel".  We traveled with a total of 4 adults and two teen boys.  This was listed when we booked.  So Disney Travel gave us this hotel and booked it as a Suite.  Fine, we figured there would be enough room.  Nope.  Suites are not suites at this hotel.  They are just regular old double bed rooms with this little couch thing, the size of a chair, that folds out.  You may get an extra 2 feet of room with this so called suite.  We ended up having to get a rollaway bed brought up and added to this cramped room.  Again, lots of adults as well...not comfy without a suite.   Honestly, I would have moved to another hotel if we could have, but this was all prepaid months in advance.  There would not have
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to post feedback about our hotel on TripAdvisor.  Your comments are very much appreciated as we strive to improve our hotel and service.  While we realize that you booked through Walt Disney Travel Company, we are sorry we did not meet your expectations.  Our suites were designed to accommodate large parties/families and we understand that it was cramped in your room.  We are glad that there were some positive components to your stay and that feedback has been shared with the appropriate department heads.  We hope that you will consider giving our hotel another opportunity to serve you in the future.

Summary Heading: Plenty of hotels in Anaheim...SKIP THIS ONE!!!!
Summary: I'm not a hotel snob by any means...give me a nice clean room and I'm set.  However, this hotel was terrible and I felt compelled to write.  * guest service was a joke - on the day we arrived our room wasn't ready yet so we decided to have the hotel hold our bags while we went to the park.  easy, right?  wrong.  the front desk was sooooooooooooooooooo sloooooooooooooooooow and there was no one at the bellman desk.  we waited for 25 minutes before a bellman FINALLY showed up to take our bags.  his response was "sorry dude, i was on break".  really?    * the hallway to our room was FILTHY.  the housekeeping staff must vacuum just the middle of the carpet because the sides of the carpet near the walls were disgusting.  * our room was decent.  no frills which is fine because we just
Manager Response: The Clarion Hotel Anaheim Resort thanks you for using TripAdvisor for reviewing our hotel.  We are sorry you experienced a lenghty wait at the Front Desk and with our Bellmen.  We appreciate your comments about the room as well.  We have forwarded your specific deficiencies (hallway carpeting, sockets and hair dryer)  to Housekeeping and Engineering.  We hope your future plans call for giving us another opportunity to win your support!

Summary: Pleasantly surprised. Room was quiet, spacious, can open window. Pool large and clean. Walk to convention center. Could not see Disney fireworks from my room, but there may be a side where that is possible. Front desk goofed up both on checkin and checkout. Took 14 minutes to wait in line. Parking was 12$ - reasonable for this area.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time for using TripAdvisor to share your comments regarding your recent stay in our hotel.  We are pleased that you found your room so spacious and accommodating, but sorry that your wait time at the Front Desk was excessive.  Our Rooms Division Manager has been advised of this incident to ensure that we speed up our processing time.  Again, your feedback is very much appreciated.

Summary: My family and I just returned from our first family trip to Disneyland.  With six of us to one room it was difficult to find a hotel which would accomodate all of us in one suite.  My kids are very young (from newborn to 5 years).  The price for our family suite was better than incredible but we got what we paid.  There were a few things we did not like:  1. the toilet did not flush all the way (took about 4 flushes to completely flush)  2. After housekeeping was done tidying the room there as sand and hair left in the bathtub.  We were not anywhere near a beach prior to then (yuck). 3.  non slip mat in tub was not removeable.  It looked like the mat was adhered to the tub with gum. 4.  pull out couch was extremely uncomfortable.  Mattress was sooooo thin it was like sleeping on
Manager Response: Please accept our apologies for the inconveniences you experienced while you were guests of the Clarion Hotel Anaheim Resort.  We appeciate the detailed list of concerns you shared on TripAdvisor.  In an effort to assist in locating your lost and found inquiry, please feel free to contact me directly at 714-750-3131.  Your other comments are being to distributed to the appropriate department supervisors for consideration.  Again, we are sorry for the frustrating details of your stay with us.

Summary Heading: Convenient hotel to Disney but rooms less than desirable.
Summary: Stayed here for the last 3 nights of our tour of california.  Hotel is ideally situated for Disneyland but there isn't anything else in Anaheim.  The rooms were comfortable and clean but very tired looking.  The carpet and bathrooms needed a major overhaul.  The plug sockets seemed very loose so would be very wary about children.  The other downside was the restaurant.  You really need to have your breakfast there as there isn't anywhere else and they really take advantage of this.  The first morning my husband had a croissant, cup of coffee and I had a bowl of cornflakes with fruit and tea.  This came to $28.  about £20.  A big rip-off - but when you are hungry what  can you do.   The next morning it was a bit busier and chaos was evident.   I had heard other people remark on
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to leave comments about your recent stay at the Clarion Hotel Anaheim Resort.    I have shared your feedback with the appropriate departments in an effort to improve our product and overall service.  Our restaurant attempts to be competitive with similar hotel restaurnants in the area.  I am sorry we did not measure up to your expectations.

Summary: Stayed at this hotel for a conference and brought the family with for Disneyland.  The rooms need major improvements.  The outlets on the wall aren't polarized so it's difficult to keep the plugs in the wall.  I attached a picture of the sink which I found disgusting.  There was one elevator out of service for the 3 days we stayed at the hotel.  The staff was still friendly.  However I would expect every staff to be friendly and it isn't above and beyond making up for the shortfalls of the hotel.  The food at the hotel was average and over priced.  If you stay at this hotel walk down 2 blocks to the 7 Eleven instead of buying anything at the rip off store in the lobby.  Items in that store were even priced above the Sheraton shops.  There is a Starbucks at the Hilton across the
Manager Response: We appreciate your comments about your stay in our hotel.  We have forwarded your concerns to our Housekeeping, Engineering and Food & Beverage Departments for review.  Guest satisfaction is a priority at the Clarion Hotel Anaheim Resort and we can only improve the hotel when we receive feedback.  Thank you again for using TripAdvisor.

Summary Heading: Will pay the more money and stay elsewhere.
Summary: I stayed at this hotel, with my husband and 2 sons ( 8 and 4 ).    Pros-The Staff were friendly. We had a mini suite that was 2 double beds and  pull out couch with a mini fridge and a microwave, small bathroom.  It is about a 10-15 minute walk to Disney, there is a bus which you can pay for that stops outside the hotel.The pool was ok, it did not have a shallow end that allowed my 4 year old to stand up. Cons:The hotel is faded. My bed had not been changed, they were just going to give me fresh sheets and I had to insist that they come up and change it. The food at the restaurant is just o.k. and even with the children eating for free it was expensive for what you received.
Manager Response: Thank you so much for providing feedback for us on Tripadvisor.  Your comments are appreciated as we strive to make guest satisfaction a priority.  I will share your comments with our Housekeeping Department regarding the issue with the bedding in your room.  Additionally, our staff will enjoy hearing that you found them to be helpful.  Again, thanks for taking the time to leave a review about our hotel.

Summary: My two sister s and I stayed at the Clarion for 2 nights and it was wonderful: service was friendly specially the nice man a the concierge desk,  he took the time to give us a customized map with all the shopping malls and local attractions we asked him for . our room was very clean and big ! 2  double beds plus a pull out sofa ( very comfortable beds by the way ) with a  great view to Disney California Adventure park . we were right on harbor Bvl and pretty much everything was with in walking distance : from the handy 7 eleven to a large shopping plaza called the block ( great shopping ) they have a restaurant right by the lobby. it is great for breakfast
Manager Response: On behalf of the entire team, thank you for posting this review on Tripadvisor.  Your comments are appreciated and I will share them with the key members of our staff.  I'm glad your enjoyed breakfast at Tivoli Gardens and that our Bell Staff was helpful.  Please come back and visit us on your next trip to Anaheim!

Summary Heading: Great Hotel for Bands Performing in Disneyland!
Summary: The Clarion Anaheim Resort has been a great hotel for my performing groups for the past 15 years.  Sales Manager Kathy Millar worked with me every step of the way from keeping all of our students on the same floor to arranging our private breakfast buffet. Thank you Clarion and Kathy Millar for another great stay! See you next year, Chuck Holtan, Daniel J. Savage Middle School Band and Orchestra
Manager Response: 5 out of 5 is terrific feedback!  We really appreciate you letting others know about your experiences at our hotel.  We realize there are many choices for lodging in Anaheim and thank you for your continued patronage.  We look forward to seeing you again next year!

Summary: I was pleasantly surprised at how nice this hotel was.  The front desk was friendly and very helpful.  Our room was great!  We had a microwave and mini-fridge in our room.  We stayed in a suite, which also had an extra living area with couch. The room was clean, looked liked it had been upgraded recently, and modern.   I have to say that my favorite though is the free wi-fi!  Thank you for having free wi-fi, I use it all the time and many hotels charge you, which totally makes me mad.  It was a good 10 minute walk to front gates at Disneyland, but definately doable.  There is also a shuttle if you need one.   They offer great rates on their website and you can get a great deal, we did.   Oh, and my students loved the pool.   They never wanted to get out.
Manager Response: I enjoyed reading your recent review on Trip Advisor and thank you for taking the time to write it.  I have passed on your comments to all of our Department Heads so they in turn can let their employees know how you enjoyed your stay with us.  Please come back to visit us the next time your travel plans bring you to Orange County.

Summary: The Clarion is easily accessible to Disneyland via ART.  The rooms were fine, nothing special.  I did appreciate the fact that even though there were a number of cheerleaders/dancers in the hotel, it was fairly quiet.  The downside was that the lobby internet did not work and the elevators were very slow.  We often took the stairs down because of the unreliable elevators.  No free breakfast.
Manager Response: Thank you for the review you posted on Trip Advisor.  Its nice to hear that even a hotel full of cheerleaders can manage to be quiet.  I am sorry about the speed of the elevators and the internet in the lobby having its challenges.  We hope you will give our hotel another opportunity on your next visit to Anaheim.

Summary: This is a great place to stay if you want to be comfortable but not spend the earth.  Sure, it's a little old and dated, but it has everything we needed (free wifi, coin laundry on the 2nd floor, a great little bar, a fridge in the room, decent sized rooms, big comfortable beds, a good shower, a safe in the room, iron and ironing board, swimming pool, coffee maker and a great location).  I've stayed in hotels that cost twice as much that don't have all of these things.  We stayed 4 nights and were very comfortable, we didn't want for anything.
Manager Response: What terrific feedback!  Thank you so much for posting a review on Trip Advisor.  We appreciate the kind words about our accommodations and the staff.  Please come back to visit us when your travels bring you back to Anaheim...we look forward to seeing you again soon!

Summary Heading: Poor service; not up to standards
Summary: We were disappointed.  We had to wait an exceedingly long time to check in on Friday afternoon.  The check-in staff were probably overworked but were not all that cordial.  The room was good sized but not spectacular.  Also, there is only one front entrance so if you park in back you have to go all the way around to get to your car.  The parking lot was frequently full.  And parking was $12/day.  The Italian restuarant there was pretty good.
Manager Response: Trip Advisor is a great way to obtain feedback...so your comments were well received.  Thank you for taking the time to let us know about your long check in process.  I am sorry that  it took such an extended period to get into your room.  I have passed on this information to the appropriate department head for consideration.  We hope to see you again in the future.

Summary Heading: Excellent customer service and very helpful and friendly staff.
Summary: My stay at the clarion anahiem hotel was brilliant ! The staff were especially helpful in all situations as they helped with finding nearby malls and other places in the area to visit.They gave helpful advise on prices for taxi's , shopping and food. The taff were exceptionally kind, helpful and very welcoming. The gift shop and resturant were good although the some of the food prices were a little bit pricey. But overall I would give this hotel 10 out of 10.  From Philip Debbie and Family
Manager Response: 10 out of 10 is high praise indeed!  Thank you so much for your review on Trip Advisor.  All of your comments have been distributed to the appropriate department heads for their review.  We hope to see you again at the Clarion Hotel Anaheim Resort on your next visit to Orange County.

Summary: My family stay for a week. This Hotel may be old but I found it clean and the staff were friendly and when you needed help they were there to answer any questions. We were upgrade to a better room apond arrive which was nice. The pool was nice and clean and was always stock with towels. The beds were a little too small for two people but were comfortable. It was close to Disneyland and to a Shopping Center, also to a food store. I would go back there to stay if I went to Anaheim again.
Manager Response: Your review on Trip Advisor is very much appreciated!  I have passed on your comments to our Department Heads about the service you received and how pleased you were with the accommodations.  We hope to see you again on your next visit to Anaheim!

Summary Heading: ...resort hotel...  very nice...crowded area of anaheim tho..
Summary: ...the stay here was very nice.  Front desk staff was somewhat helpful, although we ended up in smoking rooms as our rooms were not ready.  We did ask for an early check-in and they didn't accomodate us.  But other than that, the rooms were nice, clean and beds were very comfortable.    I didn't like a couple things, 1) no free breakfast like most of the Choice Hotels, and 2) the fact that guests had to pay for parking.  I thought that was lousy, but it's Anaheim, and the hotels want all the $$$ they can get.    Other than that, no complaints.  We only slept there as we spent the all day at Knott's Berry Farm....      Really nothing to write home about tho...
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to write a review of our hotel on Trip Advisor!  We appreciate you choosing the Clarion Hotel Anaheim Resort and hope that you will come back to see us in the future.  I have passed on your kind words about our Front Desk, and am sorry about not being able to accommodate your early check in request.

Summary: We chose a three star hotel near Disneyland on Hotwire.  We ended up with the Clarion Hotel in Anaheim.  First, I will mention the good things about this hotel.  The price was very reasonable.  The outside of the hotel, landscaping, and lobby appeared to be pretty nice.  The location wasn't bad either, it was about a 20 minute walk to Disneyland.  They charge for parking ($12 a day) which is typical for the area.  There was plenty of parking and it is gated.  They charge for a shuttle to Disneyland which is also pretty typical.  Really not a big deal considering how reasonable the rate was.  The size of the room was decent.  That is about it regarding the good things.  In all other aspects, I was disappointed with this hotel.  It is definitely not a 3 star hotel.  The room was
Manager Response: We appreciate your detailed review on Trip Advisor!  Your comments were shared with Housekeeping and the Food and Beverage Departments in an effort to improve our impressions given to guests.  We thank you for providing feedback to us and hope that you will return one day to the Clarion Hotel Anaheim Resort.

Summary: This hotel was just okay. I booked through hotwire so I didn't get a choice. They rate it 3 stars but it feels more like a 2.5. The location to disneyland is very close but to walk to the front gate and back (after an entire day of walking) looked pretty long. They charged $12 for parking but I think that is pretty standard with hotels in this area. Paid around $60 for one night, this hotel is not worth more. Did not eat at the restaurant or use room service. The rooms were okay to just sleep in but depressing decor and if you are bringing your family here or are here for a long stay I would not recommend it. The bathroom was small but the actual room was decent sized. Could definitely use remodelling though! Everything just looked old and dingy. Upon entering room towers, we
Manager Response: Thank you for your review on Trip Advisor.  Your comments are very much appreciated!  I have passed on your comments, particularly regarding housekeeping, to the appropriate department heads for action.  We hope you will consider us again in the future when you are in the Anaheim area.

Summary Heading: Excellent Service, Space, and Staff for our conference
Summary: I worked closely with the staff planning an international conference at the hotel.  The hotel venue, staff, and service exceeded all expectations.  The staff were great to work with and very responsive to the needs of those attending the conference and throughout our planning process.  The food was excellent and the conference room configuration worked really well for our conference needs.  The guest rooms were very clean and comfortable making the whole experience for our conference ideal.  Great views of the Disney nightly fireworks from our guest room windows too!
Manager Response: Thank you so much for your wonderful comments about our hotel!  We will certainly share them with the entire team, especially our Kitchen and Banquets staff.  We hope to see you again soon!

Summary: I stayed at the Clarion for two nights and really enjoyed the experence, i work in the travel industry so i get ot experence some of the finest hotels in the world. for its price the clarion is very comfortable and well priced, and the bed was very comfortable with large rooms to keep all your shopping, its a short walk to disney land and CAP, it also has the ART which is a shuttle bus that runs into disney if you are to tired to walk home at the end of the day. the hotel offers a range of facitlties if you don't want to venture out at the end of a long day in Anaheim.
Manager Response: We appreciate your comments about the Clarion Hotel Anaheim Resort!    Our team hopes you enjoyed your stay in Anaheim and will visit us again soon!

Summary Heading: Way better than I thought. Great service, these guys want our business!
Summary: I have used the Marriott and Hilton as well as the Crown Plaza here in Anaheim in the past. We only went to the Clarion because everyone else was booked this week. I was pleasantly surprised. The staff was very helpful and tended quite well to our needs. I felt like the value we received was well above my expectations. I spend about 200 nights a year in hotels and I was very pleased with what we got here. I hope this is helpful.
Manager Response: Thank you very much for your feedback!  We appreciate your patronage and look forward to seeing you again soon!

Summary: The hotel was not worth $129.00 a night.  They would come in to clean every morning but would only make the bed.  They didn't take away the room service breakfast we ordered in the morning, just left it on the table all day.  The TV did not come with a remote, only a video game controller that was supposed to be used as the remote but didnt even turn off and on the tv.  The Iron was broke.  The water in the shower would be fine for about 3 minutes then start changing to BURNING hot for 5 seconds and then FREEZING cold for 5 seconds, back and forth.  Not worth the closeness to Disney World.  Spend the extra cash and stay somewhere nice.  They should not have "Resort" anywhere in their hotel name.

This property use to be a Quality Inn, it is late 70’s or early 80’s. Clarion is supposed to be Choice Hotel’s top brand; this is NOT what a Clarion is supposed to be.  One guest computer that was out of order the entire time we were there so do not depend on having access to one unless you take your own.  Rooms have been “updated” to some degree but tub/shower/toilet are old, shabby and in need of new fixtures and updating.  Our room was on top floor, no ice on 9th, only 3-8.  Hotel trying to save energy because the halls are hot.  Our room had the old balcony enclosed which makes for extra room.  A/C has to run all the time to keep room cool on the hot days we were in Anaheim.  Our room faced Disney, but Sheraton is between Clarion and Disney so you can see fireworks at night

We stayed in the hotel for a week while at disneyland and found the hotel run down (stained and threadbare carpets and sagging mattresses). On the three occasions during the week when we went to eat in the restaurants we had to search for then finally go ask at the front desk for staff to seat us. We saw bits of paper and garbage in the halls which remained there for the entire week.

I stayed in this hotel for a week and i didnt see nothing bad about it at all. Our room was clean and nothing was broken. We enjoyed the pool every night after a long day @ disneyland or shopping. I seen some reviews that this hotel was not in good condition but i guess some people just want perfection. I was very happy with it and enjoyed my stay alot. I would go back and stay at this hotel everytime i was in anaheim.

Last few days of tour with Titan Tours and the last hotel in a long line of very mediocre hotels spoiling the fabulous sights and sounds of the California tour. This hotel once again is due a makeover.  The lobby and check in desk are quite dark and uninviting. The rooms were medium sized with 2 large beds and lovely soft pillows, the bathroom contained soap,shampoo also tea and coffee making, there was also an iron and ironing board. The bar area was very dark indeed but the staff were friendly. There were not many customers in the bar. The dining room was quite pleasant, but once again run down.  The staff at breakfast were very friendly. This hotel is a 20 minute walk away from the Disney complex. There is a shuttle bus from the hotel.  There are some nice shops off Disney

This hotel had everything we needed. The staff was very polite and helpful when we took one of our days to go to Knotts Berry Farm after visiting Disney. If you are looking for high class, this hotel is not for you. The Clarion is moderate but we had no problems whatsoever! I would stay again in a heartbeat! I also loved this balcony which was so nice to be out on in the morning and the evening.

It is about a mile walk to Disney. Our bed had metal prongs hanging out and we had to fix it ourselves. I had a bruise from the prong- the front desk did nothing about it. Plus, I have never had to pay to park at any hotel that I have stayed at, the excuse given when asked about that was, " it's because we are so close to the park". I will never stay at this hotel again, nor will I recommend it to anyone to stay at.

Summary Heading: Lots of other choices.  Pick one of them
Summary: Stayed here just one night with our 2 grandkids.  The rooms are clean, but the good part of the review has to stop there.  There was so much wrong with the room that it became comical.   The room suffered from eminence and repair upkeep.  The wall light was hanging off the wall.  The porcelain on the tub had been chipped (a large chipped area) and quite a while ago someone decided that white paint would “do the trick”.  It was rusting under the paint and bleeding through.  The shower head moved (about 6 inched) in any direction.  The canister light in the bathroom was falling out of the ceiling.  The calking job in the bathroom looked as if they hired my 4 year old grandson to do the job.  The shower curtain would pivot on the ends (an arched shower curtain shouldn’t do that).

Summary Heading: Would Love to Stay Again-Great Staff/Service!!!
Summary: The Clarion hotel was a great place for me and my wife.  We stayed 4 days at the hotel and did not have any problems or complaints.  The room was very comfy and everything seemed to be in order. I would also like to highlight that  Matilda, the first desk agent, was very helpful in answering of our numerous questions, which made our trip even more pleasant.    Although the price was a little on the pricey side, we did enjoy the stay and would love to come back to this hotel.

Summary Heading: Completely out of place with its immediate neighbors
Summary: Four-day June family vacation in SoCal.  Family stayed across the street at the Hilton which was gorgeous - Clarion is NOT in the same league as it, Marriott or Sheraton!  First, never trust the front desk agents for directions, shuttle info, etc.  Very unfriendly and inexperienced.  We were told our airport shuttle left every hour on the hour - turns out it was FORTY MINUTES on the hour.  Definitely go to the BELLMAN for help - much friendlier and knowledgable.  After a long day at Disney, you WILL want to SHUTTLE back. It's a nice 20ish minute walk up along Harbour to both DIsneyland and the Garden Walk, which has a bunch of shops, restaurants and movie theatres.  The ART #3 picks up in front of the hotel and takes you directly to Disney.  We took the #4 or #5 which stopped at

This hotel was OK for the price that we payed to stay. Check in took forever and we had to get a new set of keys THREE times because they kept resetting. The pool was fun but not that big. The beds were comfortable buy the couches were tiny. The bathrooms had a weird smell. This was a good place to stay if you only plan on actually being in your room at night. The view from our room was excellent though.

We spent 3 nights at this hotel.  We arrived to the hotel about  2 hrs. before the 4:00 pm check in time and our room was ready for us.  Our luggage was delivered to the wrong room but was quickly found, the front desk staff gave the bell man the incorrect room #. The hotel is very clean, and everyone was friendly.  The internet was not working the whole time we were there, we asked the front desk about it and they kept saying that someone was on their way to fix it, when we checked out, the internet was still not working.  We ordered room service on 2 occasions and both times the food was good, but expensive. Beware of hidden charges....a 15% gratuity is automatically added to your bill for any food purchases and there is a $1.50 daily surcharge for use of the in-room safe.

Summary Heading: there are so many better options
Summary: this hotel really shows its age.  the computer available for guest use was out of order, despite repeated claims that someone was coming to work on it.  the last time I asked when it would be worked on, I was told to go to the Marriott.  the air is stuffy.  our room overlooked the Convention Center street, so lots of street noise.  we kept the fan running to help mask the sounds.  restaurants and bars had strange hours, so we ate a snack out of a vending machine. there was a resort bus that stopped right outside the front door, so that was convenient.  but Anaheim hotels really want your business, so there are better deals.

Summary Heading: Perfect for a trip with the kids
Summary: My husband, my 5 year old daughter and I stayed at the Clarion Hotel Anaheim from April 13th to April 17th 2009.  Arrival: We took the Disneyland Resort Express from LAX to the Clarion. When we arrived at the Clarion check-in took about 20 min (there were a number of people in line to check in at 3pm).  Room: The room was clean, the bathroom and vanity area were also VERY clean. We booked a room with two beds, the room size is perfect for a small family. We booked a room facing Disneyland (we could see the fireworks from our room at night).  Room Service/Hotel Restaurant: I have to admit that the food at the hotel was horrible (both room service and the hotel restaurant). We only had to try it once to decide we were better off eating at the Disneyland Park or Downtown Disney).

We selected this property on a recent road trip to California based on location and getting a great rate through a sale Expedia advertised.  The room itself was very nice, clean, and comfortable...we'd probably stay there again. So what's wrong?...Nothing is "wrong", just some tips to be aware of...  The internet service was slow, but it was free, so we got we paid for.  The pool area is nothing to write home about. We were given room 506 and were surprised that we could hear everyone down at the pool AND THE BALCONY DOOR WAS CLOSED!  Don't waste your money on the "pool view" rooms. If you are above the 2nd/3rd floor, you're going to see more of the other hotels and parking lots in the area than anything else.  The hotel says they are "one block from the Disneyland Theme Parks".

Summary Heading: This is in a great position for Disneyland
Summary: Only ten minutes walk from Disneyland and there are shuttle buses close by too.If you wish to eat outside of the hotel there are several restaurants try IHOP for breakfast or Dennys both were very good.The Clarion rooms are comfortable and spacious.Tea/ coffee maker ,iron and board TV our room also had a small balcony.We stayed here for two days and if you get time do visit the Crystal Cathedral in Anaheim it is worth a visit and a local  guide  will show you around no charge but if you wish to donate to the cathedral you can.

Summary Heading: If all you need/want is a place to rest your head...
Summary: Then this is a decent enough place. I've spent 2 years in a row now staying here for an industry event and both times it's been just about as 'ok' as you can get. The internet is slow - 12kbps - so if you have work to do that involves time on the internet - not a good choice.   The restaurant is open for breakfast and is nothing special - terribly overpriced ($35 for a meal w/ 2 ppl of pancakes and apple juice and french toast & coffee & orange juice). The staff is friendly enough.  I did have a poor movie experience - my first night there I figured after a long day of travel from the DC area I'd just eat in my room (room service food was about what you'd expect - little to get excited about) but the movie system wasn't working. First, it did nothing after saying

Summary Heading: Not bad but not great either.....
Summary: I did not realize when booking that the Clarion only offers double beds when booking a room with multiple beds.  (no queen beds at all)  So we took a king room with a roll away for our son.  The king room is too small to use a roll away so they kindly gave us a king suite.  The king suite was perfect and the pull out couch was even comfy (or so my son says).  The hotel is close to Disneyland but is showing its age.  The shower was pathetic and not meant for anyone over 5 feet tall.  The staff was friendly and easy to work with,

Summary Heading: My Experience at the Clarion Hotel
Summary: When we walked into our room the  first time, there was a letter that read: "Dear Valued Guest:  Due to unforeseen circumstances our  pool will be closed until further notice. We apologize  for any inconvenience this may cause  you.    Once again, thank you for your understanding and we hope you enjoy your stay.  Sincerely  Clarion Hotel Management"  WHAT A JOKE!  If they REALLY felt sorry about the pool being out of order, they would make an adjustment to our room rate.  After all, we paid good money for these amenities only to find out we can't use them.  Also, the people in Room 830 (friends of ours) had no water pressure in their shower and had to use our shower in Room 828.    This motel is OVER-RATED and OVER-PRICED and although it was clean and otherwise okay, you can

We got a great deal through west jet vacation and stayed here for 8 nights in Oct. The hotel is in a good location, lots of restaurants a block or two away, and about 3 or 4 blocks to Disneyland. There is also a shuttle which will take you there & back, which is nice at the end of a long day. The hotel is a little bit older, but the beds are comfortable and the rooms are clean.  We didn't spend much time at the hotel anyways, there is so much to see and do, and we would just come back at the end of the day and sleep. Next time I would probably spend a little bit more money and upgrade, but this is a fine place if you are on a budget.

Summary Heading: I came back and would again
Summary: We came here last year, and I came back again. This is a good value hotel, without being flash. The rooms are clean and tidy. Jeff the concierge is outstanding, and has given us great service both times we visited. He is more than helpful. Other staff were ok, and some were disinterested, but not bad overall.  We would certainly come back again and recommend them to others. Of course if you dont have a budget to worry about- then by all means upgrade.

Like a lot of people I was a little worried after reading the reviews on this website but my worries  were unfounded.  We found the Clarion to be perfect for our stay. We arrived exhausted from Perth Australia and were in our rooms in minutes. The rooms were very clean although a little outdated but the beds were wonderful. The restaurants were great with lovely breakfasts and great services. Loved the mexican food also. My only complaint was the amount of time it took for room service to arrive sometimes. I think there should have been extra staff on to cater for this. Also the trays from room service were left outside the rooms for up to 24 hours. Not good but found this at other hotels we stayed at in USA also.  Overall we were really happy with our stay and would not

The staff was very rude and uncooperative.  It was difficult to make a reservation and I should have known not to stay there due to the bad reviews on the internet.  The bedspread was grimy and there were hairs on the the sheets.  The toilet looked as if it had not been cleaned since the past occupants had left.  It also smelled like someone had been smoking in the room, although it was a nonsmoking room.  We asked to be moved to another room, but of course the staff never followed through.  I would never stay here again and would not wish this hotel on my worst enemy.

The Clairon Hotel was part of our cruise/land package.  The hotel was clean and bright.  Food in the restaurant was excellent (loved those frozen margaritas).  Staff was friendly, helpful and always available to answer questions.  Would certainly stay her again.

When reading the reviews for this place, I got a little worried. However, my stay here was GREAT! We took the $3 shuttle to Disneyland, which arrived every 20 minutes. The hotel doesn't look as old as the pictures make it. The rooms were very spacious! However, the bathroom was small and super old. The door to the bathroom in our room was also old, thin, and struggling to fit through the doorway.   The best thing about this hotel is their housekeeping service! My boyfriend and I forgot to bring home our Disney souvenirs and an expensive bottle of champagne (I know, stupid of us), and housekeeping was very helpful and mailed everything back to us in Northern California!   Such a great place, got a great deal on this hotel on a sale at Orbitz. I would definitely stay here again!

I chose this hotel after reading the reviews on this wonderful website. I chose it only for the distance to the Disneyland entrance (1 block). It's a nice hotel, pretty big, and the decor was acceptable. The pool is pretty small, but there were never more than 5 people sitting poolside. Our room was bigger than i thought it would be. It was two queen beds and we had our own balcony that faced disneyland (so we could see the fireworks) except there was another hotel in the way of the full experience. There was a fridge (no extra charge) but no microwave. All in all i enjoyed the room. We only had to deal with the staff on check in and check out. They were nice enough and the only complaint i have is that all of them rudely answer the phones even if they're in the middle of a

**Clarion Hotel in Anaheim Calif, Terrible Service*** Date* August 12,2008 When I arrived at 11;30 PM  they did not Welcome you in at all and the one Man at the desk looked like he just woke up .. His shirt was completely wrinkled and he wasn't friendly at all is was like we were  bothering him from his sleep.. When we arrived in the room it STUNK.... THE ROOM SMELT STALE SO DID THE SHEETS,BATHROOM .. And you have to pay to park in there hotel $12.00 per night . Thank God I only had to stay one night .. I was out of there at 7am on AUG,13TH. So please to the people out there PAY THE EXTRA MONEY to stay somewhere else. YOU GET WHAT YOU PAY FOR it cost me 115.00 a night and dont forget the 12.00 parking w/no complementry breakfast. GOOD LUCK IF YOU STAY HERE.....

We stayed at the Clarion Hotel through out the first week of August.  I thought it was a great hotel for it's value.  Disneyland was within walking distance; about a 15-20 minute walk.  The trolley only cost us $10 a day (3 adults and 1 child; my one year old was free) and came every 20 minutes right in front of the hotel.  We ended up walking though at the end of the night since the kids were asleep in their strollers and you have to fold up the strollers to go on the trolley. We paid a bit more for the Suite and the room was clean and ready when we arrived.  We got the maid to clean our room once and she did a great job; clean towels, bed made, more coffee for my husband!!! The view was amazing and we could even see the fireworks from our window!  We also got room service one

After reading the reviews on here i was very apprehensive about spending my vacation here... but i neednt have worried.  The hotel was very nice, we had booked a mini suite which was perfect for the four of us, plenty of room.  The beds were comfortable, the bathroom and shower were clean and well maintained and the room was always spotless every time we came back after a long day.  The staff were always helpful and polite.  The breakfast was a littel pricey but good, but you can find plenty to eat around the restort.    The only downside was the pool area was a little dated, but the pool itself was lovely, very quiet on some occasions but even when it was in use at night we couldnt hear anything,  The resort itself is wonderful but would reccomend getting the bus, it is only

We booked our trip through WestJet and got an excellent deal on 7 nights in Anaheim (Clarion), 3 nights in Vegas, flight and car.    The Clarion is not the nicest hotel i've stayed at, but I didn't find it as bad as some of the reviews it got.  Our trip was split as we went to Vegas part way through and then returned to the Clarion later so we stayed in two rooms here during our vacation.  Overall the place was clean except for a little mold in the bathrooms around the shower and around the vent (which is a vent and not a fan, which would probably explain the mold, there is no ventilation in the bathrooms).  I did not see any bugs thank god or I would have been out of there.  There is AC and a fridge in the rooms which came in handy to store our bottled water we bought from

We booked our stay here as part of a package through Alaska Airlines. We were excited about our stay and visiting Disney Land until the first ten minutes in our room. My husband and daughter were surprised by a HUGE cockroach scurrying across the floor! YUCK! The main desk was nice enough to upgrade us and move us to another room, but the problems didn't stop there.  Twenty minutes after moving into another room we started to hear the whinning and howling of a dog. After listening to  the howling for 30 minutes we called the front desk who acted totally surprised and told us they would check into it.  The howling of the dog didn't stop for most of the night even though we made repeated calls to the front desk and were given multiple excuses, and to top it off our room abutted

My Husband and I stayed here for my brothers wedding, and than three days a Disneyland, We were very impressed.  The staff was great, friendly and helpful.  The only thinkg we wisehed was they had a continental breakfast, but most of the hotels around disney don't.

I stayed here with my parents and sister in May 2004. It is super close to Disneyland, only a few minutes in walking distance. There is also a shuttle bus that goes to Disneyland if you do not want to walk. The pool was a salt water pool and always perfect to cool off in. Overall, I had a good experience here.

We never received the email that we had a reservation at the clarion hotel in anaheim and therefore did not show up for the reservation.  when discussing this with the head of reservations, Naomi, she still refused to credit back our charge card.  i don't mind being responsible for something if i knew about it.  mistakes happen and to be so hard to the policies is complete poor customer service.

Good hotel for the price.  The rooms were very clean and the beds comfortable.  It is an older hotel that has not seen renovations for some time but on a budgeted vacation it works well.  The walk is about 15 minutes to the parks and it is a good idea to purchase the trolly tickets as the walk home feels much longer.  Pool was clean  with lots of chairs and never too crowded.  I do not recomend eating at this hotel.  Two pops and an appietizer of mozza sticks cost over $14.00.  Had breakfast once and was extremely disappointed with the poor quality of food and the price.  It was actually cheaper to eat in Disneyland at Cafe Orleans.  In a nutshell, if you are looking for a clean place to sleep and a refreshing swim for good value this hotel will satisfy you.

Summary Heading: Made my Disney vacation a great one
Summary: After reading the reviews on here, I was very, very afraid of staying here. We booked through Alaska Air Vacations, and it was one of the lower priced choices.  I am happy to say that I don't agree with the poor reviews, and was thrilled with the hotel.  Yes, I agree it's not a brand new hotel, but the beds were comfortable and had duvets on them, the room was always clean, and our room attendant took the time to put our kids toys in new and interesting places every single day.  Our kids were always excited to come back from Disney to see whether their stuffed animals were up to.    We booked in with my brother and he was upgraded to a suite so he could be right next door to us.   The suites are not much more than extra space and a couch, but I saw a standard room as well and I

This hotel was great! The people are so nice and friendly! I have a family of 5 2ad and 3ch. The front desk staff was so nice to my kids and made them feel so at home. The gentleman in the bar was great, good customer service, always had a smile on his face. The pool was great big and roomy. Kids were in the pool when we would get back from Disneyland.  Shuttle was very easy just bought tickets and the shuttle came up to the hotel and right to Disney. Both restaurants the food was very good. Service was excellent!! Great promotions. I will be back for sure, Thank you Clarion and Disneyland for such a great vacation.

Summary Heading: Would Not Recomend to a Friend
Summary: Due to my career I have stayed at many hotels over the years, this was probably the worst. The carpet had a grimy feel to it, the couch was stained with god knows what in several places, the shower floor felt and sounded as though it was going to give way under feet ( I'm an average size guy 195#'s), I got bit several times by something while sleeping, there is no Jacuzzi (who in the world owns a hotel with no Jacuzzi), I will say the service in the restaurant for breakfast was excellent (even though the food was horrible), they have two different bar tenders that they trade from one night to the next, Bartender A (early thirties/nice guy) did a great job, good service excellent food and drinks, Bartender B (mid twenties/smaller guy) Was horrible, it was impossible to get

Summary Heading: Close to convention center, but so-so for value
Summary: Pros: * This hotel is located within easy walking distance (< ¼ mile) from the Anaheim Convention Center.  The Disneyland/California Adventure entrance from Harbor Blvd is about ¾ mile away. * This hotel is considerably less expensive than the Marriot and Hilton hotels which are located between it and the convention center. * Free LAN (wired) and WiFi (wireless) internet access.  Cons: * I have stayed in nicer hotels for much less money in the area.  These hotels are further away (1/2 – ¾ mile) from the Convention Center, but are closer to Disney. * Parking fees.  * Small pool, no hot tub/spa. * Noise – one night there was a noisy late night drinking party (until about 2 AM) on the balcony of another (non-adjacent) room in that kept me from sleeping.  Recently I have returned

Summary Heading: Great value so close to Disney.
Summary: I was pleasantly surprised by the Clarion Anaheim.  We are a family of four:  2 adults, 2 kids.  We stayed at the Clarion for 7 nights this March/08 as part of an Alaskan Airlines Vacations Disneyland package.  We have been to Disney several times and have always stayed at one of the Harbour Drive properties, close to the Disney main gate and I was adamant that was where I wanted to stay again.  However, it was our Alaska Vacations representative who talked us into staying at the Clarion.  The price was much less expensive than staying at one of the Harbour Blvd. motels and here we had the luxury of an actual HOTEL, without much more distance.  I had convinced myself that the Clarion was too far away from the park to consider as we have always walked to and from and didn't want

This hotel was most dissapointing.  Everything from the hotel staff, restaurant and room were very substabdard.  Trust me, spend a few more bucks and stay at a nicer place.  I don't know how this can be a 3 star hotel.  This was by far the worst hotel I ever stayed at.

First stop on the West Coast Tour 2007, though this was a nice thou generic hotel, guess it is a chain. Based ourselves here to be close to Disney (which is walkable) and Angel Stadium which we visited during our stay.  Only downside during our stay was the parking charge, always find that annoying and the fact the bar was closed (supposedly for refurbishment but the California Alcoholics Annonanmous had a conference during our stay, just my luck).  Rooms though not that large were comfortable and clean.
