Location as I said was excellent for young families visiting Disney, walkable, food outlets a bit of a walk, Universal is about an hour or so drive away.

Stayed from Oct 5-10th - arrived early and had requested an early check in - was not noted when we arrived, so "pre-checked" in - bad mistake! The lady said we would have connecting rooms in a mini suite - however the connecting room was with someone with the same last name, but not the correct first names!!  On returning to check in, we had rooms that were not connecting, but 3 doors away, on complaining then said they were sold out, and then gave us another room that were "connecting" and they were not, they actually did not believe us and had someone come and check to see if there was a door in the room!! On complaining again, we got a 9th room connecting mini suite (what we were to have in the first place), this took over an hour to finally get our room, and we heard the

Summary Heading: Walk to Disney, really nice hotel
Summary: Really nice room, lobby, elevators, etc....  so if this hotel is not very expensive, you should take it.  Just remember: no free breakfast and you pay like $10 for parking per day.  But considering you can walk to Disney in 15-20 minutes (a bit under a mile) or catch all these shuttles that stop by, it is probably a good deal for most people.

Summary Heading: Enjoyed our Stay at the Clarion Hotel
Summary: When reading all the reviews I was abit worried about staying at the Clarion with my family BUT was pleasantly surprised when we booked in ... The Service desk staff were very helpful and gave us information on buses etc ... Our room looked towards Disneyland so we could see the fireworks on Saturday which was wonderful !!!! The pool area was well used by my children so again very happy with pool area .. Yes the walk to Disneyland is about 10-15mins but as our children are 12 and 14 yrs this was no problem ... Would definately stay here again !!!

Summary Heading: overcharged and manager on duty with terrible costumer service skills
Summary: we just returned from a trip to disney I made reservations for this hotel and roll away beds were included on my reservation, when I check out  I noticed there was a charge for roollaway beds and I  explain to the front office agent that they were included on my reservation that I also request 2 beds and only 1 was delivered , that it was not set-up in the room but it was left on the hallway for my to move furniture around and figer out my self where to set it up and i have to request this beds 3 times at the hotel not counting that they were requested and also confirmed at time of reservation on their website when we reserve it and were confirmed on   e-mail. the agent was rude and have no customer service skills she was very unproffesional and when i asked to speak to the

We arrived in anaheim at 12 am from vancouver and were very happy with the quick check-in even though it was so late. Our room was clean and average size but our view was the roof of the lower part of the building and the vent was on that roof so it was very loud. we were too tired and jet lagged that night so we talked to the manager the next morning and he said that he would put us in a larger room with a better view in 2 days. the new room was excellent, very clean large great front view where the disneyland fireworks could be seen from the balcony. shuttle stops right infront of hotel which was convienient and the pool was fabulous. but the best part was the service. everyone was so nice and friendly especially peopple working at breakfast time. never had an empty cup of

This is a great hotel for the price.  I spent the week at a convention and it was very handy.  The room was very clean and tidy - nothing really to complain about.  Its not first class but for a week it was fine.  The fresh fruit place directly across the road was wonderful, fresh strawberries for breakfast every day mmmmmmm.  lots of restaurants withing walking, one or two blocks.  Shuttle outside the door for Disneyland, however could stroll there in 10 mins.  Would certainly stay there again.

Summary Heading: Great stay, can not wait to go back
Summary: Stayed here on our 2nd anniversary in 2005 and loved the hotel.  We booked based on the recommendation of another GM at a Clarion in Indianapolis.  He said that if we wanted to go to Disneyland that they had a shuttle, but the hotel is literally two blocks from the main entrance, so it was not necessary.  We rented a car and got the Hertz Neverlost (Magellan sp?) navigation system.  The hotel was preprogrammed in the system and the directions were superb.  You must pay for parking there, but I never had any trouble getting close to the main entrance and they have an inexpensive daily parking fee with unlimited in and out privileges.  There were several conventions going on in the hotel, but it was amazingly quiet on our floor and in our room.  Our room was clean.  They offered

Summary Heading: Some Good, Some Marginal - Good Stay Overall
Summary: My family and I stayed at the Clarion in Anaheim the night of June 24 2007.  With our family's annual Disney passes near expiration, we decided to make a two-day vacation only 25 miles from our home in South OC.  We booked with AAA discount for a little under $100 plus tax.  Guest check-in was friendly, but painfully slow.  Exterior and interior of the hotel were nothing fancy, but acceptable for a family stay.  Surprised that there was no free breakfast (I thought all Choice Hotels had free breakfast)!  Pool was simple, but okay... elevators slow, suite with two doubles and single sleeper was large enough for five.  Room was clean with the exception of the sofa sleeper bedding that my son slept in (poor kid!).  It seems the blanket was FULL of dirt and sand from what must've

Summary Heading: Perfect for us! Kudos for Manager, Stacy at front desk!
Summary: I hope Stacy the manager at the front desk is reading this because he was wonderfui! Always efficient, on top of things, and friendly.! We were there the day after school got out for most of the country for the summer, so of course hotel was packed .  We were checked in right away, and our room was ready. We went through  Alaska Air Disney vacations so that helped and we had our confirmation printed off. Our room was  clean  and ready and the whole hotel is  very clean   The room was smaller then I thought and we had a fridge only. I thought there would be a micro, but maybe some of the rooms have them.  Our 7 and 10 year olds spent as much time at the pool as they did at  Disney and the pool is large, clean and just the right temp...In regards to the walk to Disney,it is quite

After reading some of the earlier reviews for this hotel we were slightly worried and wondered about booking somewhere else for Disney but I am glad that we didn't.  The hotel is some distance from the park (although it is one block to Disney - it is a good 15-20 mins walk) but there is a regular shuttle bus which picks up right outside the hotel every 20 minutes.  If you have small children (ours were 8 and 4) then I recommend the shuttle bus - they need all their energy for Disney.   The hotel rooms are a good size, clean & have everything that you need - fridge, microwave, TV etc.  The hotel staff were friendly and helpful and there was no problem with parking.  We ate breakfast each day, one meal in the restaurant & a snack in the bar and all were fine & not overly expensive

Summary Heading: Great Place for price, would come back!
Summary: We Stayed in August 2005 and June 2006.  The best part was the $$savings, $300 for 5 nights! WOW!  The next best thing was that the transportation picked up in front of the hotel and returned to the front of the hotel, very safe.  Everyone was friendly, yes there was at times a shortage of staff at the front desk, but that ment we were able to enjoy the sitting chairs in the lobby and get info on attractions from the info guys in the lobby.  The children ate free, which didn't matter because all our son would eat was a PB and J sandwich every day for lunch, not to mention the food was very flavorfull, large portions, low prices(cheap) and the sevice was fast and friendly.  The Pool was clean and not crowded.  The room was clean, fridge worked, HOWEVER the tub drained very slow

Grotty, untidy and not such a nice place to stay ... especially when visiting such a great area.  The Front Desk is ALWAYS understaffed and even though the staff are reasonably friendly, there were always problems with ordering or organising anything with them.  Rooms were clean enough, but have seen better.  Average all round.

After reading earlier reviews, I was a bit worried about our stay.  My sister and I each took our 2 kids and stayed in two different rooms.  The rooms were nice and well layed out.  The beds were not deluxe by any means, but weren't the worse either.  I didn't sleep well because of outside noise and really bad pillows.  The kids seemed to sleep just fine (probably more exhaused from Disneyland than anything else). The hotel staff was knowledgable and helpful.  Upon arrival they explained the Aneheim Transit system and where we needed to be to catch the little red trolley.   If I go back to Disneyland I don't think I will pick the hotel again as I want to stay in more deluxe accomodations and am now willing to spend the money for a better nights sleep.  I think this hotel was

This hotel sends mixed signals.  I made reservations about 3 months in advance (prepaid), and when I showed up I had no rooms.  There was no communication for the next 10 to 15 minutes.  When the desk staff returned, she informed me that there was some sort of mix up, and that several guests had to be moved.  I would be staying in the Holiday Inn Anaheim(see review).   After being on the road for 8 hours, I simply agreed and informed them that I would be contacting them as soon as I could get my family out of my vehicle.  The first two days of my vacation were spent at Holiday Inn, but then I was brought back to finish my stay at the Clarion.   This is the good part...  The room was outstanding.  The service after the fact was amazing.  The hotel itself is a bit old, and it

February 10- February 17, 2007  I booked this hotel as part of an Alaskan Airlines Vacation package. to Disneyland.   It is an older hotel with excellent sound proofing, something that I was looking for with a 2 year old. There were 4 adults and 1 child of 2 sharing a large family suite.  We were pleasantly surprised.  Beds were adequate, 2 doubles and 1 double sleeper sofa.  The room was spacious with 2 small fridges and a microwave.  Bathroom was large and could accommodate a wheelchair.  The front desk was helpful and did there best to accommodate your needs.   Rooms were clean, maid service excellent.    The pool was a also cleaned daily and easily accessible from first floor.    You can walk to Disneyland quite easily from here.  With my child in the stroller it took 15

Before we left for our trip, i read the reviews people were leaving/had left on this site. I was really concerned because it seemed as though everyone had poor to moderate experiences with this hotel. I was pleasantly surprised with our stay.   We didn't have to pay for parking since we booked through Alaska airlines Vacations. So that was no worry. And we never got blocked in either. The lobby was nice, the restraunts were satisfactory, and the staff was FABULOUS. The rooms are average moderate rooms. We had a fridge and micro which was great. The bathrooms are quite small, so that bothered me. And there was no hot tub which I was bummed about. But the pool was clean and heated and we used it quite a bit. We were at this hotel for 8 days with no problems. I would stay again.

I agree with the reviews that the Clarion is adequate, clean, but somewhat dated.  Hotel service was acceptable.  They initially made a mistake with a the dates of our reservation, but promptly corrected it when we called to confirm.  They accommodated our request for connecting rooms with another family who joined us in a 5-day trip to Disneyland.  Rooms are decently sized.  The location was quite good. It took our families (with children ages 4 and 7) 15-20 minutes to walk from the hotel to the main entrance to Disneyland -- about 4 to 5 city blocks.  We never bothered with the Anaheim shutte bus.  I would have given the Clairion an above-average rating except for our experience with dinner at the restaurant on the first night.  Although, the kids "ate free" the overall bill

My Son and I stayed here from 17th September for 7 nights.  I found the hotel staff very helpful especially the concierge who gave great tips on how to get where we wanted to go.  Used the ART bus most days, only walked once to Disneyland and it was a long way.  The room was cleaned well everyday.  Also ate breakfast and dinner twice at the hotel and no complaints.  Would recommend this hotel and would stay again.

We stayed at this hotel as part of a package deal after being on a cruise ship from Vancouver to Los Angeles.  The hotel itself is dated.  The rooms are clean, however, if you are looking for something modern and upbeat, you've come to the wrong place.  The desk staff and staff looking after tourist info/excursions don't seem terribly interested in providing information and more than once we were given incorrect information concerning shuttle bus pick up locations, schedules, etc.  The shuttle bus doesn't pick up at this hotel, so you have to go to the hotel next door.  (not sure why because the bus schedule does say otherwise).  In any case, had I not been doing a package deal, I would NOT have chosen this hotel.

We stayed in the Clarion at the beginning of June this year for 3nights and before arriving we were worried what to expect but we didnt need to. Upon arriving to the hotel after a 12hour flight from england and then a 2hr journey from the airport (i have never seen so much traffic in my life!) i was ready to put my feet up and found our room to be very large and even had a balcony! The room was very clean and had a big bathroom. The staff were very helpful in directing us to Disney (which we could have found on our own really) and gave us tips of where to eat and have a quiet drink. My time at the hotel was great, especially as it was my first time to America and didnt know what to expect! The only problem we encountered was when we asked for help in how to get to Santa Monica

We stayed at this hotel over the July 4th weekend for 4 nights/5 days.  Upon checking in, they only gave us 1 key (and there were 4 of us).  They told us to come back the next day for more keys.  On Saturday night we were leaving around 7 PM to go have dinner when we find that there were a line of cars double parked – leaving us trapped in our parking spot.  Now we’re paying $10 per day to park here on top of paying for our room – you’d think we’d be able to move freely with our car, right?  Nope.  There were so many conventions going on that same weekend on top of families taking their children to Disneyland that EVERY WHERE you looked, there were cars – doubled parked…even in front of the lobby were a line of cars!!  This is against regulation and the hotel could be fined

We stayed 4 nights through Alaska Air Vacations and I thought the Clarion was great.  The pool was warm and adequately large.  The staff was helpful.  The rooms were clean with fridge/micro.  The only downside is the distance to the park (at least a 15 minute brisk walk) - I don't recommend the Anaheim bus.  What a circus!  We could see the tops of the fireworks from our room on the 9th floor.  It was also very quiet up there!  No complaints.

Summary Heading: A Good Hotel to stay at.
Summary: I am giving this hotel an above average rating. It was by my standards average...however compared to some of the hotels I've stayed at lately it is above average. It was a very nice room with plenty of space for a family of four. We found the couch that made into a twin bed very useful. The room was very clean as was the bathroom and linens. I had no problem taking a shower (worring about touching moldy walls) because it was very clean. The only problem with the shower was the water temperature radically changing on me. The staff was very friendly and helpful. I had taken off my wedding ring to put on sunscreen and put it on the bed. I didn't notice until we were done eating breakfast. We ran to the room hopeing that housekeeping hadn't come yet. When we got to the room she was

My husband and I stayed at the Clarion for 5 nights in March and we had a great time.  The hotel isnt too far from Disneyland, and on the days we didnt want to walk back we caught the transit bus and it dropped us right out the front.  The check in people were lovely, we were surprised to find out that we had been upgraded and we had a lovely suite!! We ate in the restaurant and the food was really yummy - the service was wonderful & the waiter (jesus) was pleasant.  The pool looked nice - didnt test it out, too cold!!  There was one weird thing though - the cleaning lady.. everyday she left something in our bathroom which was strange, one day a dirty rag the next a bottle of liquid cleaner..   I would recommend this hotel, we had a fantastic stay.

Summary Heading: Typical Middle of the road Hotel
Summary: We stayed at this hotel after a cruise to Hawaii.  I have stayed at much nicer Clarion's but they had just done some renevations so the carpet and bathrooms were clean and nice.  The balcony that they advertise is a joke where we were.  If I stood sideways I barely fit and I weigh 120 pounds!  But we were located in an area where we could get to several things that we wanted to see.  I still don't understand $10 per day to park if you are staying in the hotel.  The staff was o.k. A bit like they were there for their job and that was all. We did visit the bar one night and the bartender was very friendly and had been there a long time.  We had a little bite to eat at the bar and it was very good.  Too cold for us at the pool but there were people out there that seemed to be

Our 4 nights at the Clarion were booked as part of our flight package and came at the reccomendation of our travel agent. Our problems began before we checked in. Although we had a voucher which specified 2pm check-in when we arrived at 1.30pm we were told that check-in was at 4pm and no there were no rooms available any earlier. We were exhausted as it had been 36 hours since leaving Australia, so this did not start our stay off well.   We had numerous problems with the rooms during our stay. Our room was on the second floor overlooking the hotel's main airconditioning units so the rooms were noisy 24 hrs a day and also smelly because the restaurant's kitchen's fumes were vented out there. The hotel is also being 'renovated' so there was dust everywhere and very strong paint

I stayed here for 3 nights Sept 30 to Oct 3, 2005 after a pacific coastal cruise. After seeing mixed reviews I was curious to see what I would think. I thought the hotel was fine, its your average hotel room, nothing fancy. I had no problems with the shower going from hot to cold and didn't experience the elevators being slow (although I was only on the 3rd floor). It is in a good location and IS within walking distance to Disneyland, about 3 blocks/10 minutes. If you have little kids you probably wouldn't want to do the walk, but it is quite close. We watched the fireworks at Disney one night from the street in front of the hotel. I would stay here again if the price was right.

We stayed at the Clarion, August 20, on our way through to San Diego and had we been happy we would have changed out reservation for the following week and spent 6 nights there while visiting Disneyland.  It is too far to walk to Disneyland so you would have to take the shuttle, which we find is not convenient, as we like to return to our room in the heat of the day to eat lunch and refresh for the long evening ahead.  The rooms were adequate, but with double beds, not queens.  I think that because they have a lobby and banquet facilities they consider themselves a classy hotel but they didn't even have shampoo in the room!  The bathroom was in need of repair as it was old and tired, and the water temperature in the shower was hot and cold suddenly.  The people in the restaurant

Review of Clarion Hotel Anaheim Resort   First, I need to let you know that we chose the Clarion out of the Get Away Today brochure.  It was the most reasonably priced hotel we could find that was supposedly within walking distance of the Disneyland Park.  We chose Clarion because they had a 4th night free promotion that was available all year long.  The service people on the Get Away Today Vacations were very helpful and patient with this high maintenance customer.   Eventually we booked a 4-night stay arriving on August 17th 2005. Out trip was sort of last minute so we had to have Get Away Today send our information directly to the hotel.  This was a convenient service.    We arrived at about Noon in the hopes of being able to check in early, we first went to the Front desk.
i stayed at this hotel for 3 and a half weeks from july 24th to aug. 17th /05  i can not say enough good things about the staff and rooms.

ive stayed at this hotel 3 times... i really like this hotel for the price. It is a good priced hotel yet it is still a nice hotel. The rooms are always clean, the lobby is nice and the staff is friendly. The only complaint I would have is that the water in the shower changes from hot to cold... Also, the walk from the hotel to Disneyland is kind of far, but if you are driving to the park everyday like we did (free parking because our annual pass) then its well worth it because it is fairly close. This is an all around good hotel.

Summary Heading: A Dark Comedy, time to check out!
Summary: This was definately not what I expected from the Clarion chain.  The hotel is severely outdated; walking through the hallways there is a musty, old smell.  The elevators are in a word, SLOW.  Thankfully I was only on the 2nd floor so we resorted to the stairs most of the time.  The Front Desk staff as a rule was less than congenial...their favorite response is a negative one.  When we went to our room, we stepped in and were hit with the smell of a smoking room (we don't smoke) so we immediately turned around and went back to the front desk.  They said we should have made it clear that we wanted a non-smoking room at the time of reservation.  The showers?  They bring some comedy.  To successfully get the soap off, or to get wet, getting on your knees seems to be the best

We were at the Clarion from June 30th to July 4th 2005 for our annual convention. I picked this hotel because of the proximity to the Anaheim Convention Center. Literally walking distance of two minutes.  PROS: clean room convenient distance to convention center no outside noise heard in the room  CONS: $10 a day parking fee staff attitude to guests - barely polite elevators - slow  MY EXPERIENCE: We booked the hotel through hotels.com. I specifically indicated a room with double beds but when I got to the hotel they had my reservation for only a king. Clarion staff was quick to indicate it was a hotels.com booking error and they could not accomodate a room change due to the heavy holiday period. Even after I booked the hotel in February. That's 5 months ahead. I was not the

Wow.  We were really suprised.  What a value.  Free high speed wireless internet in our room and even worked out by the pool.  Room was neat and clean.  The breakfast cafe was perfect.  Only complaint was the elevators were slow.

Just returned from 5 days in Anaheim, and we were pleased with our choice of the Clarion. We stayed on a 5 nights for the price of 4 plan, which helped. We arrived at 10 am, but were immediately given rooms although standard check-in time is 4 pm. We were on a non-smoking floor as requested; our room had microwave, refrigerator and coffee percolator, a balcony with a little bit of a view and a safe. The beds were comfortable and everything was clean and serviced daily. It may not be the newest hotel, but we were happy there. Disneyland is 10 to 15 minutes walk away, but the Anaheim shuttle stops at the door. Breakfast was not included, so we made our own. Had dinner in the restaurant one night, which was reasonable. The tour desk person was very helpful and knowledgeable and

Because all of the other hotels near me were booked up due to a convention, I was put into the Clarion Anaheim.  Upon entering into the room, I felt like this is where the Golden Girls would stay if they came to CA.  The room was done up in light beachy colors and the furniture looked like it came from Don Ho's yard sale.  I had a room with 2 double beds (both like rocks)  There was no desk in the room so if you want to use the internet, it is on top of a dresser where the TV is located.  Tried to get on the internet, didn't work.  Called the front desk and they said they dont have any tech people in the hotel and it is owned by another company.  Called the 800 number, no one picked up the phone.  The rooms are a good size but the bathroom is kinda scary.  Operating the shower,

We stayed at the Clarion over New Years.  We trird to check in around 1PM but the room was not ready.  We visited Disney Land  during the time that our room would be ready.  We thought the Clarion had its own shuttle?  Read the internet ad, it says "shuttle available".  You have to share a roaming shuttle for $3.00 per day per person; so we walked.  The room was great, but is slightly dated.  It was clean, quiet, and large.  The staff is good and everyone we met were helpful and friendly.  The lobby was undergoing new tile?  We enjoyed the stay and comfort.  There is a $9.00 per day uncovered parking .  I would stay again so long as we could get it for $59.00 plus tax again.

For a hotel with a good price and seeing only 2-3 stars, I was pleasantly surprised to find what a nice hotel Clarion is.  Very friendly staff, clean rooms.  I thought our refrigerator was not working and within 5 minutes, a staff person was at the room.  Only "complaint", the resturant closed after lunch and didn't open until 5pm.  We came back from Disneyland at 3p, hoping for a late lunch/early dinner.  Also the shuttle bus very prompt.  Walking distance may be a little far after a long day at Disneyland.  I plan on returning for our next trip.

We booked this hotel via the Disneyland website as a 'Good Neighbour Package' and were satisfied with the property, although I could  not rate it as any more than average. The room we were given was HUGE, complete with fridge, microwave, tea & coffee making facilities and a seperate very well lit vanity/make up area, which would go down very well with female guests. The room & bathroom were very clean, however corridors seemed in need of some refurbishment. Floors  have inexpensive vending machines on each landing, $1 can of Coke. The hotel  restaurant closed at 9pm which was a bit of a nuisance. Also Front Desk had a strange rule of only cashing travellers cheques of up to $50 value per day? We got round this by waiting for staff to change duty and they were none the wiser!!

We were pleasantly surprised when we arrived around lunchtime and were able to check into our room and head straight out to Disneyland for the afternoon/evening.  The front desk staff were great.  The room was a little small, but we weren't there to spend time in the room anyways.  Had everything we needed, including the fridge and in-room safe which we used.  It is only about a block from 7-11 where you can get groceries.  The pool was great.  Nice and big and even when there were other people there it didn't seem crowded.  Towels were supplied.  Keep in mind that you cannot go barefoot to the pool, since you have to go through the lobby (that's their rule, not ours).  Wearing runners after a swim is not fun.  We've learned our lesson and now pack flip-flops.  The restaurant

we stayed at this hotel for 6 days and 5 nights. It is a great hotel. We never had any real problems with anything there except on our last night the tv color changed to blue! but it was fixed so I cannot complain about that. I enjoyed this hotel, it is small but it is alot bigger and nicer than most of the hotels in the disneyland area. They have good customer service and were always friendly. Check in was very easy, the rooms were always clean, and it  was just an all around good hotel. When I first saw the price for the hotel, I was expecting it to be a small little place, but it exceeded my expectations, it really is a good hotel and I would recommend it to everyone.

Summary Heading: Budget hotel - well priced - good location
Summary: This hotel is well placed for everything! Close walk to Disneyland (there is also a shuttle!), close to the interstate 5 which takes you to Knotts berry Farm or further afield to Los Angeles/Hollywood etc.  The staff are VERY friendly here and made you feel welcome. The only gripe I had was we were given a room at the front of the hotel above reception. This was facing the convention centre and was VERY noisey, they did move us though when after a few nights we complained. Did'nt eat on site so can't comment there, but all in all this is a great place to stay.
